8 A kind of alms give to Brahmans,
four mouthfuls or according to others, food given in alms,
48 times the quantity of the alms called भिक्षा.
9 (In astro
nomy) the sun's amplitude. E. अङ्ग्, uṇ. aff. रन्, the nasal
of the radical being dropped.
text.496:
अग्रकर Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 The tip of the extended hand.
2 (Karmadh.) The right or better hand.
3 The extremity of
a ray of light; the focal point. E. अग्र and कर.
text.497:
अग्रकाय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The fore part of the body. E. अग्र
and काय.
text.498: अग्रग Tatpur. m. (-गः) A leader. E. अग्र and ग.
text.499:
अग्रगण्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्यः-ण्या-ण्यम्) To be reckoned or
considered as first or best. E. अग्र and गण्य.
text.500:
अग्रगामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Preceding, go
ing before. E. अग्र and गामिन्.
text.501:
अग्रज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) First-born or produced.
II. m. (-जः)
1 An elder brother; the first-born.
2 A Brahman.
III. f. (-जा) An elder sister. E. अग्र and ज.
text.502:
अग्रजङ्घा Tatpur. f. (-ङ्घा) The fore part of the thigh. E. अग्र
and जङ्घा.
text.503:
अग्रजन्मन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्मा)
1 An elder brother or first-born.
2 A priest or Brahman; a man of the sacerdotal tribe.
3 Brahmā, the first-born of the gods. E. अग्र and जन्मन्.
text.504:
अग्रजातक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A Brahman; a man of the first
class. E. अग्र and जातक.
text.505:
अग्रजाति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) A Brahman; a man of the first
class. E. अग्र and जाति.
text.506:
अग्रजिह्व Tatpur. n. (-ह्वम्) The tip of the tongue. E. अग्र
and जिह्वा.
text.507:
अग्रज्या Tatpur. f. (-ज्या) (In astronomy.) Sine of the ampli
tude. E. अग्र and ज्या.
text.508:
अग्रणी Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णीः-णीः-णि) First, principal.
E. अग्र and नी.
text.509:
अग्रतःसर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा or -री-रम्) Going
before, preceding.
II. m. (-रः) A leader. E. अग्रतस् and सर.
text.510:
अग्रतस् ind.
1 Before, in front of.
2 Before in rank, first &c.
E. अग्र, taddh. aff. तसिल्.
text.511:
अग्रदानिन् m. (-नी) A degraded Brahman, one who receives
presents from Śūdras or things first offered to the deceased.
E. अग्रदान (a present first given viz. to Śūdras or to de
ceased), taddh. aff. इनि.
text.512:
अग्रनख Tatpur. m. (-खः) The tip of the nail. E. अग्र
and नख.
text.513:
अग्रनासिका Tatpur. f. (-का) The tip of the nose. E. अग्र
and नासिका.
text.514:
अग्रनिरूपण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Determining beforehand, pro
phecy, predestination. E. अग्र and निरूपण.
text.515:
अग्रपर्णी Bahuvr. f. (-र्णी) A plant, Cowhage (Carpopogon
pruriens). E. अग्र and पर्ण.
text.516:
अग्रपाणि Tatpur. m. (-णिः)
1 The tip of the hand.
2 (Kar
madh.) The right hand. E. अग्र and पाणि.
text.517:
अग्रभाग Tatpur. m. (-गः)
1 Part of the top or end.
2 (Kar
madh.) Fore or top part.
3 (In astronomy.) Degree of am
plitude, also अग्रांश. E. अग्र and भाग.
text.518:
अग्रभूमि Tatpur. m. f. (-मिः) A goal, an object, the place
or thing to be attained. E. अग्र and भूमि.
text.519:
अग्रमांस Tatpur. n. (-सम्)
1 The heart.
2 A disease of the
liver, viz. and enlargement of one of the lobes causing it to
occupy the forepart of the stomach. E. अग्र and मांस.
text.520:
अग्रयान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Advancing before an army, for
the purpose of defiance. E. अग्र and यान.
text.521:
अग्रयायिन् Tatpur. m. (-यी) Going in front, a leader. E.
अग्र and यायिन्.
text.522:
अग्रयोधिन् Tatpur. m. (-धी) The leader of a combat. E. अग्र
and योधिन्.
text.523:
अग्रलोहिता Tatpur. f. (-ता) A kind of potherb, see चिल्ली.
E. अग्र and लोहित.
text.524:
अग्रवीज Bahuvr. m. (-जः) A viviparous plant, as the Gom
phroena globosa, &c. E. अग्र and वीज.
text.525:
अग्रसन्धानी Tatpur. f. (-नी) The register of human actions,
kept by Yama, the judge of the dead. E. अग्र and सन्धानी;
recording all actions from the original birth.
text.526:
अग्रसन्ध्या Karmadh. f. (-न्ध्या) The first twilight, dawn. E. अग्र
and सन्ध्या.
text.527:
अग्रसानु Tatpur. m. (-नुः) The front part of a table land.
E. अग्र and सानु.
text.528:
अग्रसर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा or -री-रम्) Preceding, going
before, a leader. E. अग्र and सर.
text.529:
अग्रसेन Bahuvr. m. (-नः) A proper name, the son of Jana
mejaya. E. अग्र and सेना.
text.530:
अग्रह Bahuvr. m. (-हः) An anchorite or Vānaprastha, a
Brahman of the third order, one who has retired from the
world. E. अ priv. and ग्रह a house, ‘being no longer a
householder’. Also written अगृह.
text.531:
अग्रहस्त Tatpur. m. (-स्तः)
1 The tip of the extended hand.
2 The tip of an elephant's trunk.
3 (Karmadh.) The right or
better hand. E. अग्र and हस्त.
text.532:
अग्रहायण Tatpur. m. (-णः) A name given to the solar month
Mārgaśiras or Mārgaśirṣa (q. v.) when the latter was made
to commence the year; the eighth month of the lunar year
of the Hindus, when the moon is full near the head of
Orion, or about November-December. Also written आग्र-
हायण. (The fem. अग्रहायणी is a false reading for आग्र-
हायणी q. v.) E. अग्र and हायण.
text.533:
अग्रहार Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 An endowment of land or vil
lages conferred upon Brahmans.
2 A village, or a part of
one, occupied by Brahmans and held either rent-free under
special grants or at a reduced rate of assessment. The pre
cise nature of the tenure is usually denoted by a term pre
fixed, as Sarvāgrahāra, free from all (sarva) tax &c. E.
अग्र (alms) and हार.
text.534: अग्रांश Tatpur. m. (-शः) See अग्रभाग. E. अग्र and अंश.
text.535:
अग्रांशु Tatpur. m. (-शुः) The extreme ray or point of a ray
of light, the focal point. E. अग्र and अंशु.
text.536:
अग्राक्षि Tatpur. n. (-क्षि) The fore part of the eye, fullness
of the sight. E. अग्र and अक्षि.
text.537:
अग्राङ्गुलि Tatpur. m. (-लिः) The tip of the finger. E. अग्र
and अङ्गुलि.
text.538:
अग्रानीक Tatpur. m. n. (-कः-कम्) The front of an army.
E. अग्र and अनीक.
text.539:
अग्रायणीय n. (-यम्) Name of the second of the fourteen
oldest books of the Jainas. E. अग्रायण, taddh. aff. छ.
text.540:
अग्राह्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ह्यः-ह्या-ह्यम्)
1 Not fit or proper
to be accepted.
2 Not to be attained.
3 Not to be trusted
or consented to. E. अ neg. and ग्राह्य.
text.541:
अग्रिम I. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्)
1 Chief, principal, best.
2 Prior, precedent.
3 Elder, elder born.
II. f. (-मा) The name of a fruit (Annona reticulata).
See लवणी. E. अग्र, taddh. aff. डिमच्.
text.542:
अग्रिय I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Chief, principal, best.
II. m. (-यः) The first-born, an elder brother. See also
अग्रीय and अग्र्य. E. अग्र, taddh. aff. घ.
text.543:
अग्रीय I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) and II. m. (-यः) See अग्रिय.
E. अग्र, taddh. aff. छ.
text.544:
अग्रु I. m. (-ग्रुः) Not married.
II. f. (-ग्रू)
1 A finger.
2 A river. E. अग्, uṇ. aff. क्रुन्.
text.545:
अग्रेग Tatpur. m. (-गः) A leader, a preceder. E. अग्र (loc.)
and ग.
text.546:
अग्रेगा Tatpur. m. (-गाः) A leader, a preceder. E. अग्र (loc.)
and गा.
text.547: अग्रेगू Tatpur. m. (-गूः) A leader. E. अग्र (loc.) and गू.
text.548: अग्रेणी Tatpur. m. (-णीः) A leader. E. अग्र (loc.) and नी.
text.549:
अग्रेदिधिषु Tatpur. I. m. (-षुः) A man of either of the three
first classes, whose wife has before been married, and has
born him children.
II. f. (-षुः) A younger sister married before her elder;
also अग्रेदिधिषू. E. अग्र (loc.) and दिधिषु or दिधिषू.
text.550: अग्रेपा Tatpur. m. f. (-पाः-पाः) Drinking first. E. अग्र (loc.) and पा.
text.551: अग्रेपू Tatpur. m. f. (-पूः-पूः) Drinking first. E. अग्र (loc.) and पू.
text.552:
अग्रेभ्रू Tatpur. m. (-भ्रूः) Roaming or wandering first. E. अग्र
(loc.) and भ्रू (from भ्रम् q. v.).
text.553:
अग्रेवण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) The skirts of a wood. E. अग्र (loc.)
and वन.
text.554:
अग्रेवध Tatpur. m. (-धः) Killing what is before any one,
before any one's sight. E. अग्र (loc.) and वध.
text.555:
अग्रेसर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा or -री-रम्) Preceding,
going before.
II. m. (-रः) A leader. E. अग्र (loc.) and सर.
text.556: अग्रेसरिक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A leader. E. अग्र (loc.) and सरिक.
text.557:
अग्र्य I. m. f. n. (-ग्र्यः-ग्र्या-ग्र्यम्)
1 Being on the top or sum
mit.
2 Chief, principal, best.
3 Intent, studying attentively
or eagerly.
II. m. (-ग्र्यः) A first-born, an elder brother. See also
अग्रिय and अग्रीय. E. अग्र, taddh. aff. यत्.
text.558:
अघ् (अघ-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अघयति) To
sin, to commit sin. (Probably a denominative derived from
अघ. See also अघाय्.)
text.559:
अघ I. n. (-घम्)
1 Sin.
2 Pain, suffering.
3 Passion, as love,
hatred.
4 Impurity (see अशौच). E. हन् with आ, krit aff. ड,
the preposition being made short (or better अंह् or अङ्घ्, kṛt
aff. अच्.) See अंहस्, अङ्घस् and अङ्घ.
II. 1. m. f. n. (-घः-घा-घम्) One afflicted with sin, pain,
passion, impurity (see the preceding).
2. m. (-घः) Name of a demon, the general of Kansa.
3. f. (-घा)
1 The goddess of Sin.
2 pl. f. (-घाः) The
constellation, more usually known under the name of मघाः
q. v. E. अघ (sin &c.), taddh. aff. अच्.
text.560:
अघन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not solid, liquid. E.
अ and घन.
text.561:
अघनाशक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Purifying, freeing
from sin. E. अघ and नाशक.
text.562:
अघनाशन Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Purifying, free
ing from sin.
II. m. (-नः)
1 An expiator.
2 A name of Viṣṇu. E. अघ
and नाशन.
text.563:
अघमय m. f. n. (-यः-यी-यम्) Sinful, identical with or fruit
ful in sin. E. अघ, taddh. aff. मयट्.
text.564:
अघमर्षण Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-णः-णी-णम्) An expiatory
prayer: reciting mentally a particular passage from the Ve
das, while a little water, in the palm of the right hand, is
held to the nose; this forms a part of the daily ceremonies
of the Brahmans.
II. m. (-णः) The son of Madhuchhandas and author of the
passage recited upon the above occasion. E. अघ and मर्षण.
text.565:
अघर्म Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्मः-र्मा-र्मम्) Cool, not warm. E.
अ neg. and घर्म.
text.566:
अघर्मधामन् Bahuvr. m. (-मा) The moon (as the source of
coolness). E. अघर्म and धामन्.
text.567:
अघवत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Wicked, vicious, sinful.
E. अघ, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.568: अघशंस Tatpur. m. (-सः) A wicked man. E. अघ and शंस.
text.569:
अघशंसहन् Tatpur. m. (-हा) Killing or destroying the wicked.
E. अघशंस and हन्.
text.570:
अघहरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Removing sin or impurity. E.
अघ and हरण.
text.571:
अघातिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) Harmless, not
mischievous (as a work or deed &c.). E. अ and घातिन्.
text.572:
अघाय् denom. par. (अघायति) To sin, to commit sin. See
also अघ्. E. अघ, denom. aff. क्यच्.
text.573: अघायु m. (-युः) A sinner, a wicked man. E. अघाय्, kṛt aff. उ.
text.574:
अघाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Time or day of impurity, consequent on
the death of a relative &c. E. अघ and अहन्, samāsta aff. टच्.
text.575:
अघृण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Unkind, cruel. E. अ
priv. and घृणा.
text.576:
अघोर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not formidable,
not terrible.
II. m. (-रः)
1 A name of Śiva.
2 A worshipper of Śiva
and Durgā in their terrific forms.
III. f. (-रा) The fourteenth day of the dark half of the
month Bhādra (August-September), upon which Śiva is wor
shipped. E. अ neg. and घोर. (The name of Śiva taken in
a euphemistic sense.)
text.577:
अघोरघोररूप Bahuvr. m. (-पः) A name of Śiva. E. अघोर-
घोर (not frightful and frightful in the same time) and रूप.
text.578:
अघोरपथिन् Bahuvr. m. (-पन्था) A worshipper of the terrific
forms of Śiva and Durgā. E. अघोर and पथिन्.
text.579:
अघोरमार्ग Bahuvr. m. (-र्गः) The same as the preceding. E.
अघोर and मार्ग.
text.580:
अघोष I. Tatpur. m. (-षः) (In grammar.) The absence of
soft articulation, hard articulation; such as characterises the
pronunciation of the letters क ख च छ ट ठ त थ प फ श ष स
and of Visarga. See वाह्यप्रयत्न. E. अ neg. and घोष.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्)
1 Without a soft sound
ing, sounding hard (as a letter).
2 Without a cowherd (as a
country). E. अ priv. and घोष.
text.581:
अघोस् ind. A vocative particle. E. Irregular vocative of अघ-
वत् (erroneously derived from अ neg. and हन्, aff. ओस्).
text.582:
अघ्न्य Tatpur. I. m. (-घ्न्यः) A name of Brahmā.
II. f. (-घ्न्या) A cow. E. अ and हन्, uṇ. aff. यक् (अघ्न्य
literally: not to be slain, inviolable).
text.583:
अङ्क् I. (अकि-भ्वादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. ātm. (अङ्कते-
आनङ्के-अङ्किता. p. p. अङ्कित. Des. अञ्चिकिषते)
1 To mark.
2 To go.
II. (अङ्क-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अङ्कयति.
p. p. अङ्कित)
1 To mark.
2 To go crookedly or tortuously.
See अङ्ग्. (Probably a denominative from अङ्क.)
text.584:
अङ्क m. (-ङ्कः) I.
1 Winding tortuously.
2 The flank or part
above the hips where women place young children in car
rying them.
3 The body.
4 Proximity.
5 Place, ground.
6 A
hooked instrument. E. अञ्च्, kṛt or uṇ. aff. अच्. See अङ्कस्.
II.
1 A mark or spot.
2 (In arithmetic.) A cypher, an
arithmetical sign, a number or coefficient.
3 (Used some
times to denote) the numeral 9.
4 A line, a stroke.
5 Fault,
offence.
6 Ornament, decoration.
7 The act of a play.
8 A
species of dramatic entertainment.
9 Mimic war or conflict.
E. अञ्च्, kṛt or uṇ. aff. अच् or अङ्क्, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.585:
अङ्ककरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Stamping, making marks. E. अङ्क
and करण.
text.586:
अङ्कति m. (-तिः)
1 Air, wind.
2 Fire.
3 A name of Brahmā.
4 A
Brahman who maintains a sacred fire (see अग्निहोत्रिन्). See
अङ्गति and अञ्चति. E. अञ्च्, uṇ. aff. अति, च् being changed to क्.
text.587:
अङ्कन n. (-नम्)
1 Cyphering, writing or making cyphers.
2 Stamping, impressing, making marks, stigmatising. E. अङ्क्,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.588:
अङ्कपालि Tatpur. f. (-लिः) An embrace, embracing. See
अङ्कपाली, अङ्कपालिका and अङ्गपालि. E. अङ्क and पालि.
text.589:
अङ्कपालिका Tatpur. f. (-का) An embrace, embracing. See
the preceding. E. अङ्क and पालिका.
text.590:
अङ्कपाली Tatpur. f. (-ली)
1 An embrace, embracing.
2 A
nurse.
3 A plant (Piring or Medicago esculenta). See अङ्क-
पालि. E. अङ्क and पाली.
text.591:
अङ्कपाश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Combination of numerals. E. अङ्क
and पाश.
text.592:
अङ्कपाशव्यवहार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Concatenation of digits;
a mutual mixing of the numbers, as it were a rope or halter
of numerals: their variations being likened to a coil. E. अङ्क-
पाश and व्यवहार.
text.593:
अङ्कपाशाध्याय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The same as the preceding.
E. अङ्कपाश and अध्याय.
text.594:
अङ्कभाज् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भाक्) Resting or placed upon the
side or hip. E. अङ्क and भाज्.
text.595:
अङ्कमुख Tatpur. n. (-खम्) That act of a drama, usually the first,
which contains the exposition and furnishes a clue to the sub
ject of the whole story. E. अङ्क and मुख.
text.596:
अङ्कलोड्य Tatpur. m. (-ड्यः) The name of a plant. See चिञ्चो-
टक and चिञ्चोड. E. अङ्क and लोड्य.
text.597: अङ्कविद्या Tatpur. f. (-द्या) Arithmetic. E. अङ्क and विद्या.
text.598:
अङ्कस् n. (-ङ्कः)
1 Winding tortuously.
2 A mark or spot(?).
3 The
body(?). See अङ्क. E. अञ्च्, uṇ. aff. असुन्, च् being changed to क्.
text.599:
अङ्कस n. (-सम्) (ved.) The trappings (as of a horse). E.
अङ्कस्, taddh. aff. अच्.
text.600:
अङ्कावतार Tatpur. m. (-रः) That part of the end of an act
which introduces or prepares for the following act of a
drama. E. अङ्क and अवतार.
text.601:
अङ्कित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Marked, spotted.
2 Counted,
numbered. E. अङ्क्, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.602:
अङ्किन् I. m. f. n. (-ङ्की-ङ्किनी-ङ्कि) Having an अङ्क q. v.
II. m. (-ङ्की) A small oblong drum. See अङ्की.
III. f. (-ङ्किनी) A quantity of marks &c. See the mean
ings of अङ्क. E. अङ्क, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.603: अङ्की f. (-की) A small oblong drum. E. अङ्क, fem. aff. ङीप्. See अङ्क्य.
text.604: अङ्कुट m. (-टः) A key. E. अङ्क्, aff. उट.
text.605:
अङ्कुर m. (-रः)
1 A shoot or sprout.
2 The hair of the
body.
3 Blood.
4 Water. E. अङ्क्, uṇ. aff. उरच्.
text.606: अङ्कुरक m. (-कः) A nest. E. अङ्कुर (a shoot), taddh. aff. कन्.
text.607:
अङ्कुरित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Budded, sprouted, germi
nated. E. अङ्कुर, taddh. aff. इतच्.
text.608:
अङ्कुश I. m. n. (-शः-शम्) A hook, especially one used to drive
an elephant.
II. f. (-शा or sometimes read -शी) One of the twenty
four female deities peculiar to the Jainas, supposed to direct
or to govern more immediately human beings. E. अङ्क् (to
mark) (or according to some authority अञ्च्, च् being
changed to क्), uṇ. aff. उशच्; in the fem. with aff. ङीप्.
text.609: अङ्कुशग्रह Tatpur. m. (-हः) An elephant-driver. E. अङ्कुश and ग्रह.
text.610:
अङ्कुशदुर्धर Tatpur. m. (-रः) A restive elephant. E. अङ्कुश,
and दुर्धर, who is ill restrained even by the goad.
text.611:
अङ्कूर m. (-रः) A sprout, a germin. E. See अङ्कुर, उ being
made long.
text.612:
अङ्कूष m. n. (-षः-षम्) The hook or goad for driving an ele
phant. E. See अङ्कुश, उ being made long, and श changed
to ष.
text.613:
अङ्कोट m. (-टः) A plant: also अङ्कोठ and अङ्कोल. E. अङ्क्,
aff. ओट.
text.614:
अङ्कोठ m. (-ठः) A plant (Alangium hexapetalum). E. See
अङ्कोट, ठ being used for ट.
text.615: अङ्कोल m. (-लः) A plant. See अङ्कोट and अङ्कोठ; also अङ्कोलक.
text.616:
अङ्कोलिका f. (-का) Embracing, an embrace. E. Contracted
from अङ्कपालिका q. v., प being previously softened to व,
and the inhering vowel dropped.
text.617:
अङ्कोल्लसार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A kind of poison, probably
prepared from the plant अङ्कोल, or अङ्कोट. E. अङ्कोल and
सार, ल being doubled.
text.618:
अङ्क्य I. m. f. n. (-ङ्क्यः-ङ्क्या-ङ्क्यम्)
1 To be counted.
2 To be
marked. E. अङ्क्, kṛt aff. यत्.
II. m. (-ङ्क्यः) A small oblong drum. See अङ्की. E. अङ्क,
taddh. aff. यत्; being carried upon the hip.
text.619: अङ्ख् r. 10th cl. (-ङ्खयति) To move slowly, to drawl. See अङ्क्.
text.620:
अङ्ग् I. (अगि-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अङ्गति-
आनङ्ग) To go. With परि (or पलि) To go round.--वि
and परि (or पलि-विपलि) To go round; caus. To surround.
II. (अङ्ग-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अङ्गयति)
1 To mark.
2 To go. See अङ्क्.
text.621:
अङ्ग I. Ind. (see निपात.)
1 A vocative particle implying
a. solicitation, equivalent to the English ‘do’, in phrases as
‘do give’ &c.
b. abuse,
c. joy.
2 A particle implying con
firmation, as ‘indeed, certainly’, or putting stress on the
word with which it is connected.
3 Again, further, the
rather.
4 Quick.
5 A particle of assent used in composition
with कृ and its derivatives, ई being substituted for the ter
minating vowel as in अङ्गीकरण &c. (See गति.)
II. n. (-ङ्गम्)
1 A limb or member.
2 The body.
3 A part
or division of a whole.
4 A division of Hindu learning, com
prehending especially such science as is considered depend
ant upon the Vedas, hence also called Vedāṅga; works
on six subjects come under this description, viz. शिक्षा or
pronunciation, व्याकरण or grammar, छन्दस् or prosody,
निरुक्त or explanation of obscure terms, कल्प or description
of religious rites and ज्योतिष or astronomy. Also the Jainas
call the twelve divisions of their holy work Gaṇipiṭaka,
Angas.
5 An inferior or secondary part of a whole.
6 (In
rhetoric.) An incidental passion or figure, illustrative of,
but subordinate to the main subject of the description.
7 All
the dramatis personae of a play, except the hero and he
roine, the body of the characters.
8 (In grammar.) The
theme or that part of a word in general, to which the affix
is attached, whether the affix be one of inflexion or deri
vation.
9 An expedient, a means of success.
10 Mind, un
derstanding.
11 A denomination of the numeral six (this
being the number of the Vedāṅgas). E. अङ्ग्, kṛt aff.
अच्.
III. m. (-ङ्गः)
1 A country, Bengal proper, including
Bhāgalpur, and its inhabitants. (In this sense the word is
mostly used as a plural.)
2 A proper name: the son of Ūru
by Āgneyī and grandson to Chākṣuṣa or the sixth Manu,
a descendant of Atri; the eldest son of the king Bali. E. अङ्ग्,
kṛt aff. घञ्.
IV. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्)
1 Having limbs, a body &c.
2 Near, proximate. E. अङ्ग (see II.), taddh. aff. अच्.
text.622:
अङ्गक I. n. (-कम्) A limb or member, the body &c. See
the preceding.
II. f. (-ङ्गिका) A bodice or jacket. E. अङ्ग, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.623:
अङ्गकर्तन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The cutting off of a limb. E. अङ्ग
and कर्तन.
text.624:
अङ्गकर्मन् Karmadh. n. (-र्म) An inferior or secondary sacri
ficial act, one subservient to the main ritual proceding,
as frying the Puroḍāśa in bowls &c. with respect to the
Darśapūrṇamāsa sacrifice; or the Dīkṣaṇīyā, Prāyaṇīyā
&c. with respect to the Jyotiṣṭoma &c. E. अङ्ग and कर्मन्.
text.625: अङ्गक्रिया Karmadh. f. (-या) See the preceding. E. अङ्ग and क्रिया.
text.626: अङ्गग्रह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Bodily pain, spasm. E. अङ्ग and ग्रह.
text.627:
अङ्गज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्)
1 Produced or born
of the body.
2 Produced by a secondary act (as in sacrifices).
II. m. (-जः)
1 A son.
2 The hair of the head.
3 Love.
4 A name of the god of Love.
5 Passion, desire.
6 Sick
ness, disease.
III. f. (-जा) A daughter.
IV. n. (-जम्) Blood. E. अङ्ग and ज.
text.628: अङ्गजनुस् Bahuvr. m. (-नुः) A son. E. अङ्ग and जनुस्.
text.629: अङ्गजात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) See अङ्गज. E. अङ्ग and जात.
text.630: अङ्गण n. (-णम्) A court, or yard. See अङ्गन.
text.631:
अङ्गति m. (-तिः)
1 A name of Brahmā.
2 A name of Viṣṇu.
3 Fire.
4 A Brahman, who maintains a sacred fire &c. See
अग्निहोत्रिन्. E. अङ्ग्, uṇ. aff. अति. See अङ्कति.
text.632:
अङ्गद Tatpur. I. m. (-दः) A proper name of
a. a son of La
kṣmaṇa, the brother of Rāma and king of Āṅgadi, the
capital of a country near the Himālaya;
b. a son of Gada
by Vṛhatī;
c. a celebrated monkey, one of the heroes of
the Rāmāyaṇa, the son of Bali.
II. f. (-दा) The female elephant of the south or ac
cording to others, of the north. See अङ्गना.
III. n. (-दम्) A bracelet worn upon the upper arm.
E. अङ्ग and द.
text.633:
अङ्गद्वीप Tatpur. m. (-पः) One of the divisions of the world.
E. अङ्ग and द्वीप.
text.634:
अङ्गन I. n. (-नम्)
1 Going, moving.
2 A court. E. अङ्ग्, kṛt
aff. ल्युट्.
II. f. (-ना)
1 A beautiful woman.
2 The sign Virgo.
3 A
woman, a female.
4 The female elephant of the north. (See
अङ्गदा.) E. अङ्ग, taddh. aff. न, fem. aff. टाप्.
text.635:
अङ्गनागण Tatpur. m. (-णः) A number of women. E. अङ्गना
and गण.
text.636:
अङ्गनाजन Tatpur. m. (-नः) A female, a female person. E.
अङ्गना and जन.
text.637:
अङ्गनाप्रिय Tatpur. m. (-यः) A plant (Jonesia asoka). See
अशोक. E. अङ्गना and प्रिय; worship being performed by
women to this plant.
text.638:
अङ्गन्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Touching various parts of the
body, as a religious ceremony. E. अङ्ग and न्यास.
text.639:
अङ्गपालि Tatpur. m. (-लिः) Embracing, an embrace. See
अङ्कपालि. E. अङ्ग and पालि.
text.640:
अङ्गप्रायश्चित्त Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्) Expiation for bodily impu
rity, especially the oblation offered by the heir at the first
funeral obsequies, to remove the impurity contracted during
the period of mourning. E. अङ्ग and प्रायश्चित्त.
text.641:
अङ्गमर्द Tatpur. m. (-र्दः) A servant, whose business it is to
rub and knead the body. E. अङ्ग and मर्द. Also अङ्गमर्दक
and अङ्गमर्दिन्.
text.642:
अङ्गमर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः) Pains of the limbs, rheumatism.
E. अङ्ग and मर्ष.
text.643:
अङ्गमर्षप्रशमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A medicine that removes
pain as rheumatism &c. E. अङ्गमर्ष and प्रशमन.
text.644:
अङ्गयाग Karmadh. m. (-गः) A subordinate or secondary sa
crificial act. See अङ्गकर्मन्. E. अङ्ग and याग.
text.645:
अङ्गरक्त Tatpur. n. (-क्तम्) A plant, vulg. Śunda róchani. See
रक्ताङ्ग. E. अङ्ग and रक्त.
text.646:
अङ्गरक्षणी Tatpur. f. (-णी)
1 Armour, coat of mail, thick
quilting, or an iron netting worn upon the body.
2 A gar
ment. E. अङ्ग and रक्षण, fem. aff. ङीप्. Also read अङ्ग-
रक्षिणी.
text.647:
अङ्गरक्षिणी Tatpur. f. (-णी). See the preceding. E. अङ्ग and
रक्षिन्, fem. aff. ङीप्.
text.648:
अङ्गराग Tatpur. m. (-गः)
1 Perfuming the body after cleans
ing; smearing it with unguents of sandal &c.
2 The per
fume or unguent so applied. E. अङ्ग and राग.
text.649:
अङ्गराज् Tatpur. m. (-राट्) A name of Karṇa, king of Anga,
the son of Kunti by Sūrya. See कर्ण. E. अङ्ग and राज्.
Also अङ्गराजन् and अङ्गराज.
text.650:
अङ्गरुह Tatpur. n. (-हम्) Hair of the body, wool, fleece,
down. E. अङ्ग and रुह.
text.651:
अङ्गलोड्य Tatpur. m. (-ड्यः) Ginger (Amomum zinziber).
See चिञ्चोटक and अङ्कलोड्य. E. अङ्ग and लोड्य; exciting
or stimulating the body.
text.652:
अङ्गव Tatpur. m. (-वः) A dried or withered fruit. E. अङ्ग
and व, from वै to dry or wither.(?)
text.653:
अङ्गविकृति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) Syncope, apoplexy. E. अङ्ग
and विकृति.
text.654:
अङ्गविक्षेप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Gesture, gesticulation. E. अङ्ग
and विक्षेप.
text.655:
अङ्गविद्या Tatpur. f. (-द्या) Knowledge of lucky and unlucky
marks on the body. E. अङ्ग and विद्या.
text.656: अङ्गवैकृत Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Sign, token, hint. E. अङ्ग and वैकृत.
text.657:
अङ्गसंस्कार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Embellishment of person, dress
ing, cleansing or perfuming it. E. अङ्ग and संस्कार.
text.658:
अङ्गसंस्क्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) See the preceding. E. अङ्ग and
संस्क्रिया.
text.659:
अङ्गसंहति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Bodily strength, or symmetry.
E. अङ्ग and संहति.
text.660:
अङ्गसङ्ग Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) Bodily union or contact, coition.
E. अङ्ग and सङ्ग.
text.661:
अङ्गस्कन्ध Tatpur. m. (-न्धः) A subdivision of a branch of
science or philosophy. E. अङ्ग and स्कन्ध.
text.662: अङ्गस्पर्श Tatpur. m. (-र्शः) Bodily contact. E. अङ्ग and स्पर्श.
text.663:
अङ्गहार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Gesture, gesticulation. E. अङ्ग and
हार. Also अङ्गहारि.
text.664: अङ्गहारि Tatpur. m. (-रिः). See अङ्गहार. E. अङ्ग and हारि.
text.665:
अङ्गहीन Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Mutilated, maimed,
defective.
II. m. (-नः) Kāmadeva. E. अङ्ग and हीन.
text.666:
अङ्गाङ्गि Bahuvr. and Avyayībh. Body and body, implying con
tact or cooperation. E. अङ्ग repeated, samāsānta aff. इच्.
text.667:
अङ्गाङ्गिता f. (-ता) The mutual relation of what is subordi
nate and of what is principal. Also अङ्गाङ्गित्व n. (-त्वम्). See
the following. E. अङ्गाङ्गिन् (Dwandwa अङ्ग and अङ्गिन्),
taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.668:
अङ्गाङ्गिभाव Tatpur. m. (-वः)
1 Personal relation or coope
ration.
2 The mutual relation of what is subordinate and
of what is principal. E.
1 अङ्गाङ्गि and भाव.
2 अङ्ग-अङ्गिन्
and भाव.
text.669:
अङ्गाधिप Tatpur. m. (-पः) A name of Karṇa, king of Anga.
See कर्ण. E. अङ्ग (the country) and अधिप.
text.670:
अङ्गापूर्व Tatpur. n. (-र्वम्) The consequence of, the result
obtained by a secondary or subordinate religious act. E.
अङ्ग (see अङ्गकर्मन्) and अपूर्व.
text.671:
अङ्गार I. m. n. (-रः-रम्) Charcoal, whether burning or not,
but more usually the latter.
II. m. (-रः)
1 A name of the planet Mars; from his
fiery colour.
2 The name of a plant, see हितावली.
3 pl.
(-राः) The name of a people and a country. E. अङ्ग्, uṇ.
aff. आरन्.
text.672:
अङ्गारक I. m. (-कः)
1 Charcoal, burning or extinguished.
2 The planet Mars.
3 A proper name:
a. of a prince of
Sauvīra.
b. of a Rudra, one of the children of Kāśyapa by
Surabhi.
4 Yellow or white amaranth. See कुरुण्ठक.
5 An
other plant (Eclipta or Verbesina prostrata). See भृङ्गराज.
II. n. (-कम्) A medicated oil, prepared by boiling tur
meric and various vegetable substances in common oil. E.
अङ्गार, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.673:
अङ्गारकदिन Tatpur. m. n. (-नः-नम्) A festival on the four
teenth of the latter half of the month Chaitra, in honour
of Aṅgāraka or the planet Mars, in which certain ceremo
nies for the prevention of sin and disease are observed.
E. अङ्गारक and दिन.
text.674: अङ्गारकमणि Tatpur. m. (-णिः) Coral. E. अङ्गारक and मणि.
text.675:
अङ्गारकित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Burnt, charred. E. अङ्गा-
रक, taddh. aff. इतच्.
text.676:
अङ्गारकुष्ठक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The name of a plant. See हि-
तावली. E. अङ्गार and कुष्ठक.
text.677:
अङ्गारधानिका Tatpur. f. (-का) A small portable fire-place
or fire-pan. E. अङ्गार and धानिका.
text.678:
अङ्गारधानी Tatpur. f. (-नी) See the preceding. E. अङ्गार
and धानी.
text.679:
अङ्गारपरिपाचित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Roasted food. E. अङ्गार
and परिपाचित.
text.680:
अङ्गारपर्ण Bahuvr. m. (-र्णः) A name of Chitraratha, chief
of the Gandharvas. E. अङ्गार and पर्ण.
text.681:
अङ्गारपात्री Tatpur. f. (-त्री) A small portable fire-place or
fire-pan. E. अङ्गार and पात्री.
text.682:
अङ्गारपुष्प Tatpur. m. (-पः) A plant, vulg. Ingua. See इङ्गुदी.
The seeds are used for rosaries &c. E. अङ्गार and पुष्प,
the flowers supposed to resemble coals.
text.683:
अङ्गारमञ्जरी Tatpur. f. (-री) See the following. E. अङ्गार
and मञ्जरी.
text.684:
अङ्गारमञ्जी Tatpur. f. (-ञ्जी) A tree or shrub, a species of
Karanja (Cesalpinia bonducella). E. अङ्गार and मञ्जी, com
pared to a coal.
text.685:
अङ्गारवल्लरी Tatpur. f. (-री)
1 A species of Karanja (Gale
dupa arborea).
2 Another plant (Ovieda verticallata, Rox.).
3 Another plant; see भार्गी.
4 Another plant; see गुञ्जा. E.
अङ्गार and वल्लरी.
text.686:
अङ्गारवल्ली Tatpur. f. (-ल्ली)
1 A large species of Karanja
(Galedupa arborea).
2 Another plant; see भार्गी. See अङ्गा-
रवल्लरी. E. अङ्गार and वल्ली.
text.687:
अङ्गारशकटी Tatpur. f. (-टी) A small portable fire-place. E.
अङ्गार and शकटी.
text.688:
अङ्गारसेतु Bahuvr. m. (-तुः) Name of a prince, son of Ba
bhrusetu and father of Gāndhāra. E. अङ्गार and सेतु.
text.689:
अङ्गारावक्षयण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) An extinguisher of coals,
a vessel in which coals are extinguished. E. अङ्गार and
अवक्षयण.
text.690:
अङ्गारि f. (-रिः) A small portable fire-place. E. अङ्गार, taddh.
aff. इ.
text.691:
अङ्गारिका f. (-का)
1 The stalk of the sugarcane.
2 The bud
of the Kinśuka (Butea frondosa). E. अङ्गार, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.692:
अङ्गारिणी f. (-णी)
1 A small portable fire-place.
2 The quar
ter from which the sun has departed.
3 A creeper plant.
E. अङ्गार, taddh. aff. इनि and fem. aff. ङीप्.
text.693:
अङ्गारित I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Burnt, charred.
II. n. (-तम्) The early blossom of the Kinśuka (Butea
frondosa).
III. f. (-ता)
1 A portable fire-place.
2 A bud.
3 A creeper.
4 The name of a river. E. अङ्गार, taddh. aff. इतच्.
text.694:
अङ्गारीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Fit to become coals (as
wood). E. अङ्गार, taddh. aff. छ.
text.695:
अङ्गार्या f. (-र्या) A multitude or a heap of coals. E. अङ्गार,
taddh. aff. य and fem. aff. टाप्.
text.696:
अङ्गिका f. (-का) A bodice or jacket. E. अङ्ग, taddh. aff. ठन्.
See अङ्गक.
text.697:
अङ्गिन् m. f. n. (-ङ्गी-ङ्गिनी-ङ्गि)
1 Corporeal, bodily.
2 Limbed,
having limbs or members.
3 Having means or expedients.
4 Chief, principal. E. अङ्ग, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.698:
अङ्गिर् m. (-ङ्गीर्) The proper name of a Ṛṣi, to whom the
Brahmavidyā (q. v.) or sacred knowledge was communicated
by Atharvan and who became the teacher of Satyavāha, the
descendant of Bharadvāja. E. unknown, but see अङ्गिरस्.
text.699:
अङ्गिर m. (-रः) A proper name. See the following, of which
it appears to be an abbreviated form.
text.700:
अङ्गिरस् I. m. sing. (-राः) The proper name of a Maharshi,
a great Ṛṣi or saint who is the reputed author of many
vaidik hymns, but who is mentioned also in a subse
quent period as one of the inspired legislators of India
and as the author of an astronomical work. The various
legends connected with his life seem to have been occasioned
by the word अङ्गिरस् coming from the same radical as,
and its sound recalling that of, अग्नि, fire (q. v.). Hence
we find Angiras sometimes either as an epithet or as the
father of Agni, and the Saint himself connected chiefly with
such hymns as are addressed to Agni, to Indra or to dei
ties of a kindred description: a portion of the fourth Veda,
the Atharvan, reports him also as an expounder of the
Brahmavidyā (q. v.) or the sacred knowledge, that had been
imparted to him by Satyavāha, a descendant of Bharadvāja.
(See अङ्गिर्.) Though Angiras, as may be concluded from his
name being connected with the authorship of a great por
tion of the sacred Hindu literature, appears to have been
one of the oldest civilizers of India, no historical date is
to be obtained from the epic or pauranik literature where
the vaidik legends of his life are merely amplified; there
he is named as one of the Prajāpatis or progenitors of
mankind engendered, according to some by Manu, accord
ing to others by Brahmā himself, either with the female
half of his body or from his mouth or from the space
between his eye-brows. As such he is considered also as
one of the seven Ṛṣis who preside over the reign of the
first Manu or Svāyambhuva. He is called, besides, the priest
of the Gods, the Lord of the sacrifice &c. Sometimes he
is considered as a son of Uru by Āgneyī, the daughter of
Agni. His daughters are the Ṛchas (or vaidik hymns) and
also, Śaśvatī, Sinīvālī, Kuhū, Rākā, Anumati; his sons
are Samvarta, the manes called Havishmats, Utathya,
Bṛhaspati, Mārkanḍeya; his wives, Smṛti (traditional
science), two daughters of Daksha, Svadhā and Satī, and
Śraddhā, the daughter of the sage Kardama. As an astro
nomical personification he is Bṛhaspati himself or the regent
of the planet Jupiter and presides over the sixth year of
the cycle of sixty years. See also अथर्वन्.
II. m. pl. (-रसः)
1 The descendants of the former. In this
capacity they share also in the nature of the legends attri
buted to Angiras. Angiras being the father of Agni, they
are considered as descendants of Agni himself, who is also
called the first of the Angirasas. Like Angiras, they occur
in hymns addressed to the luminous deities and, at a later
period, they become for the most part personifications of
light, of luminous bodies, of divisions of time, of celestial
phenomena and fires adapted to peculiar occasions as the
full and change of the moon, or to particular rites as the
Aśvamedha, Rājasūya, the Pākayajnas or sacrifices with
food, obsequial and funeral fires, expiatory fires, and the
like. Most of the authors of the hymns of the Rigveda are
connected with them and in the Purāṇas mention is made of
two tribes of the Angirasas which were Brāhmaṇas as well
as Kshatriyas.
2 The hymns of the Atharvaveda. See also
अथर्वन् pl. and अथर्वाङ्गिरस् pl. E. अङ्ग्, uṇ. aff. असि with
āgama इरुट्, or, according to another authority, a Tatpur.
composed of अन् (meaning अन्न food, from अन् kṛt aff. क्विप्)
and गिरस् (from गॄ to swallow) ‘devouring food’. The latter
etymology, apparently without any grammatical authority,
would refer especially to अङ्गिरस् as epithet of Agni. See
also अङ्गिरस्तम. The plural अङ्गिरसः is considered, though
without any etymological necessity, as the plural of the
deriv. form आङ्गिरस with luk or elision of the affix.
text.701:
अङ्गिरस m. (-सः) A proper name: an enemy of Viṣṇu in
his incarnation as Paraśurāma. E. unknown, perhaps अङ्गि-
रस्, taddh. aff. अच्.
text.702:
अङ्गिरसामयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The name of a sacrifice be
longing to the class of the Sattra (q. v.). E. अङ्गिरस् (gen.
plur.) and अयन, ‘the path of the Angirasas’.
text.703:
अङ्गिरस्तम m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Possessing the quality of
motion or that of devouring food in an extreme degree; a
vaidik epithet chiefly of Agni. See अङ्गिरस् and the E. of
this word. E. अङ्गिरस्, taddh. aff. तमप्.
text.704:
अङ्गिरस्वत् I. m. (-स्वान्) Coupled with or accompanied by
the Angirasas. E. अङ्गिरस्, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
II. ind. Like Angiras. E. अङ्गिरस्, taddh. aff. वति.
text.705:
अङ्गीकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Promising, agreeing, assenting.
E. अङ्ग with taddh. aff. च्वि and करण.
text.706:
अङ्गीकार Tatpur. m. (-रः) An agreement, a promise. E. अङ्ग
with taddh. aff. च्वि, and कार.
text.707: अङ्गीकृ. See कृ. E. कृ with अङ्ग, the गति, taddh. aff. च्वि.
text.708:
अङ्गीकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Agreed, promised &c.
E. अङ्ग with taddh. aff. च्वि, and कृत.
text.709:
अङ्गीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring or belonging to
Anga (the country) q. v. E. अङ्ग, taddh. aff. छ.
text.710: अङ्गु See the E. of अङ्गुष्ठ.
text.711:
अङ्गुरि f. (-रि)
1 A finger.
2 A toe. Also अङ्गुरी. E. See अङ्गु-
लि, ल् changed to र्.
text.713:
अङ्गुरीय m. n. (-यः-यम्) A finger-ring. E. See अङ्गुलीय,
ल् changed to र्.
text.714:
अङ्गुरीयक m. n. (-कः-कम्) A finger-ring. E. See अङ्गुली-
यक, ल् changed to र्.
text.715:
अङ्गुल I. m. (and according to one authority also n.) (-लः
-लम्)
1 A finger.
2 The thumb.
3 A finger's breadth, as a
linear measure, viz. a measure of eight barley corns joined
side by side in breadth or of three grains of rice in length.
Twelve angulas make a vitasti or span, and twenty-four
a hasta or cubit.
4 (In astronomy.) A digit or one twelfth
part of any dimension, subdivided into sixty vyangulas.
E. अङ्गुल is considered by the gramm. authorities as a sub
stitute of अङ्गुलि, as which it ought to occur only at the end
of certain Tatpur., derived then with samāsānta aff. अच् and
at the end of certain Bahuvr., derived with samāsānta aff. षच्.
In both cases it is a neutre. The native dictionaries how
ever state as above.
II. m. (-लः) A proper name of the sage Chāṇakya. E.
अङ्ग्, uṇ. aff. उलन्(?).
text.716:
अङ्गुलप्रमाण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) The linear measure called अङ्गुल.
See the preceding. E. अङ्गुल and प्रमाण.
text.717:
अङ्गुलमान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The linear measure called अङ्गुल
q. v. E. अङ्गुल and मान.
text.718:
अङ्गुलि f. (-लिः)
1 A finger.
2 A toe.
3 The same as अङ्गुष्ठ
q. v.
4 The tip of an elephant's trunk. This word is changed
at the end of certain Tatpur. and of certain Bahuvr. to
अङ्गुल q. v. See also अङ्गुली, अङ्गुरि and अङ्गुरी. E. अङ्ग्,
uṇ. aff. उलि.
text.719:
अङ्गुलितोरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Three semicircular lines drawn
across the forehead, with sandal or ashes of burnt cow
dung &c., a sectarial mark, especially of the followers of
Śiva, more commonly termed Tripunḍra. E. अङ्गुलि and
तोरण the ornamented arch of a gateway, to which the mark
made by the fingers upon the forehead may be compared.
text.720:
अङ्गुलित्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) See the following. E. अङ्गुलि and
त्र (what protects).
text.721:
अङ्गुलित्राण Tatpur. m.(?). n. (-णः(?)-णम्) A piece of leather
or thin iron, worn on the thumb or finger by archers to
prevent the bowstring from injuring it. E. अङ्गुलि and त्राण.
text.722:
अङ्गुलिपर्वन् Tatpur. n. (-र्व) The joint of the fingers, the
prominent parts between the joints of the fingers on the
under side. E. अङ्गुलि and पर्वन्.
text.723:
अङ्गुलिमुख Tatpur. n. (-खम्) The tip of the finger. E. अङ्गुलि
and मुख. Also अङ्गुलीमुख.
text.724: अङ्गुलिमुद्रा Tatpur. f. (-द्रा) A seal ring. E. अङ्गुलि and मुद्रा.
text.725:
अङ्गुलिमुद्रिका Tatpur. f. (-का) A seal ring. E. अङ्गुलि and
मुद्रिका.
text.726:
अङ्गुलिमोटन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Cracking or snapping the fin
ger joints. E. अङ्गुलि and मोटन.
text.727:
अङ्गुलिषङ्ग I. Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) The contact of the fingers,
laying hold of any thing with the fingers.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Sticking to the fin
gers. E. अङ्गुलि and सङ्ग.
text.728:
अङ्गुलिसन्देश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Snapping the finger joints.
E. अङ्गुलि and सन्देश.
text.729:
अङ्गुलिस्फोटन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Snapping the fingers. E. अङ्गु-
लि and स्फोटन.
text.730:
अङ्गुली f. (-ली)
1 A finger.
2 The tip of an elephant's trunk.
See अङ्गुलि.
text.731:
अङ्गुलीक m. n. (-कः-कम्) A finger ring. E. अङ्गुली, taddh.
aff. कन्. See अङ्गुलीयक.
text.732:
अङ्गुलीपञ्चक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) The five fingers collectively.
E. अङ्गुली and पञ्चक.
text.734:
अङ्गुलीय n. (-यम्) A finger ring. E. अङ्गुलि, taddh. aff. य.
See also अङ्गुरीय.
text.735:
अङ्गुलीयक n. (-कम्) A finger ring. E. अङ्गुलीय, taddh. aff.
कन्. See also अङ्गुरीयक.
text.736:
अङ्गुलीसम्भूत Tatpur. m. (-तः) A finger nail. E. अङ्गुली and
सम्भूत.
text.737:
अङ्गुष्ठ Tatpur. m. (-ष्ठः)
1 The thumb.
2 The great toe.
3 A
thumb's breadth, as a linear measure which is said to be
a measure of six barley corns. This seems, however, not
to be correct, because twelve aṅguṣṭhas are given by the
same authority as equal to a Vitasti or span. See अङ्गुल.
E. अङ्गु here said to mean the hand, and स्थ.
text.738:
अङ्गुष्ठमात्र m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्री-त्रम्) Having the size of, being
as little as a thumb. E. अङ्गुष्ठ, taddh. aff. मात्रच्; but, more
properly, a Bahuvr. composed of अङ्गुष्ठ and मात्रा.
text.739:
अङ्गुष्ठमात्रक m. f. n. (-कः-त्रिका-कम्) The same as the pre
ceding. E. The preceding, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.740:
अङ्गुष्ठ्य m. (-ष्ठ्यः) The nail of the thumb. E. अङ्गुष्ठ, taddh.
aff. यत्.
text.741:
अङ्गूष m. (-षः)
1 An ichneumon.
2 An arrow. E. अङ्ग्, uṇ.
aff. ऊषन्(?).
text.742:
अङ्ग्य m. f. n. (-ङ्ग्यः-ङ्ग्या-ङ्ग्यम्) Belonging to, being in the
body, the limbs &c. See the meanings of अङ्ग. E. अङ्ग,
taddh. aff. यत्.
text.743:
अङ्घ् (अघि-भ्वादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. ātm. (अङ्घते-
आनङ्घे-अङ्घिता &c.).
1 To go.
2 To go swiftly.
3 To be
gin moving.
4 To begin.
5 To blame, to censure.
6 To
despise. See also अंह्, of which it seems to be the fuller
and original form.
text.745:
अङ्घस् n. (-ङ्घः) Sin. E. See अंहस्, of which it seems to be
the fuller and original form.
text.746:
अङ्घारि Tatpur. m. (-रिः) The enemy of sin or evil, a vaidik
epithet of Soma and of one of the sacrificial fire altars.
E. अङ्घ, an abbreviation of अङ्घस् (see also अघ), and अरि.
text.747:
अङ्घि m. (-ङ्घिः) The same as the following. The correctness
of this form seems very doubtful.
text.748:
अङ्घ्रि m. (according to some also n.) (-ङ्घ्रिः-ङ्घ्रि)
1 A foot.
2 The root of a tree. E. अङ्घ्, uṇ. aff. क्रिन्. See also अंह्रि,
of which this word seems to be the fuller, original form.
All words meaning ‘foot’ have also the meaning of ‘root
of a tree’.
text.749: अङ्घ्रिप Tatpur. m. (-पः) A tree. See अंह्रिप. E. अङ्घ्रि and प.
text.750:
अङ्घ्रिपर्णी Bahuvr. f. (-र्णी) A plant (Hedysarum lagopodioi
des). See the following and पृश्निपर्णी. E. अङ्घ्रि and पर्ण,
fem. aff. ङीप्, the leaves rising from the root.
text.751:
अङ्घ्रिवल्लि Bahuvr. f. (-ल्लिः) A plant (Hedysarum logopodioi
des Rox.). Also अङ्घ्रिवल्ली. See the preceding and the fol
lowing. E. अङ्घ्रि and वल्लि.
text.752:
अङ्घ्रिवल्लिका Bahuvr. f. (-का) A plant (Hedysarum lagopodioi
des, Rox.). E. अङ्घ्रिवल्लि, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.753:
अङ्घ्रिस्कन्ध Tatpur. m. (-न्धः) The ancle. See also अंह्रिस्कन्ध.
E. अङ्घ्रि and स्कन्ध.
text.754:
अच् I. r. 1st cl. See अञ्च् I. (The forms अचति-अचते- p. p.
अचित- in the meaning of ‘to go’ and अचते-आचन्त- in
the meaning of ‘to bend’ belong only to the Vedas.)
II. As latter part of a compound, see अञ्च् II.
text.755:
अचक्र m. f. n. (-क्रः-क्रा-क्रम्) I. Tatpur. (ved.) Not moving,
not vacillating, immoveable. E. अ neg. and चक्र.
II. Bahuvr. Having no wheels. E. अ priv. and चक्र.
text.756:
अचक्षुर्विषय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) What is not at
tainable by sight, invisible. E. अ neg. and चक्षुर्विषय.
text.757:
अचक्षुष्क Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Having no eyes. E.
अचक्षुस्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.758:
अचक्षुस् I. Tatpur. n. (-क्षुः) A bad or contracted eye. E. अ
neg. and चक्षुस्.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षुः-क्षुः-क्षुः) Having no eyes,
blind. E. अ priv. and चक्षुस्.
text.759:
अचण्ड Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डा or -ण्डी-ण्डम्) Gentle,
not passionate.
II. f. (-ण्डी) A tractable cow. E. अ neg. and चण्ड.
text.760:
अचतुर m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) I. Bahuvr. Having not four,
being devoid of four. E. अ and चतुर्, samāsānta aff. अच्.
II. Tatpur. Not dexterous, not clever &c. See चतुर.
E. अ neg. and चतुर.
text.761: अचर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Immoveable. E. अ and चर.
text.762:
अचल Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Immoveable, fixed.
II. m. (-लः)
1 A mountain.
2 A pin or bolt.
3 A name
of Śiva.
4 A proper name, viz. the first of the nine ‘white
Balas’, a class of deified persons peculiar to the Jainas.
5 (In arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the numeral
seven.
III. f. (-ला)
1 The earth.
2 One of the ten Buddhist
earths(?). E. अ neg. and चल.
text.763: अचलकीला Bahuvr. f. (-ला) The earth. E. अचल and कील.
text.764:
अचलत्विष् Bahuvr. m. (-त्विट्) The Kokila or Indian cuckoo.
E. अचल and त्विष्.
text.765:
अचलधृति Bahuvr. f. (-तिः) The name of a metre which
consists of four lines, each of them having sixteen short
syllables. It is called also Gītyāryā. E. अचल and धृति.
text.766:
अचलभ्रातृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) A proper name: a Brāhmaṇa
of Oude, of the Harīta family, who became a convert to
the Jaina doctrine and then one of the eleven chiefs of the
gaṇas or assemblings of the Jaina Ṛṣis. E. अचल and
भ्रातृ.
text.767:
अचलमति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) The name of a Rākṣasa. E.
अचल and मति.
text.768:
अचलाधिप Tatpur. m. (-पः) The king of mountains, the
personified Himālaya; also analogous compounds, as अच-
लेन्द्र, अचलेश्वर, &c. E. अचल and अधिप.
text.769:
अचापल्य Tatpur. n. (-ल्यम्) Firmness, steadiness, consistency.
E. अ neg. and चापल्य.
text.770:
अचारु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रुः-र्वी-रु) Inelegant, not beautiful.
E. अ neg. and चारु.
text.771:
अचिक्कण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Not smooth, rough
&c. See चिक्कण. E. अ neg. and चिक्कण.
text.772:
अचित् (ved.) I. Tatpur. m. (-त्) One who does not perform
the ceremony of the अग्निचयन q. v., one who is impious.
E. अ neg. and चित् (collecting).
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्) Without understanding, foolish.
E. अ priv. and चित् (understanding).
text.773:
अचित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) I. Gone. (Only in the Vedas.)
E. अच्, kṛt aff. क्त, with āgama इट्.
II. Tatpur. Not collected &c. See चित. E. अ neg. and
चित.
text.774:
अचित्त m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) I. Tatpur.
1 Not thought,
inconceivable.
2 Unperceived, not expected. E. अ neg. and
चित्त (thought).
II. Bahuvr. Without intellect, insensible, inanimate. E.
अ priv. and चित्त (intellect).
text.775:
अचित्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Want of intellect, infatuation,
foolishness. (ved.) E. अ neg. and चित्ति.
text.776:
अचिन्ता Tatpur. f. (-न्ता)
1 Absence of thought or conside
ration.
2 Disregard. E. अ neg. and चिन्ता.
text.777:
अचिन्तित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unthought of, un
expected.
2 Disregarded. E. अ neg. and चिन्तित.
text.778:
अचिन्त्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्त्यः-न्त्या-न्त्यम्) Inconceivable,
unimaginable, incomprehensible.
II. m. (-न्त्यः) A name of Śiva. E. अ neg. and चिन्त्य.
text.779:
अचिर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not long (in time),
brief, momentary. Adverbially are used: अचिरम्, अचि-
रेण and अचिरात्, in a short time, soon, directly. In
composition with a participle, अचिर means ‘not yet a
long time, not long ago, recently’. See f. i. अचिरप्रसूता,
अचिरमृत.
II. f. (-रा) A proper name: the mother of Śānti, the
sixteenth Arhat or Jaina saint of the present Avasarpiṇī.
E. अ neg. and चिर.
text.780:
अचिरद्युति Bahuvr. f. (-तिः) Lightning. E. अचिर and द्युति;
‘its light being of short duration’.
text.781:
अचिरप्रभा Bahuvr. f. (-भा) Lightning. E. अचिर and प्रभा.
See the preceding.
text.782:
अचिरप्रसूता Tatpur. f. (-ता) A cow which has recently
calved. E. अचिर and प्रसूता.
text.783:
अचिरभास् Bahuvr. f. (-भाः) Lightning. E. अचिर and भास्.
See अचिरद्युति.
text.784:
अचिरमृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Recently deceased.
E. अचिर and मृत.
text.785:
अचिररोचिस् Bahuvr. f. (-चिः) Lightning. E. अचिर and
रोचिस्. See अचिरद्युति.
text.786:
अचिरांशु Bahuvr. f. (-शुः) Lightning. E. अचिर and अंशु.
See अचिरद्युति.
text.787:
अचिराभा Bahuvr. f. (-भा) Lightning. E. अचिर and आभा.
See अचिरद्युति.
text.788:
अचेतन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 Devoid of reason
or feeling, insensible (especially as an attribute of matter
and inanimate objects).
2 Unconsicous. E. अ priv. and
चेतना.
text.789:
अचेतस् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ताः-ताः-तः) The same as the
preceding. E. अ priv. and चेतस्.
text.790:
अचेतान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not reflecting, thought
less, infatuated. (ved.) E. अ neg. and चेतान.
text.791:
अचेष्ट Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Motionless. E. अ priv.
and चेष्टा.
text.792:
अचेष्टता f. (-ता) Fainting, syncope, loss of sense or con
sciousness. E. अचेष्ट, taddh. aff. तल्.
text.793:
अचैतन्य n. (-न्यम्) I. Tatpur.
1 Ignorance, especially spiritual.
2 Unconsciousness, insensibility. E. अ neg. and चैतन्य.
II. Bahuvr. The material universe or matter in general,
as being devoid of reason or feeling and opposed to spi
ritual being or God. E. अ priv. and चैतन्य. As a Bahuvr.
this word may also be used in the three genders.
text.794:
अचोदस् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दाः-दाः-दः) Without compulsion,
not compelled, spontaneous. (ved.) E. अ priv. and चोदस्.
text.795:
अच्छ I. m. f. n. (-च्छः-च्छा-च्छम्) Clear, transparent. See छ.
II. m. (-च्छः)
1 Crystal.
2 A bear (see ऋक्ष).
III. ind. (see निपात) A kind of preposition (or गति q. v.)
with the meaning of ‘to, unto, before, in front’, or ‘obtain
ing, taking possession of’. Its use seems to be restricted
to the vaidik literature where it appears, for the most
part, in the protracted form अच्छा. It occurs only in con
junction with verbs implying motion or speech--especially
with अज्, इ, गम्, या, नश्, नु, वा, वच्, वद्--either pre
ceding or following them and requiring the noun which de
pends upon this combination to stand in the accusative or in
the locative; the latter case, however, is only exceptional.-
The word is given also in the form अच्छम्. E. unknown.
That which is given is: अ neg. and छो, kṛt affix क,
‘not cutting or injuring sc. the sight’ and would refer
only to I. and to II. 1. in the sense of ‘not easily cut’.
text.796:
अच्छभल्ल Tatpur.(?) m. (-ल्लः) A bear. This is sometimes
considered as two words. See अच्छ and भल्ल. E. अच्छ
and भल्ल.
text.797:
अच्छावाक m. (-कः) One of the sixteen Ṛtvijs or priests
required for the performance of the great sacrifices with
the juice of the Soma plant. He is one of the three priests
who are subordinate to the होतृ q. v. (see besides मैत्राव-
रुण and ग्रावस्तुत्) and one of the four priests who receive
the third division of the Dakṣiṇā q. v. (See also नेष्टृ,
अग्नीध् and प्रतिहर्तृ.) E. वच् with अच्छ in its protracted
form, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.798:
अच्छावाकीय I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Referring to the अच्छा-
वाक q. v.
II. n. (-यम्)
1 A Sūkta or hymn in which the word अच्छा-
वाक occurs.
2 The office or function of the अच्छावाक.
E. अच्छावाक, taddh. aff. छ.
text.799:
अच्छिद्र I. Tatpur. n. (-द्रम्) Uninterruptedness, complete
ness. E. अ neg. and छिद्र.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्रः-द्रा-द्रम्)
1 Uninterrupted.
2 Un
injured, unhurt. E. अ priv. and छिद्र.
text.800:
अच्छिन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Uncut, unhurt, un
injured. E. अ neg. and छिन्न.
text.801:
अच्छिन्नपत्त्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Having the wings
uninjured, unbroken (also metaphorically as a vaidik epithet
of the इष्टकाः which were arranged in the shape of a bird.
See अग्निचयन). E. अच्छिन्न and पत्त्र.
text.802:
अच्छुप्ता Tatpur. f. (-प्ता) A proper name, viz. one of the
sixteen Vidyādevīs, female divinities peculiar to the my
thology of the Jainas. E. अ neg. and छुप्त ‘not touched
scil. by sin’.
text.803:
अच्छेत m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Approached, obtained. E. इ,
with अच्छ, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.804:
अच्छैदिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not always fit to
be cut. E. अ neg. and छैदिक.
text.805:
अच्छोक्ति Karmadh. f. (-क्तिः) Pure speech. E. अच्छ (pure)
and उक्ति. This word may also be explained in the
sense of ‘allocution’ from अच्छ (the गति), and उक्ति.
text.806:
अच्छोद Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) Having clear or
limpid waters.
II. f. (-दा) The name of a river produced by the Manes
Agniṣvāttas.
III. n. (-दम्) The name of a lake in the Himālaya, de
riving its origin from the river Achchhodā. E. अच्छ and
उद (a substitute of उदक).
text.807:
अच्युत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not falling, fixed,
firm.
2 Imperishable, permanent.
3 Not oozing, not trickling,
not dripping.
II. m. (-तः)
1 A name of Viṣṇu or Kṛṣṇa.
2 A shrub
(Morinda tinctoria). E. अ neg. and च्युत.
text.808:
अच्युतक्षित् Bahuvr. m. (-त्) Resting on a solid ground (a
vaidik epithet of Soma &c.). E. अच्युत and क्षित् (dwelling).
text.809:
अच्युतच्युत् Tatpur. m. (-त्) Shaking or destroying what is
fixed (a vaidik epithet of Indra &c.). E. अच्युत and च्युत्.
text.810:
अच्युतज Tatpur. m. pl. (-जाः) A class of Jaina deities which
belong to the Vaimānikas and are produced by Viṣṇu.
E. अच्युत and ज.
text.811:
अच्युतदन्त Bahuvr. m. (-न्तः) A proper name: the ancestor
of the warrior tribe, called आच्युतदन्ति. E. अच्युत and दन्त.
text.812:
अच्युतन्त Bahuvr.(?) m. (-न्तः) A proper name: the ancestor
of the warrior tribe, called आच्युतन्ति. E. unknown; per
haps the same as the former in a mutilated form.
text.813:
अच्युतमूर्ति Bahuvr. m. (-र्तिः) A name of Viṣṇu. E. अच्युत
and मूर्ति ‘having an imperishable shape’.
text.814:
अच्युतवास Tatpur. m. (-सः) The religious fig tree (Ficus
religiosa). E. अच्युत and वास ‘Viṣṇu's abode’.
text.815:
अच्युतस्थल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) The name of a place in the
Panjab. E. अच्युत and स्थल.
text.816:
अच्युताग्रज Tatpur. m. (-जः) A proper name of the elder
brother of Viṣṇu, viz.
1 Balarāma,
2 Indra. E. अच्युत
and अग्रज.
text.817:
अज् (अज-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अजति.
The tenses which require ārdhadhātuka affixes, are not
to be formed of this radical, वी (q. v.) being then con
sidered as a substitute, of which the formation is to take
place. According to others, however, there may be found.
perf. आजिथ- fut. अजिता-अजिष्यति- aor. आजीत्- cond.
आजिष्यत्. Pass. अज्यते- fut. अजिता-अजिष्यते- prec. अजि-
षीष्ट- aor. आजिष्ट. Des. अजिजिषति.)
1 To go.
2 To throw
or cast, to impel. With
1 अच्छ- To impel to.
2 अप- To
send away.
3 अभि- To impel to.
4 अव- To send down.
5 आ- To direct hither (trans. and intrans.), to fetch, to
scatter.
6 आ pref. अभि(अभ्या-) To direct hither.
7 उद्-
To drive out, to draw out.
8 उप- To direct near.
9 निर्-
To drive out.
10 वि- To throw asunder, to scatter.
11 सम्-
To throw or send together.
text.818:
अज I. 1. m. (-जः)
1 The mover, the instigator.
2 As such,
this word occurs in the Vedas, for the most part in con
junction with एकपाद् (q. v.), as an epithet or as a syno
nyme of
a. Indra,
b. Rudra, one of the Maruts,
c. Agni,
d. Pūṣan or Sūrya; in the epic and paurāṇik literature as
a synonyme of
a. Brahmā (see also अजन),
b. Viṣṇu,
c. Śiva,
d. Kāma; in philosophical texts, in its feminine form (अजा)
as a synonyme of
a. Prakṛti or Nature,
b. Māyā or Illusion,
the unreality of Nature or Universe.
3 A proper name,
viz.
a. A descendant of Viśvāmitra.
b. A prince of the solar
race, the son of Raghu and father of Daśaratha, or ac
cording to others, the grandson of Raghu, the son of Di
līpa and father of Dīrghabāhu; or the son of Nābhāga and
father of Daśaratha.
4 A he-goat. This animal was con
sidered as the vehicle of Pūṣan, the sun, (see अजाश्व)
and also as consecrated to Agni and Soma conjointly.
5 (In
astronomy.) The sign Aries.
6 The name of a mineral sub
stance. See माक्षिक and अजनामक.
7 A kind of rice, three
or seven years old(?).
8 The moon(?).
2. m. pl. (-जाः) The name of
a. a sort of Ṛṣis in
Brahma's heaven;
b. a people mentioned in the Vedas.
3. f. (-जा)
1 Prakṛti or Nature.
2 Māyā or Illusion
(see अज m.).
3 A she-goat.
4 The name of a plant, the
bulbs of which resemble the udder of a she-goat. E. अज्,
kṛt aff. अच्; in the fem. with the aff. टाप्. 1. 4. and 2. 3.
implying ‘the quick animal’.
II. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Unborn. This mean
ing has been applied to अज in the sense of Brahmā,
Viṣṇu, Śiva, Kāma, and अजा in the sense of Prakṛti
and Māyā. But see before. E. अ neg. and ज.
text.819:
अजक I. m. (-कः) A proper name:
1 A descendant of Purū
ravas, the son of Sumantu (or according to others of Su
naha) and grandson of Jahnu.
2 A king of Magadha, of
the line of Pradyota.
II. f. (-का)
1 A young she-goat. (Also अजिका.)
2 A
kind of disease of the pupil of the eye. See अजकाजात.
E. अज, taddh. aff. क.
text.820:
अजकर्ण Bahuvr. m. (-र्णः)
1 The ear of a goat.
2 A tree (Ter
minalia alata tomentosa, Rox.); the leaf being compared
to the ear of a goat. See also असन. E. अज and कर्ण.
text.821:
अजकर्णक m. (-कः) A tree, vulg. Sāl (Shorea robusta, Rox.).
See साल. E. taddh. कन् affixed to the preceding, denoting
resemblance.
text.822:
अजकव m. (-वः) The bow of Śiva. E. unknown; the follow
ing is evidently artificial: अज Viṣṇu, and क Brahmā,
taddh. aff. व, Brahmā being placed in the centre, and
Viṣṇu on the upper part. See also अजकाव-अजगव-अज-
गाव-अजीकव-आजगव.
text.823:
अजकाजात Tatpur. n. (-तम्) A disease of the transparent cor
nea of the eye: small tumors like the litter of goats, slightly
red, which protrude through the cornea, from which a bloody
discharge proceeds mixed with pus. E. अजका and जात.
text.824:
अजकाव I. m. n. (-वः-वम्) The bow of Śiva; see अजकव.
II. m. (-वः) A poisonous little animal.
III. n. (-वम्) A sacrificial vessel consecrated to Mitra
and Varuna. E. doubtful. Perhaps this word is derived
from अजका, taddh. aff. व, III. being explained as a vessel
having a piece of wood in the shape of the throat nipples
of a goat and II. as an animal poisonous or deadly as the
disease अजका.
text.825:
अजकूला Bahuvr. f. (-ला) The name of a town of the Bodhis.
E. अज and कूल.
text.826:
अजक्षीर Tatpur. n. (-रम्) Goat's milk. This word occurs only in
the Vedas. E. अज, instead of अजा, and क्षीर. See अजाक्षीर.
text.828:
अजगन्धा Bahuvr. f. (-न्धा) The shrubby basil (Ocymum gra
tissimum). E. अज and गन्ध, ‘smelling like a goat’.
text.829:
अजगन्धिका Bahuvr. f. (-का) The shrubby basil (Ocymum
gratissimum). E. अजगन्धा, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.830:
अजगन्धिनी f. (-नी) A plant. See अजशृङ्गी. E. अज-गन्ध,
taddh. aff. इनि.
text.831:
अजगर Tatpur. I. m. (-रः) The Boa, a large serpent. (Boa
constrictor.)
II. f. (-री) The name of a plant. E. अज and गर (who
swallows).
text.832:
अजगल्लिका f. (-का) One of the ‘minor diseases’; it occurs in
children and consists of small tuberculous eruptions of the
form of peas. E. अजगल्ल (cheek of a goat), taddh. aff. कन्.
text.833:
अजगव n. (-वम्)
1 The bow of Śiva. See अजकाव.
2 The
southern portion of the three portions into which the path
of the sun and other planets amongst the lunar asterisms
is divided. See जरद्गव. E. अजग (the meaning of this word
is not given), taddh. aff. व. See the E. of अजकाव.
text.835:
अजघन्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्यः-न्या-न्यम्) Not the last, not
the lowest. E. अ neg. and जघन्य.
text.836:
अजजीविक Bahuvr. m. (-कः) A goatherd. E. अज and जी-
विका. See also अजाजीव.
text.837:
अजटा Bahuvr. f. (-टा) The name of a plant (Flacourtia ca
taphracta). Also written अजडा and अज्झटा. E. अ priv.
and जटा.
text.838:
अजड Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-डः-डा-डम्) Not foolish, not
stupid.
II. f. (-डा) The name of two plants:
1 See अजटा.
2 See
कपिकच्छु. E. अ neg. and जड.
text.839:
अजत्व n. (-त्व) The being अजा q. v. Also अजात्व. E. अजा,
the long आ being shortened, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.840:
अजथ्या f. (-थ्या) A plant (Yellow jasmin). E. अज, taddh.
aff. थ्यन्, ‘fit for goats’. See also यूथि.
text.841:
अजदण्डी Tatpur. f. (-ण्डी) The name of a plant. See also
ब्रह्मदण्डी. E. अज (Brahmā) and दण्ड.
text.842:
अजदेवता Bahuvr. f. pl. (-ताः) The name of the twenty fifth
lunar mansion. See पूर्वभाद्रपदा. E. अज and देवता.
text.843:
अजन I. 1. n. (-नम्) Instigating, moving.
2. m. (-नः) A name of Brahmā. See अज. E. अज्, kṛt
aff. ल्युट्.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Devoid of men, soli
tary. E. अ priv. and जन.
text.844:
अजननि m. (-निः) Privation of birth; used as an impre
cation. Ex. अजननिरस्तु तस्य may he cease to exist. E. अ
priv. and जननि.
text.845:
अजनयोनिज Tatpur. m. (-जः) A name of Daksha. E. अज-
न-योनि and ज ‘born from Brahmā’.
text.846:
अजनामक Bahuvr. m. (-कः) The name of a mineral substance.
See अज and माक्षिक. E. अजनामन् (having the name of
Viṣṇu), samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.847: अजनि f. (-निः) Path, road. E. अज्, kṛt (or uṇ.?) aff. अनि.
text.848:
अजन्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्यः-न्या-न्यम्)
1 Not to be born
or produced.
2 Not fit for or favourable to men.
II. n. (-न्यम्) A portent, an omen, any natural pheno
menon as an earthquake &c. so considered. E. अ neg.
and जन्य.
text.849:
अजप I. Tatpur. m. (-पः) 1. A goat-herd. E. अज and प.
2. A reader of works considered heterodox. E. अ deter.
and जप.
II. Bahuvr. f. (-पा) The name of a particular mantra or
mystical formula, otherwise bearing the name of Hansa.
E. अ priv. and जप; so called from its not consisting of a
जप or a prayer repeated inaudibly, like other mantras,
but of a certain number of inhalations and exhalations.
text.850:
अजपथ Tatpur. m. (-थः) Probably the same as अजवीथी
q. v. E. अज and पथिन्, samāsānta aff. अ, ‘like a goat's
road’; the taddh. aff. कन् which implies similarity, being
considered as dropped in this word.
text.851:
अजपद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा or -दी-दम्) Goat-footed.
E. अज and पाद, samāsānta aff. अच्. See the following.
text.852: अजपाद Bahuvr. m. (-पादः) Goat-footed. E. अज and पाद.
text.853:
अजपार्श्व Bahuvr. m. (-श्वः) A surname of Rājīvalochana, the
son of Svetakarṇa. E. अज and पार्श्व; ‘his sides were black
like the skin of certain goats, when he was drawn out of
the water after having been found exposed by his mother
and purified by two sons of Sraviṣṭhā’.
text.854:
अजपाल Tatpur. m. (-लः)
1 A goat-herd.
2 A proper name:
according to the Matsyapurāṇa, the son of Dīrghabāhu and
father of Daśaratha. See अज. E. अज and पाल.
text.855:
अजभक्ष Tatpur. m. (-क्षः) The name of a plant. See वर्वूर.
E. अज and भक्ष ‘goat's food’.
text.856:
अजमायु Karmadh. m. (-यः) Bleating like a goat (as a frog).
(In the Vedas.) E. अज and मायु.
text.857:
अजमार Tatpur. m. (-रः) The name of a prince(?). E. अज
and मार.
text.858:
अजमीढ Tatpur. m. (-ढः) A proper name:
1 A son of Su
hotra and author of vaidik hymns.
2 The 26th king of the
lunar dynasty, a grandson of Suhotra and son of Bṛhat,
or according to others, a grandson of Suhotra and son of
Hastin.
3 A surname of Yudhiṣṭhira, the friend of Aja.
Also अजमीळ्ह (ved.). E. अज and मीढ.
text.859:
अजमुख Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-खः-खी-खम्) Goat-faced,
having a face like that of a goat.
II. f. (-खी) The name of a female fiend. E. अज and मुख.
text.860:
अजमोदा Tatpur. f. (-दा) The name of several plants:
1 Com
mon carroway (Carum carui).
2 A kind of lovage (Ligusti
cum ajwaen, Rox.).
3 A sort of parsley (Apium involu
cratum); this latter application is the one used in the dia
lects. E. अज and मोद.
text.861:
अजमोदिका f. (-का) The name of a plant (Ligusticum Ajwaen).
E. The former, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.862:
अजम्भ Bahuvr. m. (-म्भः) A frog. E. अ priv. and जम्भ ‘hav
ing no teeth’.
text.863:
अजय I. Tatpur. m. (-यः) Defeat. E. अ neg. and जय.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Unsurpassed, un
subdued, over whom or which no triumph is obtained.
2. m. (-यः)
1 A name of Viṣṇu.
2 The proper name
of a lexicographer.
3 The name of a river in Rāḍha.
3. f. (-या)
1 Hemp.
2 One of the female friends of
Durgā. See विजया. E. अ priv. and जय.
text.864:
अजय्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-य्यः-य्या-य्यम्) Invincible, not to be
subdued or surpassed. E. अ neg. and जय्य.
text.865:
अजर Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Undecaying, not
becoming old or infirm.
II. f. (-रा)
1 Aloes perfoliata. See गृहकन्या.
2 See जीर्ण-
फञ्जी, a climbing plant, a kind of वृद्धदारक q. v. E. अ
priv. and जरा. With respect to the declension of this word,
see जरा and अजरस्.
text.866:
अजरयु Tatpur. (ved.) m. (-युः) Undecaying. E. अ neg. and
जरयु.
text.867: अजरस् Bahuvr. A substitute for अजर in some cases. See जरा.
text.868:
अजर्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Imperishable, unde
caying.
II. n. (-र्यम्) Friendship. E. अ neg. and जर्य.
text.869: अजर्षभ Tatpur. m. (-भः) The best goat. E. अज and ऋषभ.
text.870: अजलम्बन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Antimony. E. अज and लम्बन.
text.871:
अजलोमन् Tatpur. m. (-मा)
1 Goat's hair.
2 Cowach (Car
popogon pruriens). See अग्रपर्णी. E. अज and लोमन्.
text.872:
अजलोमी Tatpur. f. (-मी). See the preceding. E. अज and
लोमन्, samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.873:
अजवस्ति Tatpur. I. m. (-तिः) A proper name.
II. m. pl. (-स्तयः) The descendants of the former. E. अज
and वस्ति.
text.874:
अजवाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) The name of a country. E. अज
and वाह.
text.875:
अजवीथी Tatpur. f. (-थी) One of the three divisions of the
southern portion (see अजगव or जरद्गव), one of the three
portions into which the path of the sun and other planets
amongst the lunar asterisms is divided. It comprises the
three asterisms Mūlā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā and Uttarāṣāḍhā. E.
अज and वीथी ‘goat's road’. See also अजपथ.
text.876:
अजशृङ्गी Tatpur. f. (-ङ्गी) A plant; described as a milky and
thorny plant, with a fruit of a crooked figure, like a ram's
horn, and used as a medicine for the eyes; vulg. Mera
Śriṅgī, and Kankara Śriṅgī (Odina Wodier Rox.). See
कर्क्कटशृङ्गी. E. अज and शृङ्ग.
text.877:
अजस्तुन्द Tatpur. n. (-न्दम्) The name of a town. E. अज
and तुन्द with āgama सुट् ‘like a goat's belly’.
text.878:
अजस्र Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-स्रः-स्रा-स्रम्) Continual, unin
terrupted.
II. ind. (-स्रम्) Eternally, continually, always. E. अ
neg. and जस्र.
text.879:
अजहत्स्वार्था Tatpur. f. (-र्था) A figure of speech, the cha
racteristic of the उपादानलक्षणा q. v. It consists in using
a word in an elliptic meaning without depriving it of its
primary sense; in such phrases as श्वेतो धावति or कुन्ताः
प्रविशन्ति, are to be supplied अश्व &c. in the former, पु-
रुष &c. in the latter, so as to impart the sense of ‘a white
horse gallops’, ‘the men with lances enter’, while श्वेत
and कुन्त retain their original sense. See, on the contrary,
जहत्स्वार्था.--E. अ neg. and जहत्स्वार्था, scil. लक्षणा.
text.880:
अजहल्लिङ्ग Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) (In grammar.) A noun that does
not vary its gender, even when it is used attributively.
E. अ neg. and जहल्लिङ्ग, scil. शब्द.
text.881:
अजहा Tatpur. f. (-हा) Cowach (Carpopogon pruriens). E.
अज and ह.
text.882:
अजाकृपाणीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) As in the fable of the
goat and the shears, viz. approached unreflectingly. E. अ-
जाकृपाणी (Dwandwa अजा and कृपाणी), taddh. aff. छ, im
plying here comparison.
text.883:
अजाक्षीर Tatpur. n. (-रम्) Goat's milk. See अजक्षीर. E.
अजा and क्षीर.
text.884:
अजागर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not wakeful, not
awake.
II. m. (-रः) A small plant (Eclipta, or Verbesina pro
strata). See भृङ्गराज. E. अ neg. and जागर.
text.885:
अजागलस्तन Tatpur. m. (-नः)
1 The small fleshy protuberance,
resembling a nipple depending from the throat of a species
of the Bengal goat.
2 A term for a worthless, good for
nothing person. E. अजा and गलस्तन.
text.886:
अजाजि Tatpur. f. (-जिः) See the following. E. अजा and
आजि or अजि.
text.887:
अजाजी Tatpur. f. (-जी) Cumin seed (Cuminum cyminum). E.
The preceding, fem. aff. ङीष्.
text.888:
अजाजीव Bahuvr. m. (-वः) A goatherd; also अजजीविक, अजा-
जीविन् &c. E. अज and आजीव.
text.889:
अजात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unborn, unproduced,
not yet born, not yet produced. E. अ neg. and जात.
text.890:
अजातककुद् Bahuvr. m. (-त्) A young Indian bull, the hump
of which has not yet grown. E. अजात and ककुद, the अ
of the latter being dropped.
text.891:
अजातव्यवहार Bahuvr. m. (-रः) A lad under his fifteenth
year, a minor (in law). E. अजात and व्यवहार.
text.892:
अजातशत्रु Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-त्रुः-त्रुः-त्रु)
1 Having no ene
mies existent.
2 Having no one existent who is worth be
ing called an enemy.
II. m. (-त्रुः) A proper name or a synonyme of
1 Śiva,
2 Yudhiṣṭhira,
3 A king of Kāśi,
4 A son of Śamīka,
5 A
son of Vidmisāra, or according to others,
6 A son of Bim
bisāra and contemporary of Śākyamuni. E. अजात and शत्रु.
text.893:
अजातानुशय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Having no regret.
E. अजात and अनुशय.
text.894:
अजातारि Bahuvr. m. (-रिः) A name of Yudhiṣṭhira. E.
अजात and अरि. See अजातशत्रु of which it is a synonyme.
text.895: अजात्व n. (-त्वम्). See अजत्व. E. अजा, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.896:
अजाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The ancestor of a warrior tribe,
called the आजाद्याः E. अज and अद.
text.897:
अजादनी Tatpur. f. (-नी) A small species of prickly night
shade. E. अज and अदन.
text.898:
अजानि Bahuvr. m. (-निः) Having no wife. E. अ priv. and
जानि.
text.899:
अजानिक Bahuvr. m. (-कः). See the preceding. E. अजानि,
samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.900:
अजानेय I. m. (-यः) A horse of a good breed. See आजानेय.
II. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Fearless, undaunted. E. See
आजानेय, the initial being made short.
text.901:
अजान्त्री Tatpur. f. (-न्त्री) A potherb (Convolvulus argenteus).
See छगलान्त्री. E. अज and अन्त्र.
text.902:
अजापालक Tatpur. m. (-कः) A goatherd. E. अजा and पालक.
Also used in the three genders m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्).
text.903:
अजामि Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मिः-मिः-मि) Not of kin, not
related, not friendly. (In the Vedas.) E. अ neg. and जामि.
text.904:
अजामिता f. (-ता) The not being of kin, related &c. (In
the Vedas.) E. The preceding, taddh. aff. तल्.
text.905:
अजायमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not born. E. अ
neg. and जायमान.
text.906:
अजाविक Dwandwa n. (-कम्) Goats and sheep. E. अज and
अविक, the sing. used instead of the plural.
text.907:
अजाश्व I. Dwandwa n. (-श्वम्) Goats and horses (the sing.
used instead of the plur.).
II. Bahuvr. m. (-श्वः) Having goats as his vehicle, a
vaidik epithet of Pūṣan. See अज. E. अज and अश्व.
text.908: अजि f. (-जि) A road. See also आजि. E. अज्, uṇ. aff. इ.
text.909: अजिका f. (-का) A young she-goat. E. See अजका.
text.910:
अजित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unconquered.
2 Un
excelled, unsurpassed.
II. m. (-तः)
1 The proper name of several gods and per
sons, viz.
a. Viṣṇu.
b. Śiva.
c. One of the seven Ṛṣis
who preside during the reign of the fourteenth Manu.
d. A
name of Maitreya or a future Buddha.
e. The second of
the Arhats or Jaina saints of the present Avasarpiṇī,
a descendant of Ikṣvāku and a son of Jitaśatru by Vijayā.
f. The attendant of Suvidhi or the ninth Jaina Arhat of the
present Avasarpiṇī.
2 The name of a powerful antidote.
3 A kind of poisonous rat.
III. m. pl. (-ताः) A particular class of gods in the reign
of the first Manu, the same as the जयाः in a former life.
E. अ neg. and जित.
text.911:
अजितबला Bahuvr. f. (-ला) The name of one of the Śāsana
devatās, a class of divinities particular to the Jainas, who
are supposed to carry out the commands of the Arhats.
E. अजित and बल.
text.912:
अजितविक्रम Bahuvr. m. (-मः) A surname of Chandragupta
the second. E. अजित and विक्रम ‘of invincible strength’.
text.913:
अजितात्मन् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्मा-त्मा-त्म) One who has not
subdued his mind, who has not command over himself.
E. अजित and आत्मन्.
text.914:
अजितापीड Bahuvr. m. (-डः) The name of a prince. E. अ-
जित and आपीड.
text.915:
अजितेन्द्रिय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) One who has not
subdued his senses or worldly desires. E. अजित and इन्द्रिय.
text.916:
अजिन I. n. (-नम्) The hide of a tiger, lion &c., but more
especially of the antilope or the black species of it (see
अजिनयोनि and कृष्णाजिन) and particularly appropriated
to the religious student as a garment, seat, bed &c.
II. m. (-नः) The name of a descendant of Pṛthu, the
son of Havirdhāna by Dhiṣaṇā. E. अज्, uṇ. aff. इनच्;
but it would seem that I. is derived from अज, with taddh.
aff. इनच्.
text.917: अजिनपत्त्र Bahuvr. f. (-त्त्रा or -त्त्री) A bat. E. अजिन and पत्त्र.
text.918:
अजिनपत्त्रिका Bahuvr. f. (-का) The same as the former.
E. The former, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.919:
अजिनफला Bahuvr. f. (-ला) The name of a plant. E. अजिन
and फल.
text.920:
अजिनयोनि Bahuvr. m. (-निः) A deer or antilope. E. अजिन
and योनि ‘where the hide comes from’.
text.921:
अजिनवासिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सी-सिनी-सि) Being clad in
an antilope hide. E. अजिन and वासिन्.
text.922:
अजिनसन्ध Tatpur. m. (-न्धः) One who joins together hides,
a kind of furrier. E. अजिन and सन्ध.
text.923:
अजिर I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Quick, fast. (अजिरम् is also
used adverbially.)
II. m. (-रः) The proper name of a priest who officiated
at a sacrifice performed in order to destroy the serpents.
III. f. (-रा)
1 A river.
2 A name of Durgā.
IV. n. (-रम्)
1 A court or yard.
2 Air, wind.
3 The
body.
4 A frog.
5 An object of sense. E. अज्, uṇ. aff.
किरच्.
text.924:
अजिरवती f. (-ती) The name of a river on which Śrāvasti
was situated. E. अजिर, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.925:
अजिरशोचिस् Bahuvr. m. (-चिः) Having a quick light, glitter
ing, a vaidik epithet of Agni and Soma. E. अजिर and शोचिस्.
text.926:
अजिराय् denom. ātm. (अजिरायते) To become quick, to
hasten. E. अजिर, denom. aff. क्यङ्.
text.927:
अजिरीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Being in or not far from,
produced by, possessing or having a court or yard &c.
See the meanings of अजिर. E. अजिर, taddh. aff. छ.
text.928:
अजिह्म Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ह्मः-ह्मा-ह्मम्) Straight, not crooked,
literally or metaphorically; upright, sincere, honest, direct.
II. m. (-ह्मः)
1 A frog.
2 A fish(?). E. अ neg. and जिह्म.
text.929:
अजिह्मग Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-नम्) Going or moving
in a straight line.
II. m. (-गः) An arrow. E. अजिह्म and ग.
text.930:
अजिह्व Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-ह्वः-ह्वा-ह्वम्) Tongueless, hav
ing no tongue.
II. m. (-ह्वः) A frog. E. अ priv. and जिह्वा.
text.931: अजीकव n. (-वम्) The bow of Śiva. See अजकाव. E. unknown.
text.932:
अजीगर्त Tatpur.(?) m. (-र्तः) The name of a Ṛṣi, the father
of Śunaḥśepha and son of Sūyavasa. E. अ neg. and जीगर्त.
text.933:
अजीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Not fading, not decaying. (In the
Vedas.) E. अ neg. and जीति.
text.934:
अजीर्ण Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्)
1 Undigested.
2 Un
decayed, unimpaired.
II. n. (-र्णम्)
1 Flatulency, indigestion.
2 Vigour, ab
sence of old age or decay. E. अ neg. and जीर्ण.
text.935:
अजीर्णि Tatpur. f. (-र्णिः) Indigestion, flatulency. E. अ neg.
and जीर्णि.
text.936:
अजीर्णिन् m. f. n. (-र्णी-र्णिनी-र्णि) Having an indigestion.
E. अजीर्ण, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.937:
अजीव I. Tatpur. m. (-वः)
1 Non-existence.
2 Death. E. अ
neg. and जीव.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्)
1 Lifeless, dead. E. अ
priv. and जीव.
text.938:
अजीवनि Tatpur. f. (-निः) Non-existence; used as an im
precation. Ex. अजीवनिस्तस्य भूयात्. E. अ neg. and जीवनि.
text.939:
अजीवित Tatpur. n. (-तम्)
1 Non-existence.
2 Death. E. अ
neg. and जीवित.
text.940:
अजुष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Not pleasant, not
agreable. E. अ neg. and जुष्ट.
text.941:
अजुष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) (ved.) Unpleasant feeling, dissatis
faction. E. अ neg. and जुष्टि.
text.942:
अजेतव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) Invincible, not to be
conquered or overcome. E. अ neg. and जेतव्य.
text.943:
अजेय Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Invincible, insu
perable, not to be overcome or surpassed.
II. n. (-यम्) The name of an antidote. E. अ neg. and जेय.
text.944:
अजैकपाद् Karmadh. m. (-द्)
1 The name of one of the eleven
Rudras as mentioned in the Purāṇas.
2 A name of Viṣṇu.
See अज. E. अज and एकपाद्. Also अजैकपाद m. (-दः).
text.945:
अजैडक Dwandwa n. (-कम्) Goats and rams. (The singular
used instead of the plural.) E. अज and एडक.
text.946:
अजोष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) (ved.) Having no
delight, feeling no satisfaction. E. अ priv. and जोष.
text.947:
अजोष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) (ved.) Insatiable, one
who is not easily contented. E. अ neg. and जोष्य.
text.948:
अज्जुका f. (-का) A courtezan (in theatrical language). E. अज्,
kṛt aff. उकन्(?). Sometimes read अर्ज्जुका, from अर्ज् to
earn, to gain.
text.949: अज्झटा f. (-टा) A plant (Flacourtia cataphracta). E. unknown.
text.950: अज्झल n. (-लम्) A burning coal. E. unknown.
text.951:
अज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्)
1 Ignorant.
2 Stupid,
foolish, unwise.
3 Not having the faculty of understanding,
as animals or inanimate objects. E. अ neg. and ज्ञ.
text.952:
अज्ञका Tatpur. f. (-का). The diminutive form of अज्ञा. See
the preceding. Also अज्ञिका. E. अ neg. and ज्ञका.
text.953:
अज्ञता f. (-ता) Ignorance. Also अज्ञत्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अज्ञ,
taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.954:
अज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unknown. E. अ neg.
and ज्ञात.
text.955:
अज्ञातक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) The same as अज्ञात. E. अ-
ज्ञात, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.956:
अज्ञातकेत Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Having unknown
or hidden designs. (In the Vedas.) E. अज्ञात and केत.
text.957:
अज्ञाति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) No kinsman or relation. E. अ neg.
and ज्ञाति.
text.958:
अज्ञान I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Ignorance.
2 Spiritual ignorance,
worldly illusion or belief in external appearances.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Ignorant, unwise.
E. अ neg. and ज्ञान.
text.959:
अज्ञानकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Done inadvertently,
done by a mistake. E. अज्ञान and कृत.
text.960:
अज्ञानता f. (-ता) Ignorance. Also अज्ञानत्व n. (-त्वम्). E. The
former, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.961: अज्ञिका Tatpur. f. (-का). See अज्ञका. E. अ neg. and ज्ञिका.
text.962:
अज्ञानिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नी-निनी-नि) Ignorant, unwise.
E. अ neg. and ज्ञानिन्.
text.963:
अज्ञेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Incomprehensible. E. अ
neg. and ज्ञेय.
text.964:
अज्म m. (-ज्मः) (ved.)
1 Course, way.
2 Battle. See the fol
lowing. E. अज्, kṛt aff. मन्.
text.965:
अज्मन् n. (-ज्म) (ved.)
1 Battle.
2 A house. See the preceding.
E. अज्, uṇ. aff. मनिन्.
text.966:
अज्यानि Tatpur. f. (-निः) Imperishability. (In the Vedas.)
E. अ neg. and ज्यानि.
text.967:
अज्येष्ठ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Not the oldest or best.
E. अ neg. and ज्येष्ठ.
text.968:
अज्येष्ठवृत्ति Tatpur. m. (-त्तिः) Not behaving as the eldest
brother aught to behave, not behaving like a father. E. अ
neg. and ज्येष्ठवृत्ति.
text.969:
अज्र (ved.) I. m. (-ज्रः) Field, acre, plain.
II. m. f. n. (-ज्रः-ज्रा-ज्रम्) Quick. See अजिर. E. अज्,
uṇ. aff. रन्(?).
text.970:
अज्र्य (ved.) m. f. n. (-ज्र्यः-ज्र्या-ज्र्यम्) Being in the field, in
the plain. E. अज्र, taddh. aff. यत्.
text.971:
अञ्च् I. 1. (अन्चु-भ्वादि-उदात्त-स्वरितेत्) r. 1st cl. par. and
ātm. (अञ्चति-ते-आनञ्च-चे-अञ्चिता-अच्यात्-अक्त्वा p. p. अक्त.
Pass. अच्यते and अञ्च्यते. Desid. अञ्चिचिषति-ते.--Caus.
अञ्चयति).
1 To go.
2 To ask, to beg.
3 To speak indis
tinctly.--With अप- To go away; caus. to send away.
--उद्- To rise; caus. to raise, to draw up.--उप-
To approach.--नि- To go down.--परि- To go round,
to turn round.--वि- To approach in different ways;
caus. to drive asunder.--सम्- caus. To impel together.
2. r. 1st cl. par. and ātm. (अञ्चति-ते-अञ्चित्वा- p. p.
अञ्चित and अक्न) To bend, to curve. With आ- To bend.
--नि- To bend down.--वि- To bend asunder.--सम्-
To bend together, to bend intensely.
3. (अचि-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अञ्च-
ति-अञ्च्यात्-अञ्चित्वा- p. p. अञ्चित) To honour, to worship,
to treat with respect.
4. (अन्चु-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अञ्चय-
ति) To make clear or distinct. With उद्- The same.
See also अच्.
II. 1. m. f. n. (-ङ्-ची-क्) Going.
2. m. f. n. (-ङ्-ञ्ची-क्) Honouring, worshipping.
This word occurs only as the latter part of several,
in most instances irregular compounds, the former part of
which is, in the classic dialect, restricted to some prepo
sitions and indeclinables; see f. i. अवाञ्च्-उदञ्च्-न्यञ्च्-प्राञ्च्-
सम्यञ्च्-विष्वञ्च्-तिर्यञ्च्. In the Vedas it occurs also in com
position with pronominal and nominal themes, f. i. in वि-
ष्वद्र्यञ्च्-देवद्र्यञ्च्-घृताञ्च्. When it has the meaning of ‘go
ing’, the nasal of the root appears only in the nom.,
voc. and acc. of the sing. and du. masc., in the nom. and
voc. of the plur. masc. and neuter and in the acc. of
the plur. neuter; in all the other cases and in the formation
of the fem. it is dropped. The declension and the fem. for
mation of अञ्च् ‘honouring, worshipping’ is regular in re
taining the nasal of the root. E. अञ्च्, kṛt aff. क्विन्.
text.972:
अञ्च m. (-ञ्चः) Going. It occurs only as the latter part of
compounds; f. i. in रोमाञ्च. E. अञ्च्, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.973:
अञ्चति m. (-तिः)
1 Air, wind.
2 Fire. E. अञ्च्, uṇ. aff. अति.
See अङ्कति.
text.974:
अञ्चती f. (-ती) The same as the former. E. अञ्चति, fem.
aff. ङीष्.
text.975: अञ्चन n. (-नम्) Bending, curving. E. अञ्च्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.976:
अञ्चल m. (-लः) The end or border of a cloth, veil, shawl, &c.
E. अञ्च्, uṇ. aff. अलच्(?).
text.977:
अञ्चित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Worshipped, &c.
2 Bent.
See अञ्च्. E. अञ्च्, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.978:
अञ्चितभ्रू Bahuvr. f. (-भ्रूः) A woman having beautiful eye
brows. E. अञ्चित and भ्रू.
text.979:
अञ्ज् I. (अन्जू-रुधादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 7th cl. par. (अ-
नक्ति- ved. 1st cl. अञ्जति-ते-आनञ्ज-अञ्जिता or अङ्क्ता-अञ्जि-
ष्यति or अङ्क्ष्यति-आञ्जीत्, आञ्जिषुः-अञ्जित्वा or अङ्क्त्वा or अक्त्वा-
p. p. अक्त. Desid. अञ्जिजिषति. Caus. अञ्जयति-आञ्जिजत्).
1 To anoint.
2 To make clear.
3 To glorify, to extol.
4 To
go, to approach.
5 To be beautiful. With अभि- To anoint,
to embellish.--आ-
1 To anoint.
2 To glorify, to extol.
--नि-प्र-प्रति- To anoint, to embellish.--वि-
1 To
anoint.
2 To make clear or manifest. Caus. To cause to be
come clear, to reveal.--अभिवि- To make manifest.-
सम्-
1 To anoint, to embellish.
2 To extol, to glorify.
3 To
join, to connect.
II. (अजि-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. (अञ्जयति) To
shine. (It seems to occur only in vulgar speech.)
text.980:
अञ्जक m. (-कः) A proper name:
1 A son of Viprachitti by
Sinhikā.
2 A son of Yadu. See अञ्जिक. E. अञ्ज्, kṛt aff. वुन्.
text.981:
अञ्जन I. n. (-नम्)
1 Anointing, making clear or distinct &c.
See the meanings of अञ्ज्.
2 A collyrium or application to
the eye lashes, to darken and improve them; a universal
article of the eastern toilet.
3 The name of particular kinds
of the former, viz. lamp black, antimony, and one ex
tracted from the Ammonium zanthorrhiza.
4 Ink.
5 Night.
(See अक्तु.)
6 Fire.
7 (In rhetoric.) Suggesting the special
meaning of a word or a sentence. The special meaning of
a word (शब्द) is suggested, according to Hindu rhetoric,
by its connexion with either the real (अभिधा) or the el
liptic sense (लक्षणा) of other words; and the special mean
ing of a sentence (अर्थ) by circumstances connected with
