either the speaker or the addressed, or the occasion, place,
time or the like. More usually called व्यञ्जना q. v.
II. m. (-नः)
1 A species of lizard.
2 The elephant of the
west or, according to others, of the south-west quarter.
3 The name of a fabulous serpent.
4 The name of a king
of Mithilā, the son of Kuni.
5 The name of a tree.
6 The
name of a mountain. See अञ्जनागिरि.
III. f. 1. (-ना)
1 The mother of the monkey Hanumat.
2 The daughter of Vajrendra and mother of Pravarasena.
2. (-नी)
1 A woman who is fit to be perfumed with
sandal &c.
2 The name of a medicinal plant. See कटुका,
कालाञ्जनी and अञ्जनकी.
E. अञ्ज्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.982:
अञ्जनक I. m. (-कः) A portion of the Veda, so called from
its containing the word अञ्जन.
II. f. (-की) The name of a medicinal plant. See अञ्जनी.
E. अञ्जन, taddh. aff. वुन्, having possessive meaning in
this instance.
text.983:
अञ्जनकेशी Bahuvr. f. (-शी) A vegetable perfume. See हट्ट-
विलासिनी. E. अञ्जन and केश, with fem. affix ङीप्; the
fibres being like the crystals, perhaps, of antimony.
text.984:
अञ्जननामिका Bahuvr. f. (-का) A disease of the eyelids, a swell
ing of the eyelids which is described as ‘being very hot, pain
ful and of a copper colour, soft, small and with little pain’.
E. अञ्जननामन् (Bahuvr.) samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.985:
अञ्जनागिरि Karmadh. m. (-रिः) The name of a mountain.
E. अञ्जन and गिरि, the terminating अ of the former being
made long.
text.986:
अञ्जनाधिका Tatpur. f. (-का) A kind of lizard. E. अञ्जन
and अधिक.
text.987:
अञ्जनाम्भस् Tatpur. n. (-म्भः) Eye-water, liquid collyrium.
E. अञ्जन and अम्भस्.
text.988:
अञ्जनावती f. (-ती) The female elephant of the north-east,
or according to others of the west. E. अञ्जना, taddh. aff.
मतुप्.
text.989:
अञ्जनिक I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Referring or belonging
to collyrium &c. See अञ्जन.
II. f. (-का)
1 A species of lizard (Lacerta anjaneya).
2 A
small mouse. Also read अञ्जलिका. E. अञ्जन, taddh. aff. ष्ठन्.
text.991: अञ्जल. A substitute of अञ्जलि q. v. in द्व्यञ्जल and त्र्यञ्जल q. v.
text.992:
अञ्जलि m. (-लिः)
1 The two hands put together, the palms
being slightly hollowed and in near contact with each
other, when the hands are raised to the forehead as a
reverential act of salutation or adoration: when employed
in making offerings, or giving a benediction, the hands
are left open only touching by the sides of the little fingers.
2 A measure, a Kuḍava, as much grain as can be held by
the two hands put together. E. अञ्ज्, uṇ. aff. अलिच्.
text.993:
अञ्जलिक I. m. (-कः) Perhaps the same as अञ्जनिक of which
it appears to be a various reading.
II. A small mouse. See अञ्जनिका. E. See अञ्जनिक.
text.994:
अञ्जलिकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) Making the अञ्जलि q. v., the
respectful mode of salutation or veneration. E. अञ्जलि and
कर्मन्.
text.995:
अञ्जलिकारिका Tatpur. f. (-का)
1 A doll, a puppet, made of
clay.
2 A kind of sensitive plant (Mimosa natans), or accord
ing to some, a different plant (Lycopodium imbricatum).
E. अञ्जलि and कारिका; the plant closing its petals like the
hollowed palms of the hand.
text.996:
अञ्जलिबन्धन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Making a salutation with the
hands joined and applied to the forehead. See अञ्जलि. E.
अञ्जलि and बन्धन.
text.997:
अञ्जलीकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Made or put so as
to become an अञ्जलि q. v. (said of the hands). E. अञ्जलि,
taddh. aff. च्वि, and कृत.
text.998:
अञ्जस् m. n. (-ञ्जाः-ञ्जः) Straight, straightforward, open (ved.).
Adverbially used are the acc. neutr. अञ्जः (in the Vedas)
in the sense of: straight, right; and the instrum. अञ्जसा
in the sense of
1 straight, straightforward, right;
2 truly,
justly, certainly;
3 soon, instantly. E. अञ्ज्, uṇ. aff.
असुन्.
text.999:
अञ्जस I. m. f. n. (-सः-सी-सम्) Straight, even, upright (in
morals).
II. f. (-सी) (ved.) The name of a heavenly river. E.
अञ्जस्, taddh. aff. षच्.
text.1001:
अञ्जसायन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Going straightfor
ward. E. अञ्जसा and अयन.
text.1002:
अञ्जसीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) (ved.) Straight, even, up
right. E. अञ्जस, taddh. aff. ख.
text.1003:
अञ्जि I. m. (-ञ्जिः)
1 A sender, a commander.
2 (ved.) The penis.
II. (ved.) n. (-ञ्जि) Pudendum muliebre.
III. (ved.) m. f. n. (-ञ्जिः-ञ्जिः-ञ्जि)
1 Ointment, colour.
2 Anointing.(?)
E. अञ्ज् (I. 1. ‘to go’, in the caus.; I. 2. II. ‘to make distinct’
(the sex); III. ‘to anoint’), uṇ. aff. इ.
text.1004:
अञ्जिक m. (-कः) The name of a prince, the son of Yadu.
E. अञ्जक q. v., with āgama इट्.
text.1005:
अञ्जिन् m. f. n. (-ञ्जी-ञ्जिनी-ञ्जि) (ved.) Making clear or mani
fest. E. अञ्ज्, kṛt aff. इनि.
text.1006:
अञ्जिमत् m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्) (ved.) Having colours, co
loured, bright. E. अञ्जि, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.1007:
अञ्जिष्ठ m. (-ष्ठः) The sun. E. अञ्ज् (to make manifest), uṇ.
aff. इष्ठच्, or better अञ्जिमत्, taddh. aff. इष्ठन् ‘having the
best or brightest colours’.
text.1008:
अञ्जिसक्थ Bahuvr. m. (-क्थः) (ved.) Having coloured thighs
(an epithet of one of the sacrificial animals offered to Indra
and Agni in the Aśvamedha sacrifice). E. अञ्जि and सक्थि,
samāsānta aff. षच्.
text.1009:
अञ्जीर n. (-रम्) The fig tree, also its fruit. See also मञ्जुल
and काकोदुम्बरिका. In Bengal, the word derived from this
implies the Guava; the term has, possibly, been borrowed
from the Persian. {??}. E. अञ्ज्, aff. ईरन्.
text.1010:
अट् I. (अट-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अटति-
आट-अटिता-अटिष्यति-आटीत्.--Caus. आटयति-आटि-
टत्.--Desid. अटिटिषति.--Intens. अटाट्यते.) To go round
about, to roam, to rove, to ramble, to wander about, espe
cially as a religious mendicant. With परि--the same with
an intense meaning.
II. (अट-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (आटयति)
To slight &c. See अट्ट् II, of which it is given as a various
reading.
text.1011:
अट I. m. f. n. (-टः-टा-टम्) Roaming, wandering.
II. f. (-टा) The roaming or wandering, esp. of a reli
gious mendicant. E. अट्, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.1012:
अटक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Rambling, wandering about(?).
E. अट्, kṛt aff. ष्वुन्.
text.1013:
अटन n. (-नम्) Roaming about, leading a vagrant life. E.
अट्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1014:
अटनि f. (-निः or नी) The notched extremity of a bow. E.
अट्, kṛt aff. अनि, without or with fem. aff. ङीष्.
text.1015:
अटरुष m. (-षः) A tree (Justicia adhatoda). E. unknown.
See also the following.
text.1016: अटरूष m. (-षः) See the last word. Also अटरूषक m. (-कः).
text.1017:
अटवि f. (-विः or -वी) A forest or wood. E. अट्, kṛt(?) aff.
अवि, without or with fem. aff. ङीष्. The E. is uncertain.
text.1018:
अटविक m. (-कः) A wood-man, a forester. E. अटवि, taddh.
aff. ठक्. See आटविक, which appears to be the more cor
rect form of this word.
text.1019:
अटविशिखर Bahuvr. m. pl. (-राः) The name of a people or
country. E. अटवि and शिखर.
text.1020: अटवी f. (-वी) A forest or grove. See अटवि.
text.1022:
अटाटा f. (-टा) Roaming about as a devotee or religious
mendicant. See also अटाट्या. E. अटाट् (intens. of अट्),
kṛt aff. श.
text.1023:
अटाट्यमान m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Roaming about &c. E.
अटाट्य् (intens. of अट्), kṛt aff. मान (of the part. of the
present tense).
text.1024:
अटाट्या f. (-ट्या) Roaming about as a devotee or religious
mendicant. See also अटाटा. E. अटाट्य् (intens. of अट्),
kṛt aff. श.
text.1025:
अटाय् denom. ātm. (अटायते) To enter upon a roaming life,
to engage in wandering as a religious mendicant. E. अटा,
denom. aff. क्यङ्.
text.1026:
अट्ट् I. (अट्ट-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. ātm. (अट्टते-
आनट्टे-अट्टिता)
1 To transgress or exceed.
2 To hurt, to
injure.
II. (अट्ट-चुरादि-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 10th cl. par. (अट्टयति)
1 To slight, to show disrespect.
2 To lessen, to diminish.
See अट् II.
text.1027:
अट्ट I. m. (-ट्टः)
1 Exceeding.
2 Hurting, injuring.
3 Shaking,
tossing.
4 The name of a Yaksha.
II. f. (-ट्टा) Excess(?).
III. m. (and according to some, also n.) (-ट्टः-ट्टम्)
1 A
room on the top of a house; but it is also applicable to
other structures, as the back of an edifice, a fortified place
in front of a building, a room on the top of a temporary
hall, or a particular kind of building.
2 A market, a market
place. (See हट्ट.)
IV. n. (-ट्टम्) Food, especially boiled rice.
V. m. f. n. (-ट्टः-ट्टा-ट्टम्) Dry, dried.
VI. ind. High, lofty, loud. E. अट्ट्, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1028:
अट्टक m. (-कः) A room on the top of the house. See अट्ट III,
taddh. aff. कन्.
text.1029: अट्टट्ट ind. Very high, very loud. E. See अट्ट VI.
text.1030:
अट्टन n. (-नम्) A circular weapon, a kind of discus. E. अट्ट्,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्. See also अड्डन.
text.1031:
अट्टपतिभागाख्यगृहकृत्य Tatpur. n. (-त्यम्) The name of a par
ticular revenue office in Kashmir, where duties were levied
on perfumes, sandal wood, oil &c. E. अट्ट-पति-भाग-आख्या
(Bahuvr.) -गृह and कृत्य, properly meaning ‘the business
of a house called the department of the market-master’.
text.1032:
अट्टस्थली Tatpur. f. (-ली) The site of an अट्ट q. v.(?) III. E.
अट्ट and स्थली.
text.1033:
अट्टहसित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Violent laughter, a horse-laugh.
E. अट्ट and हसित.
text.1034:
अट्टहास m. (-सः) I. Tatpur. Violent laughter, a horse
laugh. II. Bahuvr. A name of Śiva. See अट्टहासिन्. E.
अट्ट and हास.
text.1035:
अट्टहासक m. (-कः) A plant (Jasminum multiflorum). E. अट्ट-
हास, taddh. aff. कन्; resembling a laugh or smile on beau
ty's countenance; the comparison is common to the poets.
text.1036:
अट्टहासिन् Tatpur. m. (-सी) A name of Śiva. E. अट्ट and
हासिन्, ‘laughing loudly and violently’.
text.1037:
अट्टहास्य Karmadh. n. (-स्यम्) Violent laughter, a horse-laugh.
E. अट्ट and हास्य.
text.1038:
अट्टाट्टहास Karmadh. m. (-सः) Very violent laughter. E. अट्ट
and अट्टहास.
text.1039:
अट्टाय् denom. ātm. (अट्टायते) To commit an excess(?). E.
अट्टा (see अट्ट II.), denom. aff. क्यङ्.
text.1040:
अट्टाल m. (-लः) An upper room or pavilion, on the flat roof
of an Indian house. See अट्ट III. E. अट्ट and अल(?).
text.1041:
अट्टालक I. m. (-कः) A room on the top of the house. See
the preceding.
II. f. (-लिका)
1 A palace, an upper-roomed house.
2 The
name of a country. E. अट्टाल, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.1042:
अट्टालिकाकार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A bricklayer, a mason, a
builder; born of a Śūdra mother and painter father. E.
अट्टालिका and कार.
text.1043:
अट्टालिकाबन्ध Tatpur. (In architecture.) A kind of base; (there
are sixty-four different sorts of bases enumerated in archi
tectural works). E. अट्टालिका and बन्ध. (The form अट्टा-
लिकाबन्धम् used as ind., is explained as being derived from
अट्टालिका and बन्धम् (बन्ध्, kṛt aff. णमुल्); it may, how
ever, be taken also as the accus. of the former).
text.1044: अट्टिलिका f. (-का) The name of a town. E. unknown.
text.1045:
अट्या f. (-ट्या) Roaming about, wandering as a beggar or
devotee. E. अट् in the caus., kṛt aff. श. See अटा and
अटाट्या.
text.1046:
अठ् (अठ-भ्वादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. ātm. (but also
par.) (अठते-अठति) To go, to go to or towards. See also
अण्ठ्.
text.1047:
अठिल्ला f. (-ल्ला) The name of a Prākrit metre regulated by
quantity. See अतिलिहा.
text.1048:
अड् I. (अड-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अडति)
To strive or endeavour.
II. (अड-स्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 5th cl. par. (अड्नोति)
To pervade, to occupy. See अह्.
text.1049:
अड्ड् (अड्ड-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अड्डति-आ-
नड्ड-अड्डिता.--Desid. अड्डिडिषति or अडिड्डिषति. Caus.
अड्डयति-आड्डिडत्)
1 To attack or assault.
2 To connect.
3 To argue, to discern, to meditate. This radical is also
written अद्ङ्.
text.1050: अड्डन n. (-नम्) A shield. E. अड्ड्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1051:
अण् I. (अण-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अणति-
आण-अणिता.--Desid. अणिणिषति. Caus. आणयति) To
sound.
II. (अण-दिवादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 4th cl. ātm. (अ-
ण्यते). To breathe. See अन्.
text.1052:
अणक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Inferior, low. As the first
part of a Karmadh. it implies deterioration or contempt.
E. अण्, kṛt aff. वुन्. See also अनक and आणक.
text.1053:
अणकीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Containing, referring to, be
ing made by &c. what is low or inferior. E. अणक, taddh.
aff. छ.
text.1054:
अणव्य n. (-व्यम्) A field bearing panicum miliaceum. E. अणु
(panic), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.1055:
अणि m. (-णिः)
1 A pin or bolt at the extremity of the pole
of a carriage, a pin of the axle.
2 The point of a needle &c.
3 A limit, a boundary.
4 That part of a house where ani
mals are killed, where slaughtering takes place. Also अणी
f. (-णी). E. अण्, uṇ. aff. इन्.
text.1056:
अणिमन् I. m. (-मा)
1 Subtility, infinite minuteness, mole
culism.
2 The same considered as a superhuman faculty, to
be acquired by austere devotion and the performance of
magical rites, or as possessed by a deity.
II. n. (-म) The smallest piece or part (only in the Vedas).
E. अणु, taddh. aff. इमनिच्. See also अणुता-अणुत्व-आणव.
text.1057:
अणिष्ठ m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Smallest, finest, very small or
fine. E. अणु, taddh. aff. इष्ठन्.
text.1059:
अणीमाण्डव्य Tatpur. m. (-व्यः) The name of a Ṛṣi or Saint.
E. अणी, a pin, and माण्डव्य; according to the comm., अणी
would be in this word a qualification of the proper name
माण्डव्य; from his being impaled on a शूल or अणी.
text.1060:
अणीयस् m. f. n. (-यान्-यसी-यः)
1 Smaller, more minute.
2 Very small, very minute. E. अणु, taddh. aff. ईयसुन्.
text.1061:
अणीयस्क m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्). The same as अणीयस्. E.
अणीयस्, taddh. aff. क. (?)
text.1062:
अणु I. m. f. n. (-णुः-णुः or ण्वी-णु) Small, minute, atomic.
II. m. (-णुः)
1 An atom, a minute and elementary par
ticle of matter.
2 (According to some Purāṇas) A measure
of time, consisting of two Paramāṇus; 54,675,000 aṇus are
said to be equal to one muhūrta.
3 A sort of grain (Pani
cum miliaceum). See धान्य.
4 A name of Śiva.
III. f. (-ण्वी) (ved.) A finger.
IV. n. (-णु) (In prosody.) The fourth part of a मात्रा
q. v. E. अण्, uṇ. aff. उ.
text.1063:
अणुक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्)
1 Small, minute, atomic.
2 Acute, skilful, clever. E. अणु, taddh. aff. कन्; in 1. with
out altering the meaning of अणु; in 2. with the sense of
comparison, ‘like one who sees minute objects, who is
sharp-sighted’, &c.
text.1064:
अणुता f. (-ता) The state of being an atom, of being small
or minute. Also अणुत्व n. (-त्वम्). See, besides, अणिमन्
and आणव. E. अणु, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.1065:
अणुतैल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) A kind of medicated oil, pre
pared from fine oily substances. E. अणु and तैल.
text.1066: अणुभा Bahuvr. f. (-भा) Lightning. E. अणु and भा.
text.1067:
अणुमात्र m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्री-त्रम्) Having the size of an atom,
being as small as an atom. E. अणु, taddh. aff. मात्रच्;
but more correctly, a Bahuvr. E. अणु and मात्रा.
text.1068:
अणुमात्रिक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्). The same as the pre
ceding. E. अणुमात्र, taddh. aff. ष्ठन्. This word is also
explained as ‘consisting of the minute (अणु) mātrās or
eight constituent parts of the body viz. bhūta, indriya,
manas, buddhi, vāsanā, karman, vāyu and avidyā.’
text.1069:
अणुरेणु Karmadh. m. f. (-णुः-णुः) Small particles of dust, a
mote in a sunbeam &c. E. अणु and रेणु.
text.1070:
अणुरेणुजाल Tatpur. n. (-लम्) The motes in a sunbeam. E.
अणुरेणु and जाल.
text.1071:
अणुरेवती Karmadh.(?) f. (-ती) A tree (Croton polyandrum).
E. अणु and रेवती.
text.1072:
अणुव्रीहि Karmadh. m. (-हिः) A small kind of grain. See
प्रसातिका. E. अणु and व्रीहि.
text.1073: अणुशस् ind. In small pieces. E. अणु, taddh. aff. शस्.
text.1074:
अणूभाव Tatpur. m. (-वः) The becoming an atom. E. अणु, with
taddh. aff. च्वि, and भाव.
text.1075:
अण्ठ् (अठि-भ्वादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. ātm. (अण्ठते-
आनण्ठे-अण्ठिता.--p. p. अण्ठित) To go, to go to or
towards. See अठ्.
text.1076:
अण्ड m. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डम्)
1 An egg.
2 A testicle.
3 The scro
tum.
4 Semen genitale.
5 The musk bag, regarded as the
scrotum of the deer.
6 A name or epithet of Śiva (from his
being compared to the Brahmānḍa or representing the world).
E. अम्, uṇ. aff. ड.
text.1077:
अण्डक I. m. (-कः) The scrotum.
II. n. (-कम्) An egg, a small egg. E. अण्ड, taddh. aff.
कन्.
text.1078:
अण्डकटाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) The shell of the mundane egg.
E. अण्ड (see ब्रह्माण्ड) and कटाह.
text.1079:
अण्डकोटरपुष्पी Bahuvr. f. (-ष्पी) A plant (perhaps Convol
vulus argenteus). See अजान्त्री. Another reading of this
word is अन्तःकोठरपुष्पी. E. अण्ड, कोटर and पुष्प.
text.1080: अण्डकोश Tatpur. m. (-शः). See the next.
text.1081:
अण्डकोष Tatpur. m. (-षः) The scrotum. E. अण्ड and कोश
or कोष.
text.1082:
अण्डकोषक m. (-कः) The scrotum. E. taddh. aff. कन् added
to the last.
text.1083:
अण्डज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Oviparous.
II. m. (-जः)
1 A bird.
2 A fish.
3 A serpent.
4 A lizard.
III. f. (-जा) Musk. E. अण्ड and ज.
text.1084:
अण्डजेश्वर Tatpur. m. (-रः) A name of Garuḍa. E. अण्डज
and ईश्वर, ‘the king of the birds’.
text.1085:
अण्डधर Tatpur. m. (-रः) A name or epithet of Śiva. See
अण्ड, 6. E. अण्ड and धर.
text.1086:
अण्डवर्धन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A disease, swelling of the scro
tum. E. अण्ड and वर्धन.
text.1087:
अण्डवृद्धि Tatpur. f. (-द्धि) The same as the preceding. E. अण्ड
and वृद्धि.
text.1088:
अण्डसू Tatpur. f. (-सूः) The female of an oviparous animal.
E. अण्ड and सू.
text.1089: अण्डाकर्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Castration. E. अण्ड and आकर्षण.
text.1090:
अण्डाकार Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Egg-shaped,
oval, elliptical.
II. m. (-रः) An oval, an ellipsis; also अण्डाकृति, &c.
E. अण्ड and आकार.
text.1091: अण्डालु m. (-लुः) A fish. E. अण्ड, taddh. aff. आलु.
text.1092:
अण्डीर m. (-रः)
1 A man.
2 Strong, powerful. E. अण्ड,
taddh. aff. ईर.
text.1093:
अण्व n. (-ण्वम्) The small hole of a filtre or sieve (in the
Vedas; esp. in the plural). E. अणु, taddh. aff. अ(?).
text.1094:
अण्वन्त Bahuvr. m. (-न्तः) A question the object of which is
the solution of some subtle or difficult point. E. अणु and
अन्त.
text.1095: अण्वी f. (-ण्वी) (ved.) A finger. See अणु.
text.1096:
अत् (अत-भ्वादि-उदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 1st cl. par. (अतति-
आत-अतिता-अतिष्यति-आतीत्.--p. p. अतित and आत्त.)
1 To go, to move.
2 To move continually.
3 To obtain. With
अभि-
1 To approach.
2 To obtain.--अव- To go down.-
सम्- To approach, to hasten to.
text.1097:
अत् ind. A particle which is said to imply surprise or
astonishment. It occurs only in अद्भुत according to the na
tive etymology, and perhaps also in अद्धा. It belongs to
those indeclinables which in conjunction with radicals are
called गति q. v.
text.1098:
अतट Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-टः-टा-टम्) Having no shores
or banks, steep.
II. m. (-टः) A precipice. E. अ priv. and तट.
text.1099:
अतथा Tatpur. m. (-थाः) Different, not so as before. (ved.)
E. अ neg. and तथा.
text.1100:
अतथोचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not deserving such
or so like, worthy of something better. E. अ neg. and
तथोचित.
text.1101:
अतथ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-थ्यः-थ्या-थ्यम्) Untrue, false, un
real. E. अ neg. and तथ्य.
text.1102:
अतद्गुण Bahuvr. m. (-णः) (In rhetoric.) A figure of speech,
not employing predicates or comparisons which correspond
with the nature of the object itself. E. अ priv. and तद्गुण.
text.1103:
अतन (ved.) I. n. (-नम्) Going, moving continually.
II. m. (-नः) One who goes, who moves continually. E.
अत्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1104:
अतन्त्र I. Tatpur. n. (-न्त्रम्) Not the object of a rule or of
the rule in question. E. अ neg. and तन्त्र.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-न्त्रः-न्त्री-न्त्रम्)
1 Having no string
or rope &c.
2 Unrestrained. See तन्त्र. E. अ priv. and तन्त्र.
text.1105:
अतन्द्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-न्द्रः-न्द्रा-न्द्रम्) Unwearied, active,
alert. E. अ priv. and तन्द्रा.
text.1106:
अतन्द्रित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unwearied, active,
energetic. E. अ neg. and तन्द्रित.
text.1107:
अतन्द्रिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्द्री-न्द्रिणी-न्द्रि) Unwearied, ac
tive, alert. E. अ neg. and तन्द्रिन्.
text.1108:
अतप Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्)
1 Cool.
2 Unanxious.
3 Unemployed.
4 Unostentatious.
II. m. pl. (-पाः) The name of a particular class of gods
of the Buddhists. E. अ priv. and तप.
text.1109:
अतपस् Bahuvr. m. (-पाः) One who does not practise auste
rities, impious. E. अ priv. and तपस्.
text.1110:
अतपस्क Bahuvr. m. (-कः). The same as the preceding. E. अ
priv. and तपस्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1111:
अतप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Cool, not heated. E. अ
neg. and तप्त.
text.1112:
अतमेरु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रुः-रुः-रु) Not wearied, not fa
tigued, not languid or exhausted. (ved.) E. अ neg. and तमेरु.
text.1113:
अतर्क m. (-र्कः) I. Tatpur. Absence of reasoning, want of
consideration. E. अ neg. and तर्क.
II. Bahuvr. One who employs groundless arguments, who
reasons illogically. E. अ priv. and तर्क.
text.1114:
अतर्कित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unconsidered.
2 Un
expected, unweighed. अतर्कितम् used as adv., unexpected
ly, suddenly. E. अ neg. and तर्कित.
text.1115:
अतर्क्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्क्यः-र्क्या-र्क्यम्) Unsearchable, in
comprehensible, inscrutable. E. अ neg. and तर्क्य.
text.1116:
अतल Bahuvr. n. (-लम्) A particular hell or division of the
infernal regions, the portion immediately below the earth.
E. अ priv. and तल; ‘bottomless’.
text.1117:
अतलस्पर्श Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्शः-र्शा-र्शम्) Bottomless, very
deep. E. अ priv. and तल-स्पर्श; ‘the bottom of which can
not be touched’.
text.1118:
अतलस्पृश् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्पृक्). See the preceding. E. अ
neg. and तल-स्पृश्.
text.1119:
अतव्यस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यान्-व्यसी-व्यः) Not stronger, not
very strong. (ved.) E. अ neg. and तव्यस्.
text.1120:
अतस् ind.
1 Hence, from this place.
2 From that time.
3 There
fore, from that cause.
4 Used also in the same sense as
the ablative or fifth case of एतद्; f. i. अत ऊर्ध्वम् or अतः
परम्, after that, afterwards, from now; अतोऽन्यथा dif
ferent from that; अतोऽर्थात् from that reason, therefore.
E. अश् (i. e. अ considered as a substitute of एतद्), taddh.
aff. तसिल्.
text.1121:
अतस I. m. (-सः)
1 Wind, air.
2 The soul.
3 A weapon.
4 Cloth made from bark.
5 (In the Vedas.) A tree, a
large tree.
II. f. (-सी)
1 Common flax (Linum usitatissimum).
2 Saṇa,
Bengal sun, a kind of flax (Crotolaria juncea). E. अत्,
uṇ. aff. असच्, when fem. with ङीष् added.
text.1122:
अति ind. (see निपात, उपसर्ग, गति, कर्मप्रवचनीय)
1 Over,
beyond.
2 Exceedingly, very much. This word is used
either as a separable preposition with a word following
in the accusative, or as an inseparable prefix in compo
sition with verbal and nominal themes. If अति, in com
position with a nominal theme, constitutes a Tatpur. com
pound, it must either express a higher degree (f. i. in
अतिराजन्, a superior or excellent king) or the sense of
the word क्रान्त must be supplied after it and the latter
part of the compound understood in the sense of the accu
sative (f. i. in अतिखट्वः which is explained as meaning
अतिक्रान्तः खट्वाम्). E. अत्, kṛt aff. इन्(?).
text.1123:
अतिकथ Tatpur. I. f. (-था) Idle or unmeaning speech.
II. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्)
1 Incredible, unworthy of be
lief or trust.
2 Erring, deviating from the duties of a pro
fession or cast. E. अति and कथा. Some works substitute
for this word the reading इतिकथ q. v., which seems to be
the more correct form.
text.1124:
अतिकन्दक Bahuvr. m. (-कः) The name of a tree. See ह-
स्तिकन्द. E. अति and कन्द, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1125:
अतिकल्यम् Avyayībh. Too early in the morning, at dawning.
E. अति and कल्य.
text.1126:
अतिकश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Past whipping, un
manageable, restive (as a horse). E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and
कशा (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1127:
अतिकाय Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Gigantic.
II. m. (-यः) The name of a Rākṣasa. E. अति and काय.
text.1128:
अतिकुत्सित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Very low, much
despised. E. अति and कुत्सित.
text.1129:
अतिकुल्व Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ल्वः-ल्वा-ल्वम्) Having very few
hairs. (ved.) E. अति and कुल्व. Also read अतिकूल्व.
text.1130:
अतिकृच्छ्र Tatpur. m. (-च्छ्रः)
1 Extreme pain or suffering.
2 A kind of penance, eating a handful of food a day for
nine days, and fasting three. E. अति and कृच्छ्र.
text.1131:
अतिकृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) A class of metres regulated by
number and quantity. See अतिच्छन्दस्. It comprises two
species (see क्रौञ्चपदा and शम्भु) and consists of a stanza
of four lines, with twenty-five syllables in each line.
Also called अभिकृति. E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and कृति (an
other class of metres; in the sense of the accusative).
text.1132:
अतिकृश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Very thin, ema
ciated. E. अति and कृश.
text.1133:
अतिकृष्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णः-ष्णा-ष्णम्) Very dark, too
dark or dark blue. E. अति and कृष्ण.
text.1134:
अतिकेशर Bahuvr. m. (-रः) The name of an aquatic plant
(Trapa bispinosa). See कुब्जक. E. अति and केशर.
text.1135:
अतिक्रम m. (-मः)
1 Going over or beyond, lit. or fig.
2 Sur
passing, excelling, overcoming.
3 Transgressing.
4 Neglect,
disregard, impropriety.
5 Contrariety, opposition.
6 A ground
less demand, an imposition.
7 A gallant attack, advance
of an army in front of an enemy. (See अभिक्रम.) E. क्रम्
with अति, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.1136:
अतिक्रमण n. (-णम्)
1 Going over or beyond.
2 Transgress
ing.
3 Going away, passing.
4 Passing away (as time),
idling. E. क्रम् with अति, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1137:
अतिक्रमिन् m. f. n. (-मी-मिणी-मि)
1 Transgressing.
2 Ex
ceeding, surpassing. E. अतिक्रम, taddh. aff. इनि, or क्रम्
with अति, kṛt aff. इनि.
text.1138:
अतिक्रान्त m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्)
1 Transgressed, exceeded,
passed in time, excelled, surpassed, or
2 having transgressed,
exceeded &c. See क्रम् with अति. E. क्रम् with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1139:
अतिक्रान्तनिषेध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Having trans
gressed a prohibition, having done what is prohibited by
law. E. अतिक्रान्त and निषेध.
text.1140:
अतिक्रामक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Exceeding, one who over
steps due bounds. E. क्रम् with अति, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
text.1141:
अतिक्रामत् m. f. n. (-मन्-मन्ती-मत्) Transgressing, exceeding,
surpassing &c. See क्रम् with अति. E. क्रम् with अति, kṛt aff. शतृ.
text.1142:
अतिक्षिप्त I. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Thrown beyond, thrown
outside &c.
II. n. (-प्तम्) (In medicine.) A dislocation (see भग्न and
सन्धिमुक्त), described as ‘when the two bones of a joint are
forced out and cause much pain’. E. क्षिप् with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1143:
अतिग m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्)
1 Exceeding, going beyond.
2 Surpassing, excelling. E. गम् with अति, kṛt aff. ड.
text.1144:
अतिगण्ड Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डा-ण्डम्) Having large
cheeks or temples.
II. m. (-ण्डः) The Yoga star of the sixth lunar mansion
(see आर्द्रा), that star which serves as the index of the
mansion. It is perhaps the 133d of Taurus. E. अति and गण्ड.
text.1145:
अतिगन्ध Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-न्धः-न्धा-न्धम्) Of strong or
exceeding odour.
II. m. (-न्धः)
1 A fragrant grass, lemon-grass (Andropo
gon schœnanthus).
2 Champac (Michelia champaca).
3 A
kind of Jasmin. See मुद्गर.
4 Sulphur. E. अति and गन्ध.
text.1146:
अतिगन्धालु Tatpur. m. (-लुः) The name of a creeper. See
पुत्रदात्री. E. अति and गन्धालु.
text.1147:
अतिगर्बित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Very arrogant,
very proud. E. अति and गर्बित.
text.1148:
अतिगव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Having gone beyond
a cow, having surpassed a cow &c. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त)
and गो (in the sense of the accusative), samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.1149:
अतिगहन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Very impervious or
inaccessible. E. अति and गहन.
text.1150:
अतिगुप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Very secret, closely
hidden or concealed. E. अति and गुप्त.
text.1151:
अतिगुहा Tatpur. f. (-हा) A plant (Hemionites cordifolia,
Rox.). See पृश्निपर्णी. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and गुहा (in the
sense of the accusative); ‘rising above the ground’.
text.1152: अतिगो Tatpur. f. (-गौः) An excellent cow. E. अति and गो.
text.1153:
अतिग्रह m. (-हः) I. Overtaking, surpassing. E. ग्रह् with
अति, kṛt aff. अच्.
II. Tatpur. (In the philosophical terminology of the
Upanishads) that which goes beyond the grahas or the
eight instruments of apprehension i. e. the objects or func
tions of apprehension themselves: thus with the graha प्राण
(meaning there ‘the nose’) corresponds the atigraha अपान
(meaning there ‘fragrant substance’), with the graha वाच्,
the atigraha नामन् and likewise, with the other six grahas
जिह्वा, चक्षुस्, श्रोत्र, मनस्, हस्त, त्वच्, the atigrahas रस,
रूप, शब्द, काम, कर्मन् and स्पर्श.--Also called अतिग्राह.
E. अति and ग्रह (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1154:
अतिग्राह Tatpur. m. (-हः) The same as अतिग्रह in its philo
sophical meaning. E. अति and ग्राह (in the sense of the accus.).
text.1155:
अतिग्राह्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ह्यः-ह्या-ह्यम्) Very acceptable
or agreeable.
II. m. (-ह्यः) The name of three particular grahas or
sacrificial vessels (see ग्रह), with which libations were made
in the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice to Agni, Indra and Sūrya.
E. अति and ग्राह्य.
text.1156:
अतिघ Tatpur. m. (-घः)
1 A bludgeon, a weapon.
2 Anger,
wrath. E. अति and घ.
text.1157:
अतिघ्नी Tatpur. f. (-घ्नी) The state of happiness, the state of
profound sleep. (In the terminology of the Upanishads.)
E. अति and घ्न, with ङीप् aff., ‘destroying thoroughly all
unpleasant feelings’; sc. अवस्था.
text.1158:
अतिचर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Going very much.
II. f. (-रा) The name of a plant which grows in Bengal
(Hibiscus mutabilis). See also पद्मचारिणी, अव्यथा, पद्मा
and चारटी. E. अति (very much) and चर, or अति (sc.
क्रान्त) and चर (going i. e. a living being, in the sense of
the accusative); the plant being called so, because ‘it grows
in impervious places and, therefore, goes beyond the reach
of living beings’.
text.1159:
अतिचार m. (-रः) I.
1 Going over or beyond.
2 Surpassing,
excelling. E. चर् with अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
II. Tatpur.
1 Going quickly.
2 The passage of a planet
from one zodiacal sign to another, in a shorter than ordi
nary period. E. अति (exceedingly) and चार.
text.1160:
अतिचारिन् m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Transgressing, surpass
ing. E. चर् with अति, kṛt aff. घिनुण्, the affix implying
here habit or nature.
text.1161:
अतिच्छत्र Tatpur. I. m. (-त्रः) A species of mushroom. (See
छत्रा and पालघ्न.)
II. f. (-त्रा)
1 Anise (Anethum pimpinella).
2 Barleria
longifolia. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and छत्र (in the sense of
the accusative), ‘surpassing a parasol’; in the fem. with
टाप् aff.
text.1162:
अतिच्छत्रक I. m. (-कः) A mushroom. See the preceding.
II. f. (-का) The same as अतिच्छत्रा. E. taddh. aff. कन्
added to the last.
text.1163:
अतिच्छन्द Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्दः-न्दा-न्दम्) Without desire,
free from worldly desire. Also अतिच्छन्दस्. E. अति (sc.
क्रान्त) and छन्द (in the sense of the accusative), ‘having
gone beyond desires’.
text.1164:
अतिच्छन्दस् Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्दाः-न्दाः-न्दः) The same
as the preceding.
II. f. n. (-न्दाः-न्दः) The name of two classes of metres
regulated by number and quantity, the first of which com
prises the classes अतिजगती, शक्वरी, अतिशक्वरी, अष्टि,
अत्यष्टि, धृति, अतिधृति (qq. vv.) and the second the classes
कृति, प्रकृति, आकृति, विकृति, सङ्कृति, अतिकृति (or अभि-
कृति), उत्कृति (qq. vv.).
III. f. (-न्दाः) The name of one of the consecrated bricks
or iṣṭakās. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and छन्दस् I. desire, II.
metre (in the sense of the accusative) ‘going or having
gone beyond desires’ and ‘going beyond the seven Chhan
das or metres गायत्री, उष्णिह्, अनुष्टुभ्, बृहती, पङ्क्ति, त्रि-
ष्टुभ् and जगती’.
text.1165:
अतिजगती Tatpur. f. (-ती) The name of a class of metres
regulated by number and quantity. See अतिच्छन्दस्. It
comprises sixteen varieties and consists of a stanza of
four lines, with thirteen syllables in each line. (See
1 प्रहर्षिणी,
2 रुचिरा (or अतिरुचिरा),
3 मत्तमयूर (or मा-
या),
4 गौरी,
5 मञ्जुभाषिणी (or प्रबोधिता, or सुनन्दिनी,
or कनकप्रभा),
6 चन्द्रिका (or क्षमा, or उत्पलिनी, or कुटि-
लगति),
7 कलहंस (or चित्रवती, or सिंहनाद),
8 चञ्चरिका-
वली,
9 चन्द्रलेखा,
10 विद्युत्,
11 मृगेन्द्रमुख,
12 तारक,
12 क-
लाकन्द (or कन्द),
14 पङ्कजावली (or पङ्कावली),
15 चण्डी,
16 प्रभावती.) E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and जगती (in the sense
of the accusative) ‘going beyond the metre जगती q. v.’.
text.1166:
अतिजन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Solitary, lonely. E.
अति (in the sense of अतिगत or अत्यन्तविगत) and जन;
or perhaps as a Tatpur. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and जन (in the
sense of the accusative).
text.1167:
अतिजर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Exceedingly old.
With respect to the declension of this word, see जरा and
जरस्. E. अति and जरा.
text.1168:
अतिजव Tatpur. I. m. (-वः) Extreme speed.
II. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Marching fast or fleet. E. अति
and जव.
text.1169:
अतिजागर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Very wakeful,
restless.
II. m. (-रः) The black curlew. E. अति and जागर.
text.1170:
अतिजात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Superior by birth
(to the parents). E. अति and जात.
text.1171:
अतिजीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) Very old. E. अति
and जीर्ण.
text.1172:
अतिडीन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Very lofty or very rapid flight
of birds. E. अति and डीन.
text.1173:
अतितराम् ind.
1 Far more, far better (with a word follow
ing in the ablative or fifth case).
2 Very much, excessively,
exceedingly.
3 Far beyond, far above (with a word follow
ing in the accusative or second case). E. अति, taddh. aff.
तरप् and आमु. (अतितराम् may better be considered as
the comparative degree of अति in the accus. of the femin.)
text.1174:
अतितारिन् m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Crossing or getting over.
E. तॄ with अति, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.1175:
अतितीक्ष्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्ष्णः-क्ष्णा-क्ष्णम्) Very pungent,
sharp, hot or acrid. E. अति and तीक्ष्ण.
text.1176:
अतितीव्र Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-व्रः-व्रा-व्रम्) Very sharp or
pungent.
II. f. (-व्रा) Dūb grass. See गण्डदूर्वा. E. अति and तीव्र.
text.1177:
अतितृण्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्णः-ण्णा-ण्णम्) Very much hurt or
injured. E. अति and तृण्ण.
text.1178:
अतितृप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Oversatisfaction, satisfying one's
appetite too much. E. अति and तृप्ति.
text.1179:
अतित्यद् Tatpur. Beyond that. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and त्यद्
(in the sense of the accusative). This word seems to be
only one of grammatical coinage, to show that the declen
sion of त्यद् in compositions like these is like that of other
nouns ending in द् and not that of the pronominal theme
त्यद्; i. e. अतित्यद्, अतित्यदौ &c. (instead of अतिस्यः,
अतित्यौ &c.).
text.1180:
अतित्वम् Tatpur. m. Surpassing thee. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः)
and त्वम् (in the sense of त्वाम्). This word seems to be,
like the last, only a grammatical one and scarcely in real
use; its declension is equally purely fictitious and vary
ing, even, according to the different grammatical autho
rities. See the following and अतित्वाम्, अतियूयम्, also
अत्यहम्.
text.1181: अतित्वान् Tatpur. The accus. in the plural of the preceding.
text.1182:
अतित्वाम् Tatpur. The accusative in the singular and dual
of अतित्वम्.
text.1183:
अतिथि I. 1. m. f. n. (-थिः-थी-थि) One who arrives and,
though entirely unknown, is entitled to the rites of hospi
tality, a guest. See अतिथिन्.
2. m. (-थिः)
1 A proper name of a king of Ayodhyā, the
son of Kuśa and grandson of Rāma.
2 The vaidik name of an
attendant of Soma. (This latter meaning is more likely to
be taken in a figurative sense, Soma being mentioned as
the name of a king and Agni, Atithi, Śyena as those of his
attendants). E. अत्, uṇ. aff. इथिन्. (अतिथि in the mean
ing of ‘guest’ is also explained as a Bahuvr. ‘one who has
no kind of तिथि or holy day, who may arrive any day’
or ‘one who does not sojourn a whole tithi, but only one
single night’, or ‘one who is not steady (when तिथि is
supposed to be a mutilated form of स्थिति)’; all these ex
planations are artificial.)
II. Bahuvr. m. (-थिः) Wrath, anger. E. अ priv. and
तिथि ‘not restricted to a tithi, what may come at any time’.
text.1184:
अतिथिक्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) Hospitality considered as a
religious duty. E. अतिथि and क्रिया.
text.1185:
अतिथिग्व Tatpur. m. (-ग्वः) A proper name or a vaidik epithet
of Divodāsa. (Properly meaning: ‘worthy to be approached
by guests, hospitable’. E. अतिथि and ग्व (from गम्, uṇ. aff. ड्व).
text.1186: अतिथित्व n. (-त्वम्) Hospitality. E. अतिथि, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.1187:
अतिथिधर्म Tatpur. m. (-र्मः) The proper quality which con
stitutes a claim to hospitality. E. अतिथि and धर्म.
text.1188:
अतिथिधर्मिन् m. f. n. (-र्मी-र्णिनी-मि) One who has the
proper qualities which constitute a claim to hospitality.
E. The preceding, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1189:
अतिथिन् I. m. f. n. (-थी-थिनी-थि) Wandering, travelling. (ved.)
II. m. (-थी) The name of a king, called also Suhotra
and otherwise Atithi. See अतिथि. E. अत्, uṇ. aff.(?) इथिन्.
text.1190: अतिथिद्वेष Tatpur. m. (-षः) Inhospitality. E. अतिथि and द्वेष.
text.1191:
अतिथिपूजन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Hospitality considered as one
of the principal sacraments of the Hindus. E. अतिथि and
पूजन.
text.1192:
अतिथिपूजा Tatpur. f. (-जा). The same as the preceding. E.
अतिथि and पूजा.
text.1193:
अतिथिसत्कार Tatpur. m. (-रः) The rite of hospitality, the
hospitable treatment of a guest. E. अतिथि and सत्कार.
text.1194:
अतिथिसेवा Tatpur. f. (-वा) Service of a guest, hospitality.
E. अतिथि and सेवा.
text.1195:
अतिदग्ध Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ग्धः-ग्धा-ग्धम्) Very much burnt.
II. n. (-ग्धम्) (In med.) One of the four degrees of burns,
described in the following manner: ‘when the flesh hangs
down and the part is separated with the destruction of the
vessels, joints &c., with fever, thirst, faintness, the tumour
growing slowly and, when ripe, being colourless’. E. अति
and दग्ध.
text.1196:
अतिदत्त Tatpur. m. (-त्तः) A proper name, the son of Sūra
or Rājādhideva. E. अति and दत्त.
text.1197:
अतिदर्प I. Tatpur. m. (-र्पः) Excessive pride or arrogance.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्पः-र्पा-र्पम्) Very proud or arro
gant. E. अति and दर्प.
text.1198:
अतिदर्शिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्शी-र्शिनी-र्शि) Seeing very far.
E. अति and दर्शिन्.
text.1199: अतिदातृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) A liberal man. E. अति and दातृ.
text.1200:
अतिदान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Munificence, giving largely. E.
अति and दान.
text.1201:
अतिदान्त Tatpur. m. (-न्तः) The name of a prince. Perhaps
the same as, or another reading of अभिदान्त. E. अति and
दान्त.
text.1202:
अतिदाह Tatpur. m. (-हः)
1 Great heat.
2 Violent inflam
mation. E. अति and दाह.
text.1203:
अतिदिष्ट m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Being the object of an अति-
देश (q. v.), of an additional or supplementary rule. E. दिश्
with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1204:
अतिदीप्य Tatpur. m. (-प्यः) The name of a plant (Plumbago
rosea). Called also रक्तचित्रक. E. अति and दीप्य.
text.1205:
अतिदीर्घ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्घः-र्घा-र्घम्) Too or very long
(in time and space). E. अति and दीर्घ.
text.1206:
अतिदुःसह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Quite intolerable,
quite unbearable, not to be borne or endured. E. अति
and दुःसह.
text.1207:
अतिदुर्गत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) In great difficulty
or distress. E. अति and दुर्गत.
text.1208:
अतिदुर्लम्भ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्भः-म्भा-म्भम्) Very difficult to
obtain. E. अति and दुर्लम्भ. (The form दुर्लम्भ, however,
occurs only as part of a compound, दुर्लभ or दुर्लाभ being
the legitimate forms, when used alone.)
text.1209:
अतिदुष्कर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा or -री-रम्) Very ar
duous, very difficult. E. अति and दुष्कर.
text.1210:
अतिदूर Tatpur. n. (-रम्) Excessive distance. (अतिदूरम्,
अतिदूरात्, अतिदूरेण and अतिदूरे, especially in conjunc
tion with न are used adverbially ‘not very far off’.) E.
अति and दूर.
text.1211:
अतिदेव Tatpur. m. (-वः) A superior god, one who surpasses
the Gods. E. अति and देव (or according to others अति,
sc. क्रान्त, and देव, in the sense of the accusative).
text.1212:
अतिदेश m. (-शः) A rule providing for something more than
the ordinary or established rules (see प्रदेश, उपदेश) pro
vide for and not comprehended by them; it may be either
enjoined specially or derived from inference; if such a rule,
in grammar, affects the form, gender &c. of a word,
it is called रूपातिदेश, लिङ्गातिदेश &c.; in philosophy
atideśas of a general or comprehensive nature are called
सामान्यातिदेश and those restricted to a special case विशे-
षातिदेश. See also शास्त्रातिदेश, कार्यातिदेश, निमित्ता-
तिदेश, व्यपदेशातिदेश. E. दिश् with अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1213: अतिदोष Tatpur. m. (-षः) A great fault. E. अति and दोष.
text.1214:
अतिधन्वन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्वा) The proper name of a descen
dant of Śunaka. E. अति and धन्वन्.
text.1215:
अतिधृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 The name of a class of metres
which are regulated by number and quantity. See अति-
च्छन्दस्. It comprises thirteen varieties and consists of
a stanza of four lines with nineteen syllables in each
line. (See
1 शार्दूल or शार्दूलविक्रीडित,
2 मेघविस्फुर्जित or
विस्मित,
3 पञ्चचामर,
4 पुष्पदामन्,
5 बिम्बा,
6 छाया,
7 मक-
रन्दिका,
8 समुद्रतटा,
9 सुरसा,
10 मणिमञ्जरी,
11 चन्द्रमाला
or चन्द्र,
12 धवलाङ्क or धवल,
13 सम्भु.)
2 (In arithmetic
sometimes used to denote) the number nineteen. E. अति
(sc. क्रान्ता) and धृति (in the sense of the accusative) ‘going
beyond the metre धृति q. v.’.
text.1216:
अतिधेनु Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नुः-नुः-नु) Having excellent or a
great many cows. E. अति and धेनु.
text.1217:
अतिनामन् Bahuvr. m. (-मा) A proper name, one of the
seven Ṛṣis or Sages who preside over the reign of Chā
kshusha, the sixth Manu. E. अति and नामन्.
text.1218:
अतिनिचृत् Tatpur. f. (-चृत्) The name of a vaidik metre
regulated by the number of syllables; it consists of three
Pādas of seven, six, and seven syllables in each; also
read अतिनिवृत्. E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and निचृत् (or निवृत्),
in the sense of the accusative.
text.1219:
अतिनिद्र I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्रः-द्रा-द्रम्) One who sleeps
inordinately.
II. Tatpur. f. (-द्रा) Excessive sleep (also considered as
a morbid symptom).
III. Avyayībh. (-द्रम्) After sleeping. E. अति and निद्रा.
text.1221:
अतिनौ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नौः-नौः-नु) Landed from a boat.
E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and नौ (in the sense of the accusative)
‘gone beyond a boat’.
text.1222:
अतिपतन n. (-नम्) Transgressing, going beyond bounds. E.
पत् with अति, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1223:
अतिपतित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Transgressed, missed. See
also अतिपन्न. E. पत् with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1224:
अतिपत्ति f. (-त्तिः) Going beyond, passing away. E. पत्
with अति, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.1225:
अतिपत्र Bahuvr. m. (-त्रः)
1 A tree, see हस्तिकन्द.
2 Another
tree, the Teak tree. See शाकवृक्ष. E. अति and पत्र.
text.1226:
अतिपथिन् Tatpur. m. (-पन्था) A good road. E. अति and
पथिन्, ‘a very road’.
text.1227:
अतिपद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) Having one foot too
much or more (as an exuberant metre; f. i. अतिपदा गा-
यत्री, अतिपदा शक्वरी). E. अति and पद.
text.1228:
अतिपन्न m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्). The same as अतिपतित. E.
पद् with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1229:
अतिपर Tatpur. m. (-रः) I. A great enemy. E. अति and
पर.
II. One who has conquered his enemy. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः)
and पर (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1230:
अतिपरोक्ष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) Very imperceptible,
very remote. E. अति and परोक्ष.
text.1231:
अतिपरोक्षवृत्ति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) Being of
very remote explanation, very difficult to explain (as words
the etymology of which is obscure). E. अतिपरोक्ष and
वृत्ति.
text.1232:
अतिपात m. (-तः)
1 Passing away.
2 Transgression, neglect
of duty, deviation from laws or customs, sin, offence.
3 Contrariety, opposition. E. पत् with अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1233:
अतिपातक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) The worst of the great sins, a
heinous sin, viz. the sexual intercourse of a man with his
mother, daughter or daughter-in-law and that of a woman
with her son, father and father-in-law. E. अति and पातक.
text.1234:
अतिपातित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Quite thrown,
quite driven otu.
II. n. (-तम्) (In medicine.) A dislocation, complete sepa
ration of a limb from the body (see भग्न and काण्डभग्न).
E. अति and पातित.
text.1235:
अतिपातिन् m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) I. Going beyond, ex
ceeding. E. पत् with अति, kṛt aff. घिणुन्.
II. Tatpur. Passing very quick, acute (as a disease). E.
अति and पातिन्.
text.1236:
अतिपादनिचृत् Tatpur. f. (-त्) The name of a vaidik metre
regulated by the number of syllables. It is a species of the
Gāyatrī metre and consists of three Pādas of six, eight
and seven syllables in each. Also read अतिपादनिवृत्. E.
अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and पादनिचृत् (or पादनिवृत्), in the
sense of the accusative.
text.1237: अतिपादनिवृत् Tatpur. f. (-त्). See the preceding.
text.1238:
अतिपितामह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Surpassing the grand-father,
better than his grand-father (as a grand-son). E. अति (sc.
क्रान्तः) and पितामह (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1239:
अतिपितृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) Surpassing the father, better than
his father (as a son). E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and पितृ (in the
sense of the accusative).
text.1240:
अतिपुरुष Tatpur. m. (-षः) A great man, a great hero; also
written अतिपूरुष. E. अति and पुरुष or पूरुष.
text.1241:
अतिपेशल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Very dexterous or
clever. E. अति and पेशल.
text.1242:
अतिप्रगे Tatpur. ind. Very early or too early in the morning.
E. अति and प्रगे.
text.1243:
अतिप्रमाण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Exceedingly large,
very great. E. अति and प्रमाण.
text.1244:
अतिप्रवृत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Coming forth very much, runn
ing too abundantly &c. E. अति and प्रवृत्ति.
text.1245:
अतिप्रवृद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्)
1 Too much grown,
swollen &c.
2 Too haughty, too arrogant. E. अति and
प्रवृद्ध.
text.1246:
अतिप्रश्न m. (-श्नः) A question which goes beyond its proper
bounds, a question concerning a transcendental object. E.
प्रच्छ् with अति, kṛt aff. नङ्.
text.1247:
अतिप्रश्न्य m. f. n. (-श्न्यः-श्न्या-श्न्यम्) Belonging to, re
ferring to, being the object of a question which goes be
yond its proper bounds, or concerns a transcendental ob
ject. E. अतिप्रश्न, taddh. aff. यत्.
text.1248:
अतिप्रसक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः) Being attached too much, too
great attachment. See also the following. E. अति and प्रसक्ति.
text.1249:
अतिप्रसङ्ग m. (-ङ्गः) I. Tatpur. Too great attachment, being
attached too much. E. अति and प्रसङ्ग.
II. (In grammar, law and philosophy.) The applicability
of a rule, definition, notion &c. extended too far: applying
a rule &c. to a case, object &c. where properly it aught
not to be applied. E. सञ्ज् with प्र and अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1250:
अतिप्रसिद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Very notorious,
quite known. E. अति and प्रसिद्ध.
text.1251:
अतिप्रेषित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) The time after the ceremony
with the प्रैष (q. v.) Mantras has been performed. E. अति
(sc. क्रान्तम्) and प्रेषित (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1252:
अतिप्रौढयौवन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Being in the
fullness of youth. E. अति and प्रौढयौवन.
text.1253:
अतिबल Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Very strong,
very powerful.
II. m. (-लः)
1 An active soldier.
2 The name of a king.
III. f. (-ला)
1 The name of a medicinal plant ‘employed
against disorders from wind, worms, sickness, burning
heat and thirst, excess of saliva, in pregnancy &c. and
considered as possessing strengthening properties’ (Sidonia
cordifolia and rhombifolia, or according to others Annona
squamosa).
2 A proper name, a daughter of Daksha and
wife of Kaśyapa.
3 The name of a mystical verse or charm,
used as a mystical weapon. E. अति and बल.
text.1254:
अतिबाहु Bahuvr. m. (-हुः) One of the seven Ṛṣis or Sages
who preside over the reign of the fourteenth Manu. E. अति
and बाहु, ‘having very great arms’.
text.1255:
अतिब्रह्मचर्य Tatpur. n. (-र्यम्) Excess of chastity. E. अति
and ब्रह्मचर्य.
text.1256:
अतिब्रह्मन् Tatpur. m. (-ह्मा) The proper name of a king. E.
अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and ब्रह्मन् (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1257:
अतिभार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 A great or excessive burden.
2 (Figuratively.) Inexplicitness, great obscurity (of a sen
tence &c.).
II. Bahuvr.(?) A proper name, according to a Purāṇa,
the son of Ṛteyu and a descendant of Puru. See also अति-
मार. E. अति and भार.
text.1258: अतिभारग Tatpur. m. (-गः) A mule. E. अतिभार and ग.
text.1259:
अतिभाव m. (-वः) Surpassing, overcoming, overpowering.
E. भू with अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1260:
अतिभी Bahuvr. m. (-भीः) Lightning, the flash accompany
ing thunder. E. अति and भी.
text.1261:
अतिभीषण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Very horrible,
very formidable. E. अति and भीषण.
text.1262:
अतिभूमि Tatpur. f. (-मिः)
1 Extensive land.
2 Excess, ex
tremeness, impropriety. E. अति and भूमि; (some explain
this word by अतिशयस्य स्थानम्.)
text.1263:
अतिभोजन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Eating too much (considered
also as a consequence of the disease भस्मक q. v.). E. अति
and भोजन.
text.1264:
अतिभ्रू Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-भ्रूः-भ्रूः-भ्रु) Having very large eye
brows. E. अति and भ्रू.
text.1265:
अतिमङ्गल्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ल्यः-ल्या-ल्यम्) Very auspi
cious &c. (See मङ्गल्य.)
II. m. (-ल्यः) A fruit (Ægle, or Cratœva marmelos).
See विल्व. E. अति and मङ्गल्य.
text.1266:
अतिमति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Pride, arrogance. E. अति and
मति.
text.1267:
अतिमध्यन्दिन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The height of midday. E.
अति and मध्यन्दिन.
text.1268:
अतिमर्याद I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) Very much, excessive.
II. Avyayībh. (-दम्) Excessively, beyond bounds. E. अति
(sc. क्रान्त) and मर्यादा (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1269:
अतिमर्त्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्त्यः-र्त्या-र्त्यम्) Superhuman, divine.
E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and मर्त्य (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1270:
अतिमात्र I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Much, excessive.
II. Avyayībh. (-त्रम्) Excessively. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त)
and मात्रा (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1271: अतिमान् Tatpur. The accus. in the plural of अत्यहम् q. v.
text.1272:
अतिमान Tatpur. m. (-नः) Great pride or arrogance. E. अति
and मान.
text.1273:
अतिमानिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नी-निनी-नि) Very proud,
very haughty or arrogant. E. अति and मानिन्.
text.1274:
अतिमानुष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षः-षी-षम्)
1 Superhuman, more
than mortal.
2 Immortal, divine. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and
मानुष (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1275:
अतिमाम् Tatpur. The accusative in the singular and in the
dual of अत्यहम् q. v.
text.1276:
अतिमाय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्)
1 Free from illusion.
2 Entirely liberated or freed. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and माया
(in the sense of the accusative).
text.1277:
अतिमार Tatpur. m. (-रः) The name of a prince; also written
अतिभार q. v. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and मार (in the sense
of the accusative).
text.1278:
अतिमारुत I. Tatpur. m. (-तः) A hurricane.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Very windy. E. अति
and मारुत.
text.1279:
अतिमित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not wet, not moi
stened. E. अ neg. and तिमित.
2 Over measured. E. अति
and मित.
text.1280:
अतिमुक्त Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्)
1 Entirely liber
ated or freed.
2 Free from passion or worldly desire.
3 Seed
less, barren. E. अति and मुक्त.
II. m. (-क्तः) A large creeper bearing white fragrant flow
ers (Gærtnera racemosa), ‘used against colds, bilious heat,
feverish delirium, hiccough, sickness &c.’ See also पुण्ड्रक,
माधवीलता. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and मुक्ता (in the sense of
the accusative) ‘surpassing pearls sc. in whiteness’.
III. m. (-क्तः) A tree (Dalbergia oujeiniensis). E. अति
and मुक्त ‘from its spreading very widely’.
text.1281:
अतिमुक्तक m. (-कः)
1 A tree (Dalbergia oujeiniensis).
2 A
creeper (Gærtnera racemosa). See अतिमुक्त.
3 Mountain
ebony. See तिन्दुक.
4 Another tree. See हरिमन्थ. E. अति-
मुक्त, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.1282:
अतिमुक्ति f. (-क्तिः) Liberation from death. See मुक्ति, अति-
मोक्ष and मोक्ष. E. मुच् with अति, kṛt aff. क्तिन्; or a
Tatpur. consisting of अति and मुक्ति.
text.1283:
अतिमृत्यु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्युः-त्युः-त्यु) Overcoming death.
E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and मृत्यु (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1284:
अतिमैथुन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Excess of sexual intercourse.
E. अति and मैथुन.
text.1285:
अतिमोक्ष m. (-क्षः) Liberation from death. See मोक्ष, मुक्ति
and अतिमुक्ति. E. मोक्ष् with अति, kṛt aff. अच्; or a
Tatpur. consisting of अति and मोक्ष.
text.1286:
अतिमोदा Bahuvr. f. (-दा) A tree (Jasminum arboreum).
See नवमल्लिका. E. अति and मोद.
text.1287:
अतियश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Very glorious, very
celebrated. E. अति and यश (instead of यशस्). See the
following.
text.1288:
अतियशस् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शाः-शाः-शः) Very glorious,
very celebrated. E. अति and यशस्.
text.1289:
अतियाज Tatpur. m. (-जः) The name of a Ṛṣi (properly
meaning: a great sacrificer, very pious). E. अति and याज.
text.1290:
अतियुवन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-युवा-यूनी or -युवती-युव) Very
young. E. अति and युवन्.
text.1291:
अतियूयम् Tatpur. The nominative in the plural of अति-
त्वम् q. v.
text.1292:
अतियोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Too great conflux, excessive com
bination, excess. E. अति and योग.
text.1293:
अतिरक्त Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Very red.
II. f. (-क्ता) One of the seven tongues of Agni. See अग्नि-
जिह्वा. E. अति and रक्त.
text.1294:
अतिरथ Tatpur. m. (-थः) A mighty warrior or chief, one
going to battle in a car. E. अति and रथ.
text.1295:
अतिरसा Bahuvr. f. (-सा) The name of several plants. See
मूर्वा, रास्ना, क्लीतनक. E. अति and रस.
text.1296:
अतिराजकुमारि Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रिः-रिः-रि) Surpassing
a princess. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and राजकुमारी (in the sense
of the accusative).
text.1297:
अतिराजन् Tatpur. m. (-जा)
1 An excellent, a mighty king.
E. अति and राजन्. See अतिराजी.
2 One who surpasses
a king. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and राजन् (in the sense of the
accusative). See अतिराज्ञी.
text.1298:
अतिराजय् denom. par. (-यति) To surpass a king. E. अति-
राजन् (one who surpasses a king), denom. aff. णिच्.
text.1299:
अतिराजी Tatpur. m. (-जी) An excellent queen. E. अति and
राजन्, samāsānta aff. टच् and fem. aff. ङीप्. (The mas
culine form of this word which would be अतिराज, does not
exist. See अतिराजन्, 1.)
text.1300:
अतिराज्ञी Tatpur. m. (-ज्ञी) A woman who surpasses a king.
E. See अतिराजन्, 2, fem. aff. ङीप्.
text.1301:
अतिरात्र Tatpur. m. (-त्रः)
1 The name of the fifth part or Soma
sansthā of the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice, for the complete per
formance of which, however, it is not considered nitya, es
sential or obligatory but kāmya, voluntary, viz. if the sacri
ficer institutes it for the sake of progeny, and therefore anitya,
not always taking place, supererogatory. (See अग्निष्टोम.)
2 The usual beginning and concluding part of those Ahargaṇa
sacrifices which are called Sattra (q. v.) and the beginning or
the concluding part of those which are called Ahīna (q. v.).
There are, however, exceptions to this rule, see f. i. पञ्चदश-
रात्र, कुण्डपायिनामयन.
3 The name of the Sāmaveda verse
which closes the ceremonies of the sacrifices mentioned before.
4 A proper name, the son of Chākṣuṣa or the sixth Manu by
Nadvalā. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and रात्रि (in the sense of
the accusative), samāsānta aff. अच्; properly meaning ‘last
ing beyond a night’.
text.1302:
अतिरात्रसवनीयपशु Tatpur. m. (-शुः) The savanīyapaśu (q. v.)
or sacrificial animal in the Atirātra (q. v.). It is a ewe con
secrated to Sarasvatī and subject to the regulations which
exist for the अग्नीषोमीयपशु (q. v.) E. अतिरात्र and सव-
नीयपशु.
text.1303:
अतिरिक्त m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Excessive, exceeding. E.
रिच् with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1304:
अतिरिक्तता f. (-ता) Increase of bulk or quantity, expansion,
enlargement, elevation, &c. E. taddh. aff. तल् added to the
preceding.
text.1305:
अतिरिक्ताङ्ग I. Tatpur. n. (-ङ्गम्) An additional or extra limb.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Having a limb too
much (f. i. six fingers). E. अतिरिक्त and अङ्ग.
text.1306:
अतिरुच् Tatpur. m. (-रुक्र्) The knee of a horse. E. अति
and रुच् ‘very bright’(?).
text.1307:
अतिरुचिर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Very beautiful,
very pleasing.
II. f. (-रा) The name of two metres; viz.
1 A metre re
gulated by quantity, consisting of a stanza of four lines
with twenty-nine syllables to each couplet, or according to
others, a variety of the Gītyāryā, with thirty syllables in
the first couplet and thirty-two in the second. Also called
चूडिका or चूलिका.
2 A metre regulated by number and
quantity; a variety of the metre अतिजगती (q. v.) and con
sisting of a stanza of four lines with the following feet
in each line: {??} Also called
रुचिरा. E. अति and रुचिर.
text.1308:
अतिरेक m. (-कः) Going over, exceeding, excess. Also used as
adject. in the three genders, excessive. Also written अतीरेक.
E. रिच् with अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1309:
अतिरेकिन् m. f. n. (-की-किणी-कि) More, superior. E. अति-
रेक, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1310:
अतिरै Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रैः-रैः-रि) One who goes beyond
his wealth or property, extravagant. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त)
and रै (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1311:
अतिरोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Consumption (Phthisis pulmo
nalis). E. अति and रोग.
text.1312:
अतिरोमश Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Very hairy,
too hairy. See अतिलोमश.
II. m. (-शः) A wild goat, or according to some, a large
monkey. E. अति and रोमश.
text.1313:
अतिलक्ष्मी I. Tatpur. f. (-क्ष्मीः) Great fortune, great beauty &c.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्ष्मीः-क्ष्मीः-क्ष्मि) Very fortunate,
very beautiful &c. E. अति and लक्ष्मी.
text.1314:
अतिलम्ब Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्बः-म्बा-म्बम्) Very spacious,
very large or extended. E. अति and लम्ब.
text.1315:
अतिलिहा Tatpur.(?) f. (-हा) A Prākrit metre regulated by
quantity; it consists of a stanza of four lines with sixteen
mātrās in each line, does not contain an Amphibrachys and
ends in a Pyrrhichius. Also called अठिल्ला. E. अति and लिह(?).
text.1316:
अतिलुब्ध m. f. n. (-ब्धः-ब्धा-ब्धम्) Very covetous. E. अति
and लुब्ध.
text.1317:
अतिलोभ I. Tatpur. m. (-भः) Excessive desire or greediness.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-भः-भा-भम्) Very greedy, very
covetous. E. अति and लोभ.
text.1318:
अतिलोभता f. (-ता) Great greediness. E. अतिलोभ (II), taddh.
aff. तल्.
text.1319:
अतिलोम Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Having too many
or very many hairs on the body, too hairy, very hairy.
E. अति and लोम.
text.1320:
अतिलोमश Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Too hairy,
very hairy.
II. f. (-शा) A potherb (Convolvulus argenteus). E. अति
and लोमश.
text.1321:
अतिलोहित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Very red. E. अति
and लोहित.
text.1322:
अतिलौल्य Tatpur. n. (-ल्यम्) Excessive desire or greediness.
E. अति and लौल्य.
text.1323:
अतिवक्तृ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्ता-क्त्री-क्तृ) Loquacious, talkative.
E. अति and वक्तृ.
text.1324:
अतिवक्र Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-क्रः-क्रा-क्रम्) Very crooked,
very oblique &c.
II. f. (-क्रा) One of the eight gatis or kinds of motion of
a planet. (See गति.) E. अति and वक्र.
text.1325: अतिवयम् Tatpur. The nominative in the plural of अत्यहम् q. v.
text.1326:
अतिवर्तन n. (-नम्) An accident, a circumstance not capable
of being prevented or guarded against, and which, there
fore, does not render a person liable to punishment. E.
वृत् with अति, kṛt aff. ल्युट् ‘out of the reach of pu
nishment’.
text.1327:
अतिवर्तिन् m. f. n. (-र्ती-र्तिनी-र्ति)
1 Going beyond.
2 Trans
gressing, offending. E. वृत् with अति, kṛt aff. इनि.
text.1328:
अतिवर्तुल Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Very round,
circular &c.
II. m. (-लः) A kind of potherb. See कलाय. E. अति
and वर्तुल.
text.1329:
अतिवाद m. (-दः) Opprobrious or harsh speech. Another
reading of this word is अभिवाद. E. वद् with अति, kṛt
aff. घञ् ‘a speech going beyond its proper bounds’.
text.1330:
अतिवादिन् m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Speaking more than is
proper. E. वद् with अति, kṛt aff. णिनि (implying in this
instance habit or nature).
text.1331:
अतिवालक Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Childish.
II. m. (-कः) An infant. E. अति and वालक.
text.1332:
अतिवास Tatpur. m. (सः) The fast observed on the day pre
ceding that in which the Śrāddha or presentation of obla
tions to deceased ancestors is performed. E. अति and वास.
text.1333:
अतिवाहन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Excessive carrying or toiling,
carrying or toiling too much. E. अति and वाहन.
text.1334:
अतिवाहिक m. (-कः) An infernal spirit, an inhabitant of the
hell. E. अतिवाह, taddh. aff. ठक् (having to toil very hard;
see यात्य).
text.1335:
अतिविकट Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-टः-टा-टम्) Very fierce,
very formidable.
II. m. (-टः) A vicious elephant. E. अति and विकट.
text.1336:
अतिविद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Pierced through,
transfixed. E. अति and विद्ध.
text.1337:
अतिविलम्बिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्बी-म्बिनी-म्बि) Very dilatory,
very slow. E. अति and विलम्बिन्.
text.1338:
अतिविश्रब्धनवोढा Karmadh. f. (-ढा) One of the female cha
racters in the amatory poetry of the Hindus, described as
very much attached to her husband, but being sarcastic
when he is in fault and firm, and abusive when he is in
fault but weak. E. अति-विश्रब्ध and नवोढा.
text.1339:
अतिविश्व Tatpur. m. (-श्वः) The name of a Muni. E. अति (sc.
क्रान्तः) and विश्व (in the sense of the accusative) ‘beyond all’.
text.1340:
अतिविष I. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्)
1 Bahuvr. Very poisonous.
2 Tatpur. Exceeding or subduing poison.
II. Tatpur. (or Bahuvr.) f. (-षा) The name of a most
poisonous plant growing in Nepal used in medicine as an
antidote and also against disorders produced by bilious fe
vers, dysentery, sickness, preternatural parturition &c.
Its bark is also employed in dying; it is of three kinds,
white, red and black. The root is employed by the natives
of India and Nepal to poison the barbs of arrows (Aco
nitum ferox). E. Bahuvr. अति and विष; Tatpur. अति (sc.
क्रान्त) and विष (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1341:
अतिवृत्ति f. (-त्तिः) I. Going beyond, not being appropriate.
E. वृत् with अति, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
II. Tatpur. Excess, abundance. E. अति and वृत्ति.
text.1342:
अतिवृष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) Heavy rain, excess of rain. E.
अति and वृष्टि.
text.1343:
अतिवृष्टिहत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Injured by heavy
rain. E. अतिवृष्टि and हत.
text.1344:
अतिवेल I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Much, excessive.
II. Avyayībh. (-लम्) Excessively. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त)
and वेला (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1345:
अतिवोढृ m. (-ढा) One who carries over or beyond. E. वह्
with अति, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.1346:
अतिव्यथन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Causing excessive pain or agony.
E. अति and व्यथन.
text.1347:
अतिव्यथा Tatpur. f. (-था) Excessive pain, agony. E. अति
and व्यथा.
text.1348:
अतिव्यय Tatpur. m. (-यः) Extravagance, great expenditure.
E. अति and व्यय.
text.1349:
अतिव्याधिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-धी-धिनी-धि) Piercing through,
transfixing. E. अति and व्याधिन्.
text.1350:
अतिव्याप्त m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) (In grammar and philo
sophy.) Obtained through generalizing by going beyond the
mark or too far, inferred without being warranted by the
rules, premises &c. given, not authorised. E. आप् with
वि and अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1351:
अतिव्याप्ति f. (-प्तिः) (In grammar and philosophy.) Genera
lising by going beyond the mark or too far, drawing an
inference unwarranted by the premises, rules &c.; applying
a rule, definition, notion &c. to a case, object &c. where
it aught not to be applied. E. आप् with वि and अति,
kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.1352:
अतिशक्करी f. (-री). See अतिशक्वरी which is the more cor
rect reading of this word.
text.1353:
अतिशक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Very powerful. E.
अति and शक्त.
text.1354: अतिशक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः) Great power. E. अति and शक्ति.
text.1355:
अतिशक्तिता f. (-ता) Heroick valor, prowess. E. अतिशक्ति,
taddh. aff. तल्.
text.1356:
अतिशक्तिभाज् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्) Possessing great power.
E. अतिशक्ति and भाज्.
text.1357:
अतिशक्वरी Tatpur. f. (-री) The name of a class of metres
regulated by number and quantity. See अतिच्छन्दस्. It
consists in the classic Sanskṛt of a stanza of four lines
with fifteen syllables in each line and comprises eighteen
varieties. (See
1 चन्द्रावर्ता,
2 माला or स्रज्,
3 मणिगुणनि-
कर,
4 मालिनी or नन्दीमुखी,
5 चन्द्रलेखा,
6 कामक्रीडा or
लीलाखेला or सरङ्गक,
7 प्रभद्रक or सुभद्रक or सुकेसर,
8 ए-
ला,
9 उपमालिनी,
10 विपिनतिलक,
11 चित्रा,
12 तुणक or
चामर,
13 भ्रमरावली,
14 मनहंस,
15 सरभ or शशिकला,
16 नि-
शिपाल,
17 उत्सर,
18 हंस.) Also written, though not cor
rectly, अतिशक्करी. E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and शक्वरी (in the
sense of the accusative), another metre.
text.1358:
अतिशय I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Excellent, superior, excessive.
(The femin. is very seldom used.)
II. m. (-यः)
1 Excellence, superiority, excessiveness.
(अतिशयेन used adverbially.)
2 Advantage, visible result
of an action (opposed to अपूर्व q. v.).
3 A superhuman qua
lity inherent to a Jaina Arhat; there are thirty-four such
qualities belonging to them, four of which regard their per
sonal accomplishment, eleven their supernatural powers and
the remaining twenty-nine their celestial attributes.
III. n. (-यम्) used as adverb. Very much, excessive.
E. शी with अति, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.1359:
अतिशयन I. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Very much, excessive.
II. f. (-नी) A metre regulated by number and quantity;
a variety of the class called अत्यष्टि (q. v.) and consisting
of a stanza of four lines with the following feet in each
line: {??} Also called
चित्रलेखा.
III. n. (-नम्) used as adverb. Excessively. E. शी with
अति, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1360:
अतिशयित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Very much, excessive, su
perior. See अतिशेत. E. शी in the caus. with अति, kṛt
aff. क्त.
text.1361:
अतिशयिन् m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Exceeding, superior. E.
शी with अति, kṛt aff. इनि.
text.1362:
अतिशस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) Preeminent, very
excellent. E. अति and शस्त.
text.1363:
अतिशयोक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः)
1 Extreme assertion.
2 Ver
bosity, prolixity.
3 (In rhetoric.) Hyperbole. See अत्युक्ति.
E. अतिशय and उक्ति.
text.1364:
अतिशस्त्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्त्रः-स्त्रा-स्त्रम्) Surpassing a weapon.
more injurious or powerful than a weapon. E. अति (sc.
क्रान्त) and शस्त्र (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1365:
अतिशाक्वर m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Belonging to, written in
the metre Atiśakvarī. E. अतिशक्वरी, taddh. aff. अण्.
text.1366:
अतिशायन n. (-नम्) Excellence, superiority, excessiveness.
अतिशायनम् used as adverb. E. शी with अति, kṛt aff.
ल्युट्.
text.1367:
अतिशायिन् m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Very much, excessive.
E. शी with अति, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.1368:
अतिशीतम् Avyayībh. After the cold (weather &c.). E. अति
and शीत.
text.1369:
अतिशुक्ल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्लः-क्ला-क्लम्) Very white, too
white. E. अति and शुक्ल.
text.1370:
अतिशेत m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Surpassing, exceeding. See
अतिशयित. E. शी with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1371:
अतिशेष m. (-षः) Rest, remainder. E. शिष् with अति, kṛt
aff. घञ्.
text.1372:
अतिशोभन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Beautiful, splendid.
excellent. E. अति and शोभन.
text.1373:
अतिश्री Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-श्रीः-श्रीः-श्रि) Very fortunate, very
beautiful &c. E. अति and श्री.
text.1374:
अतिश्रेयसि Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सिः-सी-सि) Surpassing the
best women. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and श्रेयसी (in the sense
of the accusative).
text.1375:
अतिश्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्वः-श्वी-श्वम्)
1 Surpassing a dog.
2 Worse than a dog, more servile than a dog. E. अति (sc.
क्रान्त) and श्वन् (in the sense of the accusative), samāsānta
aff. टच्.
text.1376:
अतिश्वन् m. (-श्वा) A proper name(?). E. अति and श्वन् (or
perhaps from श्वि with अति).
text.1377:
अतिष्कद्वरी f. (-री) (ved.) A lewd woman. E. अतिष्कद्वन् (a
masc. form not in use, from स्कन्द with अति, kṛt or
uṇ. aff. क्वनिप्), fem. aff. ङीप् and र् instead of न्.
text.1378:
अतिष्ठा I. f. (-ष्ठा) Superiority, excellence, mastership. E.
स्था with अति, kṛt aff. ड, fem. aff. टाप्.
II. m. f. (-ष्ठाः-ष्ठाः) Standing above, superior. (ved.) E.
स्था with अति, kṛt aff. क्विप्.
text.1379:
अतिष्ठावन् m. (-वा) Standing above, superior. (ved.) E. स्था
with अति, kṛt aff. वन्.
text.1380:
अतिष्ठावत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Superior, preeminent.
(ved.) E. अतिष्ठा, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.1381:
अतिसक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः) Too great attachment. E. अति
and सक्ति.
text.1382:
अतिसक्तिमत् m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्) Too much attached,
too fond of. E. अतिसक्ति, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.1383:
अतिसंस्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Very accomplished
or adorned, very excellent &c. E. अति and संस्कृत.
text.1384:
अतिसञ्चय Tatpur. m. (-यः) Too or very great accumulation.
E. अति and सञ्चय.
text.1385:
अतिसन्धम् Avyayībh. Unlawfully, dishonestly. E. अति (sc.
क्रान्तम्) and सन्धा (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1386:
अतिसन्धान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Unlawfulness, wrong, deceit,
fraud, cheating. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तम्) and सन्धान (in the
sense of the accusative).
text.1387:
अतिसन्धित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Cheated, deceived. E. अति-
सन्ध, denom. aff. णिच्, and kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1388:
अतिसमर्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) Very able, very
clever &c. E. अति and समर्थ.
text.1389:
अतिसम्पर्क Tatpur. m. (-र्कः). See अत्यन्तसम्पर्क. E. अति and
सम्पर्क.
text.1390:
अतिसर्ग m. (-र्गः)
1 Giving away, spending.
2 Full leave,
unrestricted permission. See अन्ववसर्ग. E. सृज् with अति,
kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1391:
अतिसर्जन n. (-नम्)
1 Liberality, giving.
2 A gift, a donation.
3 Appointing, engaging.
4 Slaughter, killing. E. सृज् with
अति, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1392:
अतिसर्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्) Above all, beyond
all. (The masc. used as a proper name or as an epithet of
a divinity; see अतिविश्व.) E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and सर्व (in
the sense of the accusative).
text.1393:
अतिसांवत्सर m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Going or lasting beyond
a year. E. अतिसंवत्सर (beyond a year), taddh. aff. अण्.
text.1394:
अतिसाध्वस Tatpur. n. (-सम्) Extreme fear. E. अति and
साध्वस.
text.1395:
अतिसान्तपन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Severe penance or expiation,
especially for the guilt of eating unclean animals; taking
as food nothing but cow's urine, cowdung, curds, milk,
and ghee, each two days in succession. See सान्तपन and
महासान्तपन. E. अति and सान्तपन.
text.1396:
अतिसाम्या Bahuvr. f. (-म्या) The sweet juice of Bengal madder
(लतायष्टि). E. अति and साम्य.
text.1397:
अतिसायम् Tatpur. ind. Very late in the evening. E. अति
and सायम्.
text.1398:
अतिसार m. (-रः) Dysentery or diarrhœa, described as pro
duced by vitiated bile or air or phlegm or by these three
humours collectively or by grief or by vitiated mucus in the
abdomen; according to others also by various other reasons
and comprised under acute and chronic dysentery. (See
पित्तातिसार, वातातिसार, श्लेष्मातिसार, शोकातिसार, आ-
मातिसार, पक्वातिसार.) An older division is that in ज्वरा-
तिसार, वातातिसार, पित्तातिसार, श्लेष्मातिसार, रक्ताति-
सार, सन्निपातातिसार (qq. vv.). Also written अतीसार.
E. सृ with अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1399:
अतिसारकिन् m. f. n. (-की-किणी-कि) Dysenteric, afflicted
with dysentery. Also written अतीसारकिन्. E. अतिसार,
taddh. aff. इनि and āgama कुक्.
text.1400:
अतिसारिन् m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Afflicted with dysentery.
E. अतिसार, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1401:
अतिसुजन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Very good, very
virtuous or respectable. E. अति and सुजन.
text.1402:
अतिसुन्दर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Very handsome,
very beautiful.
II. m. (-रः) The name of a metre regulated by number
and quantity; a variety of the class called अष्टि, consisting
of a stanza of four lines with the following feet in each
line:{??} Also called
चित्र, चित्रसङ्ग or चञ्चला. E. अति and सुन्दर.
text.1403:
अतिसुहित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Overkind, more
than affectionate &c. E. अति and सुहित.
text.1404:
अतिसृष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) A superior creation, a more ex
cellent creation. E. अति and सृष्टि.
text.1405:
अतिसेन Bahuvr. m. (-नः) The proper name of a prince, a
son of Śambara. E. अति and सेना.
text.1406:
अतिसौरभ I. Tatpur. n. (-भम्) Extreme fragrance.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-भः-भा-भम्) Very fragrant, very
odoriferous. E. अति and सौरभ.
text.1407:
अतिसौहित्य Tatpur. n. (-त्यम्)
1 Excessive satiety or fullness.
2 Excessive goodness. E. अति and सौहित्य.
text.1408:
अतिस्त्रि Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्त्रिः-स्त्री-स्त्रि) Surpassing a woman.
E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and स्त्री (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1409:
अतिस्थिर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Very firm or durable.
E. अति and स्थिर.
text.1410:
अतिस्थूल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्)
1 Too fat.
2 Too
clumsy.
3 Too dull.
4 Too large, too great. E. अति and स्थूल.
text.1411:
अतिस्निग्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्धः-ग्धा-ग्धम्) Very amiable,
very affectionate &c. E. अति and स्निग्ध.
text.1412:
अतिस्फिर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Very tremulous.
E. अति and स्फिर.
text.1413:
अतिस्वप्न Tatpur. n. (-प्नम्) Excessive dreaming, excess of
visions (considered as a morbid affection of the eyes). E.
अति and स्वप्न. (In this sense the word occurs only as a
neuter.)
text.1414:
अतिहसित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Excessive laughter. See अति-
हास. E. अति and हसित.
text.1415:
अतिहस्तय् denom. (-यति) I. To throw out the hands. E.
हस्त, denom. aff. णिच्, with अति.
II. To surpass or run-out with an elephant. E. हस्तिन्,
denom. aff. णिच्, with अति.
text.1416:
अतिहास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Excessive, uninterrupted laughter.
E. अति and हास.
text.1417: अतिहिमम् Avyayībh. After the frost. E. अति and हिम.
text.1418:
अतिह्रस्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्वः-स्वा-स्वम्) Too short, very
short. E. अति and ह्रस्व.
text.1419:
अतीक्ष्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्ष्णः-क्ष्णा-क्ष्णम्) Not sharp, blunt,
dull, obtuse. E. अ neg. and तीक्ष्ण.
text.1420:
अतीत I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Passed, gone away.
2 Dead,
deceased.
3 Gone beyond, overcome, exceeded, surpassed.
(In this sense अतीत may enter into composition with a
word depending upon it in the accusative, f. i. दुःखमतीत
or दुःखातीत.)
4 Very much, excessive.
II. m. (-तः) The modern name of a class of ascetics
belonging to the Dāsnāmins, one of the principal sects who
adore Śiva as the supreme deity. E. इ with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1421: अतीतकाल Karmadh. m. (-लः) The past time. E. अतीत and काल.
text.1422:
अतीतनौक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Landed from a
boat. E. अतीत and नौ, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1423:
अतीत्वरी f. (-री) (ved.) A disloyal or unchaste woman. E.
अतीत्वन् (a masc. form not in use, from इ with अति, kṛt
or uṇ. aff. क्वनिप्, with āgama तुट्), fem. aff. ङीप् and र्
instead of न्; or अतीत्वर Tatpur. (अति and इत्वर), fem.
aff. ङीप्. See इत्वरी.
text.1424:
अतीन्द्रिय Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Going beyond
the senses, unattainable by the senses, imperceptible.
II. m. (-यः) (In the Sāṅkhya philosophy.) The same as
Purusha or soul.
III. n. (-यम्)
1 (In the Vedānta philosophy.) The same
as Manas q. v.
2 (In the Sāṅkhya.) The same as Pradhāna
or nature. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and इन्द्रिय (in the sense of
the accusative).
text.1426:
अतीव Tatpur. ind. Much, very much, much indeed. (Some
times अतीव may be explained as representing the two
distinct words अति (the preposition) and इव which through
Sandhi form अतीव but which are not then to be considered
as an inseparable Tatpur. compound.) E. अति and इव.
text.1427: अतीसार m. (-रः) Diarrhœa or dysentery. See अतिसार.
text.1428: अतीसारकिन् m. f. n. (-की-किनी-कि). See अतिसारकिन्.
text.1429:
अतुङ्ग Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्)
1 Short of stature,
dwarfish.
2 Low. E. अ neg. and तुङ्ग.
text.1430: अतुर Tatpur. m. (-रः) (ved.) Not liberal. E. अ neg. and तुर.
text.1431:
अतुल Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Unequalled.
II. m. (-लः) A plant bearing an oily seed (Sesamum
orientale). See तिल. E. अ priv. and तुला.
text.1432:
अतुल्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ल्यः-ल्या-ल्यम्) Unequalled, unpa
ralleled. E. अ neg. and तुल्य.
text.1433:
अतुषारकर Bahuvr. m. (-रः) The sun. E. अ-तुषार (not cold)
and कर ‘whose rays are not cold’.
text.1434:
अतुष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) Dissatisfaction, displeasure. E. अ
neg. and तुष्टि.
text.1435:
अतुहिनधामन् Bahuvr. m. (-मा) The sun. E. अ-तुहिन and
धामन्. See the following.
text.1436:
अतुहिनरश्मि Bahuvr. m. (-श्मिः) The sun. E. अ-तुहिन and
रश्मि ‘whose rays are not cold’, also analogous com
pounds, as अतुहिनरुचि &c.
text.1437:
अतूतुजि Tatpur. m. (-जिः) (ved.) Not fast, slow. E. अ neg.
and तूतुजि.
text.1438:
अतूर्त Tatpur. (ved.) I. m. f. n. (-र्तः-र्ता-र्तम्)
1 Unhurt, unin
jured.
2 Not hastening, not going speedily.
II. n. (-र्तम्) The illimited space. E. अ neg. and तूर्त.
text.1439:
अतूर्तदक्ष Bahuvr. m. (-क्षः) (ved.) Of unhurt power, irresistible;
an epithet of the Aśvins. E. अतूर्त and दक्ष.
text.1440:
अतूर्तपथिन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्थाः) (ved.) Whose path is unhurt
or without obstacles; an epithet of Vāyu and of Aryaman,
one of the Ādityas. E. अतूर्त and पथिन्.
text.1441:
अतृणाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) A recently born calf. E. अ neg.
and तृणाद ‘not or not yet eating grass’.
text.1442:
अतृण्या Tatpur. f. (-ण्या) A small quantity of grass. E. अ
neg. and तृण्या (a quantity of grass).
text.1443:
अतृदिल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) (ved.) Not brittle,
solid. E. अ neg. and तृदिल.
text.1444: अतृप Bahuvr. m. (-पः) (ved.) Not satisfied. E. अ priv. and तृपा(?).
text.1445:
अतृष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) (ved.) Not suffering
thirst. E. अ neg. and तृष्य.
text.1446:
अतेजस् I. Tatpur. n. (-जः)
1 Shade, shadow.
2 Insignificance,
feebleness, imbecility. E. अ neg. and तेजस्.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-जाः-जाः-जः) Dark, dim, dull. E.
अ priv. and तेजस्.
text.1447:
अतेजस्क Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्कः-स्का-स्कम्) Dark, dim, dull.
E. अ priv. and तेजस्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1448:
अतेजस्विन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्वी-स्विनी-स्वि) Void of splen
dour or energy. E. अ neg. and तेजस्विन्.
text.1449:
अतोषणीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Implacable, not
to be appeased. E. अ neg. and तोषणीय.
text.1450:
अत्क I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) A traveller.
II. m. (-कः)
1 A limb, a member of the body.
2 (ved.)
Moisture, fluid.
3 (ved.) Armour, mail.
4 (ved.) Thunderbolt.
lightning(?).
5 (ved.) The name of an Asura, a synonyme
of Vṛtra. E. अत्, uṇ. aff. कन्.
text.1451:
अत्कील m. (-लः) See उत्कील, the more correct reading of
this word.
text.1452:
अत्ता f. (-त्ता)
1 A mother.
2 An elder sister.
3 A mother's
elder sister. (In Prākṛt: a mother in law.) E. unknown.
See also अत्ति, अत्तिका.
text.1453:
अत्ति I. f. (-त्तिः) (In theatrical language.) An elder sister.
E. unknown. See the preceding.
II. m. (-त्तिः) (ved.) An eater, one who eats. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. ति.
text.1454:
अत्तिका f. (-का) (In theatrical language.) An elder sister.
E. अत्ता a mother, and कन् affix, ‘who is, as it were, a
mother’. Also written अन्तिका and अर्तिका.
text.1455:
अत्तृ m. f. n. (-त्ता-त्त्री-त्तृ) An eater, one who eats. See
अत्त्रिन्. E. अद्, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.1456:
अत्त्र I. m. (-त्त्रः) and II. n. (-त्त्रम्). See अत्र III. and IV.,
the less correct, but more usual reading of this vaidik word.
text.1457:
अत्त्रि m. (-त्त्रिः). See अत्रि the less correct, but more usual
reading of this word. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. त्रिप्. See the following.
text.1458:
अत्त्रिन् m. (-त्त्री). See अत्रिन्, the less correct, but more
usual reading of this vaidik word. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. त्रिनि;
or according to others, अत्त्र (food), taddh. aff. इनि. The
plur. अत्त्रिणः is also explained, as an irregul. plural of
अत्तृ, with āgama इनुङ्.
text.1459: अत्न m. (-त्नः) The sun. E. अत्, uṇ. aff. न. See the following.
text.1460: अत्नु m. (-त्नुः) The sun. E. अत्, uṇ. aff. क्नु.
text.1461: अत्य m. (-त्यः) (ved.) A horse. E. अत्, uṇ. aff. य.
text.1462:
अत्यंहस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हाः-हाः-हः) (ved.) Beyond sin, free
from sin. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and अंहस् (in the sense of
the accusative).
text.1463:
अत्यग्नि Tatpur. I. m. (-ग्निः) Too quick digestion, described as
‘followed by burning heat in throat, palate and lips’. E.
अति and अग्नि.
II. m. f. n. (-ग्निः-ग्निः-ग्नि) Surpassing fire (f. i. in bril
liancy). E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and अग्नि (in the sense of the accus.).
text.1464:
अत्यग्निष्टोम Tatpur. m. (-मः)
1 The name of the second part
or Somasansthā of the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice, for the complete
performance of which, however, it is not considered nitya,
essential or obligatory, as the Agniṣṭoma (q. v.), but kāmya,
voluntary and therefore anitya, supererogatory.
2 The name
of the Sāmaveda verse which closes the ceremonies of this sa
crifice. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and अग्निष्टोम (in the sense of
the accus.), ‘going beyond, coming after the Agniṣṭoma’.
text.1465:
अत्यङ्कुश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) No more controllable
by a hook, unmanageable, vicious (as an elephant). E.
अति (sc. क्रान्त) and अङ्कुश (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1466:
अत्यङ्गुल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Surpassing, going
beyond a finger or an angula-incasure. (See अङ्गुलि.) E.
अति (sc. क्रान्त) and अङ्गुलि (in the sense of the accusative),
samāsānta aff. अच्.
text.1467:
अत्यध्वन् Tatpur. m. (-ध्वा)
1 A very great way or road.
2 Travelling very or too much. E. अति and अध्वन्.
text.1468:
अत्यनिल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Surpassing the wind
(in quickness &c.). E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and अनिल (in the
sense of the accusative).
text.1469:
अत्यन्त I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्)
1 Excessive, very much,
very far.
2 Complete, thorough.
3 Uninterrupted, continual (in
space or time). II. Avyayībh. (-न्तम्)
1 Excessively.
2 Com
pletely.
3 Always, continually. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and अन्त
(in the sense of the accusative).
text.1470:
अत्यन्तकोपन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Very passionate,
fierce, violent. E. अत्यन्त and कोपन.
text.1471:
अत्यन्तग Tatpur. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) What goes very much
or quickly. E. अत्यन्त and ग.
text.1472:
अत्यन्तगत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Completely established
or pertinent, always applicable (as a rule). E. अत्यन्त and गत.
text.1473:
अत्यन्तगति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) (In grammar.) The sense of ‘com
