pletely, thoroughly’ (opposed to the sense of ‘diminutive’).
See अनत्यन्तगति. E. अत्यन्त (complete, thorough) and गति
(sense, understanding).
text.1474:
अत्यन्तगामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Going very
much or quickly, going very far. E. अत्यन्त and गामिन्.
text.1475:
अत्यन्तगुणिन् m. f. n. (-णी-णिनी-णि) Having highly good
qualities. E. अत्यन्त-गुण (highly good quality), taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1476:
अत्यन्ततिरस्कृतवाच्यध्वनि Karmadh. m. (-निः) (In rhetoric.)
A metaphorical expression, when the word expressing the fi
gure or comparison drops its literal sense in order to be
come appropriate for the comparison; f. i. in the sentence
‘the moon does not shine, like a mirror which has become
blind by breathing upon it’--the word ‘blind’ loses its
literal meaning, to serve as a comparison for ‘the not shin
ing’ of the moon with which it has no common quality.
E. अत्यन्त, तिरस्कृत, वाच्य (these three words forming a
Bahuvr.) and ध्वनि.
text.1477:
अत्यन्तपीडन Karmadh. n. (-नम्) Causing excessive pain or
agony. E. अत्यन्त and पीडन.
text.1478:
अत्यन्तवासिन् Karmadh. m. (-सी) The Brahman who con
tinues to live with his spiritual preceptor and always re
mains in the condition of a religious student. See नैष्ठिक.
E. अत्यन्त and वासिन्.
text.1479:
अत्यन्तसंयोग Karmadh. m. (-गः) (In grammar.) The intimate
proximity (of two words), the connexion of two words without
any other word standing between them. E. अत्यन्त and संयोग.
text.1480:
अत्यन्तसम्पर्क Karmadh. m. (-र्कः) Too frequent sexual inter
course. E. अत्यन्त and सम्पर्क.
text.1481:
अत्यन्तसुकुमार Tatpur. m. (-रः) A species of grain (Panicum
Italicum). E. अत्यन्त and सुकुमार ‘extremely soft’.
text.1482:
अत्यन्ताभाव Karmadh. m. (-वः) (In the Vaiśeṣika philosophy.)
Absolute negation or non-existence, one of the four kinds
of अभाव q. v. E. अत्यन्त and अभाव.
text.1483:
अत्यन्तिक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) I. Tatpur. Very near, very
proximate. E. अति and अन्तिक.
II. Going much or quickly, going very far. E. अत्यन्त,
taddh. aff. ठन्.
text.1484:
अत्यन्तीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Going much or quickly, go
ing very far. E. अत्यन्त, taddh. aff. ख.
text.1485:
अत्यन्तीनत्व n. (-त्वम्) The condition or property of going
very far, of being distant or exalted, a high degree. E.
अत्यन्तीन, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.1486:
अत्यम्ल Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-म्लः-म्ला-म्लम्) Very sour.
II. m. (-म्लः) A tree (Spondias mangifera). See वृक्षाम्ल.
III. f. (-म्ला) Another plant and fruit; a species of citron.
See मातुलुङ्गी. E. अति and अम्ल.
text.1487:
अत्यम्लपर्णी Bahuvr. f. (-र्णी) A creeper and medicinal plant,
‘of pungent and astringent properties, employed as a sto
machic and against pains and enlargement of the spleen,
rheumatism and diseases coming from disorders of the
phlegmatic humour.’ See तीक्ष्णा, कण्डुरा, वयस्था. E. अत्यम्ल
and पर्ण, with the fem. aff. ङीष्.
text.1488:
अत्यय m. (-यः)
1 Going over or beyond.
2 Surpassing.
3 Go
ing or passing away.
4 Death.
5 Loss, destruction, end.
6 Transgression, sin, offence, guilt.
7 Vice, fault.
8 Distress.
9 Punishment. E. इ with अति, kṛt aff. अण्.
text.1489:
अत्ययिन् m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Exceeding, excessive. E.
इ with अति, kṛt aff. इनि (implying here nature, disposition).
text.1490:
अत्यराति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) A proper name, the son of Ja
nantapa. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and अराति (in the sense of
the accusative) ‘overcoming his enemies’.
text.1491:
अत्यर्थ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) Very much, excessive.
II. Avyayībh. (-र्थम्) Excessively. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त)
and अर्थ (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1492:
अत्यल्प Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ल्पः-ल्पा-ल्पम्) Very small, very
little. E. अति and अल्प.
text.1493:
अत्यवि Tatpur. m. (-विः) (ved.) Going beyond the sheep, running
beyond the sheep's tail serving as a filtre for sacrificial pur
poses (an epithet of Soma in the Vedas). E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः)
and अवि (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1494:
अत्यशन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Eating too much, excess of eating.
E. अति and अशन.
text.1495:
अत्यष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः)
1 The name of a class of metres re
gulated by number and quantity. See अतिच्छन्दस्. It con
sists of four lines with seventeen syllables to each line and
comprises twelve varieties. (See
1 शिखरिणी,
2 पृथ्वी,
3 वं-
शपत्रपतित or वंशपत्र,
4 हरिणी,
5 मन्दाक्रान्ता,
6 नर्कुटक or
नर्धटक or अवितथ,
7 कोकिलक,
8 हरि,
9 कान्ता or क्रान्ता,
10 चित्रलेखा or अतिशयनी,
11 मालाधर or वनमालाधर,
12 हा-
रिणी.)
2 (In arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the
numeral 17. E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and अष्टि, another metre
(in the sense of the accusative).
text.1496:
अत्यस्त m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) Having overcome, having sur
passed. (This word may form a compound with a word
depending upon it in the accusative; f. i. तुहिनमत्यस्त or
तुहिनात्यस्त.) E. अस् (to throw &c.) with अति, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1497:
अत्यहम् Tatpur. m. Surpassing me. E. अति (sc. क्रान्तः) and
अहम् (in the sense of माम्). This word seems to be only
one of grammatical coinage and scarcely to occur in the
real language. See also अतिमान्, अतिमाम्, अतिवयम्;
and अतित्वम्.
text.1498:
अत्यह्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ह्नः-ह्ना-ह्नम्) Passing beyond one
day, lasting more than one day. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and
अहन् (in the sense of the accusative), samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.1499:
अत्याकार m. (-रः) Censure, blame, contempt. E. कृ with
आ and अति, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1500:
अत्याचार Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Deviating from
prescribed observances, contemning religious and moral laws.
E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and आचार (in the sense of the accusative).
II. m. (-रः) Observance of uncommanded and unnecessary
rites or practices. E. अति and आचार.
text.1501:
अत्यादान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Taking away too much. E. अति
and आदान.
text.1502:
अत्यादित्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) Surpassing the sun.
E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and आदित्य (in the sense of the accus.).
text.1503:
अत्याधान n. (-नम्)
1 Putting over, placing over or beyond.
2 A groundless demand, an imposition. E. धा with आ and
अति, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1504:
अत्यानन्दा Tatpur. f. (-न्दा) A morbid affection of the female or
gans of generation, described as ‘when the woman has no pleas
ure in the embraces of her husband’. See योनिव्यापद्. E. अति
(sc. क्रान्ता) and आनन्द (the sense of the accus.), sc. योनि.
text.1505:
अत्याय m. (-यः) Exceeding, transgressing. E. इ with अति,
kṛt aff. ण.
text.1506:
अत्याल Tatpur. m. (-लः) The name of a plant (Plumbago
rosea). See रक्तचित्रक. E. अति and आल.
text.1507:
अत्याशा Tatpur. f. (-शा) Unreasonable hope or desire. E.
अति and आशा.
text.1508:
अत्याश्रमिन् m. (-मी) An ascetic of the highest degree, one
who is above the four orders or āśramas. E. अत्याश्रम
(अति and आश्रम), taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1509:
अत्यासम् ind. After the lapse of; only used in composition,
f. i. द्व्यहात्यासम्, ‘after the lapse of two days’. E. अस्
with अति, kṛt aff. णमुल्.
text.1510: अत्याहार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Excessive food. E. अति and आहार.
text.1511:
अत्याहारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Eating ex
cessively, a glutton, a gormandizer. E. अति and आहारिन्.
text.1512:
अत्याहित Tatpur. n. (-तम्)
1 Great dread.
2 Desperate or
daring action. E. अति and आहित.
text.1513:
अत्युक्ता Tatpur. f. (-क्ता) The name of a class of metres, regulated
by number and quantity; it consists of a stanza of four lines
with two syllables in each line and comprises four varieties.
(See
1 स्त्री or काम,
2 रति or मही,
3 सारु,
4 मधु.) Also called
अत्युक्था. E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता) and उक्ता, another class of
metres (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1514:
अत्युक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः)
1 Idle or excessive talk.
2 A figure
of rhetoric, description of any thing surprising or extra
ordinary, hyperbole. E. अति and उक्ति.
text.1515:
अत्युक्था Tatpur. f. (-क्था). See अत्युक्ता. E. अति (sc. क्रान्ता)
and उक्था (in the sense of the accusative).
text.1516:
अत्युग्र Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ग्रः-ग्रा-ग्रम्)
1 Very hot, very
sharp or pungent.
2 Very formidable.
II. n. (-ग्रम्) Asa foetida. E. अति and उग्र.
text.1517:
अत्युच्चैर्ध्वनि Tatpur. m. (-नि) A very loud sound, a very high
note. E. अत्युच्चैस् and ध्वनि.
text.1518:
अत्युच्चैस् Tatpur. ind. Very loud, very high (as a sound, a
note). E. अति and उच्चैस्.
text.1519:
अत्युत्कट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-टः-टा-टम्) Exceedingly great.
E. अति and उत्कट.
text.1520:
अत्युपध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Above trial, proved,
sincere, upright. E. अति (sc. क्रान्त) and उपधा (in the
sense of the accusative).
text.1521:
अत्युल्वण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Excessive, very
much. E. अति and उल्वण.
text.1522:
अत्युष्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णः-ष्णा-ष्णम्) Very hot. E. अति
and उष्ण.
text.1523:
अत्यूमशा ind. A particle of abuse or reproach(?), used only
in composition with अस्, भू, कृ. E. unknown; comp. ऊम.
text.1524:
अत्यूर्मि m. f. n. (-र्मिः-र्मिः-र्मि) (ved.) Overflowing. E. ऋ with
अति, uṇ. aff. मि and ऊ substituted for the initial अ.
text.1525:
अत्यूह Bahuvr. I. m. (-हः) A gallinule.
II. f. (-हा) A plant (Jasminum villosum, Rox. or in
Bengal, Nyctanthes tristis). See नीलिका or शेफालिका.
E. अति and ऊह.
text.1526:
अत्र I. ind.
1 In this place, here, herein.
2 In conjunction
with nouns used in the same sense as एतस्मिन्, the locat.
of एतद्; f. i. अत्राह्नि = एतस्मिन्नह्नि, ‘on that day’.--In
the Vedas also written अत्रा which seems to be the more
original form of this word. E. अश् (i. e. अ which, in
this instance, is considered as a substitute of एतद् (and
not of इदम्), because अत्र points always to what pre
cedes), taddh. aff. त्रल्.
II. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Not protecting. E. अ
neg. and त्र.
III. m. (-त्रः) (ved.) A demon, a Rākṣasa. E. अद्, uṇ.
aff. त्र (literally: ‘one who eats or devours’). See अत्त्र.
IV. n. (-त्रम्) (ved.) Food. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. ष्ट्रन्. See अत्त्र.
text.1527:
अत्रदघ्न m. f. n. (-घ्नः-घ्नी-घ्नम्) Having that size, being of
that height. E. अत्र, taddh. aff. दघ्नच्, in the fem. with
aff. ङीप्; or more correctly, a Bahuvr. consisting of अत्र
and an obsolete noun दघ्न q. v.
text.1528:
अत्रप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Shameless, immodest.
E. अ priv. and त्रपा.
text.1529:
अत्रभवत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Respectable, ve
nerable (especially in theatrical language used as a respect
ful mode of address). E. अत्र and भवत्. See also तत्रभवत्.
text.1530:
अत्रवस् ind. The last year but one. E. अत्र, taddh. aff. वस्(?).
This word is of doubtful authority.
text.1531:
अत्रस्नु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्नुः-स्नुः-स्नु) Not timid, fearless.
E. अ neg. and त्रस्नु.
text.1532: अत्रास Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्) Fearless. E. अ priv. and त्रास.
text.1533:
अत्रि m. (-त्रिः)
1 Eater, devourer (in the Vedas especially as
an epithet of Agni, the divinity of fire).
2 The name of a
Maharshi or a great Saint, who in the Vedas occurs especi
ally in hymns composed for the praise of Agni, Indra, the
Aśvins and the Viśvadevas; and who in the epic period
is considered as one of the ten Prajāpatis or lords of crea
tion engendered by Manu for the purpose of creating the
universe; at a later period he appears as a mindborn son
of Brahmā and as one of the seven Ṛṣis who preside
over the reign of Svāyambhuva, the first, or according to
others of Svārochiṣa, the second, or of Vaivaswata, the
seventh Manu; he is married to Anasūyā, the daughter of
Daksha and their son is Durvāsas. Produced by a flash of
light from his eye which was received by Space, the via
lactea personified, or according to a more recent legend,
by his penitence, is Soma or the moon. See अत्रिजात,
अत्रिदृग्ज, अत्रिनेत्रज &c. As sons of his are also named
the Manes Barhishads and Udamaya; a daughter of his is
Apālā. The name of Atri occurs also as that of the author
of several vaidik hymns, as that of an inspired legislator,
of the author of an astronomical and medical work and,
in astronomy, as one of the seven Ṛṣis in the constel
lation of the great bear.--An Atri, son of Sāṅkhya, but
probably a different personage, is the author of a hymn in
the Ṛgveda.--Amongst the authors of vaidik hymns we
find as sons or descendants of Atri the following: Archa
nāna, Avasyu, Bāhuvṛkta, Bhauma, Budha, Dvita, Ga
viṣṭhira, Gaya, Gopavana, Isha, Paura, Pratibhānu, Pra
tiprabha, the Prayaswats, Purīṣa, Ratahavya, Sadāpṛṇa,
Saptavadhri, Śaśa, Satyaśravas, Śrutavid, Sutambhara,
Śyāvāśva, Vasuśruta, the Vasūyus, Viśvasāman, Yajata;
and as daughters of Atri, Apālā, Gātu, Viśvavārā.
3 m.
pl. (अत्रयः) The descendants (see गोत्र) of Atri collectively.
(The masc. plur. अत्रयः is considered as the plur. of the
patronymic आत्रेय (q. v.) with luk of the taddh. aff. ढक्;
the plural of the fem., however, remaining regular, viz.
आत्रेय्यः; but there is no necessity to adopt this artificial
etymology which is given to connect the sense of the pa
tronymic with that of the plur. of the original form.) E.
See अत्त्रि.
text.1534:
अत्रिचतुरह Tatpur. m. (-हः) The name of a sacrifice, be
longing to the class of those called अहीन q. v. E. अत्रि
and चतुरह.
text.1535:
अत्रिजात Tatpur. m. (-तः)
1 The moon.
2 A man of the three
first classes. E.
1 अत्रि and जात. See for the meaning under
अत्रि.
2 अ neg., त्रि and जात ‘not thrice born, i. e. born
twice’; see द्विज.
text.1536:
अत्रिदृग्ज Tatpur. m. (-जः)
1 The moon.
2 (In arithmetic
sometimes used to denote) the numeral one. E. अत्रि-दृश्
(eye) and ज. See for the meaning of this word and of its
synonymes under अत्रि.
text.1537:
अत्रिन् m. (-त्री) (ved.) A Rākṣasa, a demon. (Literally: one
who eats or devours.) E. See अत्त्रिन्.
text.1538: अत्रिनेत्रज Tatpur. m. (-जः). See अत्रिदृग्ज. E. अत्रि-नेत्र and ज.
text.1539:
अत्रिनेत्रप्रसूत Tatpur. m. (-तः). See अत्रिदृग्ज. E. अत्रि-नेत्र
and प्रसूत.
text.1540:
अत्रिनेत्रभव Tatpur. m. (-वः). See अत्रिदृग्ज. E. अत्रि-नेत्र
and भव.
text.1541:
अत्रिनेत्रभू Tatpur. m. (-भूः). See अत्रिदृग्ज. E. अत्रि-नेत्र
and भू.
text.1542:
अत्रिनेत्रसूत Tatpur. m. (-तः). See अत्रिदृग्ज. E. अत्रि-नेत्र
and सूत.
text.1543:
अत्रिभारद्वाजिका f. (-का) The marriage union of Atri and
Bhāradvājī. E. अत्रि and भारद्वाजी (as Dwandwa), taddh.
aff. वुञ् implying in this and similar Dwandwa compounds
condition or action. The more correct form of this word
seems to be आत्रिभारद्वाजिका.
text.1544:
अत्रिवत् ind. Like Atri of like the descendants of Atri. E.
अत्रि, taddh. aff. वति.
text.1545:
अत्रिसंहिता Tatpur. f. (-ता) The name of a law-book ascribed
to Atri. E. अत्रि and संहिता.
text.1546:
अत्रिस्मृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) The same as the preceding. E.
अत्रि and स्मृति.
text.1547:
अत्वरा Tatpur. f. (-रा) Want of haste or precipitation. E.
अ neg. and त्वरा.
text.1548:
अथ ind. An inceptive and auspicious particle. It serves to
introduce the beginning of a work, a chapter, a sentence
and with respect to the latter may imply doubt or inter
rogation or may serve as a conjunctive or disjunctive par
ticle. It may be accompanied by those particles or words
which themselves are used in the same sense, giving them
greater emphasis, especially by उ, अतस्, अनन्तरम्, किम्,
तु, पुनर्, वा, किमु, अपि. Without or with these particles
अथ corresponds therefore with:
1 Now (inceptive or pre
mising); in the same sense but with greater emphasis अथो
(अथ and उ), अथातस्, अथानन्तरम्.
2 Why? what? (in
terrogatively and doubtingly); (likewise अथवा.)
3 How
else? certainly; (in the same sense अथकिम्.)
4 But, on the
contrary; (in the same sense अथ तु, अथ पुनर्.)
5 Or, or
rather; (likewise अथवा, अथवापि, अथापि वा &c.)
6 More
over, so much the more, therefore, thus; (likewise अथच,
अथापि, अथो अपि, अथ किमु.) In the Vedas there occurs
also the protracted form अथा which seems to be the more
original one; (cf. तथा and यथा). E. According to the native
authorities from अर्थ्, kṛt aff. ड with र् being dropped;
but it is more probably derived from अ, the pron. theme
which is considered as a substitute for इदम् (pointing to
what follows), taddh. aff. थ.
text.1549:
अथकिम् ind. A particle of assent, how else, what else, as
suredly. (Better to be considered as two words. See अथ.)
E. अथ and किम्.
text.1550:
अथकिमु ind. So much the more. (Better to be considered as
two separate words and also written अथ किमु. See अथ.)
E. अथ and किमु.
text.1551:
अथच ind. Also, moreover. (Better to be considered as two
words. See अथ.) E. अथ and च.
text.1552:
अथतु ind. But, on the contrary. (More properly to be con
sidered as two distinct words and also written अथ तु. See
अथ.) E. अथ and तु.
text.1553:
अथरी f. (occurs only as a plural in the Vedas; -र्यः) The
finger. E. This word is given as an irregular derivation
from अत् ‘to go constantly’; but it is more probable that
it is derived, with aff. अरि, from an obsolete rad. अथ्
which seems to have had the same meaning as अत् (cf.
अट् and अठ्), but is found only in अथरी, अथर्वन् and their
derivatives, implying quickness or agility. The same etymo
logical connexion between words meaning ‘finger’ and ‘fire’
may be perceived in other derivations from a radical in the
sense of ‘to go’ f. i. in अङ्गुलि or अङ्गुरि, अग्रू and अग्नि, अङ्गिरस्,
from अङ्ग्. It reappears distinctly in the denom. अथर्य् and
its derivatives अथर्य, अथर्यु qq. vv.
text.1554:
अथर्य् par. (-र्यति) To go, to move. (Only in the Vedas.)
Probably a denominative from अथरी or अथर् with aff. यक्.
text.1555:
अथर्य m. (-र्यः) Moving constantly; an epithet of Agni in the
Vedas. See also the following. E. अथर्य्, kṛt aff. अच्(?).
A commentary explains, that अथर्य is an epithet of दक्षि-
णाग्नि, because the sacred fire ‘goes always’ from the Gār
hapatya (q. v.) to his proper place; the epithet may be con
sidered, however, as one of a more general bearing.
text.1556:
अथर्यु m. (-युः) Moving constantly; an epithet of Agni in the
Vedas. See the preceding. E. अथर्य्, kṛt aff. उ.
text.1557:
अथर्व m. (-र्वः) A proper name of the eldest son of Brahmā,
to whom Brahmā revealed the Brahmavidyā (q. v.) or know
ledge of God. See अथर्वन्. E. See अथर्वन् of which it is
an abbreviated form.
text.1558: अथर्वण m. (-णः) A name of Śiva. E. अथर्वन्, taddh. aff. अ(?).
text.1559:
अथर्वणि m. (-णिः)
1 A Brahman versed in the Atharvaveda.
2 A family priest. E. See आथर्वणि which is the better
reading of this word.
text.1560:
अथर्वन् 1. m. (-र्वा)
1 A Brāhmaṇa, a priest (probably one
connected with offerings to fire or the attendance on the
holy fire).
2 The proper name of a priest who is considered
to have obtained the fire from heaven and who in the course
of mythological personification appears as a Prajāpati or
father of all beings, as the inspired author of the fourth
or Atharvaveda, as the eldest son of Brahmā to whom
Brahmā revealed the Brahmavidyā (q. v.) or knowledge of
God (see also अथर्व) and, at a later period, as the same
as Angiras (q. v.). Sons of his are Agni (see also अङ्गिरस्),
Dadhyanch, Bhishaj, Bṛhaddiva, Kabandha.
3 An epithet of
a. Vasiṣṭha q. v.,
b. Soma q. v.,
c. प्राण q. v.,
d. Śiva (the god being
supposed to carry into effect the charms of the Atharvaveda).
2. m. n. (-र्वा-र्व) The fourth or Atharvaveda q. v. (see
also m. pl. अथर्वाणः).
3. m. pl. (-र्वाणः)
1 The descendants of Atharvan; they
appear sometimes coupled with the descendants of Bhṛgu
and of Angiras (see अथर्वाङ्गिरसः).
2 The hymns of the
fourth or Atharvaveda collectively (considered as the descen
dants of Atharvan); the Atharvaveda (see also अथर्वाङ्गि-
रसः). E. From an obsolete theme अथर्, fire, with taddh.
aff. वनिप्. See the E. of अथरी. The oldest etym. which
derives अथर्वन् from अ neg. and थर्वन् (from थर्व् ‘to go’),
is without any probability. A similar etym. is given of
अथर्वी q. v.
text.1561:
अथर्वभूत Tatpur. m. pl. (-ताः) An epithet of the twelve Maharshis:
धर्म, दक्ष, मरीचि, अत्रि, पुलस्त्य, पुलह, क्रतु, वसिष्ठ, गौ-
तम, भृगु, अङ्गिरस्, मनु and (according to a commentary)
of ‘Rudra, the Lord of the Universe’. E. अथर्वन् and भूत
(according to a commentary from भू, to obtain, ‘having
obtained i. e. versed in the Atharvaveda, the same as अ-
थर्वविद्’).
text.1562:
अथर्ववत् ind. Like Atharvan or the descendants of Atharvan.
E. अथर्वन्, taddh. aff. वति.
text.1563:
अथर्वविद् Tatpur. m. (-वित्) One versed in the Atharvaveda.
See अथर्वभूत. According to the Pariśiṣṭa of this Veda esp.
an epithet of the priest called Brahman q. v. See ब्रह्मवेद.
E. अथर्वन् and विद्.
text.1564:
अथर्ववेद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The fourth or Atharvaveda (see
ऋच्, यजुस्, सामन्), the Veda revealed by Atharvan or
Angiras and sometimes considered, therefore, personified
as a son of Angiras. See अथर्वन्, अथर्वाङ्गिरस्, प्रत्यङ्गिरस्,
ब्रह्मवेद. E. अथर्वन् and वेद.
text.1565:
अथर्वशिखा Tatpur. f. (-खा) The name of one of the Upani
shads of the Atharvaveda. E. अथर्वन् and शिखा ‘the crest’
i. e. (according to the comm.) the essence of the Atharvaveda.
text.1566:
अथर्वशिरस् Tatpur. n. (-रः) The name of an Upanishad of
the Atharvaveda. E. अथर्वन् and शिरस् ‘the head’ i. e.
the principal Upanishad of the A. V.
text.1567:
अथर्वहृदय Tatpur. n. (-यम्) The name of a Pariśiṣṭa of the
Atharvaveda. E. अथर्वन् and हृदय.
text.1568:
अथर्वाङ्गिरस् I. Tatpur. m. (-राः) The Angiras of the Athar
vaveda. This use of the word, as a Tatpur. in the sing.,
is of later origin than that of the Dwandwa in the plur.,
and, as it seems, adopted to explain the form अथर्वाङ्गि-
रस q. v.
II. Dwandwa. m. pl. (-रसः)
1 The descendants of Athar
van and of Angiras.
2 The Atharvaveda hymns of both
collectively; the Atharvaveda (q. v.), one part (or parvan)
of which is considered to have been revealed by the descen
dants of Atharvan and another by the descendants of An
giras. According to another explanation, however, this
name of the Atharvaveda would merely refer to Atharvan
(q. v.) being the inspired author of one part and Angiras
(q. v.) of the other. E. अथर्वन् and अङ्गिरस्.
text.1569:
अथर्वाङ्गिरस I. m. f. n. (-सः-सी-सम्) Referring or belonging
to the अथर्वाङ्गिरसः q. v.
II. n. (-सम्) The religious observances (कर्मन्) connected
with the ritual of the Atharvaveda.
III. m. pl. (-साः) The mantras or hymns of the Athar
vaveda. E. अथर्वाङ्गिरस्, taddh. aff. टच्.
text.1570:
अथर्वाण n. (-णम्) The religious observances (कर्मन्) connected
with the ritual of the Atharvaveda. E. Irregular derivation
from अथर्वन्, taddh. aff. अण्(?).
text.1571:
अथर्वाणविद् Tatpur. m. (-त्) One versed in the rites of the
Atharvaveda. E. अथर्वाण and विद्.
text.1572:
अथर्वी Tatpur. f. (-वी). This word occurs only in the Veda
and is explained ‘not going, unable to move’, from अ
neg. and थर्वी (from थर्व्, to go). It would seem, how
ever, that it is a Tatpur. composed of the obsolete word
अथर्, fire, and वी, ‘surrounded by fire’(?). See the E.
of अथर्वन् and अथरी.
text.1573:
अथवा ind.
1 Why? what?
2 Or, or rather. See अथ. E. अथ
and वा.
text.1574:
अथवापि ind. Or, or rather. More properly to be considered
as two separate words, अथवा and अपि. See अथ. E. अथ-
वा and अपि.
text.1575:
अथातस् ind. Now (inceptive or premising). More properly to
be considered as two distinct words. See अथ. E. अथ and
अतस्.
text.1576:
अथानन्तरम् ind. The same as the preceding; better considered
as two separate words. See अथ. E. अथ and अनन्तरम्.
text.1577:
अथापि ind. Moreover, so much the more, therefore, thus; better
considered as two distinct words. See अथ. E. अथ and अपि.
text.1578:
अथो ind. Now (inceptive or premising). (According to some
it has the same meanings as अथ.) अथो अपि, moreover &c.
See अथ. E. अथ and उ.
text.1579:
अद् I. (अद-अदादि-अनुदात्त-उदात्तेत्) r. 2d cl. par.
(अत्ति- imperf. आदत्- imper. अद्धि, ep. अदस्व- perf. आद,
2d pers. आदिथ- fut. 1. अत्स्यति, 2. अत्ता- inf. अत्तुम्- p. p.
अदित (अन्न only used as subst.). Pass. अद्यते. Caus. आद-
यति-ते.--For the tenses which are not formed of अद्,
see घस् which is then considered as a substitute of it.)
To eat. (Caus. To feed.)--With अव(?)-आ-प्र-सम्
to eat, to devour; वि- to gnaw, to nibble.
II. m. f. n. (अत्) Eating. This word occurs only as the
latter part of a Tatpur., the former part of which may be
any word but अन्न (which forms अन्नाद and not अन्नाद्).
See f. i. अहुताद्, आमाद्, क्रव्याद्. E. अद्, kṛt aff. विट्.
text.1580:
अद m. f. n. (-दः-दी-दम्) Eating; (occurs only as the latter
part of Tatpur. compounds). See f. i. अजाद, अतृणाद, अ-
न्नाद. E. अद्, kṛt aff. अण्.
text.1581:
अदक्ष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) Awkward, unskilful.
E. अ neg. and दक्ष.
text.1582:
अदक्षिण m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) I. Tatpur.
1 Not right, left.
2 Not clever, unskilful. E. अ neg. and दक्षिण.
II. Bahuvr. Being or being performed without the presents
usually given to Brahmans (see दक्षिणा), as a sacrifice &c.
The celebration of a sacrifice without the Dakṣiṇā oc
curs for instance under the following circumstances: at
the Prātaḥsavana of the Jyotiṣṭoma, when about to sing
the Vahiṣpavamāna stotra, the priests step out from the
house where the sacred fire is kept, one going after the
other and holding the one who precedes by the hem of his
garment: if it so happens, at this procession, that the
Udgātṛ inadvertently drops the hem, the sacrifice goes on
without the Dakṣiṇā; once accomplished, however, it is
to be repeated and then the Udgātṛ has to pay the Dakṣiṇā
which should have been given at the first performance; if
the Pratihartṛ meets with a similar accident, he has to pay
his whole property at the renewal of the ceremony, which
then is called सर्वस्वदक्षिण. E. अ priv. and दक्षिणा.
text.1583:
अदक्षिणत्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 Leftness, unskilfulness &c.
2 The state
of a sacrifice performed without the Dakṣiṇā. See the pre
ceding. E. अदक्षिण, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.1584:
अदक्षिणीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not worth
the sacrificial gift or दक्षिणा q. v. E. अ neg. and दक्षि-
णीय.
text.1585:
अदक्षिण्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) The same as the
preceding. E. अ neg. and दक्षिण्य.
text.1586:
अदग्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्धः-ग्धा-ग्धम्) Not burnt, un
scorched. E. अ neg. and दग्ध.
text.1587:
अदण्ड I. Tatpur. n. (-ण्डम्) Impunity. E. अ neg. and दण्ड.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ण्डः-ण्डा-ण्डम्) Unpunished. E.
अ priv. and दण्ड.
text.1588:
अदण्ड्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्ड्यः-ण्ड्या-ण्ड्यम्)
1 Unpunishable,
exempt from punishment.
2 Not deserving punishment. E.
अ neg. and दण्ड्य.
text.1589:
अदण्डनीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Unpunishable, un
fit to be punished, exempt from punishment. E. अ neg.
and दण्डनीय.
text.1590:
अदत् I. m. f. n. (-दन्-दन्ती-दत्) Eating. E. अद्, kṛt
aff. शतृ.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दन्-दती-दत्) Having no teeth,
toothless. E. अ priv. and दत्, considered as a substitute
of दन्त.
text.1591:
अदत्क Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Toothless. E. अदत् II.
q. v., samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1592:
अदत्त I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Not given. 2. f.
(-त्ता) An unmarried girl. 3. n. (-त्तम्) (In law.) A void
and resumable donation (see दत्त, देय, अदेय). E. अ neg.
and दत्त.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Not having given.
E. अ priv. and दत्त.
text.1593:
अदद्र्यञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्र्यङ्-द्रीची-द्र्यक्) Going to that.
(This word is probably one of a mere grammatical coinage,
to illustrate a rule concerning the pronom. theme अदस्.
According to some it would have the same meaning as अ-
दमुयञ्च्, अमुद्र्यञ्च् and अमुमुयञ्च् to which others add अद-
मुद्र्यञ्च्, अमुमूयञ्च्, अदमूयञ्च् qq. vv., but it might also be
that अदद्र्यञ्च् (as well as अदमुयञ्च्, अदमुद्र्यञ्च्, अदमूयञ्च्)
is formed to show that its first part represents not the
whole theme, but merely the neuter of अदस्, while the
first part of अमुद्र्यञ्च्, अमुमुयञ्च् and अमुमूयञ्च् refer to its
masc. and femin. For the declension of this word, see
अञ्च् II. E. अदस् and अञ्च् (II. 1.), with अद्रि instead of
the final अस् of अदस्.
text.1594:
अदन n. (-नम्)
1 Eating.
2 Food. E. अद्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1595:
अदन्त Bahuvr. I. 1. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Toothless. See
the preceding.
2. m. (-न्तः) A leech. E. अ priv. and दन्त.
II. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) (In grammar.) Ending in
the short vowel ‘a’. E. अत् (the grammatical designation
of short ‘a’ and अन्त.
text.1596:
अदन्तक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Toothless. E. अदन्त,
samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1597:
अदन्त्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्त्यः-न्त्या-न्त्यम्)
1 Prejudicial to the
teeth.
2 Different from or other than what is fit for the teeth.
E. अ neg. and दन्त्य; in the first meaning which is the usual
one, the word is an oxytonon, in the latter a proparoxytonon.
text.1598:
अदब्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ब्धः-ब्धा-ब्धम्) (ved.) Unhurt, un
injured, entire, pure &c. E. अ neg. and दब्ध.
text.1599:
अदब्धव्रत Bahuvr. m. (-तः) (ved.) One whose devotions or
religious observances are unbroken. E. अदब्ध and व्रत.
text.1600:
अदब्धव्रतप्रमति m. (-तिः) (ved.) I. Bahuvr. One whose mind is
superior in having his devotions or observances unbroken,
or II. Dwandwa. One whose devotions or observances are
unbroken and whose mind is superior (an epithet of Agni).
E. अदब्धव्रत and प्रमति. If a Bahuvr., the former part
stands in the sense of the locative.
text.1601:
अदब्धायु m. (-युः) Having uninjured or pure food, an epithet
of Agni in the Vedas. (According to a commentary: leaving
uninjured the man who institutes the sacrifice. E. अदब्ध
and आयु.)
text.1602:
अदभ्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भ्रः-भ्रा-भ्रम्) Not little, much. E. अ
neg. and दभ्र.
text.1603:
अदमुद्र्यञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्र्यङ्-द्रीची-द्र्यक्) Going to that.
See अदद्र्यञ्च् and the forms mentioned there. For the de
clension of this word see अञ्च् II. E. Irreg. composition of
अदस् and अञ्च् II. 1. See the following.
text.1604:
अदमुयञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यङ्-ईची-यक्) Going to that.
See the preceding and अदद्र्यञ्च्; for the declension see अञ्च् II.
E. Irreg. compos. of अदस् and अञ्च्. Also read अदमूयञ्च्.
text.1605: अदमूयञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यङ्-ईची-यक्). See the preceding.
text.1606:
अदम्भ I. Tatpur. m. (-म्भः) Want of hypocrisy or deceit,
straightforwardness, sincerity. E. अ neg. and दम्भ.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-म्भः-म्भा-म्भम्) Without deceit,
upright, straightforward, sincere. 2. m. (-म्भः) A name
of Śiva. E. अ priv. and दम्भ.
text.1607:
अदम्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्यः-म्या-म्यम्) Uncontrollable, un
tamable. E. अ neg. and दम्य.
text.1608:
अदय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Unfeeling, unmerciful,
destitute of pity. अदयम् used adverbially. E. अ priv.
and दया.
text.1609:
अदर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not little, much. E. अ
neg. and दर.
text.1610: अदरक m. (-कः) A proper name(?). E. unknown.
text.1611:
अदर्श m. (-र्शः)
1 Day of the new moon. See दर्श.
2 A mirror.
See आदर्श. E. This word seems to be an incorrect reading
of दर्श or आदर्श; but in the former sense it may be a
Tatpur. composed of अ neg. and दर्श.
text.1612:
अदर्शन I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Not seeing.
2 Disappearance,
not being visible or present (in grammar f. i. of a letter,
an affix &c.). E. अ neg. and दर्शन.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Invisible, disappear
ing. E. अ priv. and दर्शन.
text.1613:
अदर्शनीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Invisible. E. अ
neg. and दर्शनीय.
text.1614:
अदल Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Leafless.
II. m. (-लः) A plant (Eugenia acutangula). See हिज्जल.
III. f. (-ला) Socotrine aloe (Aloe perfoliata). See घृ-
तकुमारी. E. अ priv. and दल.
text.1615:
अदस् I. m. f. n. (असौ-असौ-अदस्). The pronoun (see सर्व-
नामन्) which generally points to what is absent, remote
or uncertain (differently from इदम् q. v.) and which cor
responds with
1 That.
2 A certain (so and so). In correlative
phrases it stands therefore usually in the prior sentence,
imparting greater emphasis. Its declension is defective in
as far as most of its cases are supplied by the themes असु
or अस, अमु (अमू) and अमि (अमी). The theme which ap
pears in composition is अदस् (except in the forms अद-
द्र्यञ्च् &c. q. v. See also अद्धा). In some derivations of rare
occurrence we meet also with the themes असु, अस and अमु;
see असुक, असक, अमुक.
II. ind. (esp. in composition with radicals (see गति),
when employed reflectively). So, in such a manner, f. i.
अदःकृत्य having done so &c.--In conjunction with a re
lative pronoun or particle it has the effect of giving em
phasis or of generalising, e. g. यददस् whatever, यत्रादस्
wherever, यथादस् howsoever. E. unknown; but it is pro
bably derived from the theme अद् which occurs in अद-
द्र्यञ्च् and अद्धा.
text.1616:
अदस्य् denom. par. (-स्यति) To become that. E. अदस्, de
nom. aff. यक्.
text.1617:
अदातृ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ता-त्री-तृ)
1 Not giving.
2 Not liberal,
miserly.
3 Not paying (a debt &c.).
4 Not giving in mar
riage (a daughter, as a father). E. अ neg. and दातृ.
text.1618:
अदादि Bahuvr. m. (-दिः) (In grammar.) The verbs of the
second class, the list of which in the native dictionaries
begins with अद्, to eat. E. अद् and आदि, sc. धातु.
text.1619:
अदान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not giving, withholding. E. अ neg.
and दान.
text.1620:
अदान्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Untamed, unsubdued,
undaunted. E. अ neg. and दान्त.
text.1621:
अदाभ्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-भ्यः-भ्या-भ्यम्) Unhurtable, un
injurable, irreproachable.
II. m. (-भ्यः) The name of a Graha (q. v.) in the Jyo
tiṣṭoma sacrifice. E. अ neg. and दाभ्य.
text.1622:
अदायाद m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) I. Tatpur. Not being an heir,
having no claim to be an heir. E. अ neg. and दायाद.
II. Bahuvr. Being without an heir, unclaimed as in
heritance. See the following. E. अ priv. and दायाद.
text.1623:
अदायिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्)
1 Unclaimed, as in
heritance, lapsed.
2 Not relating to inheritance. E. अ neg.
and दायिक.
text.1624:
अदार Bahuvr. m. (-रः) Having no wife, unmarried. E. अ
priv. and दार.
text.1625:
अदाशु Tatpur. m. (-शुः) (ved.) Not liberal, not pious. E.
अ neg. and दाशु.
text.1626:
अदाशुरि Tatpur. m. (-रिः) (ved.) Not liberal, not pious.
E. अ neg. and दाशुरि.
text.1627:
अदाश्वस् Tatpur. m. (-श्वान्) (ved.) Not liberal, not pious.
E. अ neg. and दाश्वस्.
text.1628:
अदास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Not a slave, a free man. E. अ neg.
and दास.
text.1629:
अदाह्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ह्यः-ह्या-ह्यम्) Inconsumable by
fire, incombustible. E. अ neg. and दाह्य.
text.1630:
अदिक्क Bahuvr. m. (-क्कः) Having no quarters, driven from
all heavenly regions (an epithet of the Asuras in the Vedas).
E. अ priv. and दिश्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1631:
अदिति I. Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Entireness, the being unbroken
or unhurt.
2 Exemption from defect or misery.
3 The full
or unbroken creative power of the Prajāpati. E. अ neg.
and दिति.
II. Bahuvr. I. m. f. (-तिः-तिः)
1 Unbroken, unhurt.
2 Free from misery, happy.
3 Pious, holy. As Bahuvr.
text.1632:
अदिति is in the Vedas often used as an epithet of Indra,
the Maruts and Agni, but it becomes personified especially in
2. f. (-तिः) which in the Vedas means
1 the earth,
2 a
cow,
3 speech; but especially
4 Aditi, the first goddess of
the intermediate space or air, the mother of the Gods, who
at a later period was considered as the daughter of Daksha
and wife of Kaśyapa, as the sister of Agastya and as the
mother of the twelve Ādityas, of the eight Vasus, eleven
Rudras and two Aśvins, besides of the thirty-six Tushitas.
--Aditi is in a still later time also an appellative of Durgā.
3. f. du. (-ती) (In the Vedas.) Heaven and earth.
E. अ priv. and दिति.
III. m. (-तिः) A name of Mṛtyu, the god of Death;
literally: the eater or devourer. (This meaning of the word
occurs only in a commentary of an Upanishad and is rather
doubtful.) E. अद् (uṇ. aff. ति?).
text.1633:
अदितिज Tatpur. m. (-जः) A son of Aditi, a deity, a god.
See अदितिनन्दन. E. अदिति and ज.
text.1634:
अदितित्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 Unbrokenness, entireness, fullness of
power.
2 The being Aditi (in the sense of Mṛtyu; see
अदिति III). E. अदिति, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.1635:
अदितिनन्दन Tatpur. m. (-नः) The same as अदितिज. E.
अदिति and नन्दन.
text.1636:
अदित्सत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्सन्-त्सन्ती-त्सत्) Not willing to
give. E. अ neg. and दित्सत्.
text.1637:
अदित्सु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्सुः-त्सुः-त्सु) Not willing to give.
E. अ neg. and दित्सु.
text.1638:
अदिप्रभृति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) The same as अदादि q. v. E.
अदि i. e. अद् with a mute इ, and प्रभृति.
text.1639:
अदीक्षित Tatpur. m. (-तः) One who has not received or
performed the दीक्षा q. v. E. अ neg. and दीक्षित.
text.1640:
अदीन Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 Not distressed.
2 Not vile, not mean.
3 Virtuous.
II. m. (-नः) The name of a prince, a descendant of Āyus
and son of Sahadeva. According to others his name is अ-
हीन. E. अ neg. and दीन.
text.1641:
अदीनसत्त्व Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्त्वः-त्त्वा-त्त्वम्) One whose na
tural goodness has remained unaltered or unbroken. E.
अदीन and सत्त्व.
text.1642:
अदीर्घ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्घः-र्घा-र्घम्) Not long. E. अ neg.
and दीर्घ.
text.1643:
अदीर्घसूत्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Not dilatory, ‘prompt
in beginning what must be done and in accomplishing what
has been begun’. E. अ neg. and दीर्घसूत्र.
text.1644:
अदीर्घसूत्रता f. (-ता) Dispatch. promptness. E. अदीर्घसूत्र,
taddh. aff. ता.
text.1645:
अदुःख Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-खः-खा-खम्) Without pain or evil,
propitious. E. अ priv. and दुःख.
text.1646:
अदुःखनवमी Karmadh. f. (-मी) A particular lunar day; the
ninth of the first fortnight of the month Bhādrapada. On
this day Devī is worshipped by women, that all evil may
be averted during the ensuing year. E. अदुःख and नवमी.
text.1647:
अदुच्छुन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) (ved.) Without evil.
E. अ priv. and दुच्छुना.
text.1648:
अदुर्ग m. f. n. (-र्गः-र्गा-र्गम्) I. Tatpur. Easy of access. E.
अ neg. and दुर्ग.
II. Bahuvr. Having no fortress. E. अ priv. and दुर्ग.
text.1649:
अदुष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Unspoiled, unvitiated.
2 Not very sinful, not wicked.
3 Good, virtuous. E. अ neg.
and दुष्ट.
text.1650:
अदूर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not distant, not remote;
अदूरे and अदूरात् or अदूरतः are used in the sense of ‘not
far from’. With numerals this word forms Bahuvr. compounds
which, according to some, are generally used in the plur.
and without the samāsānta aff. कप्; f. i. अदूरत्रिंशाः = त्रिं-
शतोऽदूरे, almost thirty. E. अ neg. and दूर.
text.1651:
अदूरभव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Being not far from.
E. अदूर and भव.
text.1652:
अदूषित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Undefiled, unvitiated.
2 Virtuous, good. E. अ neg. and दूषित.
text.1653:
अदृपित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Not humiliated,
not treated with arrogance or pride. E. अ neg. and दृपित.
text.1654:
अदृप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) (ved.) Not arrogant, not
proud, not overbearing. E. अ neg. and दृप्त.
text.1655:
अदृप्यत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्यन्-प्यन्ती-प्यत्) (ved.) Not arrogant,
not haughty or overbearing. E. अ neg. and दृप्यत्.
text.1656: अदृश् Bahvur. m. f. n. (-दृक्) Blind. E. अ priv. and दृश्.
text.1657:
अदृश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्)
1 Invisible, not to be
seen.
2 Improper to be beheld. E. अ neg. and दृश्य.
text.1658:
अदृश्यकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Making invisible. E. अदृश्य
and करण.
text.1659:
अदृश्यत् Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्-न्ती-त्) Invisible.
II. f. (-न्ती) The name of the wife of Śakti, the son of
Vaśiṣṭha, and mother of Parāśara. E. अ neg. and दृश्यत्.
text.1660:
अदृष्ट Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Unseen, unfore
seen.
2 Unknown, unfelt, not experienced.
3 Invisible.
II. n. (-ष्टम्)
1 Casual and unseen danger (as from con
flagration, inundation &c.).
2 Fortune, destiny, fate.
3 (In
philosophy.)
a. Virtue or vice (धर्म or अधर्म), as the even
tual cause of pleasure or pain.
b. The remote or unforeseen
consequence of an act, e. g. heaven as that of religious
rites &c. See अपूर्व.
III. m. (-ष्टः) A kind of poison or poisonous reptile (in
the Vedas). E. अ neg. and दृष्ट.
text.1661:
अदृष्टज Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Produced by destiny &c.
See अदृष्ट. E. अदृष्ट and ज.
text.1662:
अदृष्टनर Bahuvr. m. (-रः) The same as the following q. v.
E. अदृष्ट and नर.
text.1663:
अदृष्टपुरुष Bahuvr. m. (-षः) A form of treaty, in which the
parties treat direct, without any mediator or surety. Also
अदृष्टनर and similar compounds. E. अदृष्ट and पुरुष, sc.
सन्धि.
text.1664:
अदृष्टपूर्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्) Unseen previously,
unseen till now. E. अदृष्ट and पूर्व.
text.1665:
अदृष्टवत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्)
1 Enjoying or undergoing
good or bad fortune, more usually the former, fortunate.
E. अदृष्ट, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.1666:
अदृष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) A look of displeasure, evil eye. E.
अ deter. and दृष्टि.
text.1667:
अदृष्टिका f. (-का) An angry or displeased look, evil eye. E.
अदृष्टि, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.1668:
अदेय Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Improper or unfit to
be given. II. n. (-यम्) (In law.) An object not fit to be
given away, either because it does not belong to the person
who would give it, or because law forbids its being dis
posed of. See अदत्त, दत्त, देय. E. अ neg. and देय.
text.1669:
अदेयदान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Giving what ought not to be
given, what is not one's own &c. See the preceding. E.
अदेय and दान.
text.1670:
अदेव Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-वः-वी-वम्)
1 Not referring to
the gods, not divine.
2 Godless, impious.
II. m. (-वः) One who is not a god. E. अ neg. and देव.
I. would more probably be a Bahuvr., if it were not ac
centuated in the Vedas as a Tatpur. See the following.
text.1671:
अदेवक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Having no god or
divinity, referring to no god or divinity (as an offering &c.).
E. अ priv. and देव, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1672:
अदेवता Tatpur. f. (-ता) One who is not a divinity. E. अ
neg. and देवता.
text.1673:
अदेवत्रा Tatpur. ind. (ved.) Not towards or amongst the gods.
E. अ and देवत्रा.
text.1674:
अदेवयत् Tatpur. m. (-न्) (ved.) One who does not care for the
gods, not devout, impious. E. अ neg. and देवयत्.
text.1675:
अदेवयु Tatpur. m. (-युः) (ved.) The same as the preceding.
E. अ neg. and देवयु.
text.1676:
अदेश Tatpur. m. (-शः)
1 An improper place, a wrong place,
one not congenial with one's nature &c. E. अ deter. and देश.
text.1677:
अदेशस्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) Being not in the
proper place, being in the wrong place. E. अदेश and स्थ.
text.1678:
अदेश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्)
1 What is not proper
to be ordered.
2 Not present on the spot, not present at a
transaction. E. अ neg. and देश्य.
text.1679:
अदोमय m. f. n. (-यः-यी-यम्) Made of that, consisting of
that, containing that. E. अदस्, taddh. aff. मयट्.
text.1680:
अदोमूल Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Rooted in that,
founded upon that. E. अदस् and मूल.
text.1681: अद्ग m. (-द्गः) The same as पुरोडाश q. v. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. गन्.
text.1682:
अद्धा ind. (निपात) Tatpur.(?)
1 Indeed, truly, verily.
2 Clearly.
It may enter into composition with कृ (as a गति q. v.). E.
अद् ind. and धा (from धा, kṛt aff. विच्); or according to
others, but without probability, अद् (to eat), kṛt aff. क्विप्,
and हन् (to kill), taddh. aff. डाच्.
text.1683:
अद्धातमाम् ind. (ved.) Most truly, most certainly, most to be
relied upon. E. अद्धा, taddh. aff. तमप् (i. e. the superl. of
अद्धा in the acc. of the femin.).
text.1684: अद्धाति m. (-तिः) (ved.) A wise man. E. अद्धा, taddh. aff. तिल्(?).
text.1685:
अद्धापुरुष Tatpur. m. (-षः) (ved.) A true man, one deserv
ing the name of a man. E. अद्धा and पुरुष.
text.1686:
अद्धाबोधेय Tatpur. m. pl. (-याः) The name of a Śākhā of
the white Yajurveda. E. अद्धा and बोधेय(?).
text.1687:
अद्ध्यालोहकर्ण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा or -र्णी-र्णम्) (ved.) Hav
ing red ears (as a goat). E. अद्ध्यालोह (very red? see लोह)
and कर्ण, in the fem. with aff. टाप् or ङीष्.
text.1688:
अद्भुत Tatpur.(?) I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Surprising, wonderful (ac
cording to a vaidik interpretation: not having existed before).
II. m. (-तः)
1 Surprise, astonishment. See अद्भुतरस.
2 The
name of the Indra or chief of the ninth Manwantara.
III. n. (-तम्)
1 A prodigy, a wonder, any portentous
or marvellous phenomenon.
2 (In architecture.) A kind of
temple or vimāna, the breadth of which is divided into
four parts, seven such parts being given to its height. E.
(doubtful) अद् ind. and भू, uṇ. aff. डुतच्. Compare अन-
तिद्भुत.
text.1689:
अद्भुतगन्ध Bahvur. m. f. n. (-न्धः-न्धा-न्धम्) Having a wonder
ful smell. E. अद्भुत and गन्ध.
text.1690: अद्भुतत्व n. (-त्वम्) Wonderfulness. E. अद्भुत, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.1691:
अद्भुतब्राह्मण Karmadh. n. (-णम्) The name of a Brāhmaṇa
belonging to the Sāmaveda; more properly the last portion
of the Shaḍvinśabrāhmaṇa of the same Veda. E. अद्भुत and
ब्राह्मण.
text.1692:
अद्भुतरस Tatpur. m. (-सः) (In rhetoric.) The marvellous, as
a prevailing sentiment in poetical composition, one of the
nine rasas or characteristic sentiments of poetical compo
sition as described in Hindu works on rhetoric or poetry.
See रस. E. अद्भुत and रस.
text.1693:
अद्भुतरामायण Karmadh. n. (-णम्) The name of a work
ascribed to Vālmīki. E. अद्भुत and रामायण.
text.1694:
अद्भुतरूप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Having a wonderful
shape or figure. E. अद्भुत and रूप.
text.1695:
अद्भुतसार Karmadh. m. (-रः) The resin of the खदिर q. v.
E. अद्भुत and सार.
text.1696:
अद्भुतस्वन Bahuvr. m. (-नः) A name of Śiva. Another read
ing of this word is अद्भुतश्वन. E. अद्भुत and स्वन ‘producing
a wonderful sound’.
text.1697:
अद्मन् n. (-द्म) (ved.)
1 Food in general.
2 A house. E. अद्,
kṛt (or uṇ.) aff. मनिन्.
text.1698: अद्मनि m. (-निः) Fire. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. अनि and āgama मुट्.
text.1699: अद्मर m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Gluttonous. E. अद्, kṛt aff. क्मरच्.
text.1700:
अद्मसद् Tatpur. f. (-द्) (ved.)
1 A cook.
2 A mother. E. अद्मन्
and सद्; according to the comm. ‘sitting by the food, to
cook it; or sitting in the house; or spending food’.
text.1701:
अद्मसद्य n. (-द्यम्) (ved.) Being a cook, the condition of a
cook. See the preceding. E. अद्मसद्, taddh. aff. य.
text.1702:
अद्य I. ind.
1 To-day.
2 Now, at present. In the Vedas also
written अद्या which seems to be the more original form of
this word. अद्यापि Even now, still. अद्यपूर्वम् before to
day, before now. E. अश्, considered as a substitute of
इदम्, taddh. aff. द्य; but more probably a Karmadh. com
pound of अ (the pronom. theme in इदम्) and द्य or द्या
(from द्यु or दिव्) = अस्मिन्द्यवि.
II. 1. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) Fit to be eaten, eatable.
2. n. (-द्यम्) Food in general. E. अद्, kṛtya aff. यत्.
text.1703:
अद्यतन I. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Of or belonging to the
current day, of to-day.
II. m. (-नः) The period of a current day, from mid
night to midnight in the usual acceptation, but sometimes
considered to begin and to end with sun-set or to begin
with the proper time of rising and to end with the proper
time of going to rest.
III. f. (-नी) (In grammar.) The aorist (or लुङ्), as the
tense employed in relating what has happened during the
current day. E. अद्य, taddh. aff. ट्युल् and āgama तुट्.
text.1704:
अद्यतनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Of to-day, belonging to
the current day. E. अद्यतन, taddh. aff. छ.
text.1705: अद्यप्रभृति Bahuvr. ind. From to-day. E. अद्य and प्रभृति.
text.1706:
अद्यश्वीन I. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) What may happen to-day
or to-morrow, near to any event, at the point of death &c.
II. f. (-ना) A woman or any female animal near the time
of delivery. E. अद्य and श्वस्, taddh. aff. ख.
text.1707:
अद्यावधि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धिः-धिः-धि) Beginning or end
ing with the current day; from or till to-day. E. अद्य and
अवधि.
text.1708:
अद्यूत्य (ved.) Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) Not gained by
playing, not gained improperly, obtained honestly. E. अ
neg. and द्यूत्य.
II. Bahuvr. n. (-त्यम्) The last watch of the night, that
preceding the dawn, at which time the Aśvins are espe
cially to be worshipped. E. अ and द्यूत्य (from द्युत्, kṛt
aff. ण्यत् and ऊ instead of उ) ‘without light’. Both ex
planations of this word belong to different commentaries
but refer to the same passage in which it occurs.
text.1709:
अद्रव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Not liquid, solid. E.
अ neg. and द्रव.
text.1710:
अद्रव्य Tatpur. n. (-व्यम्) A worthless or good-for-nothing
object. E. अ deter. and द्रव्य.
text.1711:
अद्रि m. (-द्रिः)
1 A stone.
2 The thunderbolt.
3 A mountain.
4 A cloud.
5 A tree.
6 The sun.
7 The name of a measure.
8 A proper name of the son of Viśvagaśva and father of
Yuvanāśva.
9 (In arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the
numeral 7. E. अद्, uṇ. aff. क्रिन्; but more probably, a
Tatpur. composed of अ and द्रि (from दॄ or द्रा?). Compare
अग. The meanings 1. 2. 4. belong exclusively to the Vedas.
text.1712:
अद्रिकर्णी Bahuvr. f. (-र्णी) The name of a plant (Clitoria
ternatea). See अपराजिता or गिरिकर्णी. E. अद्रि and कर्ण,
fem. aff. ङीष्.
text.1713:
अद्रिका f. (-का) An Apsaras or heavenly nymph, the wife
of Amāvasu and mother of Satyavatī. E. अद्रि, taddh. aff.
कन् and fem. aff. टाप्.
text.1714: अद्रिकीला Bahuvr. f. (-ला) The earth. E. अद्रि and कील.
text.1715:
अद्रिकृतस्थली Bahuvr. f. (-ली) The name of an Apsaras. E.
अद्रि-कृत and स्थल, fem. aff. ङीष्.
text.1716:
अद्रिज Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Produced or found
in the hills.
II. f. (-जा)
1 A name of Pārvatī or Durgā, the daughter
of Himālaya, the ruler of the Himālaya mountain, and
hence this her appellation, mountain-born.
2 The name of
a plant. See सैंहली.
III. n. (-जम्) Red chalk. See शिलाजतु. E. अद्रि and ज.
text.1717:
अद्रिजा Tatpur. m. (-जाः) (ved.) Produced by the (friction
of) stones (an epithet of Agni and हंस q. v.). E. अद्रि
and जा.
text.1718:
अद्रिजूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Moved or hastened
by the stones (the sound of the stones); an epithet of the
chariot of the Aśvins. E. अद्रि and जूत.
text.1719:
अद्रितनया Tatpur. f. (-या)
1 A name of Pārvatī, the daughter
of the mountain Himālaya.
2 A metre regulated by number
and quantity; a variety of the class called विकृति q. v. It con
sists of four lines, with the following twenty-three syllables
to each: {??},
Also called अश्वललित. E. अद्रि and तनया.
text.1720:
अद्रिदुग्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्धः-ग्धा-ग्धम्) (ved.) Extracted
or expressed with stones. E. अद्रि and दुग्ध; literally:
milked with stones.
text.1721:
अद्रिद्विष् Tatpur. m. (-ट्) A name of Indra. E. अद्रि and
द्विष्, lit. the enemy of the mountains.
text.1722:
अद्रिनन्दिनी Tatpur. f. (-नी) Pārvatī. See अद्रितनया. E.
अद्रि and नन्दिनी.
text.1723:
अद्रिपति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) Hima, lord of mountains: also
similar compounds, as अद्रिराज्, अद्रीन्द्र &c.
text.1724:
अद्रिबुध्न Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ध्नः-ध्ना-ध्नम्) (ved.) Produced or
originating in mountains. E. अद्रि and बुध्न.
text.1725:
अद्रिभिद् Tatpur. m. (-भित्) A name of Indra. E. अद्रि and
भिद्, lit. the splitter of mountains (with his thunderbolt).
text.1726:
अद्रिभू Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-भूः-भूः-भु) Mountaineer, moun
tain-born.
II. f. (-भूः) A plant (Salvinea cucullata). See आखुकर्णी.
E. अद्रि and भू.
text.1727:
अद्रिमूर्धन् Tatpur. m. (-र्धा) The summit or peak of a moun
tain. E. अद्रि and मूर्धन्.
text.1728:
अद्रिराज् Tatpur. m. (-राट्) The king of mountains, the
Himālaya mountains; the snowy range on the north of
Hindustan, confounded with the mythological ruler of them,
and the father of Pārvatī. E. अद्रि and राज्.
text.1729:
अद्रिराज Tatpur. m. (-जः). The same as the preceding. E.
अद्रि and राजन्, samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.1730:
अद्रिवत् m. (-वान्, voc. in the Vedas -वः) (ved.) Having
stones, armed with stones or with the thunderbolt, an epithet
of Indra, Soma, Varuṇa. E. अद्रि, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.1731:
अद्रिवह्नि Tatpur. m. (-ह्निः) Fire on or in a mountain. E.
अद्रि and वह्नि.
text.1732:
अद्रिशय्य Bahuvr. m. (-य्यः) A name of Śiva. E. अद्रि and
शय्या; literally: whose couch is the mountain (Himālaya).
text.1733:
अद्रिशृङ्ग Tatpur. n. (-ङ्गम्) A peak, the horn or summit of
a mountain. E. अद्रि and शृङ्ग.
text.1734:
अद्रिसंहत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Struck or ex
tracted with stones, pressed with stones (an epithet of Soma).
E. अद्रि and संहत.
text.1735: अद्रिसार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Iron. E. अद्रि and सार.
text.1736:
अद्रिसारमय m. f. n. (-यः-यी-यम्) Made of iron. E. अद्रि-
सार, taddh. aff. मयट्.
text.1737:
अद्रीन्द्र Tatpur. m. (-न्द्रः). The same as the following. E.
अद्रि and इन्द्र.
text.1738:
अद्रीश Tatpur. m. (-शः)
1 A name of Śiva.
2 A name of
Himālaya, as king of mountains. E. अद्रि and ईश.
text.1739:
अद्रुह् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ध्रुक्) (ved.) Harmless, innocuous,
void of guile, kind, mild (an epithet of the gods, of heaven
and earth &c.) E. अ priv. and द्रुह्.
text.1740:
अद्रुह्वन् Tatpur. m. (-ह्वा) (ved.) The same as the preceding
(an epithet of Mitra and Varuṇa). E. अ neg. and द्रुह्वन्.
text.1741:
अद्रोघ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-घः-घा-घम्) (ved.) Having no guile,
free from deceit, true. E. अ priv. and द्रोघ.
text.1742:
अद्रोह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Mildness, moderation, the absence
of tyranny or oppression. E. अ neg. and द्रोह.
text.1743:
अद्रोहिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ही-हिणी-हि) Innocuous, mild.
E. अ neg. and द्रोहिन्.
text.1744:
अद्वय I. Tatpur. n. (-यम्)
1 Not duality, unity.
2 The
identity of Brahman (n.) and the Universe or of the divine
essence and the human soul; the real truth. E. अ neg.
and द्वय.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Without a second,
only, alone; esp. in the neuter as an epithet of Brahman (n.)
which is not distinct from the Universe.
2. m. (-यः) A name of Buddha (acc. to a commentary,
because wisdom and object of wisdom are identical with
him). E. अ priv. and द्वय.
text.1745:
अद्वयत् Tatpur. m. (-यन्) (ved.) Free from duplicity, one
whose acts are not different from his words and thoughts,
upright, honest. E. अ neg. and द्वयत्.
text.1746:
अद्वयवादिन् Tatpur. m. (-दी) A Jina or Buddha. E. अद्वय
and वादिन्: one who acknowledges but one principle;
or who teaches the real truth. See अद्वैतवादिन्.
text.1747:
अद्वयस् Tatpur. m. (-याः) (ved.) The same as अद्वयत्. E.
अ neg. and द्वयस्.
text.1748:
अद्वयानन्द Bahuvr. m. (-न्दः) The same as अद्वैतानन्द. E.
अद्वय and आनन्द.
text.1749:
अद्वयाविन् Tatpur. m. (-वी) (ved.) The same as अद्वयत्.
E. अ neg. and द्वयाविन्.
text.1750:
अद्वयु Tatpur. m. (-युः) (ved.) The same as अद्वयत्. E. अ
neg. and द्वयु.
text.1751:
अद्वार Tatpur. n. (-रम्) An entrance to a house which is
other than the door. E. अ neg. and द्वार.
text.1752:
अद्वितीय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्)
1 Only, sole, with
out a second. See अद्वय.
2 Unparalleled, unequalled. E. अ
priv. and द्वितीय.
text.1753:
अद्विषेण्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ण्यः-ण्या-ण्यम्) (ved.) Not detestable
or hateful, agreeable, desired. E. अ neg. and द्विषेण्य.
text.1754:
अद्वेष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Harmless, not malicious,
kind. E. अ priv. and द्वेष.
text.1755:
अद्वेषिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षी-षिणी-षि) Harmless, inoffen
sive. E. अ neg. and द्वेषिन्.
text.1756:
अद्वैत I. Tatpur. n. (-तम्)
1 Unity, not duality.
2 The iden
tity of Brahman (n.) and the Universe or of the divine es
sence and the human soul; the real truth.
3 The name of
an Upanishad of the Atharvaveda. E. अ neg. and द्वैत.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Without a second,
only, alone; esp. as an epithet of आत्मन् and ब्रह्मन् (n.)
or ब्रह्मलोक. E. अ priv. and द्वैत.
text.1757:
अद्वैतवादिन् Tatpur. m. (-दी) A unitarian, one who main
tains the existence of but one principle in the Universe.
E. अद्वैत and वादिन्. See अद्वयवादिन्.
text.1758:
अद्वैतानन्द Bahuvr. m. (-न्दः) The proper name of one of the
founders of the Vaiṣṇava sect in Bengal; he lived about
the end of the 15th century. Also अद्वयानन्द. E. अद्वैत and
आनन्द.
text.1759:
अध ind. (निपात) An inceptive particle which occurs only
in the Vedas. It is used very much in the same manner as
अथ of which it is apparently a variety and corresponds
chiefly with
1 Now, hereafter.
2 Moreover, so much the
more.
3 Therefore. It occurs frequently in its protracted
form अधा which seems to be the more original one. E.
See अथ.
text.1760:
अधःकर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The lower part of the hand, the
metacarpus or the hand from the wrist to the root of the
fingers. E. अधस् and कर.
text.1761:
अधःकाय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The lower part of the body, the
lower extremities. E. अधस् and काय.
text.1762: अधःखनन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Undermining. E. अधस् and खनन.
text.1763:
अधःपद्म Tatpur. n. (-द्मम्) (In architecture.) A division of the
शिखर (q. v.) or cupola, the lower cima recta. E. अधस् and पद्म.
text.1764:
अधःपात Tatpur. m. (-तः) Falling down, literally and me
taphorically. E. अधस् and पात.
text.1765:
अधःपुष्पी Bahuvr. f. (-ष्पी)
1 A plant (Pimpinella anisum).
See अवाक्पुष्पी.
2 Another plant (Elephantopus scaber)
or perhaps Hieracium. See गोजिह्वा. E. अधस् and पुष्प,
fem. aff. ङीष्, lit. having its flowers hanging downwards.
text.1766:
अधःप्रवाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Flowing or streaming down
wards. E. अधस् and प्रवाह.
text.1767:
अधःप्रस्तर Tatpur. m. (-रः) A seat or bed, made of grass,
esp. for the use of persons in the state of impurity or आ-
शौच q. v. E. अधस् and प्रस्तर.
text.1768:
अधःशय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Sleeping on the
ground. E. अधस् and शय.
text.1769:
अधःशय्य I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-य्यः-य्या-य्यम्) Sleeping on the
ground, on a kind of couch different from a bed-stead.
II. Tatpur. f. (-य्या) The sleeping in the manner described.
E. अधस् and शय्या.
text.1770:
अधःशिरस् Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-राः-राः-रः) and II. n. (-रः)
The same as अधोमुख I. and IV. q. v. E. अधस् and शिरस्.
text.1771:
अधःस्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्)
1 Below.
2 Inferior.
E. अधस् and स्थ.
text.1772:
अधःस्थित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Standing beneath.
E. अधस् and स्थित.
text.1773:
अधःस्वस्तिक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) (In astronomy.) The nadir.
Also अधरस्वस्तिक. E. अधस् and स्वस्तिक.
text.1774:
अधउपासन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Copulation, sexual union. E.
अधस् and उपासन.
text.1775:
अधन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Poor, without wealth.
E. अ priv. and धन.
text.1776:
अधम I. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्)
1 Very low or inferior in
place or degree.
2 Vile, despicable. (In the vituperative
sense it stands often as the latter part of a Tatpur. com
pound; f. i. पापाधम, नराधम.)
II. m. (-मः) (In rhetoric, according to some.) A para
mour of a low description, one without fear, pity or shame &c.
III. f. (-मा) (In rhetoric, according to some.) A mistress
of a low description, one ungrateful, whimsical, acting
unkindly towards her lover &c. E. अव्, uṇ. aff. अम, with
व् changed to ध; or according to others a Tatpur. com
posed of अ neg. and धम (from ध्मा); but a preferable
etym. is that from अधस्, taddh. aff. म, with elision of
स्; or better from अध् (the thematic form common to अधम,
अधर, अधस्, अधस्तात्), aff. अम.
text.1777: अधमभृत Karmadh. m. (-तः). See the following. E. अधम and भृत.
text.1778:
अधमभृतक Karmadh. m. (-कः) The lowest order of hired
servants, a porter, a bearer of burdens. (See also भृतक,
उत्तमभृतक and मध्यमभृतक.) E. अधम and भृतक.
text.1779: अधमर्ण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) A debtor. E. अधम and ऋण.
text.1780: अधमर्णिक m. (-कः) A debtor. E. अधमर्ण, taddh. aff. ठक्.
text.1781: अधमाङ्ग Karmadh. n. (-ङ्गम्) A foot. E. अधम and अङ्ग.
text.1782:
अधमाचार Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Wicked in prac
tice, low, vile. E. अधम and आचार.
text.1783:
अधमार्ध Karmadh. n. (-र्धम्) The inferior or lower part. Cf.
उत्तमार्ध E. अधम and अर्ध.
text.1784:
अधमार्ध्य m. f. n. (-र्ध्यः-र्ध्या-र्ध्यम्) Belonging to the inferior
or lower part. Cf. उत्तमार्ध्य. E. अधमार्ध, taddh. aff. यत्.
text.1785:
अधर I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Lower, inferior, in place.
(In this sense the word is declined like the sarvanāman यत्
&c. (q. v.), but in the abl. and loc. sing. of the masc. and
neuter and in the nom. plur. of the masc. it forms optionally
अधरस्मात् or अधरात्, अधरस्मिन् or अधरे, अधरे or अ-
धराः; it may form Tatpur. compositions with nouns having
the sense of the singular and considered then as depending
upon अधर, which is the former part of the compound, in
the genitive; for instance अधरकायः is explained, अधरं
कायस्य.) Adverbially used are अधरात्, अधरस्मात्, अधरेण;
qq. vv.
2 Low, vile.
3 Speechless, refuted, overcome in abuse
or controversy.
4 Prior, preceding in time. See अधरेद्युस्.
II. m. (-रः) The lower lip, the lip.
III. f. (-रा)
1 The lower region.
2 The nadir (?).
IV. m. n. (-रः-रम्) Pudendum muliebre. E. Probably
from अध् (see E. of अधम), aff. अर; the derivation given
by the native authorities, from अ neg. and धर is not correct.
text.1786:
अधरकण्ठ Tatpur. m. n. (-ण्ठः-ण्ठम्?) The lower part of the
throat. E. अधर and कण्ठ. See under अधर.
text.1787:
अधरकाय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The lower part of the body,
the lower extremities. E. अधर and काय. See under
अधर.
text.1788:
अधरतस् ind.
1 Underneath.
2 The lower regions, the nadir, or
in the lower regions, in the nadir. (Used in the sense of a no
minative or locative, but in the latter with the restriction
that the distance must not be far; or governing in the first
meaning a noun in the genitive.) See अधरात् and अधरेण.
Cf. अधराक्. E. अधर, taddh. aff. अतसुच्.
text.1789: अधरपान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Kissing. E. अधर II. and पान.
text.1790:
अधरस्तात् ind. Below, underneath. (The correctness of this
form appears doubtful.) E. अधर, taddh. aff. अस्ताति.
text.1791:
अधरस्वस्तिक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) (In astronomy.) The nadir.
Also अधःस्वस्तिक q. v. E. अधर and स्वस्तिक.
text.1792:
अधराक् Tatpur. ind.
1 Downwards, from below.
2 Westwards,
from or in the west.
3 The lower regions or the nadir, from
or in the lower regions or the nadir. (Used in the sense of a
locative, ablative or nominative; or governing in the two first
meanings a noun in the ablative. E. अधर and अञ्च् II. with
luk of the taddh. aff. अस्ताति. See अधराञ्च्
text.1793:
अधराचीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) (ved.) Going or being un
derneath, westwards, going to or being in the lower regions,
in the nadir. E. अधराञ्च्, taddh. aff. ख.
text.1794:
अधराच्य m. f. n. (-च्यः-च्या-च्यम्) (ved.) The same as the
preceding. E. अधराञ्च्, taddh. aff. यत्.
text.1795:
अधराञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-राङ्-राची-राक्) (ved.) Going or
being downwards, westwards, going to or being in the lower
regions, in the nadir. E. अधर and अञ्च्.
text.1796:
अधरात् ind. The same as अधरतस्. (Used in the sense of a
locative, ablative or nominative.) E. अधर, taddh. aff. आति.
text.1797:
अधरारणि Tatpur. f. (-णिः) (ved.) The nether piece of the two
pieces of wood, which, by attrition, produce the sacrificial fire.
See अरणि and उत्तरारणि. E. अधर (q. v.) and अरणि.
text.1798:
अधरावलोप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Biting the lip. E. अधर II. and
अवलोप.
text.1799:
अधरीकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Put down, overcome,
vanquished.
2 Annulled, invalidated (as a document). E.
अधर, taddh. aff. च्वि with कृ, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1800:
अधरीण m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Reproached, censured. E.
अधर, taddh. aff. ख.
text.1801:
अधरीभूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Refuted, contra
dicted, invalidated. E. अधर, taddh. aff. च्वि with भू, kṛt
aff. क्त.
text.1802:
अधरेण ind. The same as अधरतस् or अधरात्. (Used in
the sense of a locative or nominative, but in the first
with the restriction that the distance must not be far; or
governing in the first meaning a noun in the accusative or
genitive.) E. अधर, taddh. aff. एनप्.
text.1803:
अधरेद्युस् ind. A previous day, the day before yesterday. E.
अधर, irregular aff. एद्युस्; better a Tatpur, compound,
from अधर (loc.) and द्युस् from दिव् or द्यु.
text.1804:
अधरोत्तर Dwandwa I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Lower and
higher.
2 Inferior and better.
3 Prior and posterior.
II. n. sing. or plur. (-रम् or -रे)
1 The lower and higher,
inferior and better, prior and posterior.
2 A state of con
fusion, when things are tupsy-turvy.
3 Address and answer.
E. अधर and उत्तर.
text.1805:
अधरोष्ठ Karmadh. m. (-ष्ठः) The lower lip. Also अधरौष्ठ.
E. अधर and ओष्ठ.
text.1806:
अधर्म Tatpur. 1. m. (-र्मः)
1 Unrighteousness, injustice, all
behaviour contrary to the Śruti and Smṛti, or religious
and legal institutions.
2 (In philosophy.) According to the
Nyāya and Vaiśeṣika: moral demerit, the result of doing
what is forbidden, the peculiar cause of pain, one of the
twenty-four qualities united with substance.--According
to the Sāṅkhya, one of the changeable (वैकृतिक) dispo
sitions (भाव) of the mind, which being the efficient cause,
makes the soul migrate into an animal, a deer, a bird, a
reptile, a vegetable, a mineral.--According to the Bud
dhistic doctrine it is the consequence of upādāna or exertion
of body or speech.--According to the Jainas it is that
which causes the soul in general to continue embarrassed
with body notwithstanding its capacity for ascent and na
tural tendency to soar.
3 As a personification Adharma oc
curs in the Purāṇas as one of the Prajāpatis or mind-born
sons of Brahmā; his wife is Hinsā (mischief) on whom he
begot Anṛta (falsehood) and Nikṛti (immorality) or ac
cording to others, Mṛṣā (falsehood) and his children Dam
bha (hypocrisy) and Māyā (deceit) who were adopted by
Nirṛti (misfortune).--Adharma is also mentioned as one
of the eighteen servants of the sun.
2. f. (-र्मा) According to the Śāktas a kalā or part of
the original or Mūla-prakṛti and personified as the bride
of Mṛtyu or Death. E. अ neg. and धर्म.
text.1807:
अधर्मचारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Unrighteous,
wicked. E. अधर्म and चारिन्.
text.1808:
अधर्मदण्डन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Inflicting punishment without
any lawful motive, unjust punishment. E. अधर्म and दण्डन.
text.1809:
अधर्ममय m. f. n. (-यः-यी-यम्) Consisting of injustice or
unrighteousness, thoroughly unjust or unrighteous. E. अ-
धर्म, taddh. aff. मयट्.
text.1810:
अधर्मात्मन् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्मा-त्मा-त्म) Wicked, unrighteous.
E. अधर्म and आत्मन्.
text.1811:
अधर्मास्तिकाय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The category or predicament
of अधर्म, according to the Jainas (see अधर्म, 2.). E. अधर्म
and अस्तिकाय.
text.1812:
अधर्मिन् m. f. n. (-र्मी-र्मिणी-र्मि) Wicked, sinful, unrighteous.
E. अधर्म, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1813:
अधर्मिष्ठ m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Very wicked. E. अधर्मिन्,
taddh. aff. इष्ठन्.
text.1814:
अधर्म्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्म्यः-र्म्या-र्म्यम्) Not conformable or
according to justice or morality, wicked, unrighteous. E.
अ neg. and धर्म्य.
text.1815: अधवा Bahuvr. f. (-वा) A widow. See विधवा. E. अ priv. and धव.
text.1816:
अधश्चर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Going down or below.
II. m. (-रः) A thief. E. अधस् and चर. See the following.
text.1817:
अधश्चौर Tatpur. m. (-रः) A house-breaker, a thief. E.
अधस् and चौर.
text.1818:
अधस् ind.
1 Underneath, downwards or from below.
2 The lower
regions, the nadir, or: from or in the lower regions, the nadir.
(In these meanings it is used in the sense of a nominative,
ablative or locative; or governs in the first meaning a noun in
the genitive, more seldom in the ablative; the reiterated अधो
ऽधस् implies proximity and is followed by the noun in the
accusative, f. i. अधोऽधो ग्रामम् below the village, but in its
neighbourhood; it may occur as the former and as the latter
part of Tatpur. compounds.)
3 Pudendum muliebre.
4 Away,
out(?). See अधस्तात्; cf. अधराक्. E. अध् (considered as a
substitute of अधर, but more probably the thematic form
common to अधम, अधर, अधस् and अधस्तात्), taddh. aff. असि.
text.1819:
अधस्तन m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Below, underneath. E. अधस्,
taddh. aff. ट्युल् and āgama तुट्.
text.1820:
अधस्तराम् ind. Lower, very low. E. अधस्, taddh. aff. तरप्
and आमु (or better the acc. fem. in the comparative of
अधस् used as an adverb).
text.1821:
अधस्तात् ind. The same as अधस् in the three first meanings.
It is used, like this word, in its two first meanings in the
sense of a nominative, ablative and locative and may in its
first meaning govern a noun in the genitive, more seldom in
the ablative. See अधस्. E. अध् (considered as a substitute
of अधर, but more probably the thematic form common to
अधम, अधर, अधस् and अधस्तात्), taddh. aff. अस्ताति.
text.1822:
अधस्ताद्दिश् Tatpur. f. (-क्) The lower region, the nadir. E.
अधस्तात् and दिश्.
text.1823:
अधस्पद Tatpur. n. (-दम्) The place under the feet. E. अ-
धस् and पद.
text.1825:
अधामार्गव m. (-वः) A plant (Achyranthes aspera). Also
धामार्गव; and see अपामार्ग. E. unknown.
text.1826:
अधारणक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not supporting,
not giving or not allowing to gain a livelihood, unpro
fitable. E. अ priv. and धारण, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1827:
अधार्मिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Unjust, unrighteous,
wicked. See also आधार्मिक. E. अ neg. and धार्मिक.
text.1828:
अधि ind. (see निपात, उपसर्ग, गति, कर्मप्रवचनीय) A par
ticle implying superiority in place, power, rank, quality
and quantity and generally used as a separable prepo
sition or as a prefix to verbs, but in the Vedas also as
an adverb. With nouns it may form Tatpur., Bahuvr.
and Avyayībhāva compounds. It means.
1. (as adverb, in the Vedas) very much, excessively.
2. (as a separable preposition)
1 with a noun following
or preceding in the locative,
a. above (in place),
b. over (in
the sense of mastership, power &c.),
c. under (see अधीन
and अधिक 4, cf. अधस्);
2 with a noun following or pre
ceding in the accusative,
a. on, above (in place),
b. concerning,
with respect to,
c. repeated it implies also proximity; f. i.
अध्यधि ग्रामम् above the village but in its neighbourhood;
3 with a noun following or preceding in the ablative (in the
Vedas),
a. on, above,
b. from above,
c. from (in this meaning
it occurs also in the classical language, when it is supposed
to be merely an expletive, the preceding ablative implying
already the notion ‘from’),
d. in consequence of, on behalf of,
e. in presence of, before, in front of;
4 with a noun following
or preceding in the genitive (in the Vedas), amidst, amongst.
3. (as a prefix to verbs) Over, esp. in the sense of
taking possession of, mastering &c. literally or metapho
rically; but used also as an expletive esp. when followed by
another preposition: f. i. with कृ to superintend, with इ to
obtain, to study &c.; but it does not alter the meaning of
आगम्, when forming with the latter अध्यागम्.
4. (in composition)
1 (with Tatpur. or Bahuvr.) it implies
superiority in place, rank, quantity &c.,
2 (with Avyayībh.)
a. concerning, with respect to,
b. over. E. unknown.
text.1829:
अधि 1. m. (-धिः) Anxiety, mental pain; more usually आधि
q. v. of which it seems to be an incorrect reading. E. see आधि.
2. f. (-धिः) A woman in her courses. See also अवि.
E. अद्, kṛt aff. इ and ध् substituted for द् or a Tatpur.
अ neg. and धि (from धा). (The first etym. doubtful.)
text.1830:
अधिक I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्)
1 Exceeding, in addition to
(the reverse of न्यून; between both साधारण).
2 More, more
than, superior (in place, power, rank, quality or quantity).
3 Very much, excessive, excellent.
4 Less, smaller, inferior (cf.
अधि 2. 1. c.). अधिकम् used as adverb. (If अधिक has the first of
these meanings, that by which the excess is caused, stands in
the instrumental or (but seldom) in the locative or forms the
first part of a Tatpur. compound of which अधिक is the latter;
if it has the second meaning, the object compared with, stands
in the instrumental, the ablative or in the genitive; if it has
the last meaning, the object compared with stands in the abla
tive. Cf. अध्यारूढ. With numerals अधिक may form Bahuvr.
compounds, usually in the plural, if it is the former part of
the compound; for instance अधिकचत्वारिंशाः (sc. संख्याः) i. e.
more than forty. It is considered as dropped in Dwandwa
compounds of numerals f. i. in पञ्चविंशति, equal to पञ्चाधि-
कविंशति.)
5 Embolismic, intercalary (only in composition
with and prefixed to the name or numeral of a luni-solar
year, to the name of a month and to the name of a day;
f. i. अधिकाश्विन. See also अधिकतिथि, अधिकदिन, अधि-
कमास, अधिकसंवत्सर, and compare क्षय).
5 Subsequent,
following (as a day, a chapter or a passage in a book &c.;
used very much in the same manner as ऊर्ध्व).
II. n. (-कम्)
1 The surplus, that which is exceeding.
2 (In Nyāya.) Superfluity in reasons or instances, giving
more reasons or instances than are required or relevant in
a syllogism.
3 (In rhetoric.) Hyperbole (of which two
kinds are enumerated: hyperbole concerning the recipient
(substance, subject &c.) and hyperbole concerning that
which is to be received (accidents, predicate &c.). E. अधि,
taddh. aff. कन्.
text.1831:
अधिकता f. (-ता) Excess, addition; also अधिकत्व n. (-त्वम्).
E. अधिक, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.1832:
अधिकक्षयकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Causing
excessive loss, wasting too much. E. अधिक-क्षय and कारिन्.
text.1833:
अधिकतिथि Karmadh. m. f. (-थिः-थिः) An intercalary lunar
day. When no tithi (q. v.) begins or ends in a solar day,
the numeral of the preceding is repeated in the calendar,
the first tithi being accounted the intercalated and the second
the proper one. Compare क्षयतिथि. E. अधिक and तिथि.
text.1834:
अधिकदन्त Karmadh. m. (-न्तः) A tooth growing over an
other. See अधिदन्त and वर्धन. E. अधिक and दन्त.
text.1835:
अधिकदिन Karmadh. n. (-नम्) An intercalated day. See
अधिकतिथि. Also अधिदिन. E. अधिक and दिन.
text.1836:
अधिकमांसार्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म). See अधिमांसार्मन्. E. अ-
धिक-मांस and अर्मन्.
text.1837:
अधिकमास Karmadh. m. (-सः) An intercalated month. Also
अधिमास. Compare क्षयमास. E. अधिक and मास.
text.1838:
अधिकरण I. Tatpur. n. (-णम्)
1 Superiority, supremacy, govern
ment.
2 Title, right.
3 Town meeting, court of justice.
4 Sup
port, receptacle.
5 Substance (द्रव्य, as the recipient of quali
ties &c.).
6 (In grammar.) Comprehension, location, gener
ally the sense of the seventh or locative case, but occa
sionally also that of the third or instrumental and of the
sixth or genitive case.
7 (In grammar.) Government, re
gimen; see एकाधिकरण, युगपदधिकरण, समानाधिकरण.
8 (In philosophy.) A case or topic; esp. in the Mīmānsā
and Vedānta; in the former it comprehends usually five
parts or members, the subject (विषय), the doubt (संशय),
the first side (or objectionable) argument (पूर्वपक्ष), the fol
lowing (or right) argument (उत्तरपक्ष) and the conclusion
(सिद्धान्त or राद्धान्त). Sometimes, however, the second
part is inherent in the third and the fifth in the fourth.
In both philosophies an adhikaraṇa is a subdivision of a
pāda, which is the division of an adhyāya. E. कृ with अधि,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. (-णः-णी). See अधिकार II. E. अधि and
करण; in the fem. with aff. ङीप्.
text.1839:
अधिकरणमण्डप Tatpur. m. n. (-पः-पम्) A hall of the town
council, a hall of justice(?). E. अधिकरण and मण्डप.
text.1840:
अधिकरणसिद्धान्त Tatpur. m. (-न्तः) (In the Nyāya philoso
phy.) A truth or conclusion which implies another truth or
conclusion; one of the four kinds of सिद्धान्त. See also सर्व-
तन्त्रसिद्धान्त, प्रतितन्त्रसिद्धान्त and अभ्युपगमसिद्धान्त. E. अ-
धिकरण and सिद्धान्त, a paramount truth.
text.1842:
अधिकरणैतावत्त्व Tatpur. n. (-त्त्वम्) Quantity. E. अधिकरण
(substance) and एतावत्त्व ‘the fixed measure of a substance’.
text.1843:
अधिकर्द्धि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्द्धिः-र्द्धिः-र्द्धि) Prosperous, every
way happy. E. अधिक and ऋद्धि.
text.1844:
अधिकर्मकर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The same as the following.
E. अधि and कर्मकर.
text.1845:
अधिकर्मकृत् Tatpur. m. (-त्) A servant who is set over or
superintends the working men; one of the four kinds of
servants called कर्मकार or कर्मकर qq. vv. See also शुश्रूषक.
E. अधि and कर्मकृत्.
text.1846:
अधिकर्मकृत Tatpur. m. (-तः) The master or chief of a fa
mily, one who superintends all family affairs. E. अधि-
कर्मन् and कृत.
text.1847:
अधिकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) Superintendence, supervision.
E. कृ with अधि, kṛt aff. मनिन्.
text.1848:
अधिकर्मिक m. (-कः) Clerk or prefect of the market or fair.
E. अधिकर्मन्, taddh. aff. ठन्.
text.1849:
अधिकल्पिन् Tatpur. m. (-ल्पी) (ved.) An exceedingly shrewd
gambler, one skilled in superior tricks or combinations(?).
E. अधि and कल्पिन्.
text.1850:
अधिकवाक्योक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः) Exaggeration, hyperbole.
E. अधिक-वाक्य and उक्ति.
text.1851:
अधिकषाष्टिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Bought with, made of &c.
more than sixty. E. अधिक-षष्टि, taddh. aff. ठञ्.
text.1852:
अधिकसंवत्सर Karmadh. m. (-रः) An intercalated year. E.
अधिक and संवत्सर.
text.1853:
अधिकसाप्ततिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Bought with, made of &c.
more than seventy. E. अधिक-सप्तति, taddh. aff. ठञ्.
text.1854:
अधिकाङ्ग Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गी or -ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Having
more members than natural or common.
II. n. (-ङ्गम्) The girdle over the coat of mail, worn
as a kind of scarf. E. अधिक and अङ्ग; in the fem. with
aff. ङीष् or टाप्.
text.1855:
अधिकार I. Tatp. m. (-रः)
1 Superintendence, supremacy, autho
rity.
2 Rule, government.
3 Duty, office.
4 Right, title, owner
ship.
5 The use of royal insignia.
6 (In the Mīmānsā philo
sophy.) The right of action, i. e. the right to institute a
sacrifice and to claim the results which are derived from
it; it is subject to different regulations and restrictions and
forms the subject of the sixth adhyāya of the Mīmānsā.
See also कर्माधिकार.
7 A topic in a book; especially
in grammatical works where it means a precept, rule or
word, heading and applying to a number of particular rules
which follow. Also written अधीकार. E. कृ with अधि,
kṛt aff. घञ्.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. (-रः-री) One who has many duties to per
form, very busy. E. अधि and कार; in the fem. with aff. ङीष्.
text.1856:
अधिकारस्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) Established in
an office or charge. E. अधिकार and स्थ.
text.1857:
अधिकारिता f. (-ता)
1 Ownership, lordship.
2 Right, title &c.
See अधिकारिन्. Also अधिकारित्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अधि-
कारिन्, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.1858:
अधिकारिन् I. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) (In law.) Possessing
a right or title.
II. m. (-री)
1 A superintendent, a ruler, a director.
2 One holding an office.
3 A master, an owner.
4 (In the Mī
mānsā.) One entitled to institute a sacrifice; see अधिकार.
5 (In the Vedānta.) A person who is perfect in the principles
and practice of the Vedānta.
6 Man (in general). E. अधि-
कार, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1859:
अधिकार्थवचन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Exaggeration, hyperbole.
E. अधिक-अर्थ and वचन.
text.1860:
अधिकार्म Tatpur. n. (-र्मम्). Perhaps the name of a place or
country. E. अधिक and अर्म.
text.1861:
अधिकृत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Superintended,
governed.
2 Claimed or held as a right.
3 Set as a rule or
authority.
4 Set over, superintendent.
II. m. (-तः)
1 A superintendent in general.
2 Inspector
of receipts and disbursements, an auditor of public ac
compts. E. कृ with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1862:
अधिकृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) A possession, a right, a privilege.
See अधिकरण. E. कृ with अधि, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.1863:
अधिक्रम Tatpur. m. (-मः) Invasion, assailing. E. क्रम् with
अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1864:
अधिक्षित् Tatpur. m. (-त्) (ved.) Lord, ruler. E. क्षि with अधि,
kṛt aff. क्विप्.
text.1865:
अधिक्षिप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्)
1 Censured, reviled,
detracted from.
2 Thrown or cast down.
3 Dismissed, sent,
dispatched.
4 Placed, fixed. E. क्षिप् with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1866:
अधिक्षेप Tatpur. m. (-पः)
1 Detraction, censure.
2 Dismissal,
dispatch. E. क्षिप् with अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1867:
अधिगत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Obtained.
2 Gone
through or over, lit. or fig. as read, studied. E. गम् with
अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1868:
अधिगन्तव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be reached, attain
able, acquirable, lit. or fig. E. गम् with अधि, kṛtya aff. तव्य.
text.1869:
अधिगन्तृ Tatpur. m. (-न्ता) One who obtains or acquires. E.
गम् with अधि, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.1870:
अधिगम Tatpur. m. (-मः)
1 Obtaining, attaining, acquiring.
2 Attainment, apprehension, going through or over, lit. or
fig.
3 Profit, gain, interest on capital or risk. E. गम् with
अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1871:
अधिगमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Obtaining, attaining, acquiring.
2 Attainment, apprehension, going through or over, lit. or
fig. as reading, studying. E. गम् with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1872:
अधिगमनीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) To be reached,
attainable, acquirable, lit. or fig. E. गम् with अधि, kṛtya
aff. अनीयर्.
text.1873:
अधिगम्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्यः-म्या-म्यम्) Attainable, to be reached
or acquired, lit. or fig. E. गम् with अधि, kṛtya aff. यत्.
text.1874:
अधिगव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वी-वम्) (ved.) On the cow,
coming from the cow (as milk &c.). E. अधि and गो,
samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.1875:
अधिगुण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Of superior quali
ties. E. अधि and गुण.
text.1876:
अधिज Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्)
1 Superior by birth.
2 Born from, produced on(?). E. जन् with अधि, kṛt aff. ड.
text.1877: अधिजनन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Birth. E. जन् with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1878:
अधिजिह्व Bahuvr. m. (-ह्वः) One of the diseases of the throat,
described as ‘a swelling at the root of the tongue like a second
tongue’ (probably a swelling of the epiglottis)--therefore
called also द्विजिह्व--and produced by the phlegm and blood;
when it suppurates, considered as incurable. Also अधि-
जिह्विका. E. अधि and जिह्वा.
text.1879:
अधिजिह्विका Bahuvr. f. (-का) The same as the preceding.
E. अधिजिह्व, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.1880:
अधिज्य Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ज्यः-ज्या-ज्यम्) Strung (as a bow).
E. अधि and ज्या.
text.1881:
अधिज्योतिषम् Avyayībh. Concerning or relating to the lu
minous part of creation; a chapter in the Upanishads treat
