ing thereon, comprises the following subjects: fire, sun,
water and the substance of lightning. E. अधि and ज्योतिष.
text.1882:
अधित्यका f. (-का) Land on the upper part of a mountain.
E. अधि, taddh. aff. त्यकन्.
text.1883:
अधिदन्त Tatpur. m. (-न्तः) A tooth growing over another.
See अधिकदन्त and वर्धन. E. अधि and दन्त.
text.1884:
अधिदिन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The same as अधिकदिन. E. अ-
धि and दिन.
text.1885:
अधिदेव I. Tatpur. m. (-वः)
1 A supreme or tutelary deity.
II. Avyayībh. (-वम्) Concerning the gods. (In derivatives
with a taddh. aff. which has an anubandha ञ्, ण् or क्, both
parts of this word have vṛddhi, f. i. आधिदैविक q. v.) E.
अधि and देव.
text.1886:
अधिदेवतम् Avyayībh. Concerning the divinities or the gods.
E. अधि and देवता.
text.1887:
अधिदेवता Tatpur. f. (-ता) A tutelary or presiding divinity.
E. अधि and देवता.
text.1888:
अधिदेवन n. (-नम्) The ground in a hall, on which gambling
with dice takes place. E. दिव्, with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1889:
अधिदैव I. Tatpur. n. (-वम्) and
II. Avyayībh. (-वम्). See the following. E. अधि and दैव.
text.1890:
अधिदैवत I. Tatpur. n. (-तम्)
1 The supreme or tutelary
deity.
2 The active principle in creation, the regulating
power which resides in water, fire, sky, air, the regions
&c. See also अधिभूत, अध्यात्म.
II. Avyayībh. (-तम्) Concerning
1 the deity or
2 the active
principle in creation. E. अधि and दैवत.
text.1891:
अधिप Tatpur. m. (-पः)
1 An owner, a lord or master.
2 A
king.
3 (In astrology.) The regent of a sign of the zodiac.
E. पा with अधि, kṛt aff. क.
text.1892:
अधिपति Tatpur. m. (-तिः)
1 A master, an owner, a ruler.
2 A
king. (A noun depending upon it in these meanings stands in
the gen. or loc., f. i. गवामधिपति or गोष्वधिपति.)
3 (In me
dicine.) ‘That part of the trunk which is inside of the
upper part of the head, at the passage of the vessel along
the lateral sinus; wounds inflicted there produce instan
taneous death’. E. पा with अधि, uṇ. aff. डति.
text.1893:
अधिपतिवती f. (-ती) The name of certain female divinities
(in the Vedas). See पत्नी. E. अधिपति, taddh. aff. मतुप्,
the change of म् in the affix to व् being restricted, in this
word, to the vaidik meaning of it.
text.1894:
अधिपत्नी Tatpur. f. (-त्नी) A mistress, a protectress. E.
अधिपति, fem. aff. ङीप्, and न् ādeśa for the final इ.
text.1895:
अधिपथम् Avyayībh. Over or across a road. E. अधि and
पथिन्, samāsānta aff. अ.
text.1896:
अधिपा Tatpur. m. (-पाः) (ved.) A master, a lord, a pro
tector. E. पा with अधि, kṛt aff. विच्.
text.1897:
अधिपांशुल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Where dust is lying
on or has risen from, dusty. Also written अधिपांसुल. E.
अधि and पांसुल.
text.1898:
अधिपुरुष Tatpur. m. (-षः) The supreme or presiding spirit.
E. अधि and पुरुष.
text.1899:
अधिप्रजम् Avyayībh. Concerning or relating to the continua
tion of the world by procreation; a chapter in the Upa
nishads treating thereon comprises the subjects: mother,
father, posterity and generation. E. अधि and प्रजा.
text.1900:
अधिप्रष्टि Avyayībh. (ved.) Over the Praṣṭi (q. v.). See the
following. E. अधि and प्रष्टि.
text.1901:
अधिप्रष्टियुग Tatpur. m. (-गः) (ved.) The yoke over the
Praṣṭi horse, to which a fourth horse was put (in a cere
mony connected with the Vājapeya sacrifice; two horses
being put before a cart and a third in front of the two,
so as to form with them a kind of triangle or tripod
(प्रष्टि q. v.), wherefore the third horse was called meta
phorically the Praṣṭi). E. अधिप्रष्टि and युग.
text.1902:
अधिभू Tatpur. m. (-भूः) A master, a ruler. E. भू with अधि, kṛt
aff. क्विप्.
text.1903:
अधिभूत I. Tatpur. n. (-तम्) A subtile or invisible element,
one which is the cause of the gross or visible elements
(also as an attribute of the supreme soul that pervades and
regulates all elements or existence).
II. Avyayībh. (-तम्) Concerning or relating to the bhūta
or elements; a chapter in the Upanishads includes under
this topic, earth, atmosphere, material heaven, regions,
intermediate regions, fire, air, sun, moon, lunar mansions,
water, annual plants, trees, ether, soul. (In derivatives
with a taddh. aff. which has an anubandha ञ्, ण् or क्,
both parts of this word assume vṛddhi, f. i. आधिभौतिक.)
E. अधि and भूत.
text.1904:
अधिमन्थ Tatpur. m. (-न्थः) (In medicine.) Severe ophthal
mia which is described as having the following symptoms:
‘acute pains as if the eyes were torn; throbbing which ex
tends to half of the head’; it consists of four varieties ac
cording to its being produced by derangement of the air,
bile, phlegm or blood. Also अधीमन्थ. E. अधि and मन्थ.
text.1905:
अधिमन्थन Tatpur. m. n. (-नः-नम्) (ved.) A piece of wood from
the paring of the sacrificial post, placed over the araṇi
(q. v.) to kindle a fire by attrition. E. मन्थ् with अधि,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्; scil. शकल.
text.1906:
अधिमन्थित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Affected with the disease
called अधिमन्थ q. v. E. अधिमन्थय् (अधिमन्थ, denom. aff.
णिच्), kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1907:
अधिमांस Tatpur. m. (-सः) (In medicine.) A disease of the
gums, described as ‘a great and painful swelling round the
wisdom-tooth with the discharge of saliva; produced by
diseased phlegm’. Also अधिमांसक. E. अधि and मांस.
text.1908:
अधिमांसक m. (-कः). The same as the preceding. E. अधि-
मांस, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.1909:
अधिमांसार्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) (In medicine.) A disease of the
white part on the conjunctiva of the eye; it is described as ‘a
large, soft (fleshy growth), either liver-coloured or brown’.
Also अधिकमांसार्मन्. E. अधिमांस (scil. ज) and अर्मन्;
‘the disease अर्मन् produced by the fleshy excrescence’.
text.1910:
अधिमात्र I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Excessive, above
measure. Cf. अतिमात्र.
II. Avyayībh. (-त्रम्) Above syllabic measurement. (In
the doctrine of the Upanishads the mysterious syllable ओम्
is said to be exempt from the general rules of prosody.
See also अध्यक्षर.) E. अधि and मात्रा.
text.1911:
अधिमात्रकारुणिक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The name of a Mahā
brahman (q. v.) according to the mythology of the Buddhists.
E. अधिमात्र and कारुणिक, lit. ‘excessively kind or com
passionate’.
text.1912:
अधिमास Tatpur. m. (-सः) An intercalary month, formed of the
aggregate days omitted in reckoning the lunar year, in com
parison with the solar. See also अधिकमास. E. अधि and मास.
text.1913:
अधिमुक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्ति) (In Buddhistic literature.) Com
prehension, intelligence, natural disposition (of the soul). E.
मुच् with अधि, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.1914:
अधिमुक्तिक m. (-कः) A name of Mahākāla (q. v.), according
to the mythology of the Buddhists. E. अधिमुक्ति, taddh.
aff. कन्(?).
text.1915:
अधिमुक्तिसार Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) (In Buddhistic
literature.) Being quite comprehension, being thoroughly
addicted to comprehending. E. अधिमुक्ति and सार.
text.1916:
अधिमुह्य Tatpur. m. (-ह्यः) A name of Śākyamuni in
one of his thirty-four anterior births. E. मुह् with अधि,
kṛtya aff. यत्(?) or अधि and मुह्य. The word is doubtful.
text.1917:
अधियज्ञ I. Tatpur. m. (-ज्ञः)
1 The supreme sacrifice, the
sacrifice .
2 An influence superior to or pre
siding over sacrifice.
II. Avyayībh. (-ज्ञम्) Concerning or with respect to sa
crifice. E. अधि and यज्ञ.
text.1918:
अधियाङ्ग Tatpur.(?) n. (-ङ्गम्). The same as अधिकाङ्ग of
which it is given as a various reading. E. doubtful, per
haps instead of अध्याङ्ग (अधि and आङ्ग), or of अधिकाङ्ग,
with य् in the place of क्.
text.1919:
अधिरथ Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्) Being on or
above a car.
II. m. (-थः)
1 A charioteer.
2 The proper name of a
charioteer who was a prince and descendant of Anu and
of Anga, a son of Satyakarman and foster father of Karṇa.
E. अधि and रथ.
text.1920:
अधिरथि m. (-थिः). See उदरथि of which it occurs as a
various reading.
text.1921:
अधिराज् Tatpur. m. (-राट्) A supreme king or ruler. E.
अधि and राज्.
text.1922:
अधिराज Tatpur. m. (-जः). The same as the preceding. E.
अधि and राजन्, samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.1923:
अधिराजन् Tatpur. m. (-जा). The same as अधिराज्. E.
अधि and राजन्.
text.1924:
अधिराज्य Tatpur. n. (-ज्यम्)
1 Supreme sway.
2 Empire.
3 The name of a country, also read अधिराष्ट्र and अधि-
वाज्य. E. अधि and राज्य.
text.1925:
अधिराज्यभाज् Tatpur. m. (-क्) An emperor, a paramount
sovereign. E. अधिराज्य and भाज्.
text.1926: अधिराष्ट्र Tatpur. n. (-ष्ट्रम्). See अधिराज्य. E. अधि and राष्ट्र.
text.1927:
अधिरुक्म Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्मः-क्मा-क्मम्) Wearing gold.
E. अधि and रुक्म.
text.1928:
अधिरूढ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्) Ascended or gone over,
lit. or fig., act. or pass., person. or impersonally. E. रुह्
with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1929:
अधिरोपण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Causing to ascend, placing over.
E. रुह् with अधि, in the caus., kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1930:
अधिरोपित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Placed over, lit.
or fig. E. रुह् with अधि, in the caus., kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1931:
अधिरोह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Surmounting, ascending, over
topping. E. रुह् with अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.1932:
अधिरोहण Tatpur. I. n. (-णम्) Ascending, surmounting, over
topping.
II. f. (-णी) A ladder, a staircase. See also अधिरोहिणी.
E. रुह् with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1933:
अधिरोहिन् Tatp. I. m. f. n. (-ही-हिणी-हि) Who rises on or above.
II. f. (-णी) A ladder, a staircase. See अधिरोहणी. E.
रुह् with अधि, kṛt aff. णिनि(?).
text.1934:
अधिलोकम् Avyayībh. Concerning or relating to the world.
A chapter in the Upanishads treating thereon comprises
the subjects: earth, sky, æther, wind. E. अधि and लोक.
text.1935:
अधिवक्तृ Tatpur. m. (-क्ता) I. A partisan, an advocate. E. वच्
with अधि, kṛt aff. तृच्.
II. One who speaks in a superior manner, very eloquent.
E. अधि and वक्तृ.
text.1936:
अधिवचन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) I. Advocating, speaking in
favour of another. E. वच् with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
II. A name, an appellation. E. अधि and वचन.
text.1937:
अधिवस्त्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्त्रः-स्त्रा-स्त्रम्) Wearing cloth or
raiment. E. अधि and वस्त्र.
text.1938:
अधिवाज्य n. (-ज्यम्) The name of a country; see अधिराज्य
which seems to be the more correct reading of this word.
text.1939:
अधिवास Tatpur. m. (-सः) I.
1 One who dwells above others.
2 One who dwells near others, a neighbour.
3 An in
habitant.
4 An abode, a place or situation. E. वस् (to
dwell &c.) with अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
II. A cover, an upper garment. Also अधीवास. E. वस्
(to cover with dress) with अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
III. Continuance, perseverance, esp. fig.: fixing one's
self at a person's door in order to enforce compliance with
some demand. E. वस् (वसु) with अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
IV.
1 Perfuming or dressing the person &c.; (as materials and
objects of toilet by which this is done, are enumerated the fol
lowing: मृत्तिका, गन्धः, शिला, धान्यम्, दूर्वा, पुष्पम्, फलम्,
दधि, घृतम्, स्वस्तिकम्, सिन्दूरम्, शङ्खः, कज्जलम्, रोचना, श्वे-
तसर्षपः, स्वर्णम्, रौप्यम्, ताम्रम्, चामरम्, दर्पणम्, दीपः, प्रश-
स्तपात्रम्).
2 See अधिवासन. E. वास् with अधि, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.1940:
अधिवासन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) I.
1 Perfuming or dressing the per
son &c. (see अधिवास IV. 1.).
2 A religious ceremony, pre
liminary to any great Hindu festival: touching a vessel
containing perfumes, flowers and other things previously
presented to an idol, or offering perfumes &c. to it. E. वास्
with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
II.
1 A summoning and fixing of the presence of a divinity upon
an image &c., when he is wanted for any solemnity.
2 The
placing of a new image in water &c. the day before the divinity
is to be summoned to inhabit it.
3 The same as अधिवास III.
E. वस् (वसु) with अधि, in the caus., kṛt aff. युच्(?).
text.1941:
अधिवासभूमि Tatpur. f. (-मिः) A dwelling place. E. अधिवास
and भूमि.
text.1942:
अधिवासित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) I. Invested with. E.
वस् (to cover with dress) with अधि, in the caus., kṛt aff. क्त.
II. Perfumed, scented. E. वास् with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1943:
अधिवासिता f. (-ता) Residence, staying or abiding in one
place. Also अधिवासित्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अधिवासिन्, taddh.
aff. तल् or त्व.
text.1944:
अधिवासिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सी-सिनी-सि) Staying or
abiding in one place. E. वस् with अधि, kṛt aff. णिनि(?).
text.1945:
अधिवाहन Bahuvr. m. (-नः) A proper name; acc. to some,
a son of Anga. E. अधि and वाहन.
text.1946:
अधिविद्यम् Avyayībh. Concerning or relating to knowledge. A
chapter in the Upanishads treating thereon comprises the sub
jects: teacher, pupil, science and expounding. E. अधि and विद्या.
text.1947:
अधिविन्ना Tatpur. f. (-न्ना) (In law.) A wife whose husband has
subsequently married others; a superseded wife. E. विद् (विदॢ)
with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त, or according to another etym. a Bahuvr.
of अधि and विन्न, taken either in the sense of विन्ना or विन्नम्.
text.1948:
अधिवेत्तव्या Tatpur. f. (-व्या) A wife deserving or proper to be
superseded by her husband marrying another. Also अधिवेद्या
or अधिवेदनीया. E. विद् (विदॢ) with अधि, kṛtya aff. तव्य.
text.1949:
अधिवेत्तृ Tatpur. m. (-त्ता) A man marrying another than
his first wife. E. विद् (विदॢ) with अधि, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.1950:
अधिवेदन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Marrying again, whilst a former
wife is living. E. विद् (विदॢ) with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1951:
अधिवेदनीया Tatpur. f. (-या). The same as अधिवेत्तव्या. E.
विद् (विदॢ) with अधि, kṛtya aff. अनीयर्.
text.1952:
अधिवेदम् Avyayībh. Concerning or with respect to the Veda.
E. अधि and वेद.
text.1953:
अधिवेद्या Tatpur. f. (-द्या). The same as अधिवेत्तव्या. E. विद्
(विदॢ) with अधि, kṛtya aff. यत्.
text.1954:
अधिशयित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Lain or slept over or
upon; used either in an active or passive sense, personally
or impersonally. E. शी with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1955:
अधिश्रयण Tatpur. I. n. (-णम्) Placing over the fire a pot &c.
(the reverse of अवश्रयण q. v.); also as a sacrificial act which
occurs in several sacrifices, the Darśapūrṇamāsa, Vājapeya &c.
II. f. (-णी) A furnace or fire-place. E. श्रि with अधि,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्, in the fem. with ङीप्.
text.1956:
अधिश्रयणीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Relating to the अधि-
श्रयण q. v. E. अधिश्रयण, taddh. aff. छ.
text.1957:
अधिश्रित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Placed over the fire.
E. श्रि with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1958:
अधिषवण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) (ved.) The name of two wooden
boards, on which the juice of the Soma plant was expressed
and where the Somābhiṣava (q. v.) was placed, in sacrifices
as the Jyotiṣṭoma or those sharing in the principal rites
of it. E. सू with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1959:
अधिष्ठातृ Tatp. I. m. f. n. (-ता-त्री-तृ) Governing, directing, ruling.
II. m. (-ता)
1 A ruler, a governor, a superintendent.
2 (According to the doctrine of the Pāśupatas) Īśvara,
the superintending or ruling providence. (In the feminine
esp. in conjunction with देवता, a ruling or tutelary divinity.)
E. स्था with अधि, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.1960:
अधिष्ठान Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Abiding, resting upon.
2 Site,
situation.
3 A town.
4 (In architecture.) Base, basement.
5 Power, dignity, superintendence.
6 Prescribed rule, fixed
practice.
7 A wheel.
8 Approaching.
9 (In Buddhistic litera
ture.) Benediction. E. स्था with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.1961:
अधिष्ठानशरीर Karmadh. n. (-रम्) (In Sāṅkhya phil.) According
to some, an intermediate body between the लिङ्गशरीर and स्थूल-
शरीर (qq. vv.), one that is supposed to enable the subtle body
to assume the corporeity of gross body. E. अधिष्ठान and शरीर.
text.1962:
अधिष्ठायक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यकः-यिका-यकम्) Superintending,
governing. E. स्था with अधि, kṛt aff. ण्वुल् and āgama युक्.
text.1963:
अधिष्ठित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Fixed, determined, estab
lished; literally or figuratively, as a house or a practice.
2 Inha
bited, occupied.
3 Supervised, superintended, guarded.
4 Ap
pointed.
5 Superintending, inhabiting, occupying. Used act. or
pass., person. or impersonally. E. स्था with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1964:
अधिस्त्री I. Tatpur. f. (-स्त्री) A superior or excellent woman.
II. Avyayībh. (-स्त्रि) Used in the same sense as the lo
cative of स्त्री. E. अधि and स्त्री.
text.1965:
अधिहरि Avyayībh. Used in the same sense as the locative
of हरि. E. अधि and हरि.
text.1967:
अधीगर्थ Bahuvr. m. (-र्थः) (In grammatical terminology.)
A radical having the sense of remembering. E. इक् (the
technical form of इ in the sense of remembering) with अधि,
and अर्थ; scil. धातु.
text.1968:
अधीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Read, obtained &c. E.
इ (इङ् or इक्) with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1969:
अधीतवेद Bahuvr. m. (-दः) A Brahman, who has read the Vedas;
a student who has finished his course of study. E. अधीत and वेद.
text.1970:
अधीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Study, perusal.
2 (ved.) Recollec
tion, desire. E. इ (
1 इङ्,
2 इक्) with अधि, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.1971:
अधीतिन् m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) Well read in, conversant
with, versed in (with a noun in the locative; f. i. अधीती
व्याकरणे, versed in grammar). E. अधीत, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.1972:
अधीन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 Dependant.
2 Docile. E.
अधि and इन ‘having a master over one's self’. This word
and the etymology as mentioned, are given by the native
lexicographers; but according to the best grammatical autho
rities अधीन would not exist as a real word. Words as रा-
जाधीन, ब्राह्मणाधीन and the like, are explained by them as
coming from राजाधि (राजन् and अधि), ब्राह्मणाधि (ब्राह्मण
and अधि) with taddh. aff. ख, or by others as derived from रा-
जन्, ब्राह्मण with taddh. aff. सधीनन्; it would seem therefore
that the use of अधीन as an independant word is grammatically
not correct. But see अध्यधीन and अनधीनक.
text.1973:
अधीनता f. (-ता) Subjection, dependance, slavery: so अधी-
नत्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अधीन, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व. The gram
matical correctness of this word is questionable; see the E.
of the preceding.
text.1974:
अधीमन्थ Tatpur. m. (-न्थः). The same as अधिमन्थ q. v.; the
vowel in अधि being lengthened.
text.1975:
अधीयत् Tatpur. I. m. (-यन्) A student who reads the Veda &c.
with facility or ease. See अधीयान. E. इ (इङ्) with अधि,
kṛt aff. शतृ.
II. m. f. n. (-यन्-यती-यत्) Remembering. E. इ (इक्)
with अधि, kṛt aff. शतृ.
text.1976:
अधीयान m. (-नः) A student, one going over or reading the
Vedas &c. E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. शानच्.
text.1977:
अधीर Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Unsteady, unstable
(lit. or met.).
2 Perplexed, confused, not possessed of self
command.
3 Unwise.
II. f. (-रा)
1 Lightning.
2 (In rhetoric.) A cross or ca
pricious mistress, one not possessed of self-command; with
two varieties, the मध्या or adolescent dame who will ‘as
sail her lover with harsh speeches’ and the प्रगल्भा or
प्रौढा or mature dame who will ‘scold and beat him’.
See also धीरा and धीराधीरा. E. अ neg. and धीर.
text.1978:
अधीरता f. (-ता) Fickleness, unsteadiness; also अधीरत्व n.
(-त्वम्). E. अधीर, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.1979:
अधीवास Tatpur. m. (-सः). The same as अधिवास II., the इ
in अधि being made long.
text.1980: अधीश Tatpur. m. (-शः) A master, a lord. E. अधि and ईश.
text.1981:
अधीश्वर Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 An emperor, a king paramount
over all the neighbouring princes.
2 An Arhat, according
to the Jainas. E. अधि and ईश्वर.
text.1982:
अधीष्ट Tatpur. I. m. (-ष्टः) One requested or honourably engaged
to assume a duty, as a teacher &c. (not one hired for money).
II. n. (-ष्टम्) An honourable occupation. E. इष् with अधि,
kṛt aff. क्त.
text.1983:
अधुना ind. Now, at present. E. अश् (i. e. अ, considered as
a substitute of इदम्), taddh. aff. अधुना.
text.1984:
अधुनातन m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Of or belonging to the
present. E. अधुना, taddh. aff. ट्यु and āgama तुट्.
text.1985:
अधुर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Having no load (as a
cart). E. अ priv. and धुर्, samāsānta aff. अ.
text.1986:
अधृत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unheld, undetained.
II. m. (-तः) A name of Viṣṇu. E. अ neg. and धृत.
text.1987:
अधृति I. Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Laxity, want of firm hold.
2 Want of steadiness or firmness. (In rhetoric described as
one of the conditions connected with the Rasa Śṛṅgāra
q. v.) E. अ neg. and धृति.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति) Having no steadiness
or firmness. E. अ priv. and धृति.
text.1988:
अधृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Ashamed, modest,
humble.
2 Not overcome, invincible. E. अ neg. and धृष्ट.
text.1989:
अधृष्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्)
1 Proud, vain.
2 Irresistible, invincible.
II. f. (-ष्या) The name of a river. E. अ neg. and धृष्य.
text.1990:
अधेनु Tatpur. f. (-नुः) A cow that does not yield milk. E.
अ deter. and धेनु.
text.1991:
अधैर्य I. Tatpur. n. (-र्यम्) Instability, want of firmness. E.
अ neg. and धैर्य.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Unsteady, feeble, ir
resolute. E. अ priv. and धैर्य.
text.1992: अधोऽशुक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) A lower garment. E. अधस् and अंशुक.
text.1993:
अधोअक्ष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) (ved.) Being under the
axle of a car or under a car. See अधोऽक्ष. E. अधस् and अक्ष.
text.1994:
अधोऽक्ष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्). The same as अधो-
अक्ष. E. अधस् and अक्ष.
text.1995:
अधोऽक्षज Tatpur. m. (-जः)
1 A name of Kṛṣṇa.
2 The sign
Śravaṇā. Also written अधोक्षज. E. अधस्-अक्ष and ज;
‘Kṛṣṇa, as a child, killed, when lying under a car, Pūtanā,
a female fiend who was hovering over it in the shape of a
bird, and thus, as it were, was born again (under the car)’;
or according to others, from अधोक्ष, the name of a Ṛṣi,
and ज, ‘a son of Adhoksha’; or, ‘because he is produced by
or to such as have subdued or cast down their passions,
i. e. because he becomes visible to them’; or a Bahuvr. from
अधस् and अक्षज (n. knowledge derived from the senses;
m. pl. living beings), ‘because he has subdued all untrue
knowledge or because he is superior to all living beings’.
text.1996:
अधोगत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Descended, gone
down, lit. or fig. E. अधस् and गत.
text.1997:
अधोगति I. Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Going downwards, lit. or fig.
as degradation, going into hell &c.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति) Descending, going down
wards, lit. or fig. E. अधस् and गति. In the same sense
अधोगम Tatpur. m. (-मः) and अधोगमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्).
text.1998:
अधोगामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Descending,
going downwards. See the preceding. E. अधस् and गामिन्.
text.1999:
अधोघण्ठा Bahuvr. f. (-ण्टा) A plant (Acheranthes aspera).
See अपामार्ग. E. अधस् and घण्टा.
text.2000:
अधोऽङ्ग Tatpur. n. (-ङ्गम्)
1 The anus.
2 Pudendum muliebre;
also written अधोङ्ग. E. अधस् and अङ्ग.
text.2001:
अधोजानु Avyayībh. Under the knee, lower than the knee.
E. अधस् and जानु.
text.2002:
अधोजिह्विका Tatpur. f. (-का) The uvula or soft palate. E.
अधस् and जिह्विका.
text.2003:
अधोदारु Tatpur. m. n. (-रुः-रु) The under timber (of a
pillar &c.). E. अधस् and दारु.
text.2004:
अधोदिश् Tatpur. f. (-दिक्)
1 The lower region.
2 The
Nadir. E. अधस् and दिश्.
text.2005:
अधोदृष्टि I. Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) A downcast look.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ष्टिः-ष्टिः-ष्टि) Downcast, one who
looks down. E. अधस् and दृष्टि.
text.2006:
अधोदेश Tatpur. m. (-शः)
1 The bottom, the lowest part.
2 The lower part of the body. E. अधस् and देश.
text.2007:
अधोद्वार Tatpur. n. (-रम्)
1 The anus.
2 Pudendum muliebre.
E. अधस् and द्वार.
text.2008:
अधोनाभम् Avyayībh. Under the navel. E. अधस् and नाभि,
samāsānta aff. अ.
text.2009:
अधोपहास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Copulation, coition. E. This
word occurs only in the Upan. and seems to be an irre
gular compound formed of the phrase अध उप ह आस,
‘she was or lay under (him)’.
text.2010:
अधोबन्धन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) An under girth or strap. E.
अधस् and बन्धन.
text.2011:
अधोभक्त Tatpur. n. (-क्तम्) (In medicine.) A medicament
which is to be taken after eating; one of the ten kinds of
medicaments classified according to the time of their appli
cation; see besides निर्भक्त, प्राग्भक्त, मध्येभक्त, अन्तराभक्त,
सभक्त, सामुद्ग, मुहुर्मुहुर्ग्रास (which is twofold) and ग्रा-
सान्तर. E. अधस् and भक्त, scil. औषध.
text.2012:
अधोभव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Placed below, inferior.
E. अधस् and भव.
text.2013:
अधोभाग Tatpur. m. (-गः)
1 The bottom, the lowest part.
2 The lower part of the body. E. अधस् and भाग.
text.2014:
अधोभागदोषहर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Removing or
curing diseases of the lower part of the body (as a me
dicine). E. अधोभाग-दोष and हर.
text.2015:
अधोभुवन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The world below, the regions
below the earth. E. अधस् and भुवन.
text.2016:
अधोभूमि Tatpur. f. (-मिः) A place or land below (such as
land at the foot of a mountain &c.). E. अधस् and भूमि.
text.2017: अधोमर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) The anus. E. अधस् and मर्मन्.
text.2018:
अधोमुख Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-खः-खा or खी-खम्)
1 Downlooked,
looking downwards.
2 Inverted, turned upside down, headlong.
II. m. (-खः) A name of Viṣṇu.
III. f. (-खा) A plant (Premna esculenta). See गोजिह्वा.
IV. n. (-खम्) A division of Naraka or hell. See अधःशिरस्.
E. अधस् and मुख; in the fem. with aff. टाप् or ङीष्.
text.2019:
अधोयन्त्र Tatpur. n. (-न्त्रम्) A still, or the lower of two vessels
luted together for distilling, sublimation &c. E. अधस् and यन्त्र.
text.2020:
अधोरक्तपित्त Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्) (In medicine.) See अधोऽस्रपित्त.
E. अधस् and रक्तपित्त.
text.2021:
अधोराम Tatpur. m. (-मः) (ved.) White--(or according to
others, dark)--coloured on the lower part of the body, an
epithet of the goat, one of the twelve ऐकादशिन (q. v.)
animals in the Aśvamedha sacrifice. E. अधस् and राम.
text.2022:
अधोलम्ब Tatpur. m. (-म्बः) The perpendicular. Also अव-
लम्ब, वलम्ब and लम्ब. E. अधस् and लम्ब.
text.2023:
अधोलोक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The regions below the earth. E.
अधस् and लोक.
text.2024:
अधोवदन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्). The same as अधो-
मुख q. v. E. अधस् and वदन.
text.2025:
अधोवश Tatpur. m. (-शः)
1 The bottom of a thing.
2 Pu
dendum muliebre. E. अधस् and वश.
text.2026:
अधोवायु Tatpur. m. (-युः)
1 The vital air that passes down
wards, one of the five vital airs.
2 Ventris crepitus. E.
अधस् and वायु.
text.2027:
अधोऽस्रपित्त Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्) (In medicine.) A kind of ple
thora, ‘when blood is discharged from the anus and urethra’.
Also written अधोस्रपित्त. E. अधस् and अस्रपित्त.
text.2028:
अध्यक्ष Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्)
1 Perceptible, present
to the senses.
2 Superintending, presiding over.
II. m. (-क्षः)
1 A superintendent in general, one of receipts
and disbursements.
2 A plant (a species of Mimusops). See
क्षीरिका and फलाध्यक्ष. E. अधि and अक्ष, or more correctly, as
also mentioned in the native etym., अक्ष् with अधि, kṛt aff. अच्.
text.2029:
अध्यक्षरम् Avyayībh. Above all other letters (in importance
or in place; being often put at the head of various writings,
as the mysterious syllable ओम्). E. अधि and अक्षर.
text.2030:
अध्यग्नि Avyayībh. (In law.) Property given to the wife at
the time of her marriage, one of the six items of woman's
peculiar property. See स्त्रीधन. E. अधि and अग्नि; lit.
(presented) over the (nuptial) fire.
text.2031:
अध्यग्निकृत Tatpur. n. (-तम्). The same as the preceding. E.
अध्यग्नि and कृत; sc. स्त्रीधन (q. v.).
text.2032:
अध्यग्न्युपागत Tatpur. n. (-तम्). The same as the preceding.
E. अध्यग्नि and उपागत; sc. स्त्रीधन (q. v.).
text.2033:
अध्यञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ध्यङ्-धीची-ध्यक्) Superior, best. E.
अञ्च् (I. 1.) with अधि, kṛt aff. क्विन्, in the fem. with aff.
ङीप्. For the declension of this word see अञ्च् II.
text.2034:
अध्यण्डा Bahuvr. f. (-ण्डा)
1 Cowach. See अव्यङ्गा and कपिकच्छु.
2 According to others a synonyme of भूम्यामलकी. E. अधि
and अण्ड ‘having excellent seed’(?).
text.2035:
अध्यधिक्षेप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Excessive censure. E. अधि and
अधिक्षेप.
text.2036:
अध्यधीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Very dependant,
slave by birth. E. अधि and अधीन, or अध्यधि, taddh. aff.
ख; see the E. of अधीन.
text.2037:
अध्ययन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Study, reading, especially of the
sacred books; one of the six duties of a Brahman. E. इ
(इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2038:
अध्ययनतपस् Dwandwa n. du. (-सी) Study and penance.
(Only used in the dual.) E. अध्ययन and तपस्.
text.2039:
अध्ययनपुण्य Tatpur. n. (-ण्यम्) Religions merit or purity
which is in the study of the sacred works. E. अध्ययन (in
the sense of the locative) and पुण्य.
text.2040:
अध्ययनीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) To be read or
studied. E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛtya aff. अनीयर्.
text.2041:
अध्यर्ध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्धः-र्धा-र्धम्) One and a half, having
an extra half. See also सार्ध. (In derivatives of compounds
the first part of which is अध्यर्ध and which have the meaning of
‘measuring or weighing, worth, containing, bought for, pro
duced from, consisting of &c.’, the affix which would be re
quired, is dropped in many instances; see f. i. अध्यर्धकंस,
अध्यर्धशूर्प &c.) E. अधि and अर्ध.
text.2042:
अध्यर्धक m. f. n. (-र्धकः-र्धिका-र्धकम्) Bought for or worth,
containing, produced from &c. one and a half. E. अध्यर्ध,
taddh. aff. कन्.
text.2043:
अध्यर्धकंस (accord. to some) Dwigu I. m. n. (-सः-सम्) One
Kansa (q. v.) and a half.
II. m. f. n. (-सः-सी-सम्) Containing, measuring, consist
ing of, bought for &c. one Kansa (q. v.) and a half. E.
अध्यर्ध and कंस; in the meaning II. the taddh. aff. टिठन्
is considered as dropped.
text.2044:
अध्यर्धकाकिणीक (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्)
Weighing, worth, consisting of, bought for &c. one Kākiṇī
(q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध-काकिणी (accord. to some,
Dwigu), taddh. aff. ईकन्.
text.2045:
अध्यर्धकार्षापण (accord. to some) Dwigu I. m. n. (-णः-णम्)
One Kārṣāpaṇa (q. v.) and a half.
II. m. f. n. (-णः-णी-णम्) Weighing, worth, consisting of,
bought for &c. one Kārṣāpaṇa (q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध
and कार्षापण; in the meaning II. the taddh. aff. टिठन् is
considered as dropped. See also अध्यर्धकार्षापणिक.
text.2046:
अध्यर्धकार्षापणिक (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-कः-की-
कम्) Weighing, worth, consisting of, bought for &c. one
Kārṣāpaṇa (q. v.) and a half. See also अध्यर्धकार्षापण II.
E. अध्यर्धकार्षापण (I.), taddh. aff. टिठन्.
text.2047:
अध्यर्धखारीक (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्)
Measuring, containing, consisting of, bought for &c. one
Khārī (q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध-खारी (accord. to some,
Dwigu), taddh. aff. ईकन्.
text.2048:
अध्यर्धपण्य (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-ण्यः-ण्या-ण्यम्)
Measuring or weighing, consisting of, bought for &c. one
Paṇa (q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध-पण (accord. to some,
Dwigu), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.2049:
अध्यर्धपाद्य (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्)
Measuring &c. one foot and a half. E. अध्यर्ध-पाद (accord.
to some, Dwigu), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.2050:
अध्यर्धप्रतिक (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्). The
same as अध्यर्धकार्षापण II. E. अध्यर्ध-प्रति (acc. to some, Dwigu)
(considered as a substitute of कार्षापण), taddh. aff. टिठन्.
text.2051:
अध्यर्धमाष्य (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) Weigh
ing, consisting of, bought for &c. one Māṣa (q. v.) and a half.
E. अध्यर्धमाष (accord. to some, Dwigu), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.2052:
अध्यर्धविंशतिकीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Measuring, worth,
consisting of, bought for &c. twenty and a half (i. e.
thirty). E. अध्यर्ध-विंशतिक, taddh. aff. ख.
text.2053:
अध्यर्धशत I. Dwandwa(?) n. (-तम्) Hundred and fifty.
II. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Measuring, worth, consist
ing of, bought for &c. hundred and fifty. E. अध्यर्ध and
शत; in the meaning II. the aff. यत् is considered as dropped.
See also अध्यर्धशत्य.
text.2054:
अध्यर्धशतमान (accord. to some) Dwigu I. m. n. (-नः-नम्)
One Śatamāna (q. v.) and a half.
II. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Measuring, worth, consisting of,
bought for &c. one Śatamāna (q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध
and शतमान; in the meaning II. the taddh. aff. अण् is con
sidered as dropped. See also अध्यर्धशातमान.
text.2055:
अध्यर्धशत्य m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) Measuring, worth, con
sisting of, bought for &c. hundred and fifty. See also
अध्यर्धशत. E. अध्यर्धशत (I.), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.2056:
अध्यर्धशाण (accord. to some) Dwigu I. m. (-णः) One Śāṇa (q. v.)
and a half.
II. m. f. n. (-णः-णी-णम्) Weighing, worth, consisting
of, bought for &c. one Śāṇa (q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध
and शाण; in the meaning II. the taddh. aff. ठञ् is con
sidered as dropped. See also the following.
text.2057:
अध्यर्धशाण्य (acc. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-ण्यः-ण्या-ण्यम्) Weigh
ing, worth, consisting of, bought for &c. one Śāṇa (q. v.) and a
half. See also the preceding. E. अध्यर्धशाण (I.), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.2058:
अध्यर्धशातमान (accord. to some) Dwigu m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्)
Measuring, worth, consisting of, bought for &c. one Śatamāna
and a half. See also अध्यर्धशतमान. E. अध्यर्धशतमान (I.), taddh.
aff. अण्, with Vṛddhi in the latter part of the compound.
text.2059:
अध्यर्धशूर्प (accord. to some) Dwigu I. m. n. (-र्पः-र्पम्) One Śūrpa
and a half.
II. m. f. n. (-र्पः-र्पी-र्पम्) Measuring, worth, consisting of,
bought for &c. one Śūrpa and a half. E. अध्यर्ध and शूर्प; in
the meaning II. the taddh. aff. अञ् or ठक् is considered as
dropped.
text.2060:
अध्यर्धसहस्र I. Dwandwa(?) n. (-स्रम्) Thousand and a half
(i. e. thousand five hundred).
II. m. f. n. (-स्रः-स्रा-स्रम्) Measuring, consisting of, worth,
bought fort &c. thousand five hundred. E. अध्यर्ध and सहस्र;
in the meaning II. the taddh. aff. अण् is considered as
dropped. See also अध्यर्धसाहस्र.
text.2061:
अध्यर्धसाहस्र m. f. n. (-स्रः-स्री-स्रम्) Measuring, consisting of, worth,
bought for &c. thousand five hundred. E. अध्यर्धसहस्र (I.),
taddh. aff. अण् with Vṛddhi in the latter part of the compound.
text.2062:
अध्यर्धसुवर्ण (accord. to some) Dwigu I. m. n. (-र्णः-र्णम्)
One Suvarṇa (q. v.) and a half.
II. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णी-र्णम्) Weighing, consisting of, worth,
bought for &c. one Suvarṇa (q. v.) and a half. E. अध्यर्ध
and सुवर्ण; in the meaning II. the taddh. aff. ठक् is con
sidered as dropped. See also the following.
text.2063:
अध्यर्धसौवर्णिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Weighing, produced
from, worth, bought for &c. one Suvarṇa (q. v.) and a
half. See also the preceding. E. अध्यर्धसुवर्ण (I.), taddh. aff.
ठक्, with Vṛddhi in the latter part of the compound.
text.2064:
अध्यर्बुद Tatpur. n. (-दम्) An indolent swelling, the growth
of which begins in the embryo and which is considered in
curable. According to the native commentaries it is a he
reditary disease and in so far always also द्विरर्बुद (q. v.),
though the latter is distinct from it in some respects. E.
अधि and अर्बुद; ‘an Arbuda or indolent swelling which
reaches beyond (scil.) birth’, i. e. which takes place prior
to birth.
text.2065:
अध्यवसान Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Determining, ascertaining.
2 Effort,
energy.
3 (In rhetoric.) The simple enunciation of elliptic
or figurative speech without qualifying it by epithets &c.,
as it were, leaving it on its own effort; such sentences as
श्वेतो धावति ‘the white (horse) gallops’, कुन्ताः प्रविशन्ति
‘(men with) lances enter’ (see also under अजहत्स्वार्था), or
कलिङ्गः साहसिकः ‘the (inhabitant of) Kalinga is impetuous’
(see also under जहत्स्वार्था) would be lakṣaṇās or elliptic
expressions by अध्यवसान, while अश्वः श्वेतो धावति the
white horse gallops, एते कुन्ताः प्रविशन्ति these (men with)
lances enter, कलिङ्गः पुरुषो युध्यते the man (inhabitant of)
Kalinga fights would be qualified or lakṣaṇās by आरोप
q. v. (See also under लक्षणा.) Or मुखं द्वितीयश्चन्द्रः, (her)
face is another moon, would be an अतिशयोक्ति (q. v.) or
hyperbole in virtue of अध्यवसान, the comparison as it
were resting on its own merit. E. सो with अव and अधि,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2066:
अध्यवसाय Tatpur. m. (-यः)
1 Ascertainment, determining.
2 As
siduous application, effort, energy.
3 (In philosophy.) The
specific function of बुद्धि or intellect (q. v.), apprehension
by intellect, its taking hold of an object either by ascertain
ment or volition.
4 (In rhetoric.) The same as अध्यवसान.
E. सो with अव and अधि, kṛt aff. ण and āgama युक्.
text.2067:
अध्यवसायित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Undertaken, at
tempted as a difficult task. E. सो with अव and अधि, in
the caus., kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2068:
अध्यवसायिन् m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Resolute, determined.
E. अध्यवसाय, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2069:
अध्यवसित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Determined, as
certained.
2 Apprehended by intellect. See अध्यवसाय. E.
सो with अव and अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2070:
अध्यशन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Eating too often, taking food
before that previously eaten is digested. E. अधि and
अशन.
text.2071:
अध्यस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्)
1 Placed over.
2 Sub
stituted, supposed erroneously, misconceived: as a snake
when that so perceived is actually a piece of rope. E. अस्
with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2072:
अध्यस्थि Tatpur. n. (-स्थि) A bone grown over another bone.
E. अधि and अस्थि.
text.2073:
अध्यात्म I. Tatpur. n. (-त्मम्) The supreme soul or आत्मन्
(q. v.), sometimes considered as identical with प्राण (q. v.)
and, in the sectarian doctrine, especially with Nārāyaṇa
or Viṣṇu.
II. Avyayībh. (-त्मम्) Concerning or relating to soul, life
&c.; see आत्मन्. A chapter in the Upan. treating thereon con
tains the following subjects: the lower jaw, the upper jaw,
speech and tongue; another passage comprises under this
topic
1 the vital airs: prāṇa, apāna, vyāna, udāna, samāna,
2 the organs of sensation: eyes, ears, manas, speech, skin
(tvach) and
3 the elementary parts of the body: skin (char
man), flesh, tendons, bones, marrow. E. अधि and आत्मन्,
samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.2074:
अध्यात्मज्ञान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The knowledge of the supreme
spirit or of the nature of ātman or soul. E. अध्यात्म (I. or
II.) and ज्ञान.
text.2075:
अध्यात्मदृश् Tatpur. m. (-दृक्) A holy sage, one who knows
the nature of or what concerns ātman or the soul. E.
अध्यात्म (II.) and दृश्.
text.2076:
अध्यात्मरति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) An anchorite, one who de
lights in meditating on the nature of or what concerns
ātman or the soul. E. अध्यात्म (II.) and रति.
text.2077:
अध्यात्मविद् Tatpur. m. (-त्) One who knows the supreme
spirit or the nature of ātman or soul. E. अध्यात्म (I. or II.)
and विद्.
text.2078:
अध्यात्मविद्या Tatpur. f. (-द्या). The same as अध्यात्मज्ञान.
E. अध्यात्म and विद्या.
text.2079:
अध्यात्मिक m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्). See आध्यात्मिक which is
the more correct form of this word.
text.2080:
अध्यापक Tatpur. m. (-कः)
1 A teacher, esp. one who instructs
in the sacred books.
2 (According to a legend in the Calcutta
edition of the Harivanśa.) One of the sixteen Ṛtvijs (q. v.)
or priests, who was produced together with the Neṣṭṛ from
the thighs of Purushottama. The reading of the commen
tary, however, is अच्छावाक (q. v.) and the list of priests
mentioned there is differently given in the manuscripts; अ-
ध्यापक does not usually occur as the name of a Ṛtvij. (In
the first meaning अध्यापक may be the latter part of Tatpur.
compounds, the former of which stands in the sense of the
genitive (f. i. ब्राह्मणाध्यापक one who instructs a Brāhmana)
and as the latter part of several Karmadh. compounds; see
f. i. कुमाराध्यापक, कठाध्यापक.) E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, in
the caus., kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
text.2081:
अध्यापकोदित Karmadh. m. (-तः) One who is called or spoken
of as a teacher. E. अध्यापक and उदित.
text.2082:
अध्यापन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Instructing, teaching the sacred
books, one of the six duties of a Brahman. E. इ (इङ्) with
अधि; in the caus., kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2083:
अध्यापयितृ Tatpur. m. (-ता). The same as अध्यापक 1. E.
इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.2084:
अध्याप्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्) Fit to, capable of
being instructed (esp. in the sacred writings). E. इ (इङ्)
with अधि, in the caus., kṛtya aff. यत्.
text.2085:
अध्याय Tatpur. m. (-यः) I.
1 A section of a book (f. i. of the
Ṛgveda, Yajurveda, Aitareyabrāhmaṇa, Pāniṇis grammar
&c.).
2 Reading, studying. E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
II. One who reads or studies (in this sense only as the
latter part of a compound; f. i. वेदाध्यायः one who reads
the Veda). E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. अण्.
text.2086:
अध्यायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Reading, studying.
E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2087:
अध्यारूढ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्)
1 Mounted on, placed
above; used either in an active or passive sense, person. or
impersonally.
2 Exceeding, more (with a noun in the in
strum.)
3 Inferior, less (with a noun in the ablative). E. रुह्
with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2088:
अध्यारोप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Fixing in or upon, transferring;
but more especially used in philosophy, in the sense of
transferring or attributing erroneously the predicates, nature
&c. of one object to another, as those of a serpent to those
of a rope &c. See अध्यास. E. रुह्, in the caus., with आ
and अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2089:
अध्यारोपन Tatpur. n. (-नम्). The same as the preceding.
E. रुह्, in the caus., with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2090:
अध्यारोपित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Transferred or
attributed erroneously.
2 Hyperbolical, exaggerated. E. रुह्,
in the caus., with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2091:
अध्यावाप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Throwing or casting upon. E.
वप् with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2092:
अध्यावाहन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A second calling, a second in
vitation. See the following word of which it is the thema
tic form. E. अधि and आवाहन.
text.2093:
अध्यावाहनिक n. (-कम्) An item of a married woman's pro
perty. See स्त्रीधन. It is explained as the gift she takes
home from her father's house, when paying a visit to her
friends. E. अध्यावाहन, taddh. aff. ठन्.
text.2094:
अध्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः)
1 Putting, throwing in or upon.
2 (In
philosophy.) Transferring or attributing erroneously the
predicates, nature &c. of one object to another, as of a ser
pent to a rope &c. See अध्यारोप.
3 (In vaidik grammar.)
The appendage to a vaidik verse; according to some the
same as एकपदा q. v. E. अस्, to throw, in the caus., with
अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2095:
अध्यासन Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Sitting on or upon.
2 Presiding over,
ruling, inhabiting as chief. E. आस् with अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2096:
अध्यासयोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) In Buddhistic doctrine, one of
the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.), perhaps: excessive or profound
meditation. E. अध्यास and योग.
text.2097:
अध्यासित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Seated in or on.
2 Presiding
over.
3 Inhabited. E. आस्, in the caus., with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2098:
अध्यासिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सी-सिनी-सि) Sitting on or upon.
E. आस् with अधि, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2099:
अध्याहरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्). The same as अध्याहार. E. हृ
with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2100:
अध्याहरणीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्). The same as
अध्याहार्य q. v. E. हृ with आ and अधि, kṛtya aff. अनीयर्.
text.2101:
अध्याहर्तव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्). The same as
अध्याहार्य q. v. E. हृ with आ and अधि, kṛtya aff. तव्य.
text.2102:
अध्याहार Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 Adding a word or words to com
plete a sentence, supplying an ellipsis.
2 Reasoning, discuss
ing. See अध्याहरण. E. हृ with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2103:
अध्याहार्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्)
1 To be discussed or
argued.
2 To be added in order to complete a sentence, to
supply an ellipsis, as a word or words. E. हृ with आ and
अधि, kṛtya aff. ण्यत्.
text.2104:
अध्याहृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Discussed, argued.
2 Added to complete a sentence, to supply an ellipsis, as
a word or words. E. हृ with आ and अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2105:
अध्युषित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Inhabited.
2 Arrived
at, obtained. (See समयाध्युषित.) E. वस् with अधि, kṛt
aff. क्त and āgama इट्.
text.2106:
अध्युष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Bound or tied over, coiled
up. See the following. E. उच्छ् with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2107:
अध्युष्टवलय Bahuvr. m. (-यः) Having the ringlets coiled,
wound into rings. This word occurs in the poem Ānanda
laharī as the epithet of a serpent, to indicate that it is in
profound sleep, forming, then, three ringlets and a half;
the god Śiva is likened to a serpent coiled up in this man
ner, its half ringlet being compared to his Śakti or female
energy and the three others to the god as representing the
Trimūrti. E. अध्युष्ट and वलय.
text.2108:
अध्युष्ट्र Bahuvr. m. (-ष्ट्रः) A litter drawn or carried by a camel.
E. अधि and उष्ट्र.
text.2109:
अध्यूढ Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्)
1 Borne or placed over,
elevated.
2 Very prosperous, thriving.
3 Much, excessive.
II. m. (-ढः) A name of Śiva.
III. f. (-ढा) A superseded wife, one whose husband has
married others. E. वह् with अधि, kṛt aff. क्त. The com
mentaries explain I. 2. as derived from अधि, in the sense
of अधिक and ऊढ; II. as the god by whom the world has
been upheld ‘first’ and III. also as derived from अधि, in
the sense of ‘first’ and ऊढा married.
text.2110:
अध्यूध्नी Bahuvr. f. (-ध्नी) The penis (or according to another
interpretation perhaps, the urethra). This word occurs esp.
in the ritual works, in passages treating on the Agnisho
mīyapaśu (q. v.) and the ceremonies connected with it. E.
अधि and ऊधस्, samāsānta ādeśa अनङ् and fem. aff. ङीष्,
scil. इडा; literally: the tubular vessel above the scrotum.
text.2111:
अध्यूषिताश्व Bahuvr. m. (-श्वः) The name of a prince, a
descendant of Daśaratha. According to others his name
would be अभ्युत्थिताश्व or दूषिताश्व or विधृति. E. अध्यू-
षित (very diseased, from अधि and ऊषित) and अश्व.
text.2112:
अध्यूषिवस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षिवान्-षुषी-षिवस्) Having in
habited (in the sense of लुङ्, लङ् and लिट् qq. vv.). E. वस्
with अधि, kṛt aff. क्वसु.
text.2113:
अध्यूहन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Covering over, esp. with ashes and
coals. (Used principally in ritual works.) E. ऊह् with अधि,
kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2114:
अध्येतव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्). The same as अ-
ध्ययनीय. E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛtya aff. तव्य.
text.2115:
अध्येतृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) A student, one who reads or studies.
E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.2116:
अध्येय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्). The same as अध्येतव्य. E. इ
(इङ्) with अधि, kṛtya aff. यत्.
text.2117:
अध्येषण Tatpur. f. n. (-णा-णम्) Solicitation, asking, request.
E. इष् with अधि, kṛt aff. युच्.
text.2118:
अध्येष्यमाण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Parposing or be
ginning to read, to study. E. इ (इङ्) with अधि, in the
future (ऌट्), kṛt aff. शानच् and āgama मुक्.
text.2119:
अध्रि Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ध्रिः-ध्रिः-ध्रि) (ved.) Unrestrained,
irresistible. See the following. E. अ neg. and ध्रि.
text.2120:
अध्रिगु Bahuvr. m. (-गुः--n. pl. -गावः) (ved.)
1 Of un
restrained or irresistible course; esp. as an epithet of Indra,
Agni, Soma, the Rudras and the Aśvins.
2 The name of
a heavenly śamitṛ (q. v.) or killer of the sacrificial animal.
3 The name of a Praishamantra (q. v.) used in the cere
mony of the killing of the Agnīṣomīyapaśu (q. v.), and
beginning with the words दैव्याः शमितार आरभध्वमुत म-
नुष्या उपनयत मेध्याः &c. E. अध्रि and गो.
text.2121:
अध्रिज Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) (ved.) Irresistible. E.
doubtful; perhaps अ neg. and ध्रिज (from ध्रिज्).
text.2122:
अध्रिपुष्कलिका Bahuvr.(?) f. (-का) The name of a plant, a
species of Nāgavalli (Piper betel). E. अध्रि and पुष्कलिका.
text.2123:
अध्रियमाण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्)
1 Not held &c.
See धृ.
2 (In law.) Not alive, not surviving. E. अ neg.
and ध्रियमाण.
text.2124:
अध्रुव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्)
1 Not permanent, not
fixed, transient, perishable.
2 Uncertain, doubtful.
3 Not
vital, not essential for life (as a limb or part of the body).
E. अ neg. and ध्रुव.
text.2125:
अध्रुष Tatpur.(?) m. (-षः) (In medicine.) A disease of the
palate (see तालुरोग), described as ‘a hard swelling, of a
red colour, produced by (diseased) blood and accompanied
with pain and fever’. E. unknown.
text.2127:
अध्वग Tatp. I. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Travelling, being on the road.
II. m. (-गः)
1 A traveller.
2 A camel.
3 The sun.
III. f. (-गा)
1 A traveller.
2 A name of the river Ganges.
E. अध्वन् and ग.
text.2128: अध्वगत् Tatpur. m. (-गत्) A traveller. E. अध्वन् and गत्.
text.2129:
अध्वगत्यन्त Tatpur. m. (-न्तः) The same as the following, of
which it occurs as a various reading. E. अध्वन् and गति-
अन्त (sc. क्रोश or योजन &c.).
text.2130:
अध्वगन्तव्य Karmadh. m. (-व्यः) Measure of distance, as a Krośa,
a Yojana &c. E. अध्वन् and गन्तव्य; an irregular compound,
instead of गन्तव्याध्वन्.
text.2131:
अध्वगभोग्य Tatpur. m. (-ग्यः) The name of a tree (Spondias
mangifera). See आम्रात. E. अध्वग and भोग्य; lit. ‘to be
enjoyed by travellers’.
text.2132:
अध्वगमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Journeying, travelling. E. अध्वन्
and गमन.
text.2133:
अध्वगामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Travelling. E.
अध्वन् and गामिन्.
text.2134:
अध्वजा Tatpur. f. (-जा) The name of a plant. See स्वर्णुली.
E. अध्वन् and ज.
text.2135:
अध्वन् m. (-ध्वा)
1 Sky, atmosphere (only in the Vedas).
2 A road.
3 Time.
4 A place (perhaps, a place where four
roads meet).
5 A branch or school of the Vedas or sacred
literature.--In some Tatpurusha compounds the former
part of which is an उपसर्ग (q. v.), this word occurs in the
form of अध्व; i. e. the compound assumes the samāsānta
aff. अच्; e. g. प्राध्व, निरध्व, प्रत्यध्व.--(The two last
meanings of this word are rather unsettled through the
variety of readings in the native dictionaries from which
they are taken; some read अध्वा…संस्थाने स्यादवस्कन्धे,
others संस्थाने साश्रवस्कन्धे; the best reading, however, that
which has been adopted in the present translation, seems
to be this: संस्थाने शास्त्रवत्स्कन्धे.) E. doubtful; according
to some, अद्, uṇ. aff. क्वनिप्, with ध् substituted for द्
‘because it eats up the strength of the traveller’; or ac
cording to others, अत्, uṇ. aff. क्वनिप्, with ध् instead of त्.
text.2136:
अध्वनीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 Marching fast or fleet.
2 (m.) A
traveller. E. अध्वन्, taddh. aff. ख. According to some used
in all the three genders.
text.2137:
अध्वन्य m. f. n. (-न्यः-न्या-न्यम्)
1 Marching fast or fleet.
2 (m.) A
traveller. E. अध्वन्, taddh. aff. यत्. According to some
used in all the three genders.
text.2138:
अध्वपति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) An epithet of the sun, in the
Vedas. Literally: ‘the lord of the roads’ or perhaps better
‘the lord of the atmosphere’. E. अध्वन् and पति.
text.2139:
अध्वर Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Not crooked,
honest proper (ved.)
2 Not perishable, lasting (in its con
sequences, as a sacrifice; ved.).
3 Intent, attentive. (It is
doubtful whether this word in the two meanings ‘not crook
ed’ and ‘not perishable’, occurs in the femin. gender, as
it is used in the Vedas either absolutely as a neuter or as
epithet of यज्ञ in the mascul. Nor is the latter meaning
‘intent, attentive’, a usual one, though it is given in
several of the native dictionaries.)
II. m. (-रः)
1 Sacrifice in general, but in the ritual works
mostly used as the denomination of the greater sacrifices
or those performed with the juice of the Soma plant; see
also सौम्याध्वर and अध्वरकाण्ड.
2 The name of a Vasu
(q. v.).
3 The proper name of the chief of a renowned fa
mily. See आध्वरायण.
III. n. (-रम्) Sky, atmosphere (ved.). E. अ priv. and
ध्वर ‘having no crookedness, dishonesty &c.’ or according
to others ‘preventing, not allowing of injury’; another
etym. makes this word, but erroneously, a Tatpur. from
अध्वन् and र ‘giving or affording the road (scil. to heaven)’.
text.2140:
अध्वरकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्मः) The proceedings with an
Adhwara-sacrifice (ved.). See the preceding. E. अध्वर
and कर्मन्.
text.2141:
अध्वरकल्पा Tatpur. f. (-ल्पा) One of the Kāmyeṣṭis (q. v.)
or voluntary iṣṭis with three yāgas (q. v.) in the morning,
in the middle of the day and in the evening, which may
be instituted by a man of either of the three first classes.
E. अध्वर and कल्प.
text.2142:
अध्वरकाण्ड Tatpur. n. (-ण्डम्) The book on the Adhwaras;
the name of the third book of the Śatapaṭhabrāhmaṇa
(q. v.) which treats on the Adhwaras or the greater sa
crifices performed especially with the juice of the Soma
plant, the Agniṣṭoma &c. E. अध्वर and काण्ड.
text.2143:
अध्वरकृत् Tatpur. m. (-त्) Making an Adhwara-sacrifice;
also used as a vaidik epithet of स्प्य (q. v.) in the sense of
‘instrumental for the performing of the sacrifice’. E. अध्वर
and कृत्.
text.2144:
अध्वरग Tatpur. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Belonging or appro
priated to an Adhwara-sacrifice, as the Soma. E. अध्वर and ग.
text.2145:
अध्वरथ Tatpur. m. (-थः) A travelling carriage or cart. E.
अध्वन् and रथ.
text.2146:
अध्वरदीक्षणीया Tatpur. f. (-या) That part of an Adhwara-sacri
fice which is called दीक्षणीया q. v. E. अध्वर and दीक्षणीया.
text.2147:
अध्वरप्रायश्चित्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) The penance connected
with an Adhwara-sacrifice. E. अध्वर and प्रायश्चित्ति.
text.2148:
अध्वरयु Tatpur. m. (-युः) Joining or performing the sacrifice.
This word occurs as a grammatical explanation of अध्वर्यु
q. v. E. अध्वर and यु.
text.2149:
अध्वरश्री Tatpur. m. (-श्रीः) (ved.) Serving or honouring
the sacrifice, an epithet of Agni, the Aśvins, the Maruts.
E. अध्वर and श्री (serving).
text.2150:
अध्वरसमिष्टयजुस् Tatpur. n. (-जुः) The offerings called स-
मिष्टयजुस् q. v., connected with the Adhwara-sacrifice. E.
अध्वर and समिष्टयजुस्.
text.2151:
अध्वरस्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) Standing for an
Adhwara-sacrifice. E. अध्वर and स्थ.
text.2152:
अध्वरीय् denom. par. (अध्वरीयति) To be desirous of having
a sacrifice instituted for one's self. (ved.) Comp. अध्वर्य्.
E. अध्वर, denom. aff. क्यच्.
text.2153:
अध्वरेष्ठा Tatpur. m. (-ष्ठाः) (ved.) Engaged in a sacrifice. E.
अध्वर (in the locative) and स्था.
text.2154:
अध्वर्य् denom. par. (अध्वर्यति) To be desirous of having a sa
crifice instituted for one's self (used in this sense in the Rig
veda). Comp. अध्वरीय्. E. अध्वर, denom. aff. व्यच् with
elision of the final vowel.
text.2155:
अध्वर्यु m. (-र्युः)
1 One desirous of having a sacrifice insti
tuted for one's self (used in this sense in the Rigveda).
2 A
priest in general (ved.)
3 (In the ritual and the epic litera
ture.) A special priest, one conversant with and performing
the ritual observances connected with the Yajurveda; he is
one of the sixteen Ṛtvijs required for the performing of the
great Soma sacrifices (see ऋत्विज्) and, amongst them,
one of the four leading priests (see besides ब्रह्मन्, उद्गातृ
and होतृ) who receive the whole dakṣiṇā (q. v.); his pu
rushas or assistant priests are the प्रतिप्रस्थातृ, नेष्ट्ट and
उन्नेतृ who are called, like himself, the दीक्षयितृ (q. v.) because
they initiate, viz. the अध्वर्यु the three other leading priests,
the प्रतिप्रस्थातृ the अर्धिन्- (q. v.), the नेष्टृ the तृतीयिन्-
(q. v.) and the उन्नेतृ the पादिन्- (q. v.) priests. The Mi
mānsā decides in doubtful cases, viz. whenever a sacrifice
mentioned in and making part of the ritual of the Yajur
veda, is mentioned also and forms part of another Veda,
whether the Adhwaryu has another priest to share in
his functions or whether he has to abstain from the pro
ceedings altogether. The ten चमसाध्वर्यु (q. v.), who,
are also assistants or purushas of the Adhwaryu, are dis
tinct from and do not bear the name of Ṛtvij.--According
to a legend in the Harivanśa, Nārāyaṇa created the first
Adhwaryu from his arms. The dual अध्वर्यु is the collective
denomination of the अध्वर्यु and प्रतिप्रस्थातृ, his principal
assistant; the plur. अध्वर्यवः of the अध्वर्यु and his three
assistants, and in general of those devoted to the study or
the practice of the Yajurveda.
4 The Yajurveda (also in the
plur. अध्वर्यवः). E. अध्वर्य्, kṛt aff. उ.
text.2156:
अध्वर्युकाण्ड Tatpur. n. (-ण्डम्) A collection of mantras or
prayers for the special use of the Adhwaryu (q. v.). Also
called आध्वर्यवकाण्ड. E. अध्वर्यु and काण्ड.
text.2157:
अध्वर्युक्रतु Tatpur. m. (-तुः) The Kratu (q. v.)--sacri
fices contained in the Yajurveda or to be performed by
the Adhwaryu. E. अध्वर्यु (in the meanings of 3. or 2.)
and क्रतु.
text.2158:
अध्वर्युवेद Karmadh. or Tatpur. m. (-दः) The Yajurveda.
E. अध्वर्यु (in the meanings of 4. or 3.) and वेद.
text.2159:
अध्वशल्य Tatpur. m. (-ल्यः) A tree (Achyranthes aspera). See
अपामार्ग. E. अध्वन् and शल्य.
text.2160:
अध्वस्मन् Bahuvr. m. (f.?) n. (-स्मा-म) (ved.)
1 Not perishing,
not falling, everlasting.
2 Not causing to perish or to fall.
E. अ priv. and ध्वस्मन्.
text.2161:
अध्वान्त Tatpur. n. (-न्तम्) Gloom, twilight. E. अ neg. and
ध्वान्त.
text.2162:
अध्वान्तशात्रव Tatpur. m. (-वः) A plant (Bignonia Indica).
See पत्रोर्ण and श्योनाक. E. अध्वान्त and शात्रव, blossoming
in the shade.
text.2164:
II. अन्. Considered as a substitute of इद् in इदम् in some
cases, viz. अनेन, अनया and अनयोः. See इदम् and अन.
text.2165:
III. अन् I. (अन-अदादि-रुदादि-उदात्त-परस्मैपदिन्) r. 2d cl.
par. (अनिति- imp. आनीत् or आनत्-आन-अनिता-अनिष्यति-
आनीत्.--Desid. अनिनिषति.--Caus. आनयति) and
II. (अन-दिवादि-उदात्त-अनुदात्तेत्) r. 4th cl. ātm. (अ-
न्यते &c.) Also read अण् q. v.
1 To breathe, to live.
2 (ved.)
To go. (In composition with परा and प्र, the न् of the
radical is changed to ण्.) With अप- To breathe away (in
farting), to produce the action of the vital air अपान (q. v.);
अभ्यप- The same (अभि implying moreover the direction
towards); अव- To breathe out, to breathe forth; उद्-
To breathe up, to produce the action of the vital air उदान
(q. v.); अभ्युद्- The same (अभि implying also the direction
towards); परा-(पराणिति-पराणिणत्-पराणिणिषति)(?);
परि-(पर्यनिति)(?); प्र- (प्राणिति. Des. प्राणिणिषति.)
1 To
breathe, to respire, to produce the action of the vital air
प्राण q. v.
2 To live.
3 (In the Upanishads, but doubtful.)
To smell (see also प्राण and अतिग्रह). Caus. (प्राणयति-
प्राणिणत्) To revive; अनुप्र- To breathe or to live in con
formity with (a following noun depends upon it in the ac
cusative); अभिप्र- To breathe into, to make one's breath
enter into (the mouth of another); वि- To breathe, to pro
duce the action of the vital air व्यान (q. v.); अभिवि- The
same with the meaning of ‘towards’; सम्-
1 To breathe,
to live.
2 To produce the action of the vital air समान (q. v.).
text.2166:
I. अन ind. Not. E. g. अनोपमा ते बुद्धिः, explained by a
commentator: ‘thy intellect is unequalled’. See also अना,
and comp. अनानुकृत्य, अनानुद &c.
text.2167:
II. अन. Considered by some as a substitute of इदम् in some
cases; viz. अनेन, अनया and अनयोः. See इदम् and अन्.
text.2168:
III. अन m. (-नः) Spiration; it is explained as the action
which is common to the five vital airs प्राण, अपान, उदान,
व्यान and समान (qq. vv.). Compare अनिल. E. अन्, kṛt
aff. अच्.
text.2169:
अनंश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्)
1 Portionless, not en
titled to a share or portion.
2 (In law.) One excluded from
participation in an inheritance viz. a eunuch, a degraded
man, a blind or deaf person, a fool, an idiot, a dumb
person or one deprived of one of his limbs or senses, a
cripple &c. See also अनंशिन् and निरंशक.
text.2170:
अनंशत्व n. (-त्वम्) (In law.) The not being entitled to a
share &c. See the preceding. Also अनंशता f. (-ता). E.
अनंश, taddh. aff. त्व or तल्.
text.2171:
अनंशिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि). The same as अ-
नंश q. v. E. अ neg. and अंशिन्.
text.2172:
अनंशित्व n. (-त्वम्) or अनंशिता f. (-ता). The same as अनं-
शत्व. E. अनंशिन्, taddh. aff. त्व or तल्.
text.2173:
अनंशुमत्फला Tatpur. f. (-ला) A plantain (Musa paradisiaca).
See अंशुमत्फला and कदली. E. अ compar.(?) and अंशु-
मत्फला.
text.2174:
अनक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Inferior, low. See अणक of
which it is given as a various reading. E. See that of
अणक; another is that from अण (अण् to sound, kṛt aff.
अच्) and the taddh. aff. of depreciation कन्.
text.2175:
अनकदुन्दुभ Bahuvr. m. (-भः) The name of the father of Va
sudeva. E. अनक and दुन्दुभ. (This word is doubtful and
perhaps formed only by the commentaries, to explain the
patronymic आनकदुन्दुभि q. v. See also the following.)
text.2176:
अनकदुन्दुभि Bahuvr. m. (-भिः) A name of Vasudeva, the
father of Kṛṣṇa. More usually written आनकदुन्दुभि,
but given also with the short initial by some commentators
of the Amarakosha. E. अनक (instead of आनक) and दुन्दु-
भि ‘because the gods beat the Anaka-drums in his house
when Kṛṣṇa was born’.
text.2177:
अनकस्मात् Tatpur. ind.
1 Not without a cause.
2 Not im
mediately, not instantly.
3 Not suddenly, not at once. E.
अ neg. and अकस्मात्.
text.2178:
अनक्ष् Bahuvr. m. (-नक्) (ved.) Blind. E. अ priv. and अक्ष्
(from the denomin. of अक्षि, with kṛt aff. क्विप्).
text.2179:
अनक्ष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षी-क्षम्) Eyeless, blind. E.
अ priv. and अक्षि, samāsānta aff. षच्.
text.2180:
अनक्षर Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Containing, utter
ing &c. what is blamable or what aught not to be said.
II. n. (-रम्) Blamable or improper speech. E. अ deter.
and अक्षर.
text.2181:
अनक्षि Tatpur. n. (-क्षि) A bad or disfigured eye. E. अ neg.
and अक्षि.
text.2182:
अनगार Bahuvr. m. (-रः) An anchorite, a man who has re
tired from the world. See अग्रह. E. अ priv. and अगार
‘having no house i. e. living in the wood’.
text.2183:
अनगारिका f. (-का) A wandering life, the life of a men
dicant. E. अनगार, taddh. aff. ठच्(?); scil. वृत्ति.
text.2184:
अनग्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्नः-ग्ना-ग्नम्) Not naked. E. अ neg.
and नग्न.
text.2185:
अनग्नता f. (-ता) The not being naked. E. The former, taddh.
aff. तल्.
text.2186:
अनग्नि I. Tatpur. m. (-ग्निः) Any thing not or different from
fire. E. अ neg. and अग्नि.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ग्निः-ग्निः-ग्नि)
1 Having no sacrificial
fire or being deprived of the arrangement of a sacrificial
fire place (see अग्निचयन), as a sacrifice.
2 Impious, irre
ligious (as one not performing the observances which require
a sacrificial fire; also an epithet of the Manes अग्निष्वात्त
q. v.).
3 Unmarried(?).
4 Having no domestic fire, no fire
for worldly purposes (as an anchorite who has given up
his house and retired to the wood).
5 Having a bad di
gestion. E. अ priv. or (in 5.) deterior. and अग्नि.
text.2187:
अनग्नित्र Tatpur. m. f. (-त्रः-त्रा) (ved.)
1 Not having Agni
or the divinity of fire as protector, unprotected by Agni.
Or according to another interpretation,
2 not maintain
ing a sacrificial fire, impious, wicked. E. अ neg. and
अग्नि-त्र.
text.2188:
अनग्निदग्ध Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ग्धः-ग्धा-ग्धम्)
1 Not burnt
in or with fire.
2 Not burnt on the funeral pyre, not hav
ing received the obsequies in conformity with the religious
rites.
II. m. pl. (-ग्धाः) The name of a particular class of Pi
tṛs or Manes, of those apparently who when alive did
not observe religious rites. See अग्निदग्ध and the following.
E. अ neg. and अग्निदग्ध.
text.2189:
अनग्निष्वात्त Tatpur. m. pl. (-त्ताः) The name of a particular
class of Pitṛs or Manes. This word is explained by a
commentator of the Yajurveda: ‘not tasted by (स्वात्त) i. e.
not burnt by fire, not having received the obsequies in con
formity with the religious rites’ and it appears therefore as
a synonyme of अनग्निदग्ध, as well as the converse of अग्नि-
ष्वात्त which, according to the same commentator, would
be a synonyme of अग्निदग्ध. Anagniṣvātta does not occur
in the list of the Pitṛs which are given in the law books
and in the Purāṇas, while अग्निदग्ध and अग्निष्वात्त (qq. vv.)
are named there as distinct classes and explained in a
different manner. The etymology given, which identifies
स्वात्त and स्वादित, seems moreover objectionable. E. अ
and अग्निष्वात्त.
text.2190:
अनघ Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-घः-घा-घम्)
1 Sinless, pure.
2 Clean, clear.
3 Handsome, pleasing.
II. m. (-घः)
1 A name of Śiva.
2 The name of a Gan
dharva.
3 The name of a Sādhya.
4 The name of a prince,
son of Surodha and Upadānavī.
5 The name of a son of
Vasiṣṭha and Ūrjā.
6 White mustard; see गौरसर्षप. A
less correct reading of this word in the latter sense is अ-
नद्य. E. अ priv. and अघ.
text.2191:
अनङ्कुश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Unruly, licentious.
E. अ priv. and अङ्कुश.
text.2192:
अनङ्ग I. Tatpur. n. (-ङ्गम्) What is different from or other
than the अङ्ग q. v. E. अ neg. and अङ्ग.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Bodiless, in
corporeal.
2. m. (-ङ्गः) A name of Kāma, the god of Love; so
called, ‘because he was reduced to ashes, by the eye
of Śiva, for having disturbed his devotions and rendered
him enamoured of Pārvatī’.
3. n. (-ङ्गम्)
1 Sky, æther.
2 The same as मनस् q. v.
E. अ priv. and अङ्ग.
text.2193:
अनङ्गक Bahuvr. n. (-कम्). The same as मनस् q. v. E. अ
priv. and अङ्ग, samāsānta aff. कप्. See अनङ्ग II. 3. 2.; or
अनङ्ग, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.2194:
अनङ्गक्रीडा Tatpur. f. (-डा) A metre regulated by quantity;
it is a species of the द्विच्छन्दिक (q. v.) and consists of a
couplet with sixteen long syllables in the first and thirty
two short syllables in the second verse. Also called सौ-
म्या. E. अनङ्ग and क्रीडा.
text.2195:
अनङ्गदेवी Tatpur. f. (-वी) The proper name of a wife of
Mahlaṇa, a king of Kashmir. E. अनङ्ग and देवी.
text.2196:
अनङ्गपाल Tatpur. m. (-लः) The proper name of a chamber
lain of Ananta, king of Kashmir. E. अनङ्ग and पाल.
text.2197:
अनङ्गमेजय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not shaking
the body. E. अ neg. and अङ्गमेजय (अङ्ग and एज् caus.,
kṛt aff. खश्).
text.2198:
अनङ्गलेखा Tatpur. f. (-खा) A proper name: the daughter
of Balāditya, a king of Kashmir, and wife of Durlaba
vardhana, his successor. E. अनङ्ग and लेखा.
text.2199:
अनङ्गशेखर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The name of a metre regulated
by number and quantity, a species of the class Danḍaka
(q. v.) and consisting of four verses with fifteen Iambi in
each verse. E. अनङ्ग and शेखर.
text.2200:
अनङ्गसेना Tatpur. f. (-ना) The proper name of a courtesan
in a drama. E. अनङ्ग and सेना.
text.2201:
अनङ्गापीड Tatpur. m. (-डः) The proper name of a king of
Kashmir, the sixteenth king of the dynasty of Karkota.
E. अनङ्ग and आपीड.
text.2202:
अनङ्गासुहृद् Tatpur. m. (-हृत्) A name of Śiva. E. अनङ्ग
and असुहृद् ‘the foe of Kāma’; see अनङ्ग.
text.2203:
अनच्छ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-च्छः-च्छा-च्छम्) Turbid, muddy. E.
अ neg. and अच्छ.
text.2204:
अनजका Tatpur. f. (-का) A bad or miserable young female
goat. Also अनजिका. E. अ deter. and अजका.
text.2205:
अनजिका Tatpur. f. (-का). See the preceding. E. अ deter.
and अजिका.
text.2206:
अनञ्जन Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Free from colly
rium &c. See the meanings of अञ्जन.
II. n. (-नम्) Æther, atmosphere. E. अ priv. and अञ्जन.
text.2207:
अनडुज्जिह्वा Tatpur. f. (-ह्वा) The name of a plant (Ele
phantopus scaber). See गोजिह्वा. E. अनडुह् and जिह्वा.
text.2208:
अनडुत्क m. f. n. (-त्कः-त्का-त्कम्) Having bulls or oxen
(
1 as a country (according to others the reading would then
be आनडुहक q. v., from आनडुह);
2 seemingly the latter
part of the thematic form of a Bahuvrīhi compound, con
cluding with अनडुह्, f. i. प्रियानडुत्क). E. अनडुह्,
1 taddh.
aff. क,
2 the compound with samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2209:
अनडुद्द Tatpur. m. (-द्दः) The donor of a bull or ox. E.
अनडुह् and द.
text.2210:
अनडुह् Tatpur. m. (sing. -ड्वान्, -ड्वन्, -ड्वाहम्, -डुहा, -डुहे,
-डुहः, -डुहि; du. -ड्वाहौ, -डुद्भ्याम्, -डुहोः; plur. -ड्वाहः,
-डुहः, -डुद्भिः, -डुद्भ्यः, -डुत्सु) f. (-डुही or -ड्वाही)
1 A bull
or ox, especially one fit to draw a cart or to bear a weight.
2 The sign of the zodiac, Taurus.
3 (According to a vaidik
commentator also used in the adjective sense:) fit or able
to draw a cart, as an epithet of a goat; but this expla
nation seems doubtful.--(The use of the femin. अनड्वाही
would be restricted, according to one authority, to the
Vedas, while others do not make any distinction between
this form and अनडुही. In Avyayībh. compounds, the com
pound terminating with अनडुह् assumes the samāsānta aff.
टच् (see अनडुह) and in Bahuvr. compounds, the samā
sānta aff. कप् (see अनडुत्क); in the latter, however, it
may also retain its original form, with the following de
clension in the neuter: sing. अनडुत्, du. अनडुही and plur.
अनड्वांहि.) E. अनस्, with स् changed to ड्, and वह् (from
वह्, kṛt aff. क्विप्) with samprasāraṇa of व्; in the fem.
with aff. ङीष्.
text.2211:
अनडुह I. m. (-हः) The proper name of the chief of a gotra
or family. See आनडुह्य. E. अनडुह्, taddh. aff. अच्(?).
II. Seemingly the latter part of the thematic form of an
Avyayībh. compound concluding with अनडुह्, f. i. प्रत्यनडुहम्;
such a compound assuming the samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.2212:
अनडुही Tatpur. f. (-ही) A cow. Also अनड्वाही. E. See
अनडुह्.
text.2213:
अनड्वाही Tatpur. f. (-ही) A cow. Also अनडुही. E. See
अनडुह्.
text.2214:
अनणु Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-णुः-णुः or -ण्वी-णु) Not minute,
not atomic, coarse (the reverse of अणु or अस्थूल).
II. m. (-णुः) Coarse grain, as chiches (Cicer arietinum)
&c. or, according to others, as wheat, barley &c.; (the
reverse of अणु q. v.). E. अ neg. and अणु.
text.2215:
अनत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Erect, not bowed
down, stiff.
2 Proud, haughty. E. अ neg. and नत.
text.2216:
अनतिक्रम Tatpur. m. (-मः)
1 Not overstepping certain limits,
not surpassing certain qualities &c., moderation.
2 Pro
priety, decorum. E. अ neg. and अतिक्रम.
text.2217:
अनतिक्रमणीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not to be sur
passed, overstepped or transgressed, inviolable, inevitable,
unavoidable. E. अ neg. and अतिक्रमणीय.
text.2218:
अनतिक्रान्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्)
1 Unsurpassed,
unexceeded.
2 Untransgressed &c. See अतिक्रान्त. E. अ
neg. and अतिक्रान्त.
text.2219:
अनतिदृश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्) (ved.) Not pellucid,
untransparent. E. अ and अतिदृश्य (from दृश् with अति,
kṛtya aff. यत्); but more probably, ‘very invisible, very
indiscernible’ from अ neg. and अति-दृश्य, instead of अत्य-
दृश्य. A similar transposition occurs in the vaidik word
अनत्युद्य.
text.2220:
अनतिद्भुत Tatpur. m. (-तः) (ved.) Not surpassed, not ex
celled. E. अ neg. and अतिद्भुत; the latter part of the com
pound apparently being a synonyme of अतिभूत and re
sembling, as regards its formation, the word अद्भुत (q. v.).
text.2221:
अनतिप्रश्न्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्न्यः-श्न्या-श्न्यम्) Not belonging
or referring to a question which goes beyond its proper
bounds, to a question concerning a transcendental object.
E. अ neg. and अतिप्रश्न्य.
text.2222:
अनतिप्रौढ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्) Not full-grown,
young (as a plant &c.). E. अ neg. and अति-प्रौढ.
text.2223:
अनतिरिक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Not exceeded in
quantity or quality. E. अ neg. and अतिरिक्त.
text.2224:
अनतिविलम्बिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्बी-म्बिनी-म्बि) Not very
dilatory, not very slow. E. अ neg. and अतिविलम्बिन्.
text.2225:
अनतिवृत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Not going beyond, the being in
conformity or in proportion with. See पदार्थानतिवृत्ति. E.
अ neg. and अतिवृत्ति.
text.2226:
अनत्यन्तगति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) (In grammar.) The sense of
‘not completely’, ‘not very much’, the sense of diminu
tiveness. E. अ neg. अत्यन्त and गति. See अत्यन्तगति.
text.2227:
अनत्यय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Having no loss, no
end &c., eternal, continual. See the meanings of अत्यय.
E. अ priv. and अत्यय.
text.2228:
अनत्युद्य Tatpur. m. (-द्यः) (ved.) Utterly unnameable, quite
unfit to be spoken of. E. अ neg. and अति-उद्य; as it ap
pears, a transposition of अत्यनुद्य, similar to that which
has probably taken place in अनतिदृश्य (q. v.).
text.2229:
अनदत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दन्-दती-दत्) Not eating. E. अ
neg. and अदत् I.
text.2230:
अनद्धा Tatpur. ind. (ved.) Not clearly, not truly, perhaps.
Also with the particles उ and इव, अनद्धो and अनद्धेव. E. अ
neg. and अद्धा.
text.2231:
अनद्धापुरुष Tatpur. m. (-षः) (ved.) No man in the true sense
of the word, ‘one who does not serve the ends of the gods,
of the pitṛs, or of men’. E. अनद्धा and पुरुष.
text.2232:
अनद्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) Not fit to be eaten.
II. m. (-द्यः) White mustard. See अनघ which is the more
correct reading of this word. E. अ neg. and अद्य.
text.2233:
अनद्यतन Bahuvr. m. (-नः) (In grammar.) The time which
does not belong to the current day. See अद्यतन. It is either
भूतानद्यतनः the past or भविष्यदनद्यतनः the future time, if
such a period does not include the current day. E. अ priv.
and अद्यतन, sc. काल.
text.2234:
अनधिकार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Absence of right, claim, in
terest or concern. E. अ neg. and अधिकार.
text.2235:
अनधिकारचर्चा Tatpur. f. (-र्चा) Officiousness, meddling with
other people's business. E. अनधिकार and चर्चा.
text.2236:
अनधिकारिन् Tatpur. m. (-री) One who has no right or
claim &c. See the meanings of अधिकारिन्. E. अ neg.
and अधिकारिन्.
text.2237:
अनधिकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not set over, or
appointed &c. See the meanings of अधिकृत. E. अ neg.
and अधिकृत.
text.2238:
अनधिगत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not acquired.
2 Not
learnt or studied. E. अ neg. and अधिगत.
text.2239:
अनधीनक m. f. n. (-नकः-निका-नकम्) Independant. E. अ-
अधीन, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.2240:
अनध्यक्ष m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) I. Tatpur. Imperceptible,
unperceived, absent. See अप्रत्यक्ष. E. अ neg. and अध्यक्ष.
II. Bahuvr. Having no superintendent. E. अ priv. and
अध्यक्ष.
text.2241:
अनध्ययन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Want or intermission of reading
or study, especially of the Vedas. E. अ neg. and अध्ययन.
text.2242:
अनध्याय Bahuvr. m. (-यः) Time on which it is improper
and forbidden to read or to study the Vedas; also used in
the sense of ‘a holy-day’ or ‘vacation’. E. अ priv. and
अध्याय, sc. काल.
text.2243:
अनध्यायदिवस Karmadh. m. (-सः) A day on which it is
improper to study. See the preceding. E. अनध्याय and
दिवस.
text.2244: अनन n. (-नम्) Breathing, living. E. अन्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2245:
अननङ्गमेजय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not allowing the body
to remain unshaken or quiet. E. अ neg. and अनङ्गमेजय.
text.2246:
अननुभाषण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) (In the Nyāya philosophy.)
Not repeating the argument for discussion, i. e. a tacit
agreement with it or assent to the assertion of the person
who has proposed it; viz. if, after the argument for dis
cussion has been announced, it has not been repeated by
any one--the sign of taking it up--the proposer has to
proclaim it three times; if then it does not meet with the
anubhāṣana, it is considered as proved or as accepted as
such. E. अ neg. and अनुभाषण.
text.2247:
अननुषङ्गिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ङ्गी-ङ्गिणी-ङ्गि) Not attached
to, indifferent (as to pleasure &c.). E. अ neg. and अनु-
षङ्गिन्.
text.2248:
अननुष्ठान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Non-observance (of duties &c.),
neglect, want of propriety. See the meanings of अनुष्ठान.
E. अ neg. and अनुष्ठान.
text.2249:
अननूक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्)
1 Not spoken-after
or accordingly.
2 Not read or studied (as the Veda). E.
अ neg. and अनूक्त.
text.2250:
अनन्त Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Endless in time
and space: eternal, unbounded, innumerable &c.
II. m. (-न्तः)
1 A name of Viṣṇu or Kṛṣṇa.
2 A name
of Baladeva, the elder brother of Kṛṣṇa.
3 A name of
Śiva.
4 A name of Rudra, in an Upanishad of the Athar
vaveda.
5 A name of Śeṣa, the chief of the Nāgas or ser
pent race that inhabit the infernal regions: the couch and
constant attendant of Viṣṇu.
6 A name of Vāsuki, another
king of the serpents, the brother of the former.
7 A name
of one of the Viśvadevas.
8 The name of the fourteenth of
the twenty-four Arhats or Jaina deified saints of the present
Avasarpiṇī; see also अनन्तजित्.
9 The name of a king of
Kashmir; see also अनन्तदेव.
10 A proper name common to
several authors &c.
11 The name of a plant, Vitex trifolia
(Lin.); see सिन्दवार.
12 Talc (see अभ्रक; in this sense the
word is given by some as a neuter).
13 (In arithmetic.)
Infinite quantity: a fraction having a cypher for its deno
minator; see also अनन्तराशि and खहर.
14 The name of
the twenty-third of the lunar asterisms; see श्रवण.
15 A
silken cord with fourteen knots which the Hindus tie round
the right arm at the festival of Anantachaturdaśī.
III. f. (-न्ता)
1 The earth.
2 (In arithmetic sometimes
used to denominate) the numeral one.
3 A name of Pār
vatī, the wife of Śiva.
4 A name of Tārā, a Buddhist
deity.
5 The proper name of the wife of Janamejaya.
6 The
name of the following plants:
a. Hedysarum alhagi; see
यवास or रोदनी.
b. Echytes frutescens; see श्यामा or गो-
पी.
c. A sort of potherb; see विशल्या or शक्रपुष्पी.
d. Agrostis
linearis (Koen.) or Panicum dactylon; see दूर्वा or भार्गवी,
श्वेतदूर्वा and नीलदूर्वा.
e. Phyllanthus emblica (emblic my
robolan); see आमलकी.
f. Menispermum glabrum or cordi
folium; see गुडूची.
g. Gloriosa superba; see लाङ्गली.
h. See
हेममानी.
i. Premna spinosa; see असिमन्थ.
k. Piper longum
(Long pepper); see पिप्पली or कणा.
l. Terminalia chebula
(yellow myrobolan); see हरीतकी.
m. Asclepias pseudosar
sa; see शारिवा.
n. Justicia adhatoda(?).
o. Bromelia Ana
nas(?).
p. Echytes dichotoma(?).
q. According to some
also the same as अनन्तमूल q. v.
IV. n. (-न्तम्)
1 Sky, atmosphere, æther.
2 Talc; (also
given in the latter sense as a masculine). E. अ priv. and
अन्त.
text.2251:
अनन्तक I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Endless, eternal, unlimited.
II. n. (-कम्) (In the Jaina doctrine.) The collective ex
pression for what is eternal viz. matter and soul; but in
cluding also, according to a commentary, planets or accord
ing to another, æther, regions &c. E. अनन्त, taddh. aff.
कन्, or rather a Bahuvr. composed of अ neg. and अन्त,
samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2252:
अनन्तकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Making endless or
unlimited. E. अनन्त and कर.
text.2253:
अनन्तग Tatpur. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Going continually,
moving perpetually. E. अनन्त and ग.
text.2254:
अनन्तचतुर्दशी Tatpur. f. (-शी) The fourteenth lunation of
the light half i. e. the day of the full moon of the month
Bhādra (August-September), when Viṣṇu under the
form of the serpent Ananta is worshipped. E. अनन्त and
चतुर्दशी.
text.2255:
अनन्तचारित्र Bahuvr. m. (-त्रः) The proper name of a Bo
dhisattva, Mahāsattva, or a superior Bauddha saint. E.
अनन्त and चारित्र.
text.2256:
अनन्तजित् Tatpur. m. (-जित्) The name of the fourteenth
of the twenty-four Arhats or Jaina deified saints of the
present Avasarpiṇī; also called अनन्त. E. अनन्त and जित्
‘who conquers, who gains eternity’.
text.2257:
अनन्तता f. (-ता) Eternity: also अनन्तत्व n. (-त्वम्). E. अनन्त,
taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2258:
अनन्तदृष्टि Bahuvr. m. (-ष्टिः) A name of Śiva. E. अनन्त
and दृष्टि.
text.2259:
अनन्तदेव Karmadh. m. (-वः) The proper name of a king of
Kashmir, the son of Harirāja; also a proper name be
longing to several authors &c. See also अनन्त. E. अनन्त
and देव.
text.2260:
अनन्तनेमि Bahuvr.(?) m. (-मिः) The proper name of a king
of Mālava, a contemporary of Śākyamuni. E. अनन्त and
नेमि.
text.2261:
अनन्तपाल Tatpur. m. (-लः) The proper name of a warrior
chief serving under Harsha, king of Kashmir. E. अनन्त
and पाल.
text.2262:
अनन्तमति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) The proper name of a Bodhi
sattva or Bauddha saint, the son of the Tathāgata Chan
drasūryapradīpa. E. अनन्त and मति.
text.2263:
अनन्तमूल Bahuvr. m. (-लः) The name of a plant (Periploca
Indica or Asclepias pseudosarsa or Asclepias asthmatica);
see also अनन्ता and शारिवा. E. अनन्त and मूल.
text.2264:
अनन्तर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Having nothing in
termediate, having no interval or defect, uninterrupted,
entire; in the Upanishads also as an epithet of Brahman (n.)
or the supreme soul, of which it is said that it has nothing
before it nor after it, nor between ‘before’ and ‘after’
it nor besides it, or that it exists without interruption
or defect, entire.
2 Next, immediately following or pre
ceding.
3 Next of kin, in succession, in caste.
4 Close,
compact.--अनन्तरम् immediately, afterwards; it is fol
lowed or preceded sometimes by a noun depending upon
it in the ablative or genitive. E. अ priv. and अनन्तर.
text.2265:
अनन्तरज Tatpur. m. (-जः) The son of a man of the three
first castes, married to a woman of a caste inferior in order
to his own, but not to a Sūdra woman viz. of a Brāhmaṇa
by a Kṣatriyā or Vaiśyā and of a Kṣatriyā by a Vaiśyā.
The three kinds of sons got by parents of the same caste
are called सजातिज and both, comprising six kinds, have
the privileges of a Dvija or twice-born man. (This is
the explanation given by a commentator of Manu and,
according to him, अनन्तरज would have a different mean
ing than अनन्तरजात, though both words appear to be
synonymes.) E. अनन्तर and ज.
text.2266:
अनन्तरजात Tatpur. m. (-तः) The son of a father married to
a woman of a caste next in order to his own, viz. of a
Brāhmaṇa by a Kṣatriyā, of a Kshatriya by a Vaiśyā,
of a Vaiśya by a Sūdrā. E. अनन्तर and जात.
text.2267:
अनन्तरायम् Bahuvr. ind. Without interruption. E. अ priv.
and अन्तराय.
text.2268:
अनन्तराशि Karmadh. m. (-शिः) (In arithmetic.) Infinite
quantity: a fraction having a cypher for its denominator.
See also अनन्त II. 13. and खहर. E. अनन्त and राशि.
text.2269:
अनन्तरित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uninterrupted, not separated
by. E. Denom. of अनन्तर, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2270:
अनन्तरीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Belonging to what is next,
next in succession, caste &c. See the meanings of अनन्तर.
E. अनन्तर, taddh. aff. छ.
text.2271:
अनन्तरूप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Having innumerable
forms or shapes, multiform. E. अनन्त and रूप.
text.2272:
अनन्तर्हित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not separated,
not interposed.
2 Not concealed, not hidden. E. अ neg.
and अन्तर्हित.
text.2273:
अनन्तवत् I. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Endowed with infinity,
eternal.
II. m. (-वान्) A name or epithet of one of the four pā
das or feet of Brahman (in the symbolical language of the
Upanishads), consisting of four Kalās or parts, viz. earth,
