intermediate space, heaven and ocean. The other three
feet are called प्रकाशवत्, ज्योतिष्मत् and आयतनवत्
(qq. vv.).
text.2274:
अनन्तवर्मन् Bahuvr. m. (-र्मा) The proper name of a king.
E. अनन्त and वर्मन्.
text.2275:
अनन्तवात Karmadh. m. (-तः) (In medicine.) One of the
diseases of the head (see शिरोरोग). It is described in the
following manner: ‘when the three humours (air, bile and
phlegm) are deranged in the vessels of the back of the
neck they make it very feverish and painful and it sup
presses the humours particularly in the region of the eyes,
eyebrows and temples; it then produces shaking in the
sides of the cheeks, cramp of the jaws and morbid affec
tions of the eyes’. E. अनन्त and वात.
text.2276:
अनन्तविक्रमिन् m. (-मी) The proper name of a Bodhisattva
or Bauddha saint. E. अनन्त-विक्रम, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2277:
अनन्तविजय Bahuvr. m. (-यः) The name of the shell of Yu
dhiṣṭhira. E. अनन्त and विजय.
text.2278:
अनन्तवीर्य Bahuvr. m. (-र्यः) The proper name of the twenty
third Jaina Arhat or deified saint of a future age or Utsar
piṇī. E. अनन्त and वीर्य.
text.2279:
अनन्तव्रत Tatpur. n. (-तम्) The name of a festival ob
served on the day of the full moon in Bhādra (August
September) in honour of Viṣṇu under the form of the
serpent Ananta (q. v.). See अनन्तचतुर्दशी. E. अनन्त
and व्रत.
text.2280:
अनन्तशक्ति Bahuvr. m. (-क्तिः) The proper name of a son of
the king Amaraśakti. E. अनन्त and शक्ति.
text.2281:
अनन्तशयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The name of Travancore. E.
अनन्त and शयन.
text.2282:
अनन्तशीर्षा Bahuvr. f. (-र्षा) The proper name of the wife
of Vāsuki, a king of the serpents. E. अनन्त and शीर्ष;
literally: ‘having innumerous heads’.
text.2283:
अनन्तशुष्म Bahuvr. m. (-ष्मः) (ved.) Of infinite power or
strength; an epithet of the Maruts. E. अनन्त and शुष्म.
text.2284:
अनन्त्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्त्यः-न्त्या-न्त्यम्) Infinite, eternal,
unbounded.
II. n. (-न्त्यम्) Infinity, eternity, immortality. cf. आनन्त्य.
E. अ priv. and अन्त्य.
text.2285:
अनन्द Bahuvr. m. pl. (-न्दाः) (In the Upanishads) the name
of a world where those are doomed to reside after their
death, who have not acquired spiritual knowledge or who
have made to a priest a sacrificial gift of an old or de
fective cow &c. E. अ priv. and नन्द; literally: ‘having or
giving no pleasure or joy’.
text.2286:
अनन्न Tatpur. n. (-न्नम्) No-food, no-corn, bad food, bad
corn &c. See the meanings of अन्न. E. अ deter. and अन्न.
text.2287:
अनन्य m. f. n. (-न्यः-न्या-न्यम्) I. Tatpur. Not different, same,
identical. E. अ neg. and अन्य.
II. Bahuvr.
1 Without another, one, sole.
2 Fixed on
one object, having no other object or occupation. E. अ
priv. and अन्य.
text.2288:
अनन्यगति I. Tatpur. f. (-तिः) No other refuge, asylum or
hope, one only refuge &c. E. अ neg. and अन्य-गति.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति) Having but one refuge,
asylum or hope. E. अ priv. and अन्य-गति.
text.2289:
अनन्यगतिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Having but one
refuge, asylum or hope. E. अनन्यगति II, samāsānta
aff. कप्.
text.2290:
अनन्यचिन्त Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Having the
thoughts fixed on one only object. E. अनन्य and चिन्ता.
text.2291:
अनन्यज Tatpur. m. (-जः) A name of Kāma or Love. E. अ
neg. and अन्य-ज ‘produced by nothing else than the manas
or heart’.
text.2292:
अनन्यता f. (-ता) or अनन्यत्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 Sameness, identity.
2 Singleness. E. अनन्य I. and II., taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2293:
अनन्यदेव Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Having no other
gods. E. अ priv. and अन्य-देव.
text.2294:
अनन्यनिष्पाद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) What cannot
be done or accomplished by any one else. E. अ neg. and
अन्य-निष्पाद्य.
text.2295:
अनन्यपूर्व Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्) Intact, never in the
prior possession of another.
II. f. (-र्वा) A girl not previously wedded, a virgin. E.
अ neg. and अन्य-पूर्व. Also with taddh. aff. कन्, अनन्य-
पूर्वक m. f. n. (-र्वकः-र्विका-र्वकम्).
text.2296:
अनन्यप्रतिक्रिय Bahuvr. m. (-यः-या-यम्) Having no other
remedy. E. अ priv. and अन्य-प्रतिक्रिया.
text.2297:
अनन्यभव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Produced or effected
by no one or nothing else, by one particular person or
thing. E. अनन्य and भव.
text.2298:
अनन्यमनस् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नाः-नाः-नः) Intent, attentive,
having the mind fixed on one subject, not absent. E. अनन्य
and मनस्.
text.2299:
अनन्यमनस्क Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्कः-स्का-स्कम्). The same as
the preceding. E. अनन्यमनस्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2300:
अनन्यमानस Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-सः-सी-सम्). The same as
अनन्यमनस्. E. अनन्य and मानस.
text.2301:
अनन्यवृत्ति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) Having the mind
fixed on one object, intent, attentive. E. अनन्य and वृत्ति.
text.2302:
अनन्यहृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not stolen or taken,
safe. E. अ neg. and अन्य-हृत.
text.2303:
अनन्यादृश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शी-शम्) Not like another,
unusual, extraordinary. E. अ neg. and अन्यादृश.
text.2304:
अनन्यार्थ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) What exists or is done
&c. not for any one or any thing else, what exists &c. on
its own behalf, principal, absolute (e. g. a sacrifice). The
reverse of अन्यार्थ. E. अ and अन्यार्थ.
text.2305:
अनन्याश्रित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not supported
by or dependant upon another, independant.
II. n. (-तम्) (In law.) Unencumbered property. E. अ
and अन्य-आश्रित.
text.2306:
अनन्वय Tatpur. m. (-यः) (In rhetoric.) One of the Ālaṅkā
ras or figures of speech: comparing an object to itself, with
respect to its being the only one of its class as to the qua
lities expressed and therefore not liable to comparison with
any thing else; e. g. the moon shines like a moon i. e. like
a very moon, a moon indeed. E. अ neg. and अन्वय, literally:
‘want of connexion sc. with other objects’.
text.2307:
अनन्वित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unconnected with,
inconsistent, incoherent.
2 Devoid of, not possessing. E.
अ neg. and अन्वित.
text.2308:
अनप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Destitute of water. E. अ
priv. and अप्, samāsānta aff. अ.
text.2309:
अनपकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्). The same as the following.
E. अ neg. and अपकरण.
text.2310:
अनपकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) 1. Not doing ill, evil &c. (The re
verse of अपकर्मन् q. v.) 2. (In law.)
1 Not delivering (a
gift).
2 Not paying or acquitting (debts, wages). See also
अनपकरण, अनपक्रिया, अनपाकरण, अनपाकर्मन्. E. अ
neg. and अपकर्मन्.
text.2311:
अनपकार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Harmlessness, freedom from
hatred &c. (The reverse of अपकार q. v.) E. अ neg. and
अपकार.
text.2312:
अनपकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Innocuous &c.
(The reverse of अपकारिन्.) E. अ neg. and अपकारिन्.
text.2313:
अनपक्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या). The same as अनपकर्मन् q. v.
E. अ neg. and अपक्रिया.
text.2314:
अनपग Tatpur. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Not departing, not
being separated from. E. अ neg. and अपग.
text.2315:
अनपच्युत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Not fallen off,
not diminished in power &c., irresistible; as an epithet of
Soma, Indra &c. E. अ neg. and अपच्युत.
text.2316:
अनपजय्य Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-य्यः-य्या-य्यम्) (ved.) What has
no possibility of being made un-conquered or un-victorious
(as a victory). अनपजय्यम् used also adverbially: so as
not to become un-victorious (e. g. to conquer so as not to
have a barren victory, as not to have the ennemy rising
again). E. अ priv. and अपजय्य.
text.2317:
अनपत्य Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्)
1 Childless, having no
progeny.
2 (ved.) Prejudicial to progeny.
3 (ved. Tatpur.)
What causes to fall, unpropitious(?). E. अ priv. and अपत्य.
text.2318:
अनपत्यक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्). The same as अन-
पत्य. E. अनपत्य, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2319:
अनपत्यता f. (-ता) Childlessness, want of progency. E. अन-
पत्य, taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2320:
अनपत्यवत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Childless, hav
ing no progeny. E. अ neg. and अपत्यवत्.
text.2321:
अनपनिहित Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Having
suffered no loss, entire, complete. E. अ priv. and अपनिहित.
text.2322:
अनपयति Tatpur.(?) ind. Early in the morning. E. अ neg.
and अपयति (? the locative of अपयत्, from इ with अप,
kṛt aff. शतृ), meaning perhaps: ‘when the sun has not
yet gone far’.
text.2323:
अनपर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Having nothing that
follows or comes after; esp. as an epithet of the neuter
Brahman; opposed to अपूर्व. E. अ priv. and अपर.
text.2324:
अनपराद्ध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Having suffered no
injury; अनपराद्धम् also used adverbially: without injury.
E. अ priv. and अपराद्ध.
text.2325:
अनपराध I. Tatpur. m. (-धः) Not doing ill, innocuousness,
innocence, sinlessness. E. अ neg. and अपराध.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्)
1 Innocuous, sinless.
2 Uninjured, complete. E. अ priv. and अपराध.
text.2326:
अनपराधत्व n. (-त्वम्) Sinlessness, want of fault or defect.
E. अनपराध II., taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2327:
अनपराधिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-धी-धिनी-धि) Innocent, sin
less. E. अ neg. and अपराधिन्.
text.2328:
अनपलाषुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not thirsty. E.
अ neg. and अपलाषुक.
text.2329:
अनपवृज्य Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ज्यः-ज्या-ज्यम्) (ved.) Free from
impurity (hairs &c.), as a road. E. अ priv. and अपवृज्य
what is to be shunned.
text.2330:
अनपव्ययत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यन्-यन्ती-यत्) (ved.) Un
remitting, able, powerful. E. अ neg. and अपव्ययत् (from
व्यय् with अप, kṛt aff. शतृ).
text.2331:
अनपसर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Having no valid
reason, acting in an unjustifiable manner. E. अ priv. and
अपसर, literally: having no way-out.
text.2332:
अनपस्फुर् Tatpur. f. (-स्फूः) (ved.) Not going or running
away; an epithet of a cow. E. अ neg. and अपस्फुर्.
text.2333:
अनपस्फुर Tatpur. f. (-रा) (ved.) The same as the pre
ceding. E. अ neg. and अपस्फुर.
text.2334:
अनपस्फुरत् Tatpur. m. f. (-रन्-रन्ती) (ved.) The same as
अनपस्फुर्; also as an epithet of the udder of the cow &c.
E. अ neg. and अपस्फुरत्.
text.2335:
अनपहतपाप्मन् Tatpur. m. (-प्मा) (ved.) Not freed from sin
or evil; an epithet of the Manes. E. अ neg. and अपहत-
पाप्मन्.
text.2336:
अनपहृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not taken away,
not stolen. E. अ neg. and अपहृत.
text.2337:
अनपाकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) (In law.)
1 Not delivering (a
gift).
2 Not paying or acquitting (debts, wages). See अन-
पकर्मन्, अनपक्रिया and the following. E. अ neg. and अ-
पाकरण.
text.2338:
अनपाकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) (In law.) The same as the pre
ceding. E. अ neg. and अपाकर्मन्.
text.2339:
अनपाय I. Tatpur. m. (-यः) Absence of loss or diminution,
permanence. E. अ neg. and अपाय.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Undiminished, un
ceasing. 2. m. (-यः) A name or epithet of Śiva. E. अ
priv. and अपाय.
text.2340:
अनपायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि)
1 Firm, constant.
2 Durable, imperishable. E. अ neg. and अपायिन्.
text.2341:
अनपुंसक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) (In grammar.) Not a neuter
i. e. the masculine or feminine gender or a noun in these
two genders. E. अ neg. and नपुंसक.
text.2342:
अनपूपीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not fit for cakes.
E. अ neg. and अपूपीय.
text.2343:
अनपूप्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्). The same as the
preceding. E. अ neg. and अपूप्य.
text.2344:
अनपेक्ष I. Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) Carelessness, indifference, dis
regard. E. अ neg. and अपेक्षा.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्)
1 Disregarding.
2 Un
heeding, careless.
3 Not requiring another thing, not
referring to another thing or word in a sentence &c.,
independent or absolute. See निरपेक्ष. E. अ priv. and
अपेक्षा.
text.2345:
अनपेक्षत्व n. (-त्वम्) The being अनपेक्ष (II.), but more espe
cially in the sense 3. E. अनपेक्ष, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2346:
अनपेक्षित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Disregarded.
2 Unheeded.
E. अ neg. and अपेक्षित.
text.2347:
अनपेक्षिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्षी-क्षिणी-क्षि)
1 Disregarding.
2 Unheeding, careless. E. अ neg. and अपेक्षिन्.
text.2348:
अनपेत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Present, not passed
or gone.
2 Not devoid of, possessed of. E. अ neg. and
अपेत.
text.2349:
अनप्नस् Bahuvr. m. (-प्नाः) (ved.) Devoid of (pious) action,
impious or (according to another interpretation) devoid of
shape or form. E. अ priv. and अप्नस्.
text.2350:
अनफा f. (-फा) A certain configuration of the planets; a
transcription of the greek word .
text.2351:
अनभिज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्) Unacquainted,
ignorant, unwise. E. अ neg. and अभिज्ञ.
text.2352:
अनभिद्रुह् Tatpur. m. (-ध्रुक्) (ved.) Not doing injury; an
epithet of the Aśvins. E. अ neg. and अभिद्रुह्.
text.2353:
अनभिभूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unsubdued, un
surpassed.
2 Unobstructed. E. अ neg. and अभिभूत.
text.2354:
अनभिमत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Disliked, disagree
able, unpleasant &c. (The reverse of अभिमत.) E. अ neg.
and अभिमत.
text.2355:
अनभिम्लातवर्ण Tatpur. m. (-र्णः) (ved.) Of unwithered co
lour, very bright or splendent; an epithet of Apānnapāt.
E. अ neg. and अभिम्लातवर्ण.
text.2356:
अनभिम्लान Tatpur. m. (-नः) The proper name of a gotra
or family-chief. E. अ priv. and अभिम्लान. See आन-
भिम्लान.
text.2357:
अनभिरूप Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Not handsome, not
pleasing. E. अ neg. and अभिरूप.
text.2358:
अनभिलाष Tatpur. m. (-षः)
1 Absence of desire, indifference.
2 Want of appetite, indigestion. E. अ neg. and अभिलाष.
text.2359:
अनभिलक्षित Tatpur. m. (-तः) Not marked, not bearing sings
or symbols (e. g. of knowledge, of astrology or of other
learned acquirements, as a Vānaprastha when asking for
alms). E. अ neg. and अभिलक्षित.
text.2360:
अनभिलाषिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षी-षिणी-षि) Not desirous,
indifferent. E. अ neg. and अभिलाषिन्.
text.2361:
अनभिव्यक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Indistinct, dim.
E. अ neg. and अभिव्यक्त.
text.2362:
अनभिशस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) (ved.) Blameless,
irreproachable. E. अ neg. and अभिशस्त.
text.2363:
अनभिशस्ति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्तिः-स्तिः-स्ति) (ved.) Blame
less, irreproachable; an epithet of ājya or clarified butter.
E. अ priv. and अभिशस्ति.
text.2364:
अनभिशस्तेनी Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नीः-नीः-नि) (ved.) Leading
to what is blameless, to heaven &c. (The form अनभि-
शस्तेन्यम् which is explained as the acc. masc. singul. with
the meaning of the nom. neuter sing. is rather to be con
sidered as an irregular formation of the neuter with the addi
tion of अम् to the terminating नि.) E. अनभिशस्त (loc.) and नी.
text.2365:
अनभिशस्त्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्त्यः-स्त्या-स्त्यम्) (ved.) Blame
less, irreproachable. E. अ neg. and अभिशस्त्य.
text.2366:
अनभिषङ्ग Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) Detachment, disconnection, free
dom from affection or attachment. E. अ neg. and अभिषङ्ग.
text.2367:
अनभिसन्धिकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Done unin
tentionally, or by mistake. E. अ neg. and अभिसन्धि-कृत.
text.2368:
अनभिहित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not named,
not designated.
2 (ved.) Not tied with, not fastened with.
II. m. (-तः) A proper name of a gotraor family-chief.
His descendants are called अनभिहिताः or आनभिहितयः.
Acc. to others the proper name aught to be अभिहित q. v.
E. अ neg. and अभिहित.
text.2369:
अनभीशु Bahuvr. m. (-शुः) (ved.) Without reins (more esp.
without the rein called अभीशु q. v.), unrefrained; an
epithet of the sun. E. अ priv. and अभीशु.
text.2370:
अनभ्यारूढ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढः-ढा-ढम्) Not ascended, not
reached. E. अ neg. and अभ्यारूढ.
text.2371:
अनभ्यास Tatpur. I. m. (-सः) Want of practise, exercise &c.;
see अभ्यास.
II. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्) Not near, far, far away. Also
written अनभ्याश. E. अ neg. and अभ्यास.
text.2372:
अनभ्यासमित्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) What must not
be approached, what must be shunned from afar. Also
written अनभ्याशमित्य. E. अनभ्यास with āgama मुम् (or
taken adverbially) and इत्य.
text.2373:
अनभ्रक Bahuvr. m. pl. (-काः) A class of Bauddha gods who
reside in the first or lowest stage of the fourth sphere of
the Bauddha heaven. E. अ priv. and अभ्र, samāsānta aff.
कप्, literally ‘without clouds’.
text.2374:
अनम Tatpur. m. (-मः) A Brahman, one who does not salute
a Brahman, making obeisance to the gods only, and re
turning salutations with his blessing. E. अ neg. and नम
who salutes(?).
text.2375:
अनमस्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्यः-स्या-स्यम्) Unworthy of being
saluted. E. अ neg. and नमस्य.
text.2376:
अनमितम्पच Tatpur. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्) Miserly, niggardly.
E. अ neg. and अ-मितम्पच. Others read instead of this
word, where it occurs in the Amarak., मितम्पच.
text.2377:
अनमित्र Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Free from enemies,
without enemies.
II. n. (-त्रम्) The being free from or without enemies.
III. m. (-त्रः) A proper name of
1 A prince of the solar
race, a descendant of Sagara, son of Nighna and brother
of Raghu, the fifty-second king of Ayodhyā.
2 A son of
the king Kroṣṭu or Kroṣtṛ by Gāndhāri and father of
Śini or, according to others, a grandson of Vṛṣṇi, son
of Sumitra by Mādrī and brother to Śini; or, again, a
grandson of Dhṛṣṭa, son of Sumitra &c. E. अ priv. and
अमित्र.
text.2378:
अनमीव Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) (ved.)
1 Free from
disease, healthy.
2 Removing diseases, healthy (as food,
plants, fire).
II. n. (-वम्) Freedom from disease, good health. E. अ
priv. and अमीवा.
text.2379:
अनम्बर Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Naked, unclad,
unclothed.
II. m. (-रः) A Bauddha mendicant, going naked. See
दिगम्बर. E. अ priv. and अम्बर.
text.2380:
अनय Tatpur. m. (-यः) I. Bad or improper conduct, as
gambling &c. (see व्यसन). E. अ deter. and नय.
II.
1 Ill-luck, bad fortune.
2 Calamity, distress. E. अ
deter. and अय.
text.2381:
अनयङ्गत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Fallen into misfor
tune. E. अनय II., āgama मुम् and गत.
text.2382:
अनरण्य Bahuvr. m. (-ण्यः) The proper name of a king of
Ayodhyā, of the solar race; according to one authority, a
son of Vāna and father of Pṛthu, according to others,
a son of Sambhūta and father of Pṛṣadaśva or, again, a
son of Sarwakarman and father of Nighna. Those who
make him a son of Sambhūta, relate that he was slain by
Rāvaṇa.
text.2383:
अनरुस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रुः-रुः-रु) (ved.) Not sore, not
wounded, sound, healed. (As a Tatpur. this word occurs
only in the Vedas; it would be a Bahuvr. according to the
use of अरुस् in the classic language.) E. अ neg. and अरुस्,
sore, wounded; (or as a Bahuvr. अ priv. and अरुस्, sore,
wound).
text.2384:
अनर्गल Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Unrestrained, self
willed. E. अ priv. and अर्गल.
text.2385:
अनर्घ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्घः-र्घा-र्घम्) Invaluable, priceless.
E. अ priv. and अर्घ.
text.2386:
अनर्घराघव Tatpur. n. (-वम्) The name of a drama of Mu
rāri, the subject of which are the events in the life of Rā
ma, the descendant of Raghu. E. अनर्घ and राघव, sc. नाटक.
text.2387:
अनर्घ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्घ्यः-र्घ्या-र्घ्यम्)
1 Priceless, invaluable,
not to be bought.
2 Different from what is valuable or re
spectable. (In the first of these meanings the word is an
oxytonon, in the latter a proparoxytonon; the first mean
ing, however, is the usual one.) E. अ neg. and अर्घ्य.
text.2388:
अनर्घ्यता f. (-ता) or अनर्घ्यत्व n. (-त्वम्) Absence of price
or cost, invaluableness. E. अनर्घ्य, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2389:
अनर्थ I. Tatpur. m. (-र्थः)
1 Want of meaning, nonsense.
2 A thing that is useless or obnoxious.
3 Disadvantage,
misfortune, calamity. E. अ neg. and अर्थ.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्)
1 Meaningless, un
meaning, nonsensical.
2 Fruitless, vain, unprofitable.
3 Un
happy, unlucky. E. अ priv. and अर्थ.
text.2390:
अनर्थक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थकः-र्थका-र्थकम्)
1 Not having
the sense or meaning (of).
2 Not-significative (as a particle
&c.).
3 Unmeaning, meaningless, nonsensical.
4 Fruitless,
vain, unprofitable.
5 Unhappy, unlucky. E. अनर्थ II., sa
māsānta aff. कप्.
text.2391:
अनर्थकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्)
1 Following unpro
fitable or idle pursuits.
2 Doing mischief, causing calami
ties. E. अ neg. and अर्थकर or अनर्थ and कर.
text.2392:
अनर्थनाशिन् Tatpur. m. (-शी) A name or epithet of Śiva.
E. अनर्थ and नाशिन् ‘destroying or removing calamity’.
text.2393:
अनर्थ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्थ्यः-र्थ्या-र्थ्यम्) Devoid of substance,
useless, fit for no purpose &c.; the reverse of अर्थ्य q. v.
E. अ neg. and अर्थ्य.
text.2394:
अनर्व Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्) (ved.)
1 Not decaying,
not passing away, imperishable, permanent.
2 Without
impediment, not thwarted, unobstructed. See the following.
E. अ priv. and अर्व.
text.2395:
अनर्वन् Bahuvr. m. (-र्वा) (ved.)
1 Not moving, fixed.
2 Not
passing away, permanent.
3 Without an impediment, not
thwarted, unobstructed.
4 Without an enemy or foe. See
the preceding. (The declension of this word differs from
that of अर्वन् in so far, as it does not assume the ādeśa तृ
(i. e. त्) which is said to be the substitute of the न् in
अर्वन् q. v.; e. g. अनर्वाणम्, अनर्वाणौ, अनर्वाणः.) E. अ
priv. and अर्वन्.
text.2396:
अनर्विश् Tatpur. m. (-ट्) (ved.) I. A car-man, one going
with or on a cart. E. अनस्, with र् instead of स्, and
विश्. (Or according to another explanation, which ap
pears, however, to be an artificial one),
II. One who does not arrive where he is to go to, one
not attaining the end or aim of his journey. E. अ neg.
and अर् (from ऋ, kṛt aff. विच्) and विश् II.
text.2397:
अनर्शनि Tatpur. m. (-निः) (ved.) The name of a demon
slain by Indra. E. doubtful; probably अ neg. and अर्शनि.
text.2398:
अनर्शराति Tatpur. m. (-तिः) (ved.) One whose gifts are not
inauspicious or wicked, whose offerings do not cause pain.
A various reading of this word in the Sāmaveda is अलर्षि-
राति q. v. E. अ neg. and अर्श-राति (Bahuvr.).
text.2399:
अनर्ह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्हः-र्हा-र्हम्)
1 Not deserving.
2 Un
worthy.
3 Not fit, unsuitable. E. अ neg. and अर्ह.
text.2400:
अनल m. (-लः)
1 Fire.
2 A name of Agni or the god of fire.
3 The name of one of the eight Vasus.
4 A name of Vasu
deva.
5 The proper name of a Muni.
6 The proper name
of a monkey (in the Rāmāyaṇa).
7 The fire of the stomach,
digestive faculty.
8 Bile.
9 The name of several plants,
viz.
a. Plumbago zeylanica (see चित्रक),
b. Plumbago rosea
(see रक्तचित्रक),
c. Semicarpus anacardium (see भल्लातक).
10 Wind.
11 (In astronomy.) The name of the fiftieth year
of Bṛhaspati's cycle of sixty years.
12 (In astronomy.)
The name of the third lunar mansion or Kṛttikā(?).
13 (In
arithmetic sometimes used to denote) the numeral three; see
अग्नि(9.). E. अन्, in the causative, uṇ. aff. कलच्; (अनल
belongs to the वृषादि).
text.2401:
अनलङ्करिष्णु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णुः-ष्णुः-ष्णु)
1 Not fond of
ornaments, dress &c.
2 Not making show of ornaments,
not ornamented. E. अ neg. and अलङ्करिष्णु.
text.2402:
अनलदीपन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Producing appetite,
stomachic. See अग्निदीपन. E. अनल and दीपन.
text.2403:
अनलप्रभा Tatpur. f. (-भा) The name of a plant (Halicaca
bum cardiospermum); see ज्योतिष्मती. E. अनल and प्रभा
‘fire-shine’.
text.2404:
अनलप्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) The wife of Agni. E. अनल and
प्रिया.
text.2405:
अनलम् Tatpur. ind. Not enough, insufficient, unequal, un
able. E. अ neg. and अलम्.
text.2406:
अनलवाट Tatpur. m. (-टः) The name of ancient Pattana.
E. अनल and वाट.
text.2407:
अनलस Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्)
1 Not indolent or lazy.
2 Diligent, industrious. E. अ neg. and अलस.
text.2408:
अनलसाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Decrease of digestive faculty,
loss of appetite; lit. decay of the stomachic fire. E. अनल 7.
and साद.
text.2409:
अनलि m. (-लिः) The name of a tree (Sesbana grandiflora);
see अगस्तिद्रु. E. अनल, taddh. aff. इ(?).
text.2410:
अनल्प Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ल्पः-ल्पा-ल्पम्) Not a little, much.
E. अ neg. and अल्प.
text.2411:
अनल्पघोष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Making much noise,
vociferous. E. अनल्प and घोष.
text.2412:
अनवकाश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्)
1 Having no op
portunity &c.; see अवकाश.
2 Having no proper place, ir
relevant, unessential; (as words of an instance &c. which
have no bearing on the rule to be illustrated, opposed to
those words of it which are essential for the purpose). E.
अ priv. and अवकाश.
text.2413:
अनवकाशता f. (-ता) or अनवकाशत्व n. (-त्वम्) The being
irrelevant or unessential. E. अनवकाश, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2414:
अनवग्रह Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Not to be obstructed
or impeded, resistless. E. अ priv. and अवग्रह.
text.2415:
अनवच्छिन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्)
1 Not cut, not
separated, uninterrupted.
2 Unbounded.
3 Immoderate, ex
cessive.
4 (In Nyāya phil.) Undiscriminated. E. अ neg.
and अवच्छिन्न.
text.2416:
अनवच्छिन्नहास Karmadh. m. (-सः) Uninterrupted or excessive
laughter. See अतिहास. E. अनवच्छिन्न and हास.
text.2417:
अनवतप्त Tatpur. m. (-प्तः) (In Buddhist mythology and
legends.)
1 The name of a serpent-king.
2 The name of a
renowned lake where the disciples of Śākyamuni held
several of their meetings; probably the same as Rāvaṇa
hrada. E. अ neg. and अवतप्त.
text.2418: अनवत्. See the E. of the following.
text.2419:
अनवत्त्व n. (-त्त्वम्) The being endowed with life, the pro
perty or quality of what is living. E. अनवत् (endowed
with life, breathing, living, from अन III., taddh. aff. मतुप्,
but occurring only as the thematic form of this word),
taddh. aff. त्व; used in a vaidik commentary, to explain
one meaning of the word असुरत्व.
text.2420:
अनवद्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्)
1 Blameless, irre
proachable.
2 Unobjectionable, allowable.
II. f. (-द्या) The proper name of an Apsaras, the daugh
ter of Prādhā.
text.2421:
अनवद्यरूप Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Of faultless form,
beautiful. E. अनवद्य and रूप.
text.2422:
अनवद्याङ्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गी or ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Of fault
less form, beautiful. E. अनवद्य and अङ्ग, fem. ङीष् or टाप्.
text.2423:
अनवधान I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Inadvertence, inattention,
carelessness. See also अनवधानता and अनवहितत्व. E. अ
neg. and अवधान.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Inattentive, careless.
E. अ priv. and अवधान.
text.2424:
अनवधानता f. (-ता) Inadvertence, inattention, carelessness.
E. अनवधान II., taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2425:
अनवधि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धिः-धिः-धि) Illimited, infinite.
E. अ priv. and अवधि.
text.2426:
अनवधृष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) Not to be hurt or
overcome, invincible, uninjurable. E. अ neg. and अवधृष्य.
text.2427:
अनवन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Affording no help or
protection. E. अ priv. and अवन.
text.2428:
अनवनामितवैजयन्त Bahuvr. m. (-न्तः) The name of a Buddhist
future universe; one in which Ānanda is to reappear under
the name of Sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍita. E. अनवनामित
and वैजयन्त, literally: with banners unprostrate i. e. always
victorious(?).
text.2429:
अनवपृग्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्णः-ग्णा-ग्णम्) (ved.) Not mixed,
not kept together (an epithet of the lustre of the sun which
is not kept together, on a limited space, but shed over the
world). E. अ neg. and अवपृग्ण.
text.2430:
अनवब्रव Bahuvr. m. (-वः) (ved.) One whose words are not
thrown away, whose commands are not idle or given in
vain, who commands respect. E. अ priv. and अवब्रव.
text.2431:
अनवभ्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-भ्रः-भ्रा-भ्रम्) (ved.) Having suffered
no loss or diminution, undiminished. E. अ priv. and अवभ्र.
See the following.
text.2432:
अनवभ्रराधस् Bahuvr. m. (-धाः) (ved.) With undiminished
riches, in the fulness of wealth; esp. in the plural, as an
epithet of the Maruts, the riches of which consist, according
to the commentators, in the clarified butter &c. they re
ceive in the sacrifice. E. अनवभ्र and राधस्.
text.2433:
अनवम Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Not low, high, il
lustrious. E. अ neg. and अवम.
text.2434: अनवमर्शम् Tatpur. ind. Without touching. E. अ neg. and अवमर्शम्.
text.2435:
अनवर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Not inferior, not
less.
2 Excellent, superior. E. अ neg. and अवर.
text.2436:
अनवरत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uninterrupted, con
tinual, eternal.--अनवरतम् used adv., continually, eter
nally. E. अ neg. and अवरत.
text.2437:
अनवरथ Bahuvr.(?) m. (-थः) The name of a prince, descend
ant from Kroṣṭṛ, the son of Madhu and father of Kuru
vatsa; his grandson is Anuratha. E. अ priv. and अवरथ(?).
text.2438:
अनवरार्ध्य m. f. n. (-र्ध्यः-र्ध्या-र्ध्यम्) Chief, principal, best.
E. अ neg. and अवरार्ध (forming a Tatpur.), taddh. aff. यत्.
text.2439:
अनवलम्ब Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-म्बः-म्बा-म्बम्) Without support,
dependance &c.; see अवलम्ब. E. अ priv. and अवलम्ब.
text.2440:
अनवलोभन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) One of the संस्कार q. v., a
purificatory rite observed in the third month after concep
tion. E. अ neg. and अवलोभन.
text.2441:
अनवस Bahuvr. m. (-सः) (ved.) Without food while travelling.
(See अवस.) E. अ priv. and अवस.
text.2442:
अनवसर I. Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 Want of leisure or opportunity.
2 Unseasonableness, inopportuneness. E. अ neg. and अवसर.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Having no leisure,
occupied, busy.
2 Unseasonable, inopportune. E. अ priv.
and अवसर.
text.2443:
अनवसान Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 Without conclusion,
endless.
2 Free from death. E. अ priv. and अवसान.
text.2444:
अनवसित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not terminated
&c. See अवसित.
II. f. (-ता) The name of a metre regulated by number and
quantity, a species of the class called Triṣṭubh (q. v.); it con
sists of a stanza of four lines with the following eleven feet in
each line: {??} E. अ neg. and अवसित.
text.2445:
अनवस्कर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Freed from dirt,
cleansed. E. अ priv. and अवस्कर.
text.2446:
अनवस्थ I. Tatpur. f. (-स्था)
1 An unsettled state, want of
fixedness, unsteadiness, uncertainty.
2 Incontinence, dis
soluteness.
3 Indeterminateness, unboundedness; esp. in the
Nyāya philosophy: an endless series (of causes and effects),
the regressus in infinitum; e. g. in arguing that the lamp
is the cause which reveals the existence of a jar, the eye
the cause which reveals that of the lamp, and so on. E. अ
neg. and अवस्था.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्)
1 Not fixed, not per
manent, unstable, not lasting. E. अ priv. and अवस्था.
text.2447:
अनवस्थान I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Instability, want of fixed
ness, unsteadiness.
2 Incontinence, misconduct. E. अ neg.
and अवस्थान.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Unsteady, mutable, va
riable, not lasting. 2. m. (-नः) Wind. E. अ priv. and अवस्थान.
text.2448:
अनवस्थायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Unstable,
transitory. E. अ neg. and अवस्थायिन्.
text.2449:
अनवस्थित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unfixed, unstable,
unsteady, inconstant, uncertain.
2 Loose, abandoned, vio
lating moral and legal restraint. E. अ neg. and अवस्थित.
text.2450:
अनवस्थितचित्त Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Unsteady
minded. E. अनवस्थित and चित्त.
text.2451:
अनवस्थितता f. (-ता) or अनवस्थितत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as
the following. E. अनवस्थित, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2452:
अनवस्थिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Unsteadiness, instability.
2 Misconduct, incontinence, dissoluteness.
text.2453:
अनवहित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Inattentive, careless.
E. अ neg. and अवहित.
text.2454:
अनवहितत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as अनवधान q. v. E. अनव-
हित, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2455:
अनवह्वर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) (ved.) Not crooked,
straight, upright, honest. E. अ neg. and अवह्वर.
text.2456:
अनवाच् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्) Not dumb, eloquent. E. अ
neg. and अवाच्.
text.2457:
अनवाञ्च् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ङ्-ची-क्) Not downlooked, look
ing upwards or in front of. E. अ neg. and अवाञ्च्.
text.2458:
अनवानम् Tatpur. ind. Without breathing, in one breath, with
out interruption. E. अ neg. and अवानम् (अन् with अव,
kṛt aff. णमुल्).
text.2459:
अनवानता f. (-ता) Close contiguity, uninterruptedness. E.
अनवान (अनवानम् with elision of the म् of the kṛt aff.
णमुल्), taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2460:
अनवाप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Not obtained, not
received. E. अ neg. and अवाप्त.
text.2461:
अनवाप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Not obtaining, not receiving, not
getting. E. अ neg. and अवाप्ति.
text.2462:
अनवायम् Bahuvr. ind. (ved.) Without interruption, continually.
E. अ priv. and अवाय.
text.2463:
अनविथ्य(?) Tatpur. m. f. n. (-थ्यः-थ्या-थ्यम्) Not fit for or suited
to a sheep. E. अ neg. and अविथ्य.
text.2464:
अनवेक्ष I. Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) Want of attention, want of re
gard, regardlessness. E. अ neg. and अवेक्षा.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षा-क्षम्) Taking no regard,
regardless.--अनवेक्षम् used also as adv.; without paying
attention or taking regard. E. अ priv. and अवेक्षा; अनवेक्षम्
may be however also a Tatpur. from अ neg. and अवेक्षम्
(ईक्ष् with अव, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
text.2465:
अनव्रत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not destitute of
meritorious acts of devotion; especially.
II. m. (-तः) A Jaina devotee who only partially con
forms to the rules of his order. E. अ neg. and अव्रत.
text.2466:
अनशन I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) A fast, fasting. In law, fasting
of a creditor or of a Brahman employed by him to enforce
payment of a debt, the debtor incurring the guilt of Brahma
nicide, if the person should die of inanition. E. अ neg. and
अशन.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) One who fasts. E. अ
priv. and अशन.
text.2467: अनशनता f. (-ता) Fasting. E. अनशन II., taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2468:
अनशनाय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not hungry. E. अ
priv. and अशनाया.
text.2469:
अनशित Tatpur. n. (-तम्) Fasting; esp. in composition with
अशित; e. g. अशितेनानशितेन जीवति he lives now eating
now fasting. E. अ neg. and अशित.
text.2470:
अनश्नत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्नन्-श्नती-श्नत्) Not eating, not
enjoying. E. अ neg. and अश्नत्.
text.2471:
अनश्नन्त्साङ्गमन Tatpur. m. (-नः) (ved.) The name of the
sacrificial fire in the Sabhā, so called because it is ap
proached early in the morning before breakfast. E. अनश्नत्
and साङ्गमन ‘the fire approached by those who have not
yet eaten any thing’.
text.2472:
अनश्रु Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-श्रुः-श्रुः-श्रु) Without tears, not shedding
tears. E. अ priv. and अश्रु.
text.2473:
अनश्व Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-श्वः-श्वा-श्वम्) Without a horse or
horses. E. अ priv. and अश्व.
text.2474:
अनश्वदा Tatpur. m. (-दाः) (ved.) Not giving horses. E. अ
neg. and अश्वदा.
text.2475:
अनश्वन् Tatpur.(?) m. (-श्वा) The proper name of a prince,
the son of Vidūratha by Sampriyā and father of Parīkṣit.
E. unknown.
text.2476:
अनश्वर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Imperishable, eternal.
E. अ neg. and नश्वर.
text.2477:
अनष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not lost, not destroyed.
E. अ neg. and नष्ट.
text.2478:
अनस् n. (-नः)
1 A cart, esp. one made of wood and tied over
with cloth.
2 Boiled rice (cf. अन्न and अन्धस्).
3 A mother.
4 Birth.
5 A living being, an animal. (The final स् of this word
is changed sometimes to र् or ड्; see अनर्विश्, अनडुह्.-
Avyayībhāva compounds, or according to others, also other
compounds, the latter part of which is अनस्, assume the
samāsānta aff. टच्, e. g. उपानसम्, महानस (qq. vv.). E.
अन्, uṇ. aff. असुन्.
text.2479:
अनसूय I. Tatpur. f. (-या) Want of detractiveness, the not
lowering maliciously other's merits, good qualities &c. E.
अ neg. and असूया.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Free from detractive
ness, not lowering maliciously other's merits, good qualities &c.
2. f. (-या) A proper name of
1 a daughter of Daksha,
the wife of Atri (q. v.) and mother of Durvāsas,
2 a friend
of Śakuntalā (in the drama Śak.). E. अ priv. and असूया.
text.2480:
अनसूयक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) The same as अनसूय
II. 1. E. अनसूय II. 1., samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2481:
अनसूयु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-युः-युः-यु) Free from detractiveness,
not lowering maliciously other's merits, good qualities &c.
E. अ neg. and असूयु.
text.2482:
अनसूरि Tatpur. m. (-रिः) Not unwise, wise, not unintelli
gent. E. अ neg. and असूरि.
text.2483:
अनस्तमित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not set (as the
sun).
2 Not ceasing, not perishing, imperishable. E. अ
neg. and अस्तमित.
text.2484:
अनस्थ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्थः-स्था-स्थम्) (ved.) Boneless. E.
अ priv. and अस्थि, samāsānta aff. अ(?).
text.2485:
अनस्थि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-स्थिः-स्थिः-स्थि) Boneless. (For the
declension of this word see अस्थि.) E. अ priv. and अस्थि.
text.2486:
अनस्थिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Boneless. E. अनस्थि,
taddh. aff. कप्.
text.2487:
अनस्थिमत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्) Boneless. E.
अ neg. and अस्थिमत्.
text.2488:
अनस्वत् m. f. n. (-स्वान्-स्वती-स्वत्) Having a cart, with a
cart. E. अनस्, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.2489:
अनहङ्कार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 Absence of the sense of self.
2 Absence of the pride of individuality, humility. E. अ
neg. and अहङ्कार.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Free from the pride
of individuality, not proud, humble.
text.2490:
अनहङ्कारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि). The same as
अनहङ्कार II. E. अ neg. and अहङ्कारिन्.
text.2491:
अनहङ्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not having the pride
of individuality, not proud, humble. E. अ neg. and अहङ्कृत.
text.2492:
अनहङ्कृति I. Tatpur. f. (-तिः). The same as अनहङ्कार I.
E. अ neg. and अहङ्कृति.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति). The same as अन-
हङ्कार II. E. अ priv. and अहङ्कृति.
text.2493:
अनहन् Tatpur. n. (-हः) No-day, a bad day, an unlucky day.
(For the declension of this word see अहन्.) E. अ deter.
and अहन्.
text.2494:
अना ind. (ved.) Certainly, indeed. (A commentator of the
Amarakosha considers this particle as a synonyme of the
negative न; his opinion rests, however, only on an arti
ficial interpretation of the word अनावृष्टि (q. v.) and is
refuted by others who explain it as derived, not from अना
and वृष्टि, but from अ neg. and आवृष्टि.) E. unknown;
probably an obsolete third case of the pronominal theme
अ (q. v.).
text.2495:
अनाकार Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Shapeless, without
form. E. अ priv. and आकार.
text.2496:
अनाकारित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not demanded,
not exacted. E. अ neg. and आकारित.
text.2497:
अनाकाल Tatpur. m. (-लः)
1 Unfit or improper time.
2 Hard
time, as famine &c. See the following word. E. अ neg.
and आकाल.
text.2498:
अनाकालभृत Tatpur. m. (-तः) (In law.) One of the fifteen
kinds of slaves (see दास): a man who has become a slave
voluntarily, for the sake of sustenance at a season of fa
mine. (The less correct reading of this word is अन्नाकाल-
भृत.) E. अनाकाल and भृत, scil. दास.
text.2499:
अनाकाश I. Tatpur. m. n. (-शः-शम्) No-æther, any thing
different from æther or atmosphere. E. अ neg. and आकाश.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Having no æther,
destitute of the properties of æther. E. अ priv. and आकाश.
text.2500:
अनाकुल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्)
1 Unperplexed, col
lected, composed.
2 Not contradicting one's self, consistent
with one's self. E. अ neg. and आकुल.
text.2501:
अनाकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unrestrained;
(according to the explanation of a vaidik commentator).
E. अ neg. and आकृत.
text.2502:
अनाक्रान्त Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) The reverse of
आक्रान्त q. v.
II. f. (-न्ता) A sort of prickly nightshade (Solanum
jacquini Wild.). See अग्निदमनी and कण्टकारिका. E. अ
neg. and आक्रान्त.
text.2503:
अनाग I. Bahuvr. m. (-गः) (ved.) Without fault or sin. E.
an abbreviated form of अनागस्.
II. Tatpur.(?) f. (-गा) The name of a river; (the read
ing of this word, however, is doubtful). E. uncertain.
text.2504:
अनागत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not arrived, not
approached.
2 Not acquired, not learnt, not obtained.
3 Un
known, undistinguished.
4 Not yet come, future.
II. n. (-तम्) The future time. E. अ neg. and आगत.
text.2505:
अनागतवत् m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Full with future events,
much engaged with what will come (as thoughts &c.). E.
अनागत, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.2506:
अनागतविधातृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) One who makes his dispositions
for the future, forecasting, cautious. E. अनागत and विधातृ.
text.2507:
अनागताबाध Karmadh. m. (-धः) Future pain or illness. E.
अनागत and आबाध.
text.2508:
अनागतार्तवा Bahuvr. f. (-वा) A young girl, one not arrived
at puberty; according to a commentary, a girl eight years
old (the same as गौरी q. v.). E. अनागत and आर्तव.
text.2509:
अनागतावेक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Looking or referring to
what is to come or follows (e. g. in a book &c.). E. अनागत
and अवेक्षण.
text.2510:
अनागम I. Tatpur. m. (-मः)
1 Non-arrival.
2 Non-acquisition.
E. अ neg. and आगम.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्)
1 Not arrived, not
present.
2 (In law.) Without legal acquisition, without
title deeds, from time immemorial (used of estates, privi
leges &c.). See also निरागम. E. अ priv. and आगम.
text.2511:
अनागमोपभोग Karmadh. m. (-गः) The use or enjoyment of
estates &c. without legal acquisition, without title deeds,
from time immemorial. See also निरागमोपभोग. E. अनागम
and उपभोग.
text.2512:
अनागम्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-म्यः-म्या-म्यम्)
1 Unapproachable,
inaccessible.
2 Unobtainable. E. अ neg. and आगम्य.
text.2513:
अनागस् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-गाः-गाः-गः)
1 Free from fault or
sin, pious, virtuous.
2 Removing fault or sin, conferring
happiness. E. अ priv. and आगस्. Comp. अनाग.
text.2514:
अनागामिन् Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि)
1 Not arriv
ing, not coming.
2 Not future.
II. m. (-मी) The third of the four orders of the Bud
dhists, generally termed Āryās; (see besides श्रोतआपन्न,
सकृदागामिन् and अर्हत्): literally, one who does not return,
but it means one who has only to pass through forty
thousand kalpas and then is freed from transmigration. E.
अ neg. and आगामिन्.
text.2515:
अनागामुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not arriving or
coming frequently, not disposed to come habitually. E. अ
neg. and आगामुक.
text.2516:
अनागास्त्व n. (-त्वम्) (ved.) Exemption from fault or sin,
sinlessness. E. अनागस्, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2517:
अनाचरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Improper or immoral conduct.
E. अ neg. and आचरण.
text.2518:
अनाचार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) Impropriety, misconduct, vio
lation of moral or civil laws.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Ill behaved, indecent.
immoral.
text.2519:
अनाचारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Ill behaved, in
decent, immoral. E. अ neg. and आचारिन्.
text.2520:
अनाचार्यभोगीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not fit to be
eaten or enjoyed by a spiritual teacher. E. अ neg. and
आचार्यभोगीन.
text.2521:
अनाज्ञप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Not ordered, not
commanded. E. अ neg. and आज्ञप्त.
text.2522:
अनाज्ञप्तकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Doing what
is not ordered, acting without order. E. अनाज्ञप्त and
कारिन्.
text.2523:
अनाज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not known, un
heard of. (This word may form, as a term of praise, the
first part of Karmadh. compounds e. g. अनाज्ञाताध्यापक.)
E. अ neg. and आज्ञात.
text.2524:
अनाढ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ढ्यः-ढ्या-ढ्यम्) Not rich, poor. E. अ
neg. and आढ्य.
text.2525:
अनाढ्यम्भविष्णु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णुः-ष्णुः-ष्णु) Not becoming
rich or wealthy. E. अ neg. and आढ्यम्भविष्णु.
text.2526:
अनातत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not strung (as a bow).
(According to a vaidik commentary also: not placed on a
bow, as an arrow; this latter meaning, however, seems
doubtful.) E. अ neg. and आतत.
text.2527:
अनातप Tatpur. m. (-पः)
1 Coolness.
2 Shade, shadow. E.
अ neg. and आतप.
text.2528:
अनातुर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Free from sickness
or disease, well, vigorous. E. अ neg. and आतुर.
text.2529:
अनात्मक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Void of substance
or reality (as the phenomena of this world, according to
the Bauddha doctrine). E. अ priv. and आत्मन्, samāsānta
aff. कप्.
text.2530:
अनात्मन् I. Tatpur. m. (-त्मा)
1 No-soul, other than spirit
or soul.
2 Not self, other. E. अ neg. and आत्मन्.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्मा-त्मा-त्म) Without spirit or soul.
E. अ priv. and आत्मन्.
text.2531:
अनात्मनीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not suitable, not
fit for one's self. E. अ neg. and आत्मनीन.
text.2532:
अनात्मप्रत्यवेक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) In Buddhist doctrine, one of
the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.): the reflection that there is no
soul or self. E. अनात्मन् and प्रत्यवेक्षा.
text.2533:
अनात्मवत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्) Not self pos
sessed, without self-control. E. अ neg. and आत्मवत्.
text.2534:
अनात्म्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्म्यः-त्म्या-त्म्यम्) Impersonal (as
Brahman. n.). E. अ neg. and आत्म्य.
text.2535:
अनात्यन्तिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) Not final, not
permanent. E. अ neg. and आत्यन्तिक.
text.2536:
अनात्यन्तिकत्व n. (-त्वम्) Absence of finality, reoccurrence
(e. g. of pains). E. अनात्यन्तिक, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2537:
अनाथ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्)
1 Without a lord or
protector (as an orphan, one without a सपिण्ड (q. v.) &c.),
without a master.
2 Helpless, poor. E. अ priv. and नाथ.
text.2538:
अनाथपिण्डद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The name of a celebrated
merchant, the owner of the garden Jetavana near Śrāvasti,
where the Buddha Sākyamuni used to explain his doctrine
to his disciples. He was also called अनाथपिण्डिक. E.
अनाथ and पिण्ड-द ‘giving food to the poor’.
text.2539:
अनाथपिण्डिक m. (-कः) The same as the preceding. E. अनाथ-
पिण्डिन्, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.2540: अनाथसभा Tatpur. f. (-भा) A poor-house. E. अनाथ and सभा.
text.2541:
अनादर I. Tatpur. m. (-रः) Disrespect, contempt. E. अ
neg. and आदर.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) (According to the com
mentary of an Upanishad.) Not bewildered, not agitated
(an epithet of आत्मन् or the soul; but perhaps also: ‘not
zealous, not making any effort, calm, quiet’). E. अ priv.
and आदर.
text.2542:
अनादरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Not having regard, treating
with disrespect or contempt. E. अ neg. and आदरण.
text.2543:
अनादरिन् m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Wanting in respect or re
gard, disrespectful, disregardful. E. अनादर, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2544:
अनादि Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दिः-दिः-दि) Without any beginning,
unborn, uncreate, eternal. E. अ priv. and आदि.
text.2545:
अनादिता f. (-ता) or अनादित्व n. (-त्वम्) Exemption from
commencement, eternity. E. अनादि, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2546:
अनादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Who or what does
not sound. E. अ neg. and नादिन्.
text.2547:
अनादिनिधन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without beginning
and termination, eternal. E. अ priv. and आदि-निधन
(Dwandwa).
text.2548:
अनादिमत् m. f. n. (-मान्-मती-मत्). The same as अनादि.
E. अनादि, taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.2549:
अनादिमत्त्व n. (-त्त्वम्) The being without any beginning,
the being eternal. E. अनादिमत्, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2550:
अनादिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Not assigned, not
appointed, not fixed.
2 Not commanded, not directed.
3 Not
allowed. E. अ neg. and आदिष्ट.
text.2551:
अनादृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not respected.
2 Dis
respected, disregarded, despised. E. अ neg. and आदृत.
text.2552:
अनादेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्)
1 Not to be taken or
received, unacceptable.
2 Not admissible, inadmissible (as
a law suit, a plaint). E. अ neg. and आदेय.
text.2553:
अनाद्य m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) I. Tatpur. Not to be eaten,
not edible. E. अ neg. and आद्य.
II. Bahuvr. Without a beginning, unborn, uncreate,
eternal. E. अ priv. and आद्य.
text.2554:
अनाद्यनन्त Dwandwa m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Without a be
ginning and end, eternal. E. अनादि and अनन्त.
text.2555:
अनाद्यन्त Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Without a be
ginning and end, eternal.
II. m. (-न्तः) A name of Śiva. E. अ priv. and आदि-
अन्त (Dwandwa).
text.2556:
अनाधृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Not overcome,
not vanquished, unconquered. E. अ neg. and आधृष्ट.
text.2557:
अनाधृष्टि Bahuvr. m. (-ष्टिः)
1 The proper name of
a. a prince,
the son of Śura by Bhojyā, or according to others by
Māriṣā, and brother of Vasudeva; his wife is Aśmakī
and his son Ninartaśatru or according to another reading,
Nirvṛttiśatru;
b. a son of Ugrasena and chief of the Yā
davas.
2 A name or epithet of Ṛcheyu, the son of Rau
drāśva. E. अ priv. and आधृष्टि, ‘suffering no defeat, in
vincible’.
text.2558:
अनाधृष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) (ved.) Unconquerable,
indomitable. E. अ neg. and आधृष्य.
text.2559:
अनानत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Not bent,
not depressed, unimpaired, superior.
II. m. (-तः) The name of a Ṛṣi, the son of Paru
chhepa and author of a vaidik hymn. E. अ neg. and आनत.
text.2560:
अनानुकृत्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्) (ved.) Not to be
done again, unparalleled. E. अ neg. and अनुकृत्य, the first
syllable of the latter part of the compound being made long,
or perhaps अन neg. and अनुकृत्य.
text.2561:
अनानुद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्) (ved.)
1 Having no
follower, unaided, alone.
2 Unsurpassed in liberality (lit.
without any one who could give after, i. e. in a similar
manner). Both meanings of this word, as given according
to the comm., seem doubtful; it occurs as an epithet of
Indra and Brihaspati. E. अ priv. and अनुद, the first syllable
of the latter part of the compound being lengthened, or per
haps अन priv. and अनुद.
text.2562:
अनानुदिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Unasked. E. अ
neg. and अनुदिष्ट, the first syllable of the latter part of the
compound being made long, or perhaps अन neg. and अनुदिष्ट.
text.2563:
अनानुभूति Tatpur. f. (-तिः; occurs only in the plur. -तयः)
(ved.) Inattentiveness, neglect; esp. personified: those who
are neglectful in holy acts or worship (sc. प्रजाः). Cf. अनाभू.
E. अ neg. and अनुभूति, the अ of the latter part of the com
pound being made long, or perhaps, अन neg. and अनुभूति.
text.2564:
अनापद् Tatpur. f. (-त्) Absence of calamity or misfortune.
E. अ neg. and आपद्.
text.2565:
अनापन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Unobtained, unattained.
E. अ neg. and आपन्न.
text.2566:
अनापान Bahuvr. m. (-नः) The proper name of a prince;
according to one authority, the son of Anga, a descendant
of Anu. E. अ priv. and आपान.
text.2567:
अनापि Bahuvr. m. (-पिः) (ved.) Without relations, without
equals(?); an epithet of Indra. E. अ priv. and आपि, re
lation (equal?).
text.2568:
अनापूयित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not infected with
stench or putrefaction. E. अ neg. and आपूयित.
text.2569:
अनाप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्)
1 Not obtained, not
gained.
2 Not having obtained, not having attained.
3 Un
skilful, unapt. E. अ neg. and आप्त.
text.2570:
अनाप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Not obtaining, not attaining. E.
अ neg. and आप्ति.
text.2571:
अनाप्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्) Not obtainable. E. अ
neg. and आप्य.
text.2572:
अनाबाध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Without obstruction
or vexation, unobstructed, unmolested. See also निराबाध.
E. अ priv. and आबाधा.
text.2573:
अनाभयिन् Tatpur. m. (-यी) (ved.) Fearless; an epithet of
Indra. E. अ neg. and आभयिन्(?).
text.2574:
अनाभू Tatpur. m. (-भूः, esp. in the plur. -भुवः) (ved.) One
who is neglectful in worship or holy acts. Cf. अनानुभूति.
E. अ neg. and आभू.
text.2575:
अनामक Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्)
1 Nameless.
2 Hav
ing a bad name.
II. m. (-कः) An intercalary month. See मलमास.
III. n. (-कम्) Piles or hœmorrhoids. E. अ priv. or deter.
and नामन्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2576:
अनामन् Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-मा-मा-म)
1 Nameless.
2 Hav
ing a bad name.
II. f. (-मा) The ring finger. See अनामिका. E. अ priv.
and नामन्, ‘because the head of Brahmā having being cut
off with this finger, it has become unworthy of a name’.
text.2577:
अनामय Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्)
1 Free from dis
ease or sickness, healthy.
2 Not producing disease.
II. m. (-यः) A name of Śiva.
III. n. (-यम्)
1 Health.
2 A medicament or drug(?). E.
अ priv. and आमय.
text.2578:
अनामयत् Tatpur. n. (-यत्) (ved.) Health. E. अ neg. and
आमयत्, lit.: absence of what makes or allows to be sick.
text.2579:
अनामयित्नु m. f. n. (-त्नुः-त्नुः-त्नु) (ved.) Freeing from disease.
E. अनामय् (denom. from अनामय), uṇ. aff. इत्नुच्.
text.2580:
अनामिका Bahuvr. f. (-का) The ring finger. See अनामन्.
E. अ priv. and नामन्, samāsānta aff. कप् (the insertion
of इ before the aff. is irregular).
text.2581:
अनामिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) (ved.) Unbending.
E. अ neg. and नामिन्.
text.2582:
अनामिष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Without flesh, with
out enjoyment, bootless, profitless &c. See आमिष. E. अ
priv. and आमिष.
text.2583:
अनामृण Bahuvr. m. (-णः) (ved.) Free from foes or such as
can do injury; an epithet of Indra. E. अ priv. and आमृण.
text.2584:
अनामृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) No where perishable,
everlasting. E. अ neg. and आमृत.
text.2585:
अनायक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Without a leader,
without a ruler or chief. E. अ priv. and नायक.
text.2586:
अनायत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unchecked, un
restrained.
2 Close, continuous, unseparated.
3 Unextended,
having no length. E. अ neg. and आयत.
text.2587:
अनायतन I. Tatpur. n. (-नम्) No-altar, no-abode. E. अ
neg. and आयतन.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Having no abode, no
altar. E. अ priv. and आयतन.
text.2588:
अनायतनवत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वान्-वती-वत्)
1 Having no
abode.
2 Having no altar. E. अ neg. and आयतनवत्.
text.2589:
अनायत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Independent, uncon
trolled. E. अ neg. and आयत्त.
text.2590:
अनायत्तवृत्ति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) Having an in
dependent subsistence or livelihood. E. अनायत्त and वृत्ति.
text.2591:
अनायत्तवृत्तिता f. (-ता) Independence, self subsistence. E.
अनायत्तवृत्ति, taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2592:
अनायसाग्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्रः-ग्रा-ग्रम्) Having no iron
point (as an arrow). E. अ neg. and आयसाग्र.
text.2593:
अनायास I. Tatpur. m. (-सः)
1 Exemption from pain or dif
ficulty, facility, ease.
2 Absence of exertion, idleness,
neglect. E. अ neg. and आयास.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-सः-सा-सम्) Easy, not difficult.
E. अ priv. and आयास.
text.2594:
अनायासकृत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Done easily,
readily, without effort.
II. n. (-तम्) (In medicine.) An infusion made by simply
putting the plant into water without any other preparations
and extracting in such a manner its juice or essence; f. i.
myrobalan (त्रिफला)--infusions &c. E. अनायास and कृत.
text.2595:
अनायुषा Bahuvr. f. (-षा) A proper name: one of the daughters
of Daksha and wives of Kāśyapa, the mother of Bala and
Vṛtra. See अनायुस्. E. अ priv. and आयुस्, fem. aff.
टाप्; (the formation is irregular).
text.2596:
अनायुष्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्यः-ष्या-ष्यम्) Not giving long life,
destructive of life, fatal. E. अ neg. and आयुष्य.
text.2597:
अनायुस् Bahuvr. f. (-युः) A proper name: the same as अना-
युषा. E. अ priv. and आयुस्.
text.2598:
अनारत Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Continual, eternal.
अनारतम् continually, eternally. E. अ priv. and आरत.
text.2599:
अनारभ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भ्यः-भ्या-भ्यम्) What cannot or
aught not to be begun or attempted. E. अ neg. and आरभ्य.
text.2600:
अनारभ्यवाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) An injunction (concerning sa
crifices or vaidik rites) not connected with the books or
chapters which treat authoritatively on sacrifices &c. in the
regular order. See आरभ्यवाद and the following. E. अ
neg. and आरभ्यवाद.
text.2601:
अनारभ्याधीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not read in con
nexion with chapters or books treating authoritatively on
vaidik rites or sacrifices; said of passages, esp. in the
Brāhmaṇas, which treat on rites, sacrifices &c. not to be
connected with other passages with which they may happen
to be found together, the injunctions of the latter not be
ing applicable to those of the former. A ceremonial, for
instance, taught in an anārabhyādhīta, would not be con
sidered as the essential part of another ceremonial, treated
in passages, called ārabhyādhīta, which may precede or
follow it, nor share in the general rules concerning these;
and it is, therefore, always the object of special rules which
define its position amongst the other parts of the ritual and
its applicability. E. अ neg. and आरभ्याधीत.
text.2602:
अनारम्बण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) (ved.) Without
support, unsupported. See अनालम्बन. E. अ priv. and
आरम्बण.
text.2603:
अनारम्भ I. Tatpur. m. (-म्भः) Non-commencement, not at
tempting or undertaking. E. अ neg. and आरम्भ.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-म्भः-म्भा-म्भम्) Without beginning or
commencement. E. अ priv. and आरम्भ.
text.2604:
अनारम्भण Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) (ved. according
to the comm.) Without support, unsupported (see अना-
लम्बन); but it may mean also: without a point of touch,
not palpable, as æther, darkness. E. अ priv. and आरम्भण.
text.2605:
अनारोग्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-ग्यः-ग्या-ग्यम्) Unhealthy, not
salubrious, unwholesome.
II. n. (-ग्यम्) Want of health, sickness. E. अ neg. and
आरोग्य.
text.2606:
अनारोग्यकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Causing sickness,
unwholesome. E. अनारोग्य and कर, fem. ङीप्.
text.2607:
अनार्जव Tatpur. n. (-वम्)
1 Crookedness, moral or physical.
2 Disease. E. अ neg. and आर्जव.
text.2608:
अनार्तव Tatpur. m. f. n. (-वः-वी-वम्) Not seasonable, as
plants &c. E. अ neg. and आर्तव.
text.2609:
अनार्त्विजीन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not fit for a priest,
not fit to be a priest. E. अ neg. and आर्त्विजीन.
text.2610:
अनार्य I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Not respectable,
not venerable, unworthy, inferior, bad, vile.
2. m. (-र्यः) Other than an Ārya, a barbarian, a Sūdra,
a Mlechchha, a Kirāta &c. E. अ neg. and आर्य.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Having no Āryas,
inhabited by Mlechchhas &c. as a country. E. अ priv.
and आर्य.
text.2611:
अनार्यक Bahuvr. n. (-कम्) Agallochum or aloe wood (Aquila
agallocha). See also अनार्यज. E. अनार्य II., samāsānta
aff. कप्.
text.2612:
अनार्यकर्मिन् m. (-र्मी) One doing the work of a Sūdra or
a non-Ārya. E. अनार्य-कर्म, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2613:
अनार्यज Tatpur. n. (-जम्). The same as अनार्यक q. v. E.
अनार्य and ज ‘produced in the country of the Mlechchhas
or barbarians’.
text.2614:
अनार्यता f. (-ता) or अनार्यत्व n. (-त्वम्) Vileness, unworthi
ness, baseness. E. अनार्य, taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2615:
अनायतिक्त Tatpur. m. (-क्तः) A medicinal plant, a kind of
gentian (Gentiana cherayta, Rox.) See also किराततिक्त.
E. अनार्य I. 2. and तिक्त.
text.2616:
अनार्ष Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्षः-र्षी-र्षम्)
1 Not relating or be
longing to a Ṛṣi (to his name &c.).
2 Not relating to
the vaidik hymns (considered as the inspirations of the
Ṛṣis). E. अ neg. and आर्ष.
text.2617:
अनार्षेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-यी-यम्) Not relating or be
longing to a Ṛṣi. E. अ neg. and आर्षेय.
text.2618:
अनालम्ब I. Tatpur. m. (-म्बः)
1 Want of support.
2 Despon
dency, heart-brokenness. E. अ neg. and आलम्ब.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-म्बः-म्बा-म्बम्) Without support
or stay, unsupported. E. अ priv. and आलम्ब.
text.2619:
अनालम्बन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 Without stay or
support, unsupported.
2 Despondent, heart-broken. E. अ
priv. and आलम्बन.
text.2620:
अनालम्बनता f. (-ता)
1 Unsupportedness.
2 Despondency,
heart-brokenness. E. अनालम्बन, taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2621:
अनालम्बी Tatpur. f. (-म्बी) The Vīṇā or lute of Śiva. E. अ
neg. and आलम्बी.
text.2622: अनालम्बुका Tatpur. f. (-का). See the following.
text.2623:
अनालम्भुका Tatpur. f. (-का) A woman during menstruation.
This word occurs only in ritual works and is sometimes,
though less correctly written अनालम्बुका. E. अ neg. and
आलम्भुका.
text.2624:
अनालाप I. Tatpur. m. (-पः) Taciturnity, silence. E. अ neg.
and आलाप.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-पः-पा-पम्) Silent, taciturn. E. अ
priv. and आलाप.
text.2625:
अनालोचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unseen, unbe
held.
2 Unweighed, unconsidered, rash, imprudent. E. अ
neg. and आलोचित.
text.2626:
अनाविद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Not pierced, not
wounded, not hurt. E. अ neg. and आविद्ध.
text.2627:
अनाविल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Clear, clean, pure.
E. अ neg. and आविल.
text.2628:
अनावृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Uncovered, unhidden.
2 Open, uninclosed (as a field &c.). E. अ neg. and आवृत.
text.2629:
अनावृत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्)
1 Not turned round.
2 Not retreating.
3 Not approached, not visited. E. अ neg.
and आवृत्त.
text.2630:
अनावृत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Not-returning, literally and me
taphorically (as after death into this world). E. अ neg.
and आवृत्ति.
text.2631:
अनावृष्टि Tatpur. f. (-ष्टिः) Drought. E. अ neg. and आ-वृष्टि
(explained with समन्ताद्वृष्टि). See also under अना.
text.2632:
अनावेदित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not made known,
not announced. E. अ neg. and आवेदित.
text.2633:
अनाश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) I. Without hope, hope
less. E. अ priv. and आशा.
II. Not dead, living. E. अ priv. and नाश. The latter
meaning is artificial.
text.2634: अनाशक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) Fasting. E. अ neg. and आशक.
text.2635:
अनाशकनिवृत्त Tatpur. m. (-त्तः) One who desists from fast
ing (as a Sannyāsin who returns to his home &c.). E.
अनाशक and निवृत्त.
text.2636:
अनाशकायन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) The penitence of fasting. E.
अनाशक and अयन.
text.2637:
अनाशस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) Not excellent, not
praiseworthy; (according to a vaidik commentary). E. अ
neg. and आशस्त.
text.2638:
अनाशिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि) Not perishing, not
being lost. E. अ neg. and नाशिन्.
text.2639:
अनाशु m. f. n. (-शुः-शुः-शु) I. Tatpur. Not quick, slow.
E. अ neg. and आशु.
II. Bahuvr. (ved.) Without destruction, indestructible,
unchecked (as horses going extremely fast). This meaning
seems doubtful. E. अ priv. and नाशु(?).
text.2640:
अनाश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्) Indestructible. E. अ
neg. and नाश्य.
text.2641:
अनाश्रमवास Tatpur. m. (-सः). See अनाश्रमेवास. E. अ neg.
and आश्रमवास.
text.2642:
अनाश्रमिन् Tatpur. m. (-मी) One not belonging to one of the
āśramas (q. v.) or religious orders. E. अ neg. and आश्रमिन्.
text.2643:
अनाश्रमेवास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Not staying in or belonging
to one of the āśramas (q. v.) or religious orders. E. अ
neg. and आश्रमवास.
text.2644:
अनाश्रय Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Without an asylum
or refuge, unprotected. E. अ priv. and आश्रय.
text.2645:
अनाश्रित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not connected with,
not resorting to, esp. not belonging to one of the āśramas
(q. v.) or religious orders.
2 (In philosophy.) Not inherent
in, not requiring any thing else, self-dependent, absolute;
as in the Sāṅkhya philosophy, pradhāna or matter, which
is complete or absolute in itself, unlike the produced prin
ciples mahat, ahamkāra &c., which are आश्रित relative or
resorting to one another. E. अ neg. and आश्रित.
text.2646:
अनाश्वस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्वान्-शुषी-श्वः) Not having eaten,
fasting. E. अ neg. and आश्वस् (from अश् to eat).
text.2647:
अनाष्ट्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ष्ट्रः-ष्ट्रा-ष्ट्रम्) (ved.) Free from ene
mies, free from mischievous beings. E. अ priv. and नाष्ट्र.
text.2648:
अनासिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Noseless. E. अ priv.
and नासिका.
text.2649:
अनास्था Tatpur. f. (-स्था)
1 Want of fixity or condition.
2 Disregard, want of consideration. E. अ neg. and आस्था.
text.2650:
अनास्थान Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a fixed
site, without a basis or foundation. E. अ priv. and आस्थान.
text.2651:
अनाहत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unhurt, unbeaten,
unwounded.
2 Unwashed, new (as cloth).
3 (In music.)
Not beat or struck, not produced in the ordinary way (as
a sound). See अनाहतनाद.
II. n. (-तम्)
1 A new garment (see आहत).
2 The fourth
of the six mystical Chakras or circles of the body. E. अ
neg. and आहत.
text.2652:
अनाहतनाद Karmadh. m. (-तः) A sound not produced in the
ordinary manner; the mysterious sound (om) which is heard
in consequence of religious meditation and which is said
‘not to give pleasure, but eternal bliss’; unlike the आहत-
नाद (q. v.) or the real musical sound. E. अनाहत and नाद.
text.2653:
अनाहार I. Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 Abstinence, starvation.
2 Non
seizure. E. अ neg. and आहार.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not taking food. E.
अ priv. and आहार.
text.2654:
अनाहिताग्नि Tatpur. m. (-ग्निः) A householder who has not
performed the ceremony of the अग्न्याधान q. v. E. अ neg.
and आहिताग्नि.
text.2655:
अनाहिताग्निता f. (-ता) or अनाहिताग्नित्व n. (-त्वम्) The con
dition of an अनाहिताग्नि q. v. E. The preceding, taddh.
aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2656:
अनाहुति Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Not-sacrificing.
2 A bad or im
proper sacrificing. E. अ neg. or deter. and आहुति.
text.2657:
अनाहूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uncalled, unbidden.
E. अ neg. and आहूत.
text.2658:
अनिकेत Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Without a house. E.
अ priv. and निकेत.
text.2659:
अनिकेतन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a house.
E. अ priv. and निकेतन.
text.2660:
अनिक्षिप्तधूर Tatpur. m. (-रः) The proper name of a Bodhi
sattva or Bauddha deified saint. E. अ neg. and निक्षिप्तधूर(?).
text.2661:
अनिक्षु Tatpur. m. (-क्षुः) A sort of long grass or reed (Saccharum
spontaneum). E. अ comp. and इक्षु sugar-cane. Cf. इक्षुतुल्या.
text.2662:
अनिगीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्)
1 Not swallowed.
2 (In rhetoric.) Not to be supplied, not being the object
of an ellipsis. E. अ neg. and निगीर्ण.
text.2663:
अनिग्रह I. Tatpur. m. (-हः)
1 Want of restraint &c. See निग्रह.
2 (In Nyāya phil.) No-failure in argument, not perceiving
one's self having failed in argument. E. अ neg. and निग्रह.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Unrestrained, uncon
fined. E. अ priv. and निग्रह.
text.2664:
अनिग्रहस्थान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) (In Nyāya phil.) No-failure
in argument. E. अ neg. and निग्रहस्थान.
text.2665:
अनिघातेषु Bahuvr. m. (-षुः) Probably a proper name or sur
name implying blame; lit. one whose arrows do no harm.
E. अ priv. and निघात-इषु.
text.2667:
अनिच्छ I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-च्छः-च्छा-च्छम्) Undesirous, in
different, disliking. E. अ priv. and इच्छा.
II. Tatpur. f. (-च्छा) Absence of wish or desire, indif
ference, dislike. E. अ neg. and इच्छा.
text.2668:
अनित्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्)
1 Transient, not ever
lasting (as the body, or in the Sāṅkhya philosophy the
discrete principles mahat, ahaṅkāra &c. or in the Nyāya
the sound &c.
2 Occasional, not peremptory, not obligatory
as a rule &c. (see also काम्य; as in the Jyotiṣṭoma the six
samsthās: अत्यग्निष्टोम, उक्थ्य, षोडशिन्, अतिरात्र, अप्तोर्याम
and वाजपेय &c.).
3 Not necessary, not immutable. See
अनित्यसमास.
4 Unstable, inconstant.
5 Unusual, irregular.
(अनित्यम् not always.) E. अ neg. and नित्य.
text.2669:
अनित्यकर्मन् Karmadh. n. (-र्म) An act of worship which is
not peremptory, but voluntary and occasional. See काम्य-
कर्मन्. E. अनित्य and कर्मन्.
text.2670:
अनित्यक्रिया Karmadh. f. (-या). The same as the preceding.
E. अनित्य and क्रिया.
text.2671:
अनित्यता f. (-ता) or अनित्यत्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 Impermanence,
transient existence.
2 The being occasional, not peremptory.
3 The being not necessary.
4 Unstableness, inconstance.
5 Unusual occurrence. See the meanings of अनित्य. E. अनित्य.
taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2672:
अनित्यदत्त Tatpur. m. (-त्तः) (In law.) A son given away by his
natural parents temporarily or for a term. The adoption of such
a son is performed without the homas or burnt offerings re
quired at the adoption of a nityadatta (q. v.). Also अनित्यदत्तक
and अनित्यदत्रिम. E. अनित्य and दत्त, temporarily given, scil. पुत्र.
text.2673:
अनित्यदत्तक m. (-कः) (In law.) The same as अनित्यदत्त q. v.
E. The preceding, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.2674:
अनित्यदत्रिम Tatpur. m. (-मः) (In law.) The same as अनि-
त्यदत्त q. v. E. अनित्य and दत्रिम.
text.2675:
अनित्यप्रत्यवेक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) In Buddhist doctrine, one of
the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.): the reflection that (every thing)
is transitory. E. अनित्य and प्रत्यवेक्षा.
text.2676:
अनित्यभाव Tatpur. m. (-वः) The state or condition of what
is transient or perishable, perishableness. E. अनित्य (in
the sense of the genitive) and भाव.
text.2677:
अनित्यसम Tatpur. m. f. (-मः-मा) (In the Nyāya philosophy.)
Wrongly generalizing the predicament of perishableness i. e.
a sophism on perishableness; viz. arguing perishableness
from the reason that every thing is perishable because it
shares in some qualities with other things which are pe
rishable. E. अनित्य and सम (in the sense of जाति, sophism);
the masc. form of this word is explained according to some,
by the ellipsis of प्रतिषेध or contradiction, as a Sūtra in
the Nyāya treating on a sophism is always followed by
another containing the refutation; or, according to others,
by the ellipsis of विकल्प (in the sense of विविधः कल्पः
i. e. प्रकारः or variousness), there being various sophisms,
viz. twenty-four; or according to others, by the ellipsis of
प्रयोग i. e. a (logical) proceeding which likens or produces
the plausibility of perishableness; or the word is taken as
a Bahuvr. with the ellipsis of प्रयोग i. e. a logical proceeding
in which perishableness is likened (viz. made plausible).-
As a feminine, ºसमा is taken in the sense of जाति, sophism.
text.2678:
अनित्यसमप्रकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) The chapter in the Nyāya
philosophy which treats on the sophism अनित्यसम q. v. E.
अनित्यसम and प्रकरण.
text.2679:
अनित्यसमास Karmadh. m. (-सः) (In grammar.) A compound
which may be dissolved into its constituent parts without under
going a material change of sense; e. g. राजपुरुषः, which may
be dissolved into राज्ञः पुरुषः. The converse of नित्यसमास q. v.
text.2680:
अनिद्र I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्रः-द्रा-द्रम्) Sleepless, awake.
E. अ priv. and निद्रा.
II. Tatpur. f. (-द्रा) Want of sleep. E. अ neg. and निद्रा.
text.2682:
अनिधृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not defeated, not
overcome. Cf. अनिभृष्ट. E. अ neg. and निधृष्ट.
text.2683:
अनिध्म Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ध्मः-ध्मा-ध्मम्) Without fuel. E.
अ priv. and इध्म.
text.2684:
अनिन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a master, in
dependent. E. अ priv. and इन.
text.2685:
अनिन्दित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Irreproachable, blame
less, virtuous, good. E. अ neg. and निन्दित.
text.2686:
अनिन्द्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्द्यः-न्द्या-न्द्यम्) Irreproachable,
blameless. E. अ neg. and निन्द्य.
text.2687:
अनिन्द्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-न्द्रः-न्द्रा-न्द्रम्)
1 Deprived of Indra.
2 (ved.) Not paying regard to Indra, not holding Indra in
esteem. E. अ priv. and इन्द्र.
text.2688:
अनिन्द्रिय Tatpur. n. (-यम्). The same as अन्तःकरण q. v. E. अ
neg. and इन्द्रिय, ‘no-indriya (q. v.), different from the indriyas’.
text.2689:
अनिपद्यमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not falling down,
not dejected, untiring. (ved.) E. अ neg. and निपद्यमान.
text.2690:
अनिपात Tatpur. m. (-तः) Not dying, remaining alive. E.
अ neg. and निपात.
text.2691:
अनिपुण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Unskilled, unlearned,
not conversant. Comp. आनैपुण्य. E. अ neg. and निपुण.
text.2692:
अनिबद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Not attached, not
bound, not connected, incoherent. E. अ neg. and निबद्ध.
text.2693:
अनिबद्धप्रलापिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पी-पिनी-पि) Talking in
coherently, talking without regard to the subject in question.
E. अनिबद्ध and प्रलापिन्.
text.2694:
अनिबाध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) Unconfined, un
restricted, extended. E. अ priv. and निबाध.
text.2695:
अनिभृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not modest, bold.
2 Not lonely, not private. E. अ neg. and निभृत.
text.2696:
अनिभृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) (ved.) Not defeated,
not overcome, unhurt. E. अ neg. and निभृष्ट.
text.2697:
अनिभृष्टतविषि Bahuvr. m. (-षिः) (ved.) Of unhurt power,
of unabated strength. E. अनिभृष्ट and तविषी.
text.2698:
अनिभ्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-भ्यः-भ्या-भ्यम्) Not wealthy, not
opulent. E. अ neg. and इभ्य.
text.2699:
अनिमन्त्रित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Uninvited, uncalled.
E. अ neg. and निमन्त्रित.
text.2700:
अनिमन्त्रितभोजिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जी-जिनी-जि) Eating
without having being invited. E. अनिमन्त्रित and भोजिन्.
text.2701:
अनिमान Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Measureless, im
mense, boundless. E. अ priv. and निमान.
text.2702:
अनिमित्त I. Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्) No cause, want of cause.
E. अ neg. and निमित्त.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Having no cause or
motive. (अनिमित्तम् from no cause, without a cause.) E.
अ priv. and निमित्त.
text.2703:
अनिमित्ततस् ind. From no cause, without a cause. E. अनि-
मित्त (Tatpur.), taddh. aff. तसिल्.
text.2704:
अनिमित्तलिङ्गनाश Karmadh. m. (-शः) (In medicine.) A dis
ease of the pupil of the eye, when the whole crystalline
lens is affected; it is described as being produced ‘by the
sight of the divine Ṛṣis, the Gandharvas, the great Ser
pents and luminous bodies’ and causing the entire loss of
vision. See also लिङ्गनाश and सनिमित्तलिङ्गनाश. E. अनि-
मित्त and लिङ्गनाश.
text.2705:
अनिमिष् Tatpur. f. (only in the acc. -षम् and instrum. -षा)
(ved.)
1 The not twinkling.
2 Attentiveness, watchfulness.
3 Uninterruptedness. अनिमिषम् and अनिमिषा
1 Attentively,
watchfully.
2 Uninterruptedly, continually. E. अ neg. and
निमिष्.
text.2706:
अनिमिष Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्)
1 Not twinkling,
having the eyes fixed.
2 Attentive, watchful.
II. m. (-षः)
1 A god.
2 A fish. See also अनिमेष. E. अ
priv. and निमिष.
III. Tatpur. m. (-षः). The same as अनिमिष्. E. अ neg.
and निमिष्.
text.2707: अनिमिषम् Tatpur. (ved.) See अनिमिष् and अनिमेषम्.
text.2709:
अनिमिषाक्ष Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-क्षः-क्षी-क्षम्) One whose eyes are
fixed (as in disease). E. अनिमिष and अक्षि, samāsānta aff. षच्.
text.2710:
अनिमिषाचार्य Tatpur. m. (-र्यः) A name of Vṛhaspati. E.
अनिमिष and आचार्य, ‘the preceptor of the gods’.
text.2711:
अनिमिषीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Relating to the gods. E.
अनिमिष, taddh. aff. छ.
text.2712:
अनिमेष I. Tatpur. m. (-षः) The not-twinkling. E. अ neg.
and निमेष.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-षः-षा-षम्) Not twinkling.
2. m. (-षः)
1 A god.
2 A fish. E. अ priv. and निमेष.
text.2713:
अनिमेषम् Tatpur. ind. (ved.)
1 Without twinkling.
2 Atten
tively, watchfully, without interruption. See also अनिमिषम्.
E. अ and निमेषम् (from मिष् with नि, kṛt aff. णमुल्).
text.2714:
अनियत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not restrained, not
fastened.
2 Not necessarily connected.
3 Not inevitable,
not certain, not always occurring.
4 Not positive, not de
finite, undefined, undetermined. (The अनियता धर्माः or
‘undetermined rules’ of the Buddhists, are the topic of
one of the chapters of their Phātimokkha, and treat on
transgressions that involve exclusion, suspension and pe
nance, but not permanent exclusion, of a Bauddha priest.)
E. अ neg. and नियत.
text.2715:
अनियतपुंस्का Tatpur. f. (-स्का) An unsteady or unchaste woman.
E. अ neg. and नियत-पुम् (Bahuvr. samāsānta aff. कप्).
text.2716:
अनियतवृत्ति Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) One who has
no fixed profession or livelihood. E. अ neg. and नियत-वृत्ति.
text.2717:
अनियताङ्क Karmadh. m. (-ङ्कः) (In Arithmetic.) An inde
terminate digit. E. अनियत and अङ्क.
text.2718:
अनियतात्मन् Tatpur. m. (-त्मा) Not exercising self-control,
not subduing one's mind. E. अ neg. and नियत-आत्मन्.
text.2719:
अनियम 1. Tatpur. m. (-मः)
1 Absence of a restriction or
fixed rule.
2 Absence of moral or religious obligation.
3 In
decorous or improper conduct. E. अ neg. and नियम.
2. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Without restriction,
undertermined, undefined, unprovided for, by any rule or
law. E. अ priv. and नियम.
text.2720:
अनियुक्त Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Not authorised,
not called, not appointed &c. See नियुक्त.
2. m. (-क्तः) (In Law.) A Brāhmaṇa who attends a court
without having been appointed a member of it, whose vote
is therefore not binding, and who is at liberty to attend
the court meetings and to debate in them, or not. (See,
on the contrary, सभासद्.)
text.2721:
अनिर (ved.) I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Without food,
without an offering (of clarified butter). E. अ priv. and इरा.
II. Tatpur. f. (-रा) Want of food, famine, calamity,
distress. E. अ neg. and इरा.
text.2722:
अनिराकरिष्णु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्णुः-ष्णुः-ष्णु)
1 Not disposed
to or in the habit of throwing obstacles in the way, of
being obstructive.
2 Not in the habit of disdaining, of dis
pising. E. अ neg. and निराकरिष्णु.
text.2723:
अनिराकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unob
structed. E. अ neg. and निराकृत.
text.2724:
अनिरुक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्)
1 Not spoken out,
not declared.
2 Not explained, not defined (e. g. the di
vinity, if spoken of in general terms, or Brahma (n.) that
is without qualities, or an invocation, not containing the
special name of the god addressed, one addressed to the
gods in general &c.).
3 Obscure, incomprehensible, literally
and metaphorically; e. g. Prajāpati, Brahman (n.) or a
hymn uttered inaudibly, so as not being comprehensible to
the by-standers. E. अ neg. and निरुक्त.
text.2725:
अनिरुक्तगान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) One of the modes of chanting
the hymns of the Sāmaveda. See गान. E. अनिरुक्त and गान.
text.2726:
अनिरुद्ध Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्)
1 Unobstructed,
unrestrained.
2 Self-willed, ungovernable, headstrong.
3 Move
able, unsteady(?).
2. m. (-द्धः)
1 The name of the son of Pradyumna or
Kāmadeva by Śubhāṅgī or, according to others, Kaku
dvatī, the daughter of Rukmin; his wife is Uṣā, the
daughter of Vāna, or, according to others, Subhadrā, the
granddaughter of Rukmin, and his son Vajra.--The
Vaiṣṇava sect, called Pāñcharātra or Bhāgavatas, con
sider him as an incarnation or part of Viṣṇu and identify
him with Ahaṅkāra, self-consciousness.--
2 A name of
Śiva.
3 The name of a celebrated Bauddha Arhat and con
temporary of Śākyamuni.
4 The name of a member of the
Vṛṣṇi tribe, the descendants of Vṛṣṇi. See also आनिरुद्ध
and आनिरुद्धायनि.
5 A spy(?).
3. n. (-द्धम्) A rope for fastening cattle. E. अ neg.
and निरुद्ध. (It is doubtful whether the meaning 1. 3. (move
able) or the meaning 2. 4. (spy) is the correct one, the
translation being founded on the word चर, given as one
of the meanings of अनिरुद्ध, but without any further in
dication as to the gender. From the place, however, चर
occupies in the explanation of some of the native dictio
naries, the meaning ‘spy’ is likely to be preferable to the
meaning ‘moveable’.)
text.2727:
अनिरुद्धपथ Bahuvr. n. (-थम्) Atmosphere, æther. E. अनिरुद्ध
and पथिन्, samāsānta aff. अ; lit. having an unobstructed path.
text.2728:
अनिरुद्धभाविनी Tatpur. f. (-नी) The wife of Aniruddha,
Uṣā (q. v.). E. अनिरुद्ध and भाविनी.
text.2729:
अनिर्जित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unsubdued, uncon
quered. E. अ neg. and निर्जित.
text.2730: अनिर्णय Tatpur. m. (-यः) Uncertainty. E. अ neg. and निर्णय.
text.2731:
अनिर्णीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unascertained, un
determined. E. अ neg. and निर्णीत.
text.2732:
अनिर्दश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Not out of, i. e.
within, the ten days of impurity which follow after a case
of birth or death. अनिर्दशम् also used adverbially. See
the following. E. अ neg. and निर्दश; scil. अहन्.
text.2733:
अनिर्दशाह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्). The same as the
preceding. E. अ neg. and निर्दशाह.
text.2734:
अनिर्दिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not defined or de
termined by a rule. E. अ neg. and निर्दिष्ट.
text.2735:
अनिर्देश Tatpur. m. (-शः)
1 Absence of rule or direction.
2 A
bad or imperfect direction, a rule not conveying exactly the
bearing or sense it is intended to have. E. अ neg. or deter.
and निर्देश.
text.2736:
अनिर्धारित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unascertained, un
determined, undefined. E. अ neg. and निर्धारित.
text.2737:
अनिर्मल Tatpur. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्) Unclean, dirty. E.
अ neg. and निर्मल.
text.2738:
अनिर्माल्या Tatpur. f. (-ल्या) A plant (Trigonella corniculata
or Medicago esculenta, Rox.). Also निर्माल्या, लङ्क, पिका,
पृक्का, पिशुना, and ranging amongst the महौषध. E. अ
neg. and निर्माल्य, according to a commentary ‘because no
garland can be made of it’.
text.2739:
अनिर्लोचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not considered,
not reflected. E. अ neg. and निर्लोचित.
text.2740:
अनिर्वचनीय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Not explainable,
indescribable. E. अ neg. and निर्वचनीय.
text.2741:
अनिर्वाच्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-च्यः-च्या-च्यम्) Not explainable,
indescribable. E. अ neg. and निर्वाच्य.
text.2742:
अनिर्वाह Tatpur. m. (-हः)
1 Want of completion.
2 Want of
logical connexion (in a sentence &c.).
3 Want of means of
subsistence. E. अ neg. and निर्वाह.
text.2743:
अनिर्वृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unaccomplished, un
terminated.
2 Unhappy, discontented, ill at ease. E. अ neg.
and निर्वृत.
text.2744:
अनिर्वृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Incompleteness, want of com
pletion.
2 Discontent, unhappiness.
3 Poverty. E. अ neg.
and निर्वृति.
text.2745:
अनिर्वेद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Undauntedness, hopefulness, self
confidence. E. अ neg. and निर्वेद.
text.2746:
अनिल m. (-लः)
1 Wind, viz.
a. (in its usual acceptation) the
motion of air;
b. the deity of wind;
c. one of the eight
Maruts, and in this sense distinct from मारुत, वायु &c.
(see मरुत्);
d. one of the eight Vasus (see वसु);
e. (in the
plural अनिलाः) a class of the Gaṇadevatās, comprising
forty-nine Anilas;
f. (in medicine) one of the three Rasas
or temperamental elements of the body (see रस), subdi
vided into प्राण, उदान, समान, व्यान and अपान; in this
sense used synonymously with मारुत, वात, वायु, समीरण
and other words meaning wind;
g. (in the terminology of
the Upanishads) the exterior wind or the surrounding air,
in distinction from वायु or प्राण, the vital air of the body.
2 A proper name of
a. a son of Tansu and father of Du
shwanta;
b. a Rākṣasa;
c. a Ṛṣi, author of a vaidik
hymn;
d. (in the mythology of the Jainas) the seventeenth
Arhat of the past Utsarpiṇī.
3 (In arithmetic, sometimes
used to denote) the numeral 49 (there being forty-nine
Anilas).
4 A mystic denomination of the letter य. E. अन्,
uṇ. aff. इलच्.
text.2747:
अनिलकुमार Tatpur. m. pl. (-राः) (In the mythology of the
Jainas.) One of the ten kinds of Bhavanapatis (q. v.) or
Bhavanādhīśas (q. v.), the first of the four classes of Jaina
divinities. E. अनिल and कुमार.
text.2748:
अनिलघ्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-घ्नः-घ्नी-घ्नम्) Removing disorders
