from wind (see अनिल 1. f.), as a medicine &c. Also वातघ्न,
वायुघ्न &c. E. अनिल and घ्न.
text.2749:
अनिलघ्नक m. (-कः) A large tree (Terminalia belerica). See
also विभीतक. E. अनिलघ्न, taddh. aff. कन्.
text.2750:
अनिलपर्याय Tatpur. m. (-यः) (In Medicine.) An inflammation
affecting the whole eye, described as produced from the
vitiated Rasa wind (see अनिल 1. f.) ‘which pervades the eye
lids, eye and eyebrows and makes them diseased one after the
other’. The less correct reading of this word is अनिलपयय.
See also मारुतपर्याय and वातपर्याय. E. अनिल and पर्याय.
text.2751:
अनिलप्रकृति Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-तिः-तिः-ति) Of airy or windy
nature; an epithet of the planet Saturn. E. अनिल and प्रकृति.
text.2752:
अनिलम्भसमाधि Karmadh. f. (-धिः) A fanciful name of a
Buddhistic samādhi or profound meditation. E. अनिलम्भ
and समाधि, meaning perhaps ‘a meditation that sur
passes all impediments or limits, one which nothing can
resist’.
text.2753:
अनिलयन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) No-resting place, no-support
(an epithet of the neuter Brahman, in an Upanishad, be
cause it is devoid of qualities, impersonal &c.). E. अ neg.
and निलयन.
text.2754:
अनिलव्याधि Tatpur. f. (-धिः) (In Medicine.) Derangement
of the Rasa wind (see अनिल 1. f.), produced, according to
the native theory, by the continued use of dry, cold or light
articles of food, taken in unusually small quantities &c.
and causing, according to some authorities, eighty varieties
of nervous diseases. See also अनिलामय and वातव्याधि.
E. अनिल and व्याधि.
text.2755:
अनिलसख Tatpur. m. (-खः) A name of Fire. Cf. अग्निसख.
E. अनिल and सखि, samāsānta aff. टच्, ‘the friend of Wind’.
text.2756:
अनिलहन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हा-घ्नी-ह) The same as अनिलघ्न
q. v. E. अनिल and हन्.
text.2757:
अनिलहृत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्-त्-त्) The same as अनिलघ्न
q. v. E. अनिल and हृत्.
text.2758:
अनिलात्मज Tatpur. m. (-जः)
1 A name of Hanumat.
2 A name
of Bhīma. See also वायुपुत्र and similar synonymes. E.
अनिल and आत्मज.
text.2759:
अनिलान्तक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The name of a plant. See इङ्गुदी
or अङ्गारपुष्प. E. अनिल and अन्तक, in the same sense as
अनिलघ्न.
text.2760:
अनिलापह Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) The same as अनिलघ्न
q. v. E. अनिल and अपह.
text.2761:
अनिलामय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The same as अनिलव्याधि q. v.
E. अनिल and आमय.
text.2762:
अनिलाशिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि) Feeding on the
wind, fasting. E. अनिल and आशिन्.
text.2763:
अनिवर्तित्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 The not returning.
2 The not turning
back, not running away, not flying. E. अनिवर्तिन्, taddh.
aff. त्व.
text.2764:
अनिवर्तिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्ती-र्तिनी-र्ति)
1 Not coming back,
not returning.
2 Not turning back, not flying.
text.2765:
अनिवारित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unim
peded, unopposed, unforbidden. E. अ neg. and निवारित.
text.2766:
अनिवार्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्) Not to be prevented
or forbidden, necessary, unavoidable. E. अ neg. and
निवार्य.
text.2767:
अनिविशमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not reposing, not
resting, restless. (ved.) E. अ neg. and निविशमान.
text.2768:
अनिवृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unchecked, unimpeded,
unopposed. E. अ neg. and निवृत.
text.2769:
अनिवेदित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not told, not
mentioned, not pointed out. E. अ neg. and निवेदित.
text.2770:
अनिवेदितविज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Known without
having been told or pointed out. E. अनिवेदित and विज्ञात.
text.2771:
अनिवेशन Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Without a resting
place, without an abode, restless. E. अ priv. and निवेशन.
text.2772:
अनिश Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Continual, incessant.
अनिशम् used adv. continually, without interruption. E. अ
priv. and निशा, according to some, implying here merely
the period of time, according to others, the want of occu
pation or rest i. e. literally ‘without a night’ or ‘without rest’.
text.2773:
अनिशित m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Restless, incessant(?).
E. अनिशि (a denom. from अनिश), kṛt aff. क्त(?). (Mean
ing and etymology of this word are doubtful. According
to the native commentaries it would be a Tatpur. compounded
of अ neg. and निशित, sharpened, sharp, and would mean
either:
1 not sharp, not injurious, or:
2 not difficult, easy,
or
3 not slender, not little; but these explanations, when
applied to the passages to which they refer, seem artificial.
text.2774:
अनिशितसर्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्गः-र्गा-र्गम्) (ved.) Of con
tinual effusion, continually flowing (an epithet of the wa
ters)(?). (This meaning is doubtful; according to the comm.
it would be: of strong or abundant effusion. See the pre
ceding.) E. अनिशित and सर्ग.
text.2775:
अनिषङ्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ङ्गः-ङ्गा-ङ्गम्) Without a quiver.
(According to the vaidik comm.: not connected with or
impeded by, scil. the Rākṣasas; this interpretation seems
artificial.) E. अ priv. and निषङ्ग.
text.2776:
अनिषिद्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्धः-द्धा-द्धम्) Not prohibited, not
forbidden. E. अ neg. and निषिद्ध.
text.2777:
अनिषु Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-षुः-षुः-षु) Having no arrow or hav
ing bad arrows. E. अ priv. and इषु.
text.2778:
अनिषेद्ध्र Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-द्ध्रः-द्ध्रा-द्ध्रम्) (ved.) Without im
pediment, unchecked, unimpeded. E. अ priv. and निषेद्ध्र.
text.2779:
अनिष्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not completed, not ac
complished, not perfect. E. अ neg. and निष्कृत.
text.2780:
अनिष्ट Tatpur. I. 1. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Unwished, un
desirable, bad, wrong.
2 Bad, evil.
3 Unlucky.
2. n. (-ष्टम्)
1 Bad luck, evil occurrence, misfortune.
2 Evil deed, crime.
3. f. (-ष्टा) The name of a plant (Sida alba). See नाग-
वला. E. अ neg. and इष्ट (इष्, kṛt aff. क्त).
II. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Not sacrificed.
2 Not honoured
with a sacrifice (as a god). E. अ neg. and इष्ट (यज्, kṛt
aff. क्त).
text.2781:
अनिष्टदुष्टधी Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धीः-धीः-धि) Of a bad and
wicked disposition or mind. (Another and apparently more
correct reading of this word is अरिष्टदुष्टधी q. v.) E. अनिष्ट-
दुष्ट (Dwandwa) and धी.
text.2782:
अनिष्टप्रसङ्ग Tatpur. m. (-ङ्गः) Connexion or association with
what is undesirable, incongruous or wrong connexion, as
that of a Yogin with worldly objects; or (in Nyāya) that
of an inference with wrong premises, the former tending to
prove the absurdity of the argument advanced; or (in gram
matical literature) connecting one rule with an other rule
which has no relation to it. E. अनिष्ट and प्रसङ्ग.
text.2783:
अनिष्टफल Karmadh. n. (-लम्) Evil consequence, evil result.
E. अनिष्ट and फल.
text.2784:
अनिष्टशङ्का Tatpur. f. (-ङ्का) Apprehension of an unpleasant
or unlucky occurrence, apprehension of danger; (in rhetoric
one of the व्यभिचारिभाव (q. v.) of the rasa वत्सल (q. v.).
E. अनिष्ट and शङ्का.
text.2785: अनिष्टहेतु Tatpur. m. (-तुः) An evil omen. E. अनिष्ट and हेतु.
text.2786:
अनिष्टापादन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) 1. Obtaining or getting what
is not desirable. See प्राप्तिसम. E. अनिष्ट and आपादन.
2. Not obtaining what is desirable. See अप्राप्तिसम. E.
अ neg. and इष्ट-आपादन.
text.2787:
अनिष्टाप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) The same as the preceding. E. 1.
अनिष्ट and आप्ति, 2. अ neg. and इष्ट-आप्ति.
text.2788:
अनिष्टाशंसिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-सी-सिनी-सि) Boding ill or
evil. E. अनिष्ट and आशंसिन्.
text.2789:
अनिष्टिन् Tatpur. m. (-ष्टी) One who has not performed a
sacrifice. E. अ neg. and इष्टिन्.
text.2790:
अनिष्टृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (ved.) Not hurt, not
injured. E. अ neg. and निष्टृत.
text.2791:
अनिष्टोत्प्रेक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Apprehension of an unpleasant
or unlucky occurrence, apprehension of danger, fear. E.
अनिष्ट and उत्प्रेक्षण.
text.2792:
अनिष्ठुर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Not contumelious.
2 Not
harsh. E. अ neg. and निष्ठुर.
text.2793:
अनिष्णात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unskilful, ignorant.
E. अ neg. and निष्णात.
text.2794:
अनिष्पत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Non-completion, non-termination.
E. अ neg. and निष्पत्ति.
text.2795:
अनिष्पत्रम् Tatpur. ind. (Wounding) so as not to make the
arrow come out on the other side of the body, i. e. not
too violently. E. अ neg. and निष्पत्र.
text.2796:
अनिष्पन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Not accomplished,
incomplete, imperfect. E. अ neg. and निष्पन्न.
text.2797:
अनिसर्ग Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्गः-र्गा-र्गम्) Unnatural, unnaturally
elated or depressed. E. अ priv. and निसर्ग.
text.2798:
अनिस्तब्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ब्धः-ब्धा-ब्धम्)
1 Not paralyzed,
not overpowered.
2 Not stopped, not fixed. E. अ neg. and
निस्तब्ध.
text.2799:
अनिस्तीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्)
1 Not got over.
2 (In law.) Not refuted, not answered (as a plaint, a charge).
See the following. E. अ neg. and निस्तीर्ण.
text.2800:
अनिस्तीर्णाभियोग Bahuvr. m. (-गः) (In law.) A defendant
who has not or not yet refuted the charge brought against
him. E. अनिस्तीर्ण and अभियोग.
text.2801:
अनीक m. n. (-कः-कम्)
1 The face (ved.).
2 The fore part,
front, the principal or conspicuous part (ved.).
3 The point
(e. g. of an arrow) (ved.).
4 Multitude, assemblage, quan
tity (ved.).
5 An army, a host, forces (according to some,
also: part of an army).
6 War, combat. E. अन्, to breathe
(in 1. 2. 3.) and to go (in 4. 5. 6.), uṇ. aff. ईकन्, the radical
being कित्.
text.2802:
अनीकवत् m. (-वान्) (ved.) Having or occupying the pro
minent or principal place, principal, superior, first, an
epithet of Agni, used chiefly when the god receives the
first offerings in certain sacrifices, his name then also oc
curring as the first in the list of the gods invoked. E. अनीक,
taddh. aff. मतुप्.
text.2803:
अनीकविदारण Tatpur. m. (-णः) A proper name: a brother
of Jayadratha. E. अनीक and विदारण ‘destroyer of hosts’.
text.2804:
अनीकस्थ Tatpur. m. (-स्थः)
1 A warrior, a combattant.
2 A
royal body guard.
3 A trainer of an elephant, an elephant
driver.
4 A large military drum.
5 A mark, a sign, a signal.
6 (According to one authority: अश्वल q. v.) E. अनीक and स्थ.
text.2805:
अनीकिनी f. (-नी)
1 An army, a host, forces.
2 A certain
force; three chamūs or one-tenth of an Akṣauhiṇī, con
taining two thousand, one hundred and eighty-seven ele
phants, and as many cars, six thousand, five hundred and
sixty-one horses, and ten thousand, nine hundred and thirty
five foot. E. अनीक, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2806:
अनीक्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) Not seeing, not looking at (e. g.
the rising or the setting sun, as one of the प्रजापतिव्रत q. v.).
E. अ neg. and ईक्षण.
text.2807:
अनीच Tatpur. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्)
1 Not low, respectable,
decent.
2 (In grammar.) Not pronounced with the low or
anudātta accent (as a syllable). E. अ neg. and नीच.
text.2808:
अनीचानुवर्तिन् Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्ती-र्तिनी-र्ति) Not keeping
low or improper company. 2. m. (-र्ती) A faithful lover
or husband. E. अ neg. and नीच-अनुवर्तिन्.
text.2809:
अनीचिदर्शिन् Tatpur. m. (-र्शी) The name of a Bauddha
saint. E. अनीचि(?) and दर्शिन्. (The reading of this word
is doubtful, and the correct form is probably अवीचिदर्शिन्;
from अवीचि the last of the eight fiery hells of the Bud
dhists and दर्शिन्, ‘seeing’; as an Arhat, who has made
himself conversant with the whole doctrine of Sākyamuni,
is promised to penetrate with his sight all the worlds,
‘from the highest summit of existence, down to the great
hell Avīchi’.)
text.2810:
अनीड I. Tatpur. m. (-नीडः) (ved.) Not nesting, not rest
ing, restless; an epithet of Agni. Also written अनीळ. E.
अ neg. and नीड.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-डः-डा-डम्) Having no nest or
repose; metaphorically applied to the highest divinity which
is without an abode i. e. without a body. E. अ priv. and नीड.
text.2811:
अनीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) I.
1 Impropriety, immorality.
2 Im
policy, ill conduct. E. अ neg. and नीति.
II. Freedom from calamities of season, as excessive rain
&c. E. अ neg. and ईति.
text.2812:
अनीतिज्ञ Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ज्ञः-ज्ञा-ज्ञम्)
1 Indiscreet, im
moral.
2 Impolitic. E. अ neg. and नीतिज्ञ.
text.2813:
अनीतिविद् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्-त्-त्) The same as the pre
ceding. E. अ neg. and नीतिविद्.
text.2814:
अनीदृश Tatpur. m. f. n. (-शः-शी-शम्) Unlike, dissimilar.
E. अ neg. and ईदृश.
text.2815:
अनीप्सित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not desirable. E. अ
neg. and ईप्सित.
text.2816:
अनीश I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Not ruling, not
being master over, without power, powerless, unable.
2. f. (-शा) (In the Upanishads.) Want of power, im
potence, insufficiency. E. अ neg. and 1. ईश, 2. ईशा.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-शः-शा-शम्) Without a lord or
superior. And see अनीश्वर II.
2. m. (-शः)
1 A name of Viṣṇu.
2 A name of Śiva.
E. अ priv. and ईश.
text.2817:
अनीशता f. (-ता) or अनीशत्व n. (-त्वम्) The condition or
state of not being a master or ruler. E. अनीश I., taddh.
aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2818:
अनीश्वर I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not ruling, not
being master over, without power, powerless, unable. E.
अ neg. and ईश्वर.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Without a lord or
superior.
2 Unchecked, uncontrolled.
3 Not belonging to
the supreme deity.
4 Not acknowledging a supreme deity,
atheistic. E. अ priv. and ईश्वर.
text.2819:
अनीश्वरता f. (-ता) or अनीश्वरत्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 Want of power,
impotence, insufficiency.
2 The being without a lord.
3 The
being unchecked.
4 Atheism. E. 1. अनीश्वर I.; 2. 3. 4. अनी-
श्वर II., taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2820:
अनीश्वरवादिन् Tatpur. m. (-दी) An atheist, one who denies
a supreme ruler of the universe. E. अनीश्वर and वादिन्.
text.2821:
अनीह I. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Without a desire,
indifferent.
2. m. (-हः) The proper name of a king of Ayodhyā,
father of Pārijātra; (according to other authorities the same
king is called Ahīnagu and is father of Pārijātra or Saha
śrāsva). E. अ priv. and ईहा.
II. Tatpur. f. (-हा)
1 Want of desire, indifference.
2 Want
of energy, apathy. E. अ neg. and ईहा.
text.2822:
अनीहित Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unwished for, dis
agreeable. 2. n. (-तम्) Displeasure. E. अ neg. and ईहित.
text.2824:
I. अनु ind. (see निपात, उपसर्ग, गति, कर्मप्रवचनीय). A
particle implying the notion of ‘after’ in its literal and
metaphorical acceptations; it is used either as a separable
preposition or as a prefix to verbs, but, in the latter ca
pacity, in the Vedas and in archaic passages of the epic
literature, also detached from the verb, very much in the
same manner as German prepositions when connected with
verbs; in the Vedas it is sometimes also used adverbially.
With nouns it may form Avyayībh., Tatpur. and Bahuvr.
compounds. It means:
1. (as a separable preposition, with a noun following
or preceding in the accusative)
1 After;
a. in space (literally),
b. in time, implying successiveness,
c. in rank or order, im
plying inferiority.
2 Along, lengthwise (in this sense also
with a noun in the genitive).
3 With, together with (in this
meaning, however, only in conventional phrases; e. g.
पर्वतमनु or नदीमन्ववसिता सेना ‘the army was (so placed
as to be) in communication with a mountain or with a
river’.
4 To the part or share of; e. g. यदत्र मामनु स्यात्
‘what there may fall to my share’.
5 By (implying dis
tribution); e. g. वृक्षं वृक्षमनु सिञ्चति ‘he throws water tree
by tree i. e. he waters every tree.
6 After, in the sense of
to, towards, in the direction of; e. g. वृक्षमनु विद्योतते विद्युत्
‘the lightning flushes after i. e. towards, in the direction of
the tree’.
7 In regard to, in consequence of, on behalf of
(only in conventional phrases), e. g. जपमनु प्रावर्षत् ‘it
rained in consequence of prayers’ or शाकल्यस्य संहितामनु
or अनुडुद्यज्ञमनु प्रावर्षत् ‘it rained in consequence of the
hymns of Sākalya (having been recited) or in consequence
of an ox having being sacrificed’.
8 In accordance with, agree
ably to, like, similar.
9 According to the statement of, e. g.
साधुर्देवदत्तो मातरमनु ‘Devadatta is an excellent man,
according to what his mother tells’.
2. (as a prefix to verbs, undetached or detached)
1 After,
in space or time, literally and metaphorically, e. g. गम्,
सज्ज्, शी &c. with अनु qq. vv.
2 Similarly, likewise (im
plying imitation); in accordance with, agreeably to, lit.
and met., see f. i. कृ, वच्, ज्ञा with अनु &c.
3. (as adverb, in the Vedas) Afterwards.
4. (in composition with nouns) I. (In Avyayībh. com
pounds.)
1 After,
a. in space (literally), e. g. अनुरथम्,
after, behind the cart;
b. in order or rank, e. g. अनुज्येष्ठम्,
after, next to the eldest.
2 Along, lengthwise, on, e. g.
अनुगङ्गं वाराणसी ‘Benares is situated along, i. e. on the
Ganges’.
3 Near to; e. g. अनुवनमशनिर्गतः ‘it lightens near
the forest’.
4 According to, agreeably to, like; e. g. अनु-
क्रमम् ‘according to order, in due order’.
5 Severally, by;
e. g. अनुदिनम् ‘day by day, daily’.
II. (In Tatpur. compounds.)
1 After (in order or rank),
subsequent, inferior, secondary; see f. i. अनुकनीयस्, अनु-
कल्प, अनुनायिका.
2 According to, in conformance with,
similar, like to; e. g. अनुकूल, अनुलोम, अनुब्राह्मण.
3 Again;
e. g. अनुलाप.
III. (In Bahuvr. compounds.) In conformity with, si
milar, like, e. g. अनुगुण, अनुरूप &c. E. unknown; the
native etym. अन्, uṇ. aff. उ, is not plausible; अनु is pro
bably connected in origin with आ, towards, in its oldest
form आंँ = अंँस्. See s. v. आ and the Preface.
text.2825:
II. अनु m. (-नुः)
1 (in the Vedas; esp. in the plural अनवः)
Man in general; but it seems that this word is in the Vedas
the name of a tribe or family, the meaning ‘men’ being
an etymological interpretation of the commentaries.
2 The
proper name of a king in the North, the fourth son of
Yayāti by Śarmiṣṭā; according to others, a son of Kuru
vaśa or of Kuru. E. अन्, uṇ. aff. उ.
text.2826:
अनुक m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Desirous, lustful, libidinous. E.
अनु (the particle), taddh. aff. कन्; acc. to others, a Tatpur.,
E. कम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ड.
text.2827:
अनुकथन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Telling according to (what has been
said), report, account. E. कथ् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2828:
अनुकनीयस् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यान्-यसी-यः) The next
youngest, the youngest in succession. Comp. अनुज्येष्ठ. E. अनु
and कनीयस्.
text.2829:
अनुकम्पक Tatpur. m. (-कः) The name of a king, who lived,
accord. to the Mahābh., in the Kṛta-yuga. E. कम्प्, with
अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
text.2830:
अनुकम्पन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Compassion, commiseration. E. कम्प्
with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2831:
अनुकम्पा Tatpur. f. (-म्पा) Compassion, tenderness. E. कम्प्
with अनु, kṛt aff. अ, and fem. aff. टाप्.
text.2832:
अनुकम्प्य Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-प्यः-प्या-प्यम्) Worthy of tender
ness or compassion.
II. m. (-म्प्यः)
1 A courier, an express, a runner.
2 An
ascetic, keeping the vow of rigorous penance. E. कम्प् with
अनु, kṛtya aff. ण्यत्.
text.2833:
अनुकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Doing any thing like
another, imitating. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
text.2834:
अनुकरण Tatpur. n. (-णम्)
1 Making or doing like or in
imitation of another, imitating.
2 Resemblance, similarity.
E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2835:
अनुकर्तृ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्ता-र्त्री-तृ) Imitating. 2. m. (-र्ता)
A performer, an actor. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.2836:
अनुकर्मन् Tatpur. n. (-र्म) A subsequent rite or ceremony.
E. अनु and कर्मन्. See अनुक्रिया.
text.2837:
अनुकर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः)
1 Attracting.
2 (In Grammar.) Including
a preceding in a subsequent rule.
3 Invoking, summoning by
incantations.
4 Deferred performance of a duty: performance
at a period posterior to that for which it is prescribed (opp.
to अपकर्ष q. v.).
5 The bottom of a carriage (so called, be
cause it is, as it were, dragged after by the wheel which
is under it). E. कृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2838:
अनुकर्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्). The same as अनुकर्ष 1. 2. 3. E.
कृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2839:
अनुकर्षन् Tatpur. m. (-र्षा) The bottom of a carriage. See अनुकर्ष.
E. Probably a further developement of the partic. अनुकर्षत्,
from कृष् with अनु, conformably to the general origin of bases
in अन्; the native dict. consider it as अनुकर्ष with an additional
न्, but अनुकर्ष is more likely the curtailed अनुकर्षन् as most
bases in अ probably originate in a fuller form on अस्, अत्, अन्.
text.2840:
अनुकल्प Tatpur. m. (-ल्पः) A secondary or succedaneous in
junction: an injunction of what is to be done, if the ori
ginal injunction cannot be acted upon; f. i. to make offer
ings with nīvāra, if vrīhi--the dravya originally required
--cannot be had; but used also in a more general sense
with regard to other duties. E. अनु and कल्प.
text.2841:
अनुकाङ्क्षा Tatpur. f. (-ङ्क्षा) Wish, desire after. E. काङ्क्ष्
with अनु, kṛt aff. अ and fem. aff. टाप्.
text.2842:
अनुकाम I. Tatpur. 1. m. (-मः) (ved.) Wish, desire. E. कम्
with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
2. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Consistent with one's desire,
agreeable, liked. E. अनु and काम.
II. Avyayībh. (-मम्)
1 According to wish or desire.
2 After (i. e. past) one's wish or desire(?).
3 Desire by de
sire, every desire(?). E. अनु and काम.
text.2843:
अनुकामकृत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कृत्) (ved.) Fulfilling desire
or wish. E. अनुकाम and कृत्.
text.2844:
अनुकामीन m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्)
1 One who goes where he
pleases.
2 One who acts as he pleases. E. अनुकाम, taddh.
aff. ख.
text.2845:
अनुकामीनता f. (-ता)
1 Going according to wish or inclin
ation.
2 Acting according to wish or inclination. E. अनु-
कामीन, taddh. aff. तल्.
text.2846:
अनुकार Tatpur. m. (-रः)
1 Imitation.
2 Resemblance. E.
कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2847:
अनुकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Imitating (also
as an actor). Comp. अनुकर्तृ. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2848:
अनुकार्य Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-र्यः-र्या-र्यम्)
1 To be imitated.
2 To be performed (as the character in a play). E. कृ with
अनु, kṛtya aff. ण्यत्.
2. n. (-र्यम्) A subsequent duty or business. E. अनु
and कार्य.
text.2849: अनुकालम् Avyayībh. In due time. E. अनु and काल.
text.2850:
अनुकीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) Filled, thronged, crowded.
E. कॄ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2851:
अनुकीर्तन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Proclaiming, publishing. E. कॄत्
with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2852:
अनुकुञ्चित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Inflected, curved. E.
कुञ्च् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त with āgama इट्.
text.2853:
अनुकूल Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-लः-ला-लम्)
1 Conformable to.
2 Well disposed to, friendly, favourable.
2. m. (-लः) (In Rhetoric.) See अनुकूलनायक.
3. f. (-ला)
1 The name of a medicinal plant (Croton
polyandrum). See दन्ती.
2 The name of a metre regulated
by number and quantity; it belongs to the class, called
त्रिष्टुभ् q. v. and consists of a stanza of four lines with the
following eleven syllables in each: {??}
Also called कुद्मलदन्ती, मौक्तिकमाला and श्री.
4. n. (-लम्) (In Rhetoric.) An alaṅkāra or mode of writing
or speaking elegantly, viz. representing an act, unpleasant in
itself, as arising out of kindness or affection; e. g. when ‘an
ill-humoured mistress embraces her lover and apparently out
of excess of love wounds him with her nails’. E. अनु and कूल
literally ‘along or according to the bank (of a river)’.
text.2854:
अनुकूलता f. (-ता) and अनुकूलत्व n. (-त्वम्)
1 Conformity,
consistency.
2 Concord, good will, consent. E. अनुकूल,
taddh. aff. तल् or त्व.
text.2855:
अनुकूलनायक Karmadh. m. (-कः) (In Rhetoric.) One of the
forty-eight characters of a hero or principal personage in
a poetical composition; he is described as a lover attached
only to one mistress and as one of the four varieties (see
also दक्षिण, धृष्ट and शठ) of either of the four principal
divisions of the नायक (q. v.), viz. of the धीरोदात्त, धी-
रोद्धत, धीरललित and धीरप्रशान्त (qq. vv.). The अनुकूल-
नायक may again be उत्तम, मध्यम or अधम (qq. vv.). E.
अनुकूल and नायक.
text.2856:
अनुकूलि Denom. (अनुकूलयति) To act kindly, to show favour.
E. अनुकूल, denom. aff. णिच्.
text.2857:
अनुकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Imitated, made like or
done in like manner. E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2858:
अनुकृति Tatpur. f. (-तिः)
1 Making or doing any thing like or
in imitation of another, imitating.
2 Resemblance, similarity.
E. कृ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.2859:
अनुकृत्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्यः-त्या-त्यम्). The same as अनुकार्य.
E. कृ with अनु, kṛtya aff. क्यप् and āgama तुक्.
text.2860:
अनुकृष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्)
1 Attracted.
2 (In Gram
mar.) Included in a subsequent rule (as a preceding one).
E. कृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2861:
अनुक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्)
1 Not spoken, not ex
pressed.
2 Unheard of, unthought of, extraordinary (esp.
in Karmadh. compositions, implying praise, e. g. अनुक्ता-
ध्यापक an unheard of i. e. a very excellent teacher). E. अ
neg. and उक्त.
text.2862:
अनुक्तनिमित्त I. Tatpur. n. (-त्तम्)
1 A reason not expressed.
2 An extraordinary, unthought of reason.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्)
1 Being without an
apparent reason.
2 Having or owing its origin to an extra
ordinary, unthought of reason. See विभावना and विशेषोक्ति.
E. अनुक्त and निमित्त.
text.2863:
अनुक्ति Tatpur. f. (-क्तिः)
1 The not speaking, not saying.
2 The not having been said or mentioned. E. अ neg. and उक्ति.
text.2864:
अनुक्थ Bahuvr. m. (-क्थः) (ved.) Without hymns, not praising
(the divinity) in hymns. E. अ priv. and उक्था.
text.2865:
अनुककच Tatpur. m. f. n. (-चः-चा-चम्) Serrated, dentated.
E. अनु and क्रकच.
text.2866:
अनुक्रम I. Tatpur. m. (-मः) Order, arrangement, regular and
methodical disposal or succession.--अनुक्रमेण and अनु-
क्रमात् in the order. E. क्रम् with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्.
II. Avyayībh. (-मम्) According to order, in due order.
E. अनु and क्रम.
text.2867:
अनुक्रमण Tatpur. 1. n. (-णम्)
1 Following.
2 Arranging, dis
posing methodically.
2. f. (-णी) An explanatory table of contents, esp. of
vaidik writings. E. क्रम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्; 2. with
fem. aff. ङीप्.
text.2868:
अनुक्रमणिका f. (-का). The same as अनुक्रमणी. E. अनुक्रमणी,
taddh. aff. कन् and fem. aff. टाप्.
text.2869:
अनुक्रान्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Done or arranged
methodically, passed over &c. in due order. E. क्रम् with
अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2870:
अनुक्रिया Tatpur. f. (-या) A subsequent rite or ceremony.
See अनुकर्मन्. E. अनु and क्रिया.
text.2871:
अनुक्रोश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Tenderness, compassion. E. क्रुश्
with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2872: अनुक्षणम् Avyayībh. Momentarily, perpetually. E. अनु and क्षण.
text.2873:
अनुक्षत्तृ Tatpur. m. (-क्षत्ता) (ved.)
1 The follower or servant
of a charioteer.
2 The follower or servant of a doorkeeper.
E. अनु and क्षत्तृ.
text.2874:
अनुक्षपम् Avyayībh. Night by night, every night. E. अनु
and क्षपा.
text.2875:
अनुक्षेत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) (A modern term.) A charitable
allowance made to the native servants of certain temples
in Orissa, by the Marathas and continued by the British
Government. E. अनु and क्षेत्र.
text.2876:
अनुखञ्ज Tatpur. m. (-ञ्जः) The name of a country (as a king of
which Paurava is mentioned). E. अनु and खञ्ज.
text.2877:
अनुख्याति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Reporting, revealing. E. ख्या with
अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.2878:
अनुख्यातृ Tatpur. m. (-ता) Reporter, revealer. E. ख्या with अनु,
kṛt aff. तृच्.
text.2879:
अनुग Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्)
1 Following, lit. and
met.
2 Corresponding with.
2. m. (-गः)
1 A follower, a companion.
2 A servant,
an attendant.
3. f. (-गा) The proper name of an Apsaras. E. गम्
with अनु, kṛt aff. ड.
text.2880:
अनुगङ्गम् Avyayībh. Along the Ganges, on the Ganges. See
I. अनु 4. E. अनु and गङ्गा.
text.2881:
अनुगणित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Reckoned over, cal
culated over. E. गण् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त and āgama इट्.
text.2882:
अनुगणितिन् m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) One who has reckoned
over, calculated over (with a noun following in the locative).
E. अनुगणित, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2883:
अनुगत Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Following, pursu
ing.
2 Followed, pursued.
3 Acquired, obtained, lit. and met.
4 Gone out, extinguished (as fire).
2. n. (-तम्) (In Music.) The middle measure, neither
quick nor slow; the same as घन q. v. E. गम् with अनु,
kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2884:
अनुगतार्थ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) Having an obvious
meaning, one easily inferred from the etymon (as a word),
e. g. the words गर्भाधान, अन्नप्राशन, उदयगिरि &c. E. अनुगत
and अर्थ.
text.2885:
अनुगन्तव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be followed (also
in a special sense: at funeral obsequies). E. गम् with अनु,
kṛtya aff. तव्य or तव्यत्.
text.2886:
अनुगन्धिका f. (-का) A river of mount Mālyavat. E. अनु-गन्ध,
taddh. aff. क(?).
text.2887:
अनुगम Tatpur. m. (-मः)
1 Following, going or coming after. See
also अनुगमन.
2 (In Philosophy.) The comprehension men
tally of the essence of an object.
3 The going out, ex
tinction (of fire). E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
text.2888:
अनुगमन Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Following, going or coming after
(also in a special sense: at funeral obsequies).
2 Following
in death, the self-immolation of a widow on the funeral
pile. See also अनुमरण. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2889:
अनुगवम् Avyayībh. Of a cow's breadth, as wide as is required
for a cow (said of a cart). E. अनु and गो, samāsānta aff. अच्.
text.2890: अनुगवीन m. (-नः) A cowherd. E. अनुगु, taddh. aff. ख.
text.2891:
अनुगादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Speaking the
same as or like another. E. गद् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2892:
अनुगामिन् Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-मी-मिनी-मि) Going behind
or after, following.
2. m. (-मी)
1 A follower, a companion.
2 A servant,
an attendant. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2893:
अनुगामुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Always following,
always connected with. E. गम् with अनु, kṛt aff. उकञ्.
text.2894:
अनुगिरम् Avyayībh. On the mountain (= गिरौ). E. अनु
and गिरि, samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.2895:
अनुगीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) The name of a metre regulated by
feet and belonging to the class called गणच्छन्दस् or गणवृत्त
qq. vv. It consists of a couplet of two verses with twenty
seven syllables in the first, and with thirty-two syllables
in the second verse; it is measured by feet, denominated
गण or मात्रागण which are equivalent to two long syllables
or to four short; its odd feet (the first, third, fifth and
seventh) must never be amphibrachys, the sixth foot of
the first verse consists of a single short syllable and that
of the second verse of an Amphibrachys or Proceleusmaticus.
The pause is commonly restricted to the close of the third
foot. If the long verse precede the short one, the metre
is called सुगीति. E. अनु and गीति (another metre).
text.2896: अनुगु Avyayībh. After the cow or the cows. E. अनु and गो.
text.2897:
अनुगुण I. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-णः-णा-णम्) Of similar qualities,
congenial with, corresponding with, suitable to.
II. Tatpur. m. (-णः) (In Rhetoric.) An alaṅkāra or mode
of writing elegantly, representing the natural properties of
a thing as more intense through contact with another thing.
III. Avyayībh. (-णम्) According to the quality or natural
property (of an object). E. अनु and गुण.
text.2898:
अनुगृहीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Favoured, obliged.
E. ग्रह with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त and āgama इट् lengthened.
text.2899:
अनुग्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्रः-ग्रा-ग्रम्) Not violent, calm,
gentle, mild. E. अ neg. and उग्र.
text.2900:
अनुग्रह Tatpur. m. (-हः)
1 Promoting good and preventing ill or
(according to another interpretation) promoting good by
preventing ill.
2 The conferring benefits, favour.
3 Aid,
assistance.
4 Instructing in the mystical verses or incan
tations of the Vedas(?).
5 See अनुग्रहसर्ग. E. ग्रह् with अनु,
kṛt aff. अप्.
text.2901:
अनुग्रहण Tatpur. n. (-णम्). The same as अनुग्रह 1. 2. 3. E.
ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2902:
अनुग्रहसर्ग Tatpur. m. (-र्गः) (In the Sāṅkhya philosophy.) The
creation of mental conditions; in some of the Purāṇas it
is considered as an eighth creation, in others as a fifth, and
subdivided into विपर्यय, अशक्ति, सिद्धि and तुष्टि qq. vv.
See also प्रत्ययसर्ग. E. अनुग्रह (perhaps in the sense of
‘feeling’ in general) and सर्ग.
text.2903:
अनुग्रहिन् m. (-ही) One instructed in the mystical verses or
incantations of the Vedas(?). E. अनुग्रह, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2904:
अनुग्रामम् Avyayībh. Village for village, according to or in
every village. E. अनु and ग्राम.
text.2905:
अनुग्रासक m. (-कः) A mouthful or a quantity equivalent to a
mouthful of boiled rice. E. अनु-ग्रास, taddh. aff. क.
text.2906:
अनुग्राहक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-हकः-हिका-हकम्)
1 Manifesting
grace or favour towards; e. g. आदित्यपुरुषो वा चक्षुषोऽनु-
ग्राहकः.
2 A supporter, an assistant (also in evil deeds).
E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
text.2907:
अनुग्राहिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ही-हिणी-हि) Gracious, favour
able. E. ग्रह् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2908:
अनुग्राह्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ह्यः-ह्या-ह्यम्) To be treated with
graciousness or favour, to be favoured. E. ग्रह् with अनु,
kṛtya aff. ण्यत्.
text.2909:
अनुचर Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Going or coming
after, following.
2. m. f. (-रः-री)
1 A follower, a companion.
2 A ser
vant, an attendant. (The fem. form अनुचरा, if not the latter
part of a Bahuvr. compound, is grammatically incorrect.
E. चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्; चर being टित् or, according
to some, चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. ट.
text.2910:
अनुचारक Tatpur. m. f. (-रकः-रिका)
1 A follower, a companion.
2 A servant, an attendant. E. चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. ण्वुल्.
text.2911:
अनुचारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Following, attend
ing. E. चर् with अनु, kṛt aff. घिणुन्.
text.2912:
अनुचित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not proper, not
suitable, not convenient, wrong.
2 Not known, not under
stood. E. अ neg. and उचित.
text.2913:
अनुचितार्थ Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्थः-र्था-र्थम्) Having an un
known or an unusual meaning (as a word; in rhetoric
considered as one of the पददोष q. v.; e. g. if the word
पशु, animal, is used in the sense of sacrificial animal, in
a poetical passage, while it has this sense only in the
ritual literature, or with the intention of implying timidity
which it does not imply). E. अनुचित and अर्थ.
text.2914:
अनुचिन्तन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Thinking of, recollecting, recall
ing. E. चिन्त् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2915:
अनुचिन्ता Tatpur. f. (-न्ता) Thinking of, recollecting, recall
ing. E. चिन्त् with अनु, kṛt aff. अङ्.
text.2916:
अनुच्चार Tatpur. m. (-रः) Non-utterance, omission (of a word).
E. अ neg. and उच्चार.
text.2917:
अनुच्छाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) A cloth or garment, that hangs
down; different from पर्यास, a cloth that is thrown round
q. v., from नीवि q. v. &c. (ved.). E. छद् with अनु (along,
scil. the body), kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2918:
अनुच्छित्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) Non-destruction, indestructibility,
eternity. E. अ neg. and उच्छित्ति.
text.2919:
अनुच्छित्तिधर्मन् Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-र्मा-र्मा-र्म) Having the
property of eternity, of indestructibility (an epithet of आत्मन्
in the Upan.). E. अनुच्छित्ति and धर्मन्.
text.2920:
अनुच्छिन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Not cut off, not
destroyed. E. अ neg. and उच्छिन्न.
text.2921:
अनुच्छिष्ट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Not rejected, pure.
E. अ neg. and उच्छिष्ट.
text.2922:
अनुच्छेद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Non-destruction, indestructibility,
eternity. E. अ neg. and उच्छेद.
text.2923:
अनुच्छेद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्)
1 Not divisible.
2 In
destructible, permanent. E. अ neg. and उच्छेद्य.
text.2924:
अनुज Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Born after or later.
2. m. (-जः) A younger brother.
3. f. (-जा)
1 A younger sister.
2 The name of a me
dicinal plant. See त्रायमाणा.
4. n. (-जम्) A small herbaceous plant used in medicine
and as a perfume. See प्रपौण्डरीक. E. जन् with अनु,
kṛt aff. ड.
text.2925:
अनुजनम् Avyayībh. According to people, according to every
body. E. अनु and जन.
text.2926:
अनुजन्मन् Bahuvr. m. (-न्मा) A younger brother or younger
born. E. अनु and जन्मन्.
text.2927:
अनुजात Tatpur. I. 1. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Born after. Used ac
tively, passively and impersonally; when actively with a noun
depending in the accusative; e. g. अनुजातो माणवको माण-
विकाम् or अनुजाता माणविका माणवकेन ‘the boy is born
after the girl’ or अनुजातं माणवकेन ‘the boy is later born’.
2. m. (-तः) A younger brother.
3. f. (-ता) A younger sister. E. जन् with अनु, kṛt
aff. क्त.
II. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 After teething (as a child;
the word is explained so by a commentator of Manu, where
it appears as an elliptical expression instead of अनुदन्तजात,
the word दन्तजात preceding immediately; this meaning is
therefore restricted to the passage alone alluded to (book 5
verse 58) and not generally applicable).
2 Born like or with
similar qualities as (another). E. अनु and जात.
text.2928:
अनुजावर See आनुजावर. (The form आनुयाजावर which occurs
in the existing edition of Pāṇini V. 4. 36. v. 5., is wrong.)
text.2929:
अनुजिघृक्षा Tatpur. f. (-क्षा) The desire of conferring favours,
of acting kindly. E. ग्रह् in the desid., with अनु, kṛt aff. अ.
text.2930:
अनुजीर्ण Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्णः-र्णा-र्णम्) Grown old after, decayed
after, or in consequence of, on behalf of. (Used actively,
passively and impersonally; when actively with a noun de
pending in the accusative; e. g. अनुजीर्णो वृषलीं चैत्रः or
अनुजीर्णा वृषली चैत्रेण; अनुजीर्णं चैत्रेण. Compare the con
struction of अनुजात.) E. जॄ with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2931:
अनुजीविन् Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-वी-विनी-वि) Living upon,
getting a livelihood by or through, dependant.
2. m. (-वी)
1 A servant, a dependant.
2 A companion,
a follower. (It occurs as the proper name of a crow in a
fable.) E. जीव् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2932:
अनुजीविसात् ind. See the following. E. अनुजीविन्, taddh.
aff. साति.
text.2933:
अनुजीविसात्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Made subser
vient, become entirely one's own. E. अनुजीविसात् and कृत.
text.2934:
अनुजीव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be lived upon or after,
in conformance with. E. जीव् with अनु, kṛtya aff. तव्यत्.
text.2935:
अनुज्ञप्ति Tatpur. f. (-प्तिः) Ordering, commanding, enjoining.
The same as अनुज्ञापन. E. ज्ञप् with अनु (or perhaps better
ज्ञा, in the caus., with अनु, with āgama पुक् and the vowel
of the radical shortened), kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.2936:
अनुज्ञा Tatpur. f. (-ज्ञा)
1 Assent, permission.
2 Order, com
mand(?).
3 (In Rhetoric.) An alaṅkāra or mode of writing
elegantly viz. taking a favourable view of another's faults and,
as it were, assenting to them. E. ज्ञा with अनु, kṛt aff. अङ्.
text.2937:
अनुज्ञात Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Assented to, permitted,
allowed, accepted, acknowledged.
2 Ordered, directed.
3 Dismissed.
4 Honoured. E. ज्ञा with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2938:
अनुज्ञान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Assenting, permitting. E. ज्ञा with
अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2939:
अनुज्ञापक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पकः-पिका-पकम्) Commanding.
E. ज्ञा in the caus., with अनु, with āgama पुक्, kṛt aff.
ण्वुल्.
text.2940:
अनुज्ञापन Tatpur. n. (-नम्). The same as अनुज्ञप्ति. E. ज्ञा
in the caus., with अनु, with āgama पुक्, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2941:
अनुज्ञाप्रार्थना Tatpur. f. (-ना) Asking permission. E. अनुज्ञा
and प्रार्थना.
text.2942:
अनुज्ञैषणा Tatpur. f. (-णा) Asking permission. E. अनुज्ञा
and एषणा.
text.2943:
अनुज्येष्ठ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ष्ठः-ष्ठा-ष्ठम्) Following the
eldest, the next eldest, eldest but one.
II. Avyayībh. (-ष्ठम्)
1 After the eldest.
2 According
to seniority. E. अनु and ज्येष्ठ.
text.2945:
अनुतप्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-प्तः-प्ता-प्तम्) Filled with regret or re
pentance, repentant, remorseful. E. तप् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2946: अनुतर Tatpur. m. (-रः) Fare, freight. E. तॄ with अनु, kṛt aff. अप्.
text.2947:
अनुतर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः)
1 Thirst.
2 Wish, desire.
3 A drinking
vessel, one used to drink spirituous liquors from.
4 Spi
rituous liquor. See अनुतर्षण. E. तृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2948:
अनुतर्षण Tatpur. n. (-णम्)
1 A vessel (according to some, of
crystal), from which spirituous liquor is drunk.
2 Serving up
or distributing liquor. (Some authorities admit only the first,
some only the second meaning; neither both together. A
later compilation makes this word a synonyme of अनुतर्ष
also in its other meanings.) E. तृष् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2949:
अनुताप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Repentance. E. तप् with अनु, kṛt
aff. घञ्.
text.2950:
अनुतापन Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-नी-नम्) Making remorseful or
penitent, afflicting. E. तप् with अनु, in the caus., kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2951:
अनुतापिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-पी-पिनी-पि) Penitent, regretting.
E. अनुताप, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2952:
अनुतिलम् Avyayībh. According or like a seed of sesamum;
(probably used in the same manner as तिलतुल्य in negative
phrases answering ‘a single grain, a pin's head, an iota, a
whit &c.’). E. अनु and तिल.
text.2953:
अनुतूलि Denom. (अनुतूलयति). E. तूल, denom. aff. णिच्, with
अनु. See under तूलि.
text.2954:
अनुत्कर्ष Tatpur. m. (-र्षः) Want of excellence or superiority,
inferiority. E. अ neg. and उत्कर्ष.
text.2955:
अनुत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Not thrown, not over
powered, invincible (ved.). E. अ neg. and नुत्त. (According
to others: not wetted, not moistened. E. अ neg. and उत्त;
this interpretation, however, seems erroneous.)
text.2956:
अनुत्तम m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) I. Tatpur. Very best, chief,
principal. E. अ compar. or expl. and उत्तम, or perhaps a
compound framed after the analogy of अनुत्तर.
II. Bahuvr. (In grammar.) Without the first person, used
in any but the first person, i. e. in the second or third person
(viz. a verb). E. अ priv. and उत्तम.
text.2957:
अनुत्तमन्यु Bahuvr. m. (-न्युः) (ved.) Of invincible wrath, an
epithet of Indra. E. अनुत्त and मन्यु.
text.2958:
अनुत्तमाम्भस् Tatpur. n. (-म्भः) A technical term in the Sāṅkhya
philosophy denoting one of the five sorts of external ac
quiescence or indifference (see तुष्टि), viz. that condition of
mind in which a man abstains from sensual enjoyments on
the ground that there is no repose for the senses when at
tachment to sensual pleasures prevails. Some call this in
difference नारीक; compare also अम्भस्, सलिल, ओघ, वृष्टि,
सुतमस्, पार, सुनेत्र, सुपार, अपार, पारापार, उत्तमाम्भस्
and the following. E. अ neg. and उत्तमाम्भस्(?).
text.2959:
अनुत्तमाम्भसिक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) A technical term in the
Sāṅkhya philosophy denoting one of the five sorts of ex
ternal acquiescence or indifference (see तुष्टि), viz. that con
dition of mind in which a man abstains from sensual enjoy
ments on the ground that it is sinful to injure created things,
enjoyment however being impossible without doing so. Some
call this indifference उत्तमाम्भस्. Compare the preceding and
the terms named there. E. अनुत्तम and आम्भसिक(?).
text.2960:
अनुत्तर I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Low, nether.
2 South, southern.
3 Low, inferior, vile.
2. n. (-रम्)
1 No-answer.
2 A bad or evasive reply
and held therefore to be no-answer (e. g. of the defendant,
in a law-suit). E. अ neg. and उत्तर.
II. Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्)
1 Best, excellent,
supreme, chief, principal (literally: than which there is no
higher or better).
2 Fixed, firm.
3 Unable to answer or to
give a proper answer.
2. m. pl. (-राः) In Jaina mythology, one of the two
divisions (see also ग्रैवेयक) of the gods called कल्पातीत
(q. v.) which are one of the two divisions (see also कल्पभव)
of the gods called वैमानिक (q. v.); the अनुत्तराः comprise
five classes. See विजय, वैजयन्त, जयन्त, अपराजित and
सर्वार्थसिद्धि. See also अनुत्तरोपपातिक. E. अ priv. and उत्तर.
text.2961:
अनुत्तरयोगतन्त्र Tatpur. n. (-न्त्रम्) The name of the last of
the four Bauddha Tantras, the Tantra of the supreme Yoga.
(The other three are called क्रियातन्त्र, आचारतन्त्र and यो-
गतन्त्र qq. vv.) E. अनुत्तर-योग and तन्त्र.
text.2962:
अनुत्तरोपपातिक m. pl. (-काः) Apparently the same as अनुत्तर
m. pl.: the name of the Jaina gods so called. According
to a commentary it would mean literally ‘those who have
the highest origin i. e. who are born in the five Vimānas’
from which the five classes of the अनुत्तराः derive their
appellations. E. अनुत्तरोपपातिन् (अनुत्तर and उपपात,
taddh. aff. इनि), taddh. aff. कन्(?).
text.2963:
अनुत्तरोपपातिकदशा Bahuvr. f. pl. (-शाः) The name of the
ninth of the twelve sacred writings of the Jainas: that
treating on the अनुत्तरोपपातिकाः (q. v.). E. अनुत्तरोपपा-
तिक and दशा (acc. to a comm. in the sense of अध्ययन);
but more probably अनुत्तº and दशन्, samāsānta aff. डच्,
like आसन्नदश &c.
text.2964:
अनुत्पत्ति I. Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः) The not taking origin or birth,
the not being produced, the not arising (as in philosophy,
e. g. of all knowledge at once, or of Prakṛti &c.). See
also अनुत्पत्तिसम. E. अ neg. and उत्पत्ति.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्तिः-त्तिः-त्ति) Having no origin or
birth, not being produced. E. अ priv. and उत्पत्ति.
text.2965:
अनुत्पत्तिक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-की-कम्) (In Bauddha li
terature.) Having no origin or birth, not or not yet being
produced. (The fem. -की belongs to Bauddha writings; in
the classic language, it would be -का.) See the following.
E. अनुत्पत्ति II., samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.2966:
अनुत्पत्तिकधर्मक्षान्ति Tatpur. f. (-न्तिः) (In Bauddha literature.)
Enduring conditions which have not yet taken place i. e.
reconciling one's mind to the conditions of a future life;
one of the hundred-eight धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.) or means to
comprehend the doctrine of Śākyamuni; ‘it leads to the
reception of revelations’ i. e. it enables an enquirer to get
possessed of the mysteries of the Bauddha doctrine. E.
अनुत्पत्तिक-धर्म and क्षान्ति.
text.2967:
अनुत्पत्तिसम Tatpur. m. f. (-मः-मा) (In the Nyāya philosophy.)
The sophism of the impossibility of origin or birth; viz.
arguing that a thing cannot take origin, because a thing
exists in consequence of an immaterial cause; as the latter,
however, does not exist before the material cause and the
instance proving the existence of such material cause, and
as the material cause again depends upon what exists, and
the instance upon the material cause, the thing itself can
never come into existence: or origin in general is impossible.
E. अनुत्पत्ति and सम. (With respect to the gender of this
word and the ellipsis required to explain it, see the E. of
अनित्यसम.)
text.2968:
अनुत्पन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्) Not born, not pro
duced &c. See उत्पन्न. E. अ neg. and उत्पन्न.
text.2969:
अनुत्पाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) The not taking origin or birth,
the not arising. E. अ neg. and उत्पाद.
text.2970:
अनुत्पादक्षान्ति Tatpur. f. (-न्तिः) (In Bauddha literature.) En
during non-birth i. e. reconciling one's mind to not being
born again; one of the hundred-eight धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.)
or means to comprehend the doctrine of Śākyamuni; it is
conducive to a clear apprehension of all that may impede
(sc. the attainment of this desirable end). E. अनुत्पाद and क्षान्ति.
text.2971:
अनुत्पादन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not producing, not bringing
forth. E. अ neg. and उत्पादन.
text.2972:
अनुत्पाद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) Not producible,
eternal (e. g. प्रकृति or पुरुष in the Sāṅkhya philosophy). E.
अ neg. and उत्पाद्य.
text.2973:
अनुत्साह I. Tatpur. m. (-हः) Want of effort or energy, in
difference, unconcernedness. E. अ neg. and उत्साह.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-हः-हा-हम्) Without energy, in
different, unconcerned. E. अ priv. and उत्साह.
text.2974:
अनुत्सुक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Not strongly attached
to, not longing for &c. See उत्सुक. E. अ neg. and उत्सुक.
text.2975:
अनुद Tatpur. m. (-दः) (ved.) 1. A companion, a follower.
E. दो with अनु, kṛt aff. क. Comp. अनुदेयी.
2. Giving like, liberal in a similar manner. E. दा with
अनु, kṛt aff. क. In both meanings only in composition
with अ priv. See अनानुद.
text.2976:
अनुदक Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) Without water, water
less. E. अ priv. and उदक.
text.2977:
अनुदत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Given back, returned.
Also अनूत्त q. v. E. दा with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.2978:
अनुदर Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Thin, lank. E. अ priv.
and उदर.
text.2979:
अनुदर्शन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Looking after, considering. E.
दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.2980:
अनुदर्शिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्शी-र्शिनी-र्शि) Looking after, con
sidering, foreseeing. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.2981:
अनुदात्त Tatpur. (In Grammar.) 1. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्)
Not elevated, not being pronounced with the accent called
उदात्त (q. v.) or स्वरित (q. v.) (as the syllable of a word).
2. m. (-त्तः) The not elevated accent, the accent (see
स्वर and वाह्यप्रयत्न) which is neither उदात्त (q. v.) nor
स्वरित (q. v.) and which by the depression of the voice, it
requires, prepares, as it were, for the greater effort in the
pronunciation of the syllables accented with the उदात्त or
स्वरित. This depression being the greatest when the syl
lable having the अनुदात्त accent, is immediately followed
by a syllable accented with the उदात्त or स्वरित, the अनु-
दात्त is called in this case अनुदात्ततर ‘a very anudātta’.
The mode of marking the अनुदात्त, is restricted, as is also
the case with the other two accents, to the vaidik Sanhitās
(Sanhitā-Pāṭhas) and Brāhmaṇas, and varies according to
the different Vedas. In the Sanhitā, Pada and the Brāhmaṇas
of the Ṛgveda, in the Sanhitā and Pada of the Yajurand
Sanhitā of the Atharvaveda the Anudātta is marked with a
horizontal line under the syllable so accented (thus becoming
comparable also in graphic value to the sign of the Virāma, the
horizontal line representing as it were the repose in accentua-
tion); in the Brāhmaṇas of the White Yajurveda, it is not
marked at all; and in the Sanhitā of the Sāmaveda the anu
dātta syllable when anudāttatara before an udātta, or before
a svarita syllable bearing the figures २ or ३, is marked with
the figure ३ over it, except when it is preceded in the be
ginning of a verse by other anudātta syllables, in which
case only the first anudātta syllable bears the figure ३,
while the following anudātta syllables are left unmarked.
If the anudāttatara is followed by a svarita syllable bearing
the sign २र, the syllable so accented is marked with ३क.
In the Pada-text of the Sāmaveda the sign ३ denotes the
anudāttatara before an udātta, if the latter occupies the
second syllable from the beginning, or the syllable before
an anudāttatara, if the latter is followed by a svarita, or
lastly the anudātta accentuation of a syllable so marked and
of all the syllables following it until an udātta or svarita
syllable comes; the sign ३क or क denotes the anudāttatara
immediately followed by a svarita. Compare also the terms
नीच, निहत, न्यस्त, न्यस्ततर, नियत, निघात, न्यास, नियम
and the radd. हन् with नि and यम् with नि.--In the native
lists of radicals, the Dhātupāthas, certain radicals have the
anudātta accent as an इत् (q. v.) or अनुबन्ध (q. v.) connected
with them i. e. as a technical sign for certain rules they are
subject to with respect to derivation &c. See also अनु-
दात्तेत् and अनुदात्तोपदेश. E. अ neg. and अनुदात्त.
text.2982:
अनुदात्ततर m. (-रः) The अनुदात्त accent (or स्वर) or a syl
lable so accented when immediately preceding a syllable
having the उदात्त or स्वरित accent. See under अनुदात्त.
E. अनुदात्त, taddh. aff. तरप्.
text.2983:
अनुदात्तत्व n. (-त्वम्) The having or being the accent अनुदात्त.
E. अनुदात्त, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.2984:
अनुदात्तस्वरित Karmadh. See नीचस्वरित. E. अनुदात्त and
स्वरित.
text.2985:
अनुदात्तादि Bahuvr. n. (-दि) (In Grammar.) A nominal base
which is अनुदात्त (q. v.) in the first syllable. E. अनुदात्त
and आदि; scil. प्रातिपदिक.
text.2986:
अनुदात्तेत् Bahuvr. m. (-त्) (In Grammar.) A radical having
in the Dhātupāṭha or the native list of radicals, the अनु-
दात्त accent as अनुबन्ध i. e. as a technical sign for certain
rules of derivation &c. See the Appendix. E. अनुदात्त and
इत् (the technical denomination of अनुबन्ध); scil. धातु.
text.2987:
अनुदात्तोदय Bahuvr. n. (-यम्) (In Grammar.) A syllable fol
lowed by an अनुदात्त (q. v.) syllable. E. अनुदात्त and उदय;
scil. अक्षर.
text.2988:
अनुदात्तोपदेश Bahuvr. m. (-शः). The same as अनुदात्तेत्.
See s. v. उपदेश. E. अनुदात्त and उपदेश; scil. धातु.
text.2989:
अनुदार I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-रा-रम्) Not liberal, not
generous, niggardly, mean. E. अ neg. and उदार.
II. Bahuvr. m. (-रः) Adhered to or followed by a wife.
E. अनु and दार.
text.2990:
अनुदित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) I. Unrisen. II. Unsaid,
unuttered. E. अ neg. and उदित.
text.2991: अनुदिनम् Avyayībh. Daily, every day. E. अनु and दिन.
text.2992: अनुदिवसम् Avyayībh. Daily, every day. E. अनु and दिवस.
text.2993:
अनुदिशम् Avyayībh. In every quarter, in every direction. E.
अनु and दिश्, samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.2994:
अनुदृष्टि Bahuvr.(?) f. (-ष्टिः) The proper name of the mother
or ancestress of आनुदृष्टिनेय. E. अनु and दृष्टि ‘having her
eyes after i. e. provident’.
text.2995:
अनुदेय Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) To be given back,
to be returned. (ved.)
2. f. (-यी) (ved.)
1 Restitution, restoration(?).
2 A
female friend or companion. Comp. अनुद. E. दा with अनु,
kṛtya aff. यत्.
text.2996:
अनुदेश Tatpur. m. (-शः)
1 (In Grammar.) A rule or injunction
relating to a preceding rule or injunction, to an उद्देश q. v.
If there are several उद्देशाः followed by an equal number
of अनुदेशाः, the first अनुदेशः is to be connected with the
first उद्देश, the second अनुदेशः with the second उद्देशः
and so on.
2 Order, injunction in general. E. दिश् with
अनु, kṛt aff. घञ्.
text.2997:
अनुदेशिन् m. f. n. (-शी-शिनी-शि) (In Grammar.) Being the ob
ject of an अनुदेश (q. v.) in distinction from उद्देशिन् (q. v.)
the object of an उद्देश (q. v.); ‘समानां समसंख्यानां समपरि-
पठितानामुद्देशिनामनुदेशिनां च यथाक्रममुद्देशिभिः सहानुदे-
शिनः संबध्यन्ते।’. E. अनुदेश, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.2998:
अनुद्धृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not taken out, not
taken away &c. See उद्धृत. (If in ritual books said of the
Āhavanīya (q. v.) fire, it means that this fire is not yet
taken from the Gārhapatya (q. v.) where it is kept.) E. अ
neg. and उद्धृत.
text.2999:
अनुद्धृताभ्यस्तमय Tatpur. m. (-यः) The setting of the sun,
while the Āhavanīya (q. v.) fire is not yet removed from
the Gārhapatya (q. v.) where it is kept. E. अनुद्धृत (in the
sense of the locative) and अभ्यस्तमय.
text.3000:
अनुद्भट Tatpur. m. f. n. (-टः-टा-टम्) Not exalted, lowly
minded, not lofty. E. अ neg. and उद्भट.
text.3001:
अनुद्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-द्यः-द्या-द्यम्) What must or ought
not to be said, unspeakable, unutterable. Compare अवद्य.
(The reading अनूद्य in the actual edition of Pāṇ. III. 1. 101.
is to be corrected to अनुद्य.) E. अ neg. and उद्य.
text.3002:
अनुद्योग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Absence of exertion or effort,
laziness. E. अ neg. and उद्योग.
text.3003:
अनुद्रष्टव्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-व्यः-व्या-व्यम्) To be recognised,
to be seen, visible. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt aff. तव्य.
text.3004:
अनुद्रुत Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Followed, pursued.
E. द्रु with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
II. n. (-तम्) A measure of time in music, half a Druta,
or one-fourth of a Mātrā or time taken to articulate a short
vowel. E. अनु and द्रुत ‘an inferior or minor Druta’.
text.3005: अनुद्वाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) Celibacy. E. अ neg. and उद्वाह.
text.3006:
अनुद्विग्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ग्नः-ग्ना-ग्नम्) Easy, free from ap
prehension or perplexity. E. अन् neg. and उद्विग्न.
text.3007:
अनुद्वेग I. Tatpur. m. (-गः) Freedom from anxiety, the not
being discomposed. E. अ neg. and उद्वेग.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-गः-गा-गम्) Free from anxiety. E.
अ priv. and उद्वेग.
text.3008:
अनुद्वेगकर Tatpur. m. f. n. (-रः-री-रम्) Not causing fear,
not terrifying sc. by its appearance (e. g. as the staff of a
man belonging to the three superior castes, or as a judge
ought to be). E. अ neg. and उद्वेगकर.
text.3009:
अनुधावन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) I.
1 Chasing, pursuit, running after.
2 (fig.) Pursuit of any object, research, investigation, medita
tion. II. Cleansing, purifying. E. धाव् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.3010:
अनुध्यान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Meditation, religious contempla
tion. E. ध्यै with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.3011:
अनुध्यायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Meditating, re
flecting. E. ध्यै with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.3012:
अनुनय I. Tatpur. m. (-यः)
1 Salutation, courtesy, shewing
respect or adoration to a guest or deity, submission, hu
mility.
2 Humble supplication, conciliatory entreaty, re
concilement. E. नी with अनु, kṛt aff. अच्.
II. Avyayībh. (-यम्) According to propriety, agreeably
to what is required, to circumstance; e. g. अब्रवीदनुनयं वचः.
E. अनु and नय.
text.3013:
अनुनयप्रतिघप्रहाण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) (In Buddhistic literature.)
One of the 108 धर्मालोकमुख (q. v.), (probably) relinquish
ing what is adverse to respectful conduct or humility. E.
अनुनय-प्रतिघ and प्रहाण.
text.3014:
अनुनयमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Showing respect
or adoration, honouring. E. नी with अनु, kṛt aff. शानच्,
and āgama मुक्.
text.3015:
अनुनयामन्त्रण Tatpur. n. (-णम्) An address marked with
conciliation, conciliatory address. E. अनुनय and आमन्त्रण.
text.3016:
अनुनयिन् m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Courteous, humble, sub
missive. E. अनुनय, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.3017:
अनुनाद Tatpur. m. (-दः) Sound, consequent sound, vibration,
echo. E. अनु and नाद.
text.3018:
अनुनादिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-दी-दिनी-दि) Sounding after,
echoing; e. g. कलानुनादिन् q. v. E. अनु and नादिन्.
text.3019:
अनुनायिका Tatpur. f. (-का) A secondary or inferior female
character in a drama, one subordinate to the नायिका or prin
cipal female character, such as ‘a friend, a female devotee,
a slave, a nurse or female artisans’. E. अनु and नायिका.
text.3020:
अनुनाश Tatpur. m. (-शः) The name of a country (? this
meaning is doubtful). E. अनु and नाश.
text.3021:
अनुनासिक Tatpur. m. f. n. (-कः-का-कम्) (In Grammar.) Uttered
through the nose, nasal (see also रक्त), viz.
1 A nasal sound
in general, it being pronounced through the nose and with
the appropriate organ of speech, as ङ् through the nose
and the throat, ञ् through the nose and with the palate &c.
2 (Conditionally) a vowel or य्, व्, ल्; in this case the nasal
nature of the sound is indicated by the sign ंँ. (N. B. य्ंँ or
व्ंँ represent the value of य् or व् preceded by म्; ल्ंँ that
of ल् preceded by म् or न्. In the pause a final vowel may
be anunāsika. A short anunāsika vowel, when not occurr
ing in a pause, represents apparently always the value of
the same vowel and म् or न्; it must be, in general, the
last vowel sound of the former part of a compound or of
the word itself, followed by a final sibilant, e. g. संँस्कर्ता
instead of सम्स्-कर्ता, पुंँश्चली = पुम्स्-चली, तस्मिंँस्त्वा =
तस्मिन्स्-त्वा. Only a few exceptions of this rule are mentioned
by the vaidik grammarians, e. g. अमिनन्तंँ एवैः, when अ of न्त
is anunāsika, although it does neither stand in a pause nor
represent more than its own sound.--A long anunāsika
vowel, when not occurring in a pause, may be generally
considered as representing the value of its short vowel and
an original न्त्स् or of its short vowel and न्त्, provided स् or
its substitute has been preserved; e. g. महांँ इन्द्रः = महन्त्स्
इन्द्रः, दधन्वांँ यः = दधन्वन्त्स् यः, सर्गांँ इव = सर्गन्त्स् इव
or महांँश्चरति = महन्त्स् चरति, दस्यूंँरेकः = दस्युन्त्स् एकः.
The material difference that prevails between the anunāsika
(ंँ) and the anusvāra (ं) sound, does not appear to have
been kept alive beyond the period of the vaidik literature,
when an interchange between both was not deemed legiti
mate; according to the grammarians of the classical period,
in the latter the anunāsika may be replaced by the anu
svāra. The sign of the anunāsika (ंँ), however, is but
seldom met with in the ordinary Mss. referring to the post
vaidik literature; and from the reasons stated, its use in
vaidik Mss. is objectionable, when it occurs in words like
यशांँसि, धनूंँषि, विश्वेषांँ हितः or in मंँहिष्ठ, वाजंँ सनिषत्, इन्द्रंँ
स्तवाम and similar instances in which the long nasal vowel
does not represent more than the value of a short vowel
and a nasal, or in which the short nasal vowel is not fol
lowed by a final sibilant.) E. अनु and नासिका.
text.3022:
अनुनासिकत्व n. (-त्वम्) The being nasal, nasality. E. अनु-
नासिक, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.3023:
अनुनासिकलोप Tatpur. m. (-पः) The dropping or disappear
ance of a nasal. E. अनुनासिक and लोप.
text.3024:
अनुनासिकात्व n. (-त्वम्) The nasality of आ. E. अनुनासिक-
आ, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.3025:
अनुनासिकादि Bahuvr. m. (-दिः) A combined consonant be
ginning with a nasal (न् &c.) as न्द् &c. E. अनुनासिक and
आदि; scil. संयोग.
text.3026:
अनुनासिकान्त Bahuvr. m. (-न्तः) A radical ending in a nasal;
as तन्, गम् &c. E. अनुनासिक and अन्त; scil. धातु.
text.3027:
अनुनासिकोपध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्)
1 Having a
nasal penultimate.
2 Having a preceding syllable pronounced
with nasality (as a विवृत्ति or hiatus between सचांँ इन्द्रः &c.).
E. अनुनासिक and उपधा.
text.3028:
अनुनिनीषु Tatpur. m. f. n. (-षुः-षुः-षु) Desirous of showing
respect, of reconciling, of pleasing. E. नी in the desider.,
with अनु, kṛt aff. उ.
text.3029:
अनुनिर्देश Tatpur. m. (-शः) Telling, describing &c. (see निर्देश)
in accordance with, in the same order as something pre
viously told; e. g. भूयसामुपदिष्टानां क्रियाणामथ कर्मणाम्।
क्रमशो योऽनुनिर्देशो यथासंख्यं तदुच्यते. E. अनु and निर्देश.
text.3030:
अनुनिर्वाप Tatpur. m. (-पः) Subsequently pouring out (e. g.
clarified butter); a sacrificial rite occurring in several sacri
fices. E. अनु and निर्वाप.
text.3031:
अनुनिर्वाप्या f. (-प्या) A religious ceremony referring to the
अनुनिर्वाप. E. अनुनिर्वाप, taddh. aff. यत्.
text.3032:
अनुनीति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) The same as अनुनय. E. नी with
अनु, kṛt aff. क्तिन्.
text.3033:
अनुन्नतगात्र Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्रः-त्रा-त्रम्) Whose limbs are
not too full (one of the eighty secondary signs or अनुव्यञ्जन
which characterize a great man according to the Buddhists.
E. अ neg. and उन्नतगात्र.
text.3034:
अनुन्मत्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-त्तः-त्ता-त्तम्) Sane, sober, not
wild, not mad. E. अ neg. and उन्मत्त.
text.3035:
अनुन्माद Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-दः-दा-दम्). The same as अनुन्मत्त.
E. अ priv. and उन्माद.
text.3036:
अनुपकारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) Not assisting,
neglecting, ungrateful. E. अ neg. and उपकारिन्.
text.3037:
अनुपकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Unassisted. E. अ
neg. and उपकृत.
text.3038:
अनुपक्षित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not destroyed, not
perished. E. अ neg. and उपक्षित.
text.3039:
अनुपगीत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not praised, not made
known. (In a vaidik passage, where this word occurs, it
means ‘not praised by others’.) E. अ neg. and उपगीत.
text.3040:
अनुपघातार्जित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) (In Law.) Ac
quired without injury (to the father's property). E. अ neg.
and उपघात-अर्जित.
text.3041:
अनुपघ्नत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्-न्ती-त्) Not doing injury (e. g.
पितृद्रव्यम् to the father's property). E. अ neg. and उपघ्नत्.
text.3043:
अनुपजीवनीय m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) I. Tatpur. Who does
not afford means to live upon. E. अ neg. and उपजीवनीय.
II. Bahuvr. Who has nothing to live upon. E. अ priv.
and उपजीवनीय.
text.3044:
अनुपठित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Recited. E. पठ with
अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.3045:
अनुपठितिन् m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति) Having recited, with a
noun in the locative, e. g. अनुपठिती वेदे ‘having recited
the Veda. E. अनुपठित, taddh. aff. इनि.
text.3046:
अनुपतन Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 Falling on or upon.
2 Following.
3 (In Arithmetic.) Proportion. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.3047: अनुपति Avyayībh. After the husband. E. अनु and पति.
text.3048:
अनुपतित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Fallen, descended.
2 Followed. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. क्त.
text.3049:
अनुपथ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्) Following the road.
II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-थः-था-थम्) Having favourable
roads (a vaidik epithet of the Maruts). E. अनु and पथिन्,
samāsānta aff. अ.
III. Avyayībh. (-थम्) Along the road. E. अनु and पथिन्,
samāsānta aff. टच्.
text.3050:
अनुपद् Tatpur. f. (-द्) Food (according to a vaidik comm.
‘because it is daily searched for). E. पद् with अनु, kṛt
aff. क्विप्.
text.3051:
अनुपद I. Bahuvr. m. (-दः) A proper name (explained by a
comm. अनुगतं पदमस्य); his descendants are called अनुपदाः
or आनुपदयः.
II. Tatpur. n. (-दम्) A burden, a word or passage repeated.
III. Avyayībh. (-दम्)
1 Upon the foot, after, immediately
after, with a noun in the genitive case.
2 Step by step.
3 Word for word. E. अनु and पद.
text.3052:
अनुपदसूत्र Tatpur. n. (-त्रम्) The name of a work which in
terprets the Shaḍvinśabrāhmaṇa word for word. E. अनुपद
(III.) and सूत्र.
text.3053:
अनुपदस्वत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्वान्-स्वती-स्वत्) (ved.) Probably:
not diminishing, not decaying. E. अ neg. and उपदस्वत्.
text.3054:
अनुपदिन् m. (-दी) A searcher, an inquirer, one who follows
or seeks for, with a noun in the genit., e. g. मृगस्यानुपदी,
अनुपद्युष्ट्राणाम्. E. अनुपद (III.), taddh. aff. इनि.
text.3055:
अनुपदीना f. (-ना) A boot, a buskin. E. अनुपद (III.), taddh.
aff. ख.
text.3056:
अनुपदृष्टिन् m. (-ष्टी) A proper name. E. अ-उपदृष्ट, taddh.
aff. इनि(?).
text.3057:
अनुपदेष्टृ Tatpur. m. (-ष्टा) One who does not advise or in
struct; e. g. हितानुपदेष्टा कुत्सितः सखा. E. अ neg. and
उपदेष्टृ.
text.3058:
अनुपध Bahuvr. m. (-धः) Not preceded by a letter (liter.
having no penultimate; as a sibilant or ह् which may be
doubled if they are followed by a consonant and not pre
ceded by a letter; e. g. श्श्चोतन्त्यभितः, ह्ह्वयाम्यग्निम्). E. अ
priv. and उपधा; scil. ऊष्मन्.
text.3059:
अनुपनाह Tatpur. m. (-हः) (In Buddhistic doctrine.) One of
the 108 धर्मालोकमुख q. v.; (perhaps) want of attachment(?).
E. अ neg. and उपनाह.
text.3060:
अनुपन्यस्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-स्तः-स्ता-स्तम्) Not laid down, not
established, not clearly shown. E. अ neg. and उपन्यस्त.
text.3061:
अनुपन्यास Tatpur. m. (-सः) Failure of proof or determination,
the not establishing satisfactorily. E. अ neg. and उपन्यास.
text.3062:
अनुपपत्ति Tatpur. f. (-त्तिः)
1 The not taking place, failing
to be, failure.
2 The not being applied or applicable (as a
rule in grammar &c.).
3 The not being conclusive (as an
argument &c. brought to support a doctrine).
4 Absence of
the means of subsistence(?). E. अ neg. and उपपत्ति.
text.3063:
अनुपपन्न Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्नः-न्ना-न्नम्)
1 Uneffected, unac
complished.
2 Not applicable, not relevant.
3 Inconclusive
(as an argument).
4 Undemonstrated, unsubstantiated.
5 Not
having means of subsistence(?). E. अ neg. and उपपन्न.
text.3064:
अनुपपादक Bahuvr. m. pl. (-काः) (In the Buddhistic doctrine
of Nepal) a class of Buddhas which is of non-material ori
gin, also called ध्यानिबुद्धाः ‘the Buddhas of contemplation’;
in contradistinction from the मानुषिबुद्धाः or the seven Bud
dhas of human origin, the last of which is Śākyamuni.
E. अ priv. and उपपादक lit. ‘without a parent’.
text.3065:
अनुपप्लव Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-वः-वा-वम्) Free from misfortune,
not distressed. E. अ priv. and उपप्लव.
text.3066:
अनुपप्लुत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्). The same as the pre
ceding. E. अ neg. and उपप्लुत.
text.3067:
अनुपबाध Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-धः-धा-धम्) (ved.) Not obstructed,
not injured. E. अ priv. and उपबाधा.
text.3068:
अनुपम Bahuvr. I. m. f. n. (-मः-मा-मम्) Incomparable, ex
cellent, best.
II. f. (-मा) The female elephant of the south-west (as
the wife of the elephant Kumuda) or according to others,
of the north-east (as the wife of the elephant Supratīka).
E. अ priv. and उपमा.
text.3069:
अनुपममति Bahuvr. m. (-तिः) The proper name of a con
temporary of Śākyamuni, one of those to whom the Buddha
expounded his doctrine. E. अनुपम and मति ‘of incom
parable intellect’.
text.3070:
अनुपमर्दन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not refuting a charge. E. अ
neg. and उपमर्दन.
text.3071:
अनुपमित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Incomparable. E. अ
neg. and उपमित.
text.3072:
अनुपमेय Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) Incomparable. E. अ
neg. and उपमेय.
text.3073:
अनुपयुक्त Tatpur. m. f. n. (-क्तः-क्ता-क्तम्) Useless, unsuitable,
unserviceable. E. अ neg. and उपयुक्त (as according to a law
book, ‘vaidik writings to fools’).
text.3074:
अनुपयोग Tatpur. m. (-गः) Unserviceableness, uselessness.
E. अ neg. and उपयोग.
text.3075:
अनुपरत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not stopped, not
ceased. E. अ neg. and उपरत.
text.3076:
अनुपरिधि Avyayībh. Along or near the परिधि q. v. E. अनु
and परिधि.
text.3077:
अनुपलक्षित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Unseen, unper
ceived.
2 Unmarked, undiscriminated. E. अ neg. and
उपलक्षित.
text.3078:
अनुपलब्ध Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ब्धः-ब्धा-ब्धम्)
1 Unobtained.
2 Unperceived, imperceptible. E. अ neg. and उपलब्ध.
text.3079:
अनुपलब्धत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as अनुपलम्भ q. v. E. अनु-
पलब्ध, taddh. aff. त्व.
text.3080:
अनुपलब्धि Tatpur. m. (-ब्धिः) Not perceiving, non-perception,
non-recognition (esp. used in the Sūtras of various philos.
systems and the writings relating to them. See also अनु-
पलम्भ and अनुपलब्धिसम). E. अ neg. and उपलब्धि.
text.3081:
अनुपलब्धिसम Tatpur. m. f. (-मः-मा) (In the Nyāya philo
sophy.) A sophism on non-perception; viz. arguing: ‘be
cause the non-perception of an object cannot be perceived,
therefore the non-perception of the object does not exist
and consequently the non-existence of the object cannot
exist i. e. the object itself must exist’. This sophism is at
tributed by the Nyāya e. g. to those who maintain the eter
nity of sound on the ground that ‘the non-perception of
sound antecedently to pronunciation’--the reason alleged
by the Nyāya for its non-eternity--may be refuted in
the manner explained. E. अनुपलब्धि and सम (m. scil.
प्रतिषेध or विकल्प or प्रयोग; f. scil. जाति; comp. for the
meaning of these words the E. of अनित्यसम).
text.3082:
अनुपलभ्यमान Tatpur. m. f. n. (-नः-ना-नम्) Not being per
ceived, not being seen. E. अ neg. and उपलभ्यमान.
text.3083:
अनुपलम्भ Tatpur. m. (-म्भः) The not being perceived, ascer
tained, or the not being perceptible, ascertainable; e. g.
तदनुपलब्धेरनुपलम्भादावरणोपलब्धिः ‘the perception of a
covering is from the non-perception there of not being percep
tible’. See अनुपलब्धि and अनुपलब्धिसम. E. अ neg. and उपलम्भ.
text.3084:
अनुपवीतिन् Tatpur. m. (-ती) One who does not wear the
cord of his caste. E. अ neg. and उपवीतिन्.
text.3085:
अनुपशय Tatpur. m. (-यः) (In Medicine.) Any aggravating
thing or circumstance that increases the disease. E. अ neg.
and उपशय.
text.3086:
अनुपशान्त Tatpur. 1. m. (-न्तः-न्ता-न्तम्) Not calm, not
tranquil.
2. m. (-न्तः) The name of a Bauddha mendicant. E. अ
neg. and उपशान्त.
text.3087:
अनुपश्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-श्यः-श्या-श्यम्) Looking after, con
sidering attentively. See प्रत्ययानुपश्य. E. दृश् with अनु, kṛt
aff. श.
text.3088:
अनुपसंहारिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-री-रिणी-रि) (In philosophy.)
Non-exclusive, purely affirmative, as an argument of all
comprehensiveness whose subject does not exclude any thing;
as such an argument would lead to a conclusion of a purely
formal kind, i. e. to no real conclusion, अनुपसंहारिन् is
the characteristic of one of the modes of हेत्वाभास (q. v.)
or ‘semblance of argument’; compare also अनैकान्तिक. E.
अ neg. and उपसंहारिन्.
text.3089:
अनुपसर्ग I. Tatpur. m. (-र्गः) (In Grammar.) A particle which (or
when it) is not an उपसर्ग (q. v.), for instance अन्तर् in com
pounds like अन्तर्वण, or अभि, परि in formations like अभि-
सावकीयति, परिसावकीयति, when अभि and परि do not quali
fy the radical सु but the denom. सावकीयति. E. अ neg. and उपसर्ग.
II. Bahuvr. m. (-र्गः)
1 Without an उपसर्ग q. v. (as a radical).
2 Without obstruction, free from impediment; an epithet of
ईश्वर. E. अ priv. and उपसर्ग.
text.3090:
अनुपसर्गत्व n. (-त्वम्) The not being an उपसर्ग q. v. (see the
preceding). E. अनुपसर्ग (I.), taddh. aff. त्व.
text.3091:
अनुपस्कृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not vitiated, not
blamed, blameless (e. g. the law of Manu).
2 Not orna
mented, unfinished; e. g. राजतमनुपस्कृतम् a silver vessel not
enchased. E. अ neg. and उपस्कृत.
text.3092: अनुपस्थान Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Absence. E. अ neg. and उपस्थान.
text.3093:
अनुपस्थापन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Not bringing near, not having
ready or at hand. E. अ neg. and उपस्थापन.
text.3094:
अनुपस्थापयत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यन्-यन्ती-यत्) Not offering,
not having ready or at hand (e. g. money). E. अ neg. and
उपस्थापयत्.
text.3095:
अनुपस्थापित Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not ready, not
at hand, not offered or produced. E. अ neg. and उपस्थापित.
text.3096:
अनुपस्थायिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-यी-यिनी-यि) Absent, distant.
E. अ neg. and उपस्थायिन्.
text.3097:
अनुपस्थित Tatpur. I. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not approached
&c.
2 Not ready, not fresh in memory.
3 Sunk into oblivion
(as a science &c.).
II. n. (-तम्) (In Grammar.) A word which is not उपस्थित
(q. v.) i. e. which is not the word इति as it occurs in the
writings referring to the recitation of the vaidik hymns. E.
अ neg. and उपस्थित.
text.3098: अनुपस्थिति Tatpur. f. (-तिः) Absence. E. अ neg. and उपस्थिति.
text.3099:
अनुपहत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not injured, not
impaired, not obstructed.
2 Not polluted, not vitiated, not
made impure. E. अ neg. and उपहत.
text.3100:
अनुपहतक्रुष्ट Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-ष्टः-ष्टा-ष्टम्) Who has (in his
aspect) nothing that indicates injury or anger (one of the
eighty secondary signs (or अनुव्यञ्जन) which characterize a
great man, acc to the Buddhists. E. अ priv. and उपहत-क्रुष्ट.
text.3101:
अनुपहूत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्)
1 Not summoned, not
invoked.
2 Not summoned in a loud voice, invoked in a
low voice. E. अ 1. neg. 2. deter. and उपहूत.
text.3102:
अनुपाकृत Tatpur. m. f. n. (-तः-ता-तम्) Not prepared or made
fit for sacrificial purposes (as a victim before the muttering
of prayers over it, or as the प्रातरनुवाक before the com
pletion of the ceremonies required for it &c.). E. अ neg.
and उपाकृत.
text.3103:
अनुपाकृतमांस Karmadh. n. (-सम्) Flesh of an animal which
has not been made fit for sacrificial purposes by the recital
of vaidik hymns, flesh of an animal which has not been
killed at a sacrifice. (A Brahmaṇa is forbidden to eat such
flesh.) E. अनुपाकृत and मांस.
text.3104:
अनुपाख्य Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ख्यः-ख्या-ख्यम्) Not clearly per
ceptible. E. अ neg. and उपाख्य.
text.3105:
अनुपात Tatpur. m. (-तः)
1 Falling subsequently upon, alight
ing or descending upon in succession.
2 Following.
3 (In
arithmetic.) Proportion, the rule of three. E. अनु and पात
or पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. ण.
text.3106:
अनुपातक Tatpur. n. (-कम्) A heinous offence, one similar
to the four great crimes (महापातक) which are:
a. Causing
the death of a Brāhmaṇa (directly or indirectly).
b. Drink
ing spirits.
c. Stealing (acc. to the comm. ‘gold from a
Brāhmaṇa’).
d. Committing incest with the wife of a
father, natural or spiritual. The अनुपातक mentioned by
Manu are the following: 1. False boasting of superiority
(as pretending to be a Brāhmaṇa or conversant with the
four Vedas, if one is not); 2. Malignant report, before a
king, of crimes (comm.: punishable by death)--omitted
by Yājnavalkya--; 3. Falsely accusing a spiritual preceptor;
4. Forgetting the Veda; 5. Showing contempt of the Veda
(comm.: by resorting to heretical writings); 6. Giving false
evidence (omitted by Yājnav.); 7. Killing a friend (comm.:
not a Brāhmaṇa, this case being the first महापातक); 8.
(Knowingly) eating things prohibited (i. e. food fit only for
a Śūdra, as garlick &c.) or unfit to be tasted (as excrements
&c.); [9. (According to Yājnavalkya) Kissing a woman
while in menstruation; 10. (Acc. to Yājn.) Deceitfulness
(i. e. saying one thing and doing another)]; 11. Appro
priating a deposit (comm.: not the gold of a Brāhmaṇa
(this case being the third महापातक) or acc. to another
author. a deposit not of gold, if it belongs to a Brāhmaṇa);
12--17. Stealing a man, a horse, silver, a piece of land, a
diamond or a gem [acc. to Yājnavalkya, 12--17. a horse,
a gem, a man, a woman, a piece of land, and a cow];
18--22. Sexual intercourse with one's own sister, with little
girls before they have attained to puberty, with women of
the lowest tribe (comm.: a Chāṇdālī), with the wives of a
friend or of a son [to which Yājnavalkya adds: 23--30. with
a woman of the same gotra or family, the sister of a father
or mother, the wife of a maternal uncle, the wife of one's
father, the daughter or wife of a spiritual teacher or one's
own daughter; Nārada adds moreover: 31--40. with a mother
in law, the wife of a paternal uncle or of a pupil, the friend
of a sister, one who comes for protection, the wife of one
who carries on the government of the country--comm.:
if he is not a Kshatriya--, a nurse, a female mendicant,
a female devotee and a woman of the Brāhmaṇa class.]-
Similar to the first Mahāpātaka are the Anupātakas, acc.
to Manu, 1--3, acc. to Yājnavalkya, 3--5 and 7. Similar to
the second Mahāpātaka are the Anup., acc. to Manu, 4--8;
acc. to Yājnav., 1. 8. 9. 10. Similar to the third Mahāp.
are the Anup., acc. to Manu and Yājnav., 11--17. Similar
to the fourth Mahāp. are, according to Manu, the Anupāt.
18--22, acc. to Yājnav. (and Nārada, Yama &c.), 18-40. E.
अनु and पातक.
text.3107:
अनुपातम् Tatpur. ind. Following, going after, having fol
lowed or gone after (used in phrases implying reiteration;
for the construction comp. s. v. अनुप्रपातम्); e. g. लतानु-
पातं कुसुमान्यगृह्लात् ‘following creeper for creeper &c.’,
क्रीडन्भुजङ्गेन गृहानुपातं कश्चिद्यथा जीवति संशयस्थः &c. ‘like
as a snake-catcher who plays with the snake is always in
uncertainty whenever he goes house for house &c.’. E. पत्
with अनु, kṛt aff. णमुल्.
text.3108:
अनुपातिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ती-तिनी-ति)
1 Following.
2 Re
sulting from e. g. शब्दज्ञानानुपाती वस्तुशून्यो विकल्पः ‘imagi
nation is (a notion) devoid of reality, resulting from know
ledge conveyed by words’. E. पत् with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.3109:
अनुपान Tatpur. n. (-नम्)
1 (In Medicine.) A fluid vehicle in
medicine, drink taken after or with medicine.
2 (In a pas
sage of the Chhānd. Upan.) Drink which is near or stands
close by. E. अनु and पान.
text.3110:
अनुपानत्क Bahuvr. m. f. n. (-त्कः-त्का-त्कम्) Without shoes.
E. अ priv. and उपानह्, samāsānta aff. कप्.
text.3111:
अनुपानीय I. Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) To be drunk
after. E. पा with अनु, kṛtya aff. अनीयर्.
2. n. (-यम्) Drink which is near (see अनुपान). E.
अनु and पानीय.
II. m. f. n. (-यः-या-यम्) What is used as a vehicle (in
medicine). E. अनुपान, taddh. aff. छ.
text.3112:
अनुपालन Tatpur. n. (-नम्) Preserving, guarding; e. g. वि-
द्यानुपालन keeping to science, studying. E. पा, in the caus.,
with अनु, kṛt aff. ल्युट्.
text.3113:
अनुपालयत् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-न्-न्ती-त्)
1 Preserving, taking
care of; e. g. अभिवर्षति योऽनुपालयन्विधिवीजानि विवेक-
वारिणा &c.
2 (Accord. to a comm.) Neglecting, disregard
ing; e. g. अनुपालयतामुदेष्यतीं प्रभुशक्तिं द्विषतामनीहया। अ-
पयान्त्यचिरान्महीभुजां जननिर्वादभयादिव श्रियः (the comm.
referring अनुपालयताम् = उपेक्षमाणानाम् not to द्विषताम् but
to महीभुजाम्). E. पा, in the caus., with अनु, kṛt aff. शतृ.
text.3114:
अनुपालिन् Tatpur. m. f. n. (-ली-लिनी-लि) Preserving,
cherishing, guarding; e. g. विद्यानुपालिन्. E. पा, in the caus.,
with अनु, kṛt aff. णिनि.
text.3115:
अनुपालु Tatpur. n. (-लु) The name of a plant (wild Calladium
escul.). It is doubtful whether the word is genuine Sanskrit.
E. unknown.
text.3116:
अनुपावृत्त Tatpur. m. pl. (-त्ताः) The name of a people. E.
अ neg. and उपावृत्त.
text.3117:
अनुपार्श्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्श्वः-र्श्वा-र्श्वम्) Lateral. E. अनु and
पार्श्व.
text.3118:
अनुपुरुष Tatpur. m. (-षः)
1 The man spoken of before, the
said man.
2 A man who follows, a follower. E. अनु and
पुरुष.
text.3119:
अनुपुष्प Bahuvr.(?) m. (-ष्पः) A kind of read (Saccharum
sara). See also शर. E. अनु and पुष्प.
text.3120:
अनुपूर्व Tatpur. m. f. n. (-र्वः-र्वा-र्वम्)
1 Following what pre
cedes, successive.
2 Orderly, in regular or proper order;
अनुपूर्वम् used adv., in regular or proper order, successively.
Comp. अनुपूर्वशस्.
text.3121:
अनुपूर्वकेश Bahuvr. m. (-शः) Whose hairs are grown in per
fect order; one of the eighty secondary signs or अनुव्यञ्जन
q. v. which indicate the ‘great man’, accord. to the Bud
dhists. E. अनुपूर्व and केश.
text.3122:
अनुपूर्वगात्र Bahuvr. m. (-त्रः) Whose limbs are regular or
symmetrical; one of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (compare the
preceding), accord. to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and गात्र.
text.3123:
अनुपूर्वज Tatpur. m. f. n. (-जः-जा-जम्) Born of parents in
the regular sequence of the castes. Comp. अनुलोमज. E.
अनुपूर्व and ज.
text.3124:
अनुपूर्वत्व n. (-त्वम्). The same as आनुपूर्व्य q. v. E. अनुपूर्व,
taddh. aff. त्व.
text.3125:
अनुपूर्वदंष्ट्र Bahuvr. m. (-ष्ट्रः) Whose (large?) teeth are grown
in a regular manner or symmetrically; one of the eighty
अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (compare अनुपूर्वकेश); accord. to the Bud
dhists. E. अनुपूर्व and दंष्ट्रा.
text.3126:
अनुपूर्वनाभि Bahuvr. m. (-भिः) Whose navel is regular (acc.
to an interpretation, whose navel turns to the right); one
of the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (comp. the preced.); accord.
to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and नाभि.
text.3127:
अनुपूर्वपाणिलेख Bahuvr. m. (-खः) Whose lines of the hands
are regular (acc. to an interpretation: extended); one of
the eighty अनुव्यञ्जन q. v. (comp. the two preced.), accord.
to the Buddhists. E. अनुपूर्व and पाणि-लेखा.
text.3128:
अनुपूर्वभ्रू Bahuvr. m. (-भ्रूः) Whose eye-brows are regular
